original: zhes tshigs su bcad pa las //
analyzed: zhes tshigs su bcad pa las //
translated: As it is said in verse:

original: sems nyid la bdag gi sgrar gsungs so //
analyzed: sems nyid la bdag gi sgrar gsungs so //
translated: The mind itself is called the self.

original: 'di gang las she na /
analyzed: 'di gang las she na /
translated: Why is this?

original: phung po las tha dad pa'i bdag med pa'i phyir dang / mdo gzhan dag las kyang sems 'dul bar gsungs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: phung po las tha dad pa'i bdag med pa'i phyir dang / mdo gzhan dag las kyang sems 'dul bar gsungs pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because there is no self apart from the aggregates, and because other s≈´tras say that the mind is to be disciplined.üîΩAs it is said:

original: sems 'dul ba ni legs pa ste //
analyzed: sems 'dul ba ni legs pa ste //
translated: It is good to discipline the mind.

original: sems thul bas ni bde ba 'dren //üîΩzhes bya ba de las so //
analyzed: sems thul bas ni bde ba 'dren // zhes bya ba de las so //
translated: A disciplined mind brings happiness.

original: de'i phyir ngar 'dzin pa'i gzhi sems la bdag ces gdags so zhe'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir ngar 'dzin pa'i gzhi sems la bdag ces gdags so zhe'o //
translated: Therefore, the basis of the conception of ‚ÄúI‚Äù is designated as the self.

original: 'di la lan brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di la lan brjod par bya ste /
translated: We respond to this as follows:

original: gal te phung po bdag na de phyir te //
analyzed: gal te phung po bdag na de phyir te //
translated: If the aggregates were the self,

original: mang bas bdag de dag kyang mang por 'gyur //
analyzed: mang bas bdag de dag kyang mang por 'gyur //
translated: then since there are many aggregates, the self would be many.

original: bdag ni rdzas su 'gyur zhing der lta ba //
analyzed: bdag ni rdzas su 'gyur zhing der lta ba //
translated: The self would be a substance, and the view of the self would engage a substance.

original: rdzas la 'jug pas phyin ci log mi 'gyur //
analyzed: rdzas la 'jug pas phyin ci log mi 'gyur //
translated: Therefore, it would not be a misconception.

original: de la phung po rnams bdag yin no zhes bya ba'i phyogs gang gi yin pa de'i ltar na phung po rnams mang ba'i phyir bdag kyang mang por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la phung po rnams bdag yin no zhes bya ba'i phyogs gang gi yin pa de'i ltar na phung po rnams mang ba'i phyir bdag kyang mang por 'gyur ro //
translated: If the aggregates were the self, then according to this view, since there are many aggregates, the self would be many.

original: gang gi ltar na sems bdag yin pa de'i ltar na yang mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i dbye bas sam /
analyzed: gang gi ltar na sems bdag yin pa de'i ltar na yang mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i dbye bas sam /
translated: But if the mind is the self, then the self would be multiple because of the divisions of eye consciousness and so on, or

original: skad cig re re la rnam par shes pa skye ba dang 'gag pas mang ba'i phyir bdag kyang mang por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skad cig re re la rnam par shes pa skye ba dang 'gag pas mang ba'i phyir bdag kyang mang por 'gyur ro //
translated: because the mind arises and ceases moment by moment in many ways.

original: yang na ji ltar rigs pa bzhin du skyon brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: yang na ji ltar rigs pa bzhin du skyon brjod par bya'o //
translated: Or else, as is appropriate, the error should be stated.

original: de ltar nyes pa 'di phung po dang rnam par shes pa bdag tu smra ba la brjod par bya zhing /
analyzed: de ltar nyes pa 'di phung po dang rnam par shes pa bdag tu smra ba la brjod par bya zhing /
translated: Thus, this error should be stated in regard to the assertion that the aggregates or consciousness is the self.

original: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i nyes pa gzhan yang 'di la 'bab pa kho na yin pas phyogs gnyi ga la yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i nyes pa gzhan yang 'di la 'bab pa kho na yin pas phyogs gnyi ga la yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: And since the other errors that will be explained also apply to this position, they should be stated in regard to both positions.

original: 'jig rten skye ba na gang zag nyag gcig skye'o zhes bya ba'i lung las na /
analyzed: 'jig rten skye ba na gang zag nyag gcig skye'o zhes bya ba'i lung las na /
translated: Since a scripture says, ‚ÄúWhen the world is generated, only a single person is generated,‚Äù

original: bdag ni mang ba dag tu 'dod pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag ni mang ba dag tu 'dod pa yang ma yin no //
translated: it is not asserted that the self is many.

original: bdag ni rdzas su 'gyur zhing ste /
analyzed: bdag ni rdzas su 'gyur zhing ste /
translated: The self would be a substance.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i rdzas 'das pa la sogs pa'i dbye ba tha dad par gyur pa rnams kho na la phung po nyid du brjod pa'i phyir dang / de rnams kho na la bdag tu bsnyad pa'i phyir bdag rdzas su yod par 'gyur na /üîΩdge slong dag lnga po 'di rnams ni ming tsam tha snyad tsam btags pa tsam ste /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i rdzas 'das pa la sogs pa'i dbye ba tha dad par gyur pa rnams kho na la phung po nyid du brjod pa'i phyir dang / de rnams kho na la bdag tu bsnyad pa'i phyir bdag rdzas su yod par 'gyur na / dge slong dag lnga po 'di rnams ni ming tsam tha snyad tsam btags pa tsam ste /
translated: because only the different types of past, etc., substances such as form are called aggregates, and because only they are called self.

original: gang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gang 'di lta ste /
translated: ‚ÄúMonks, these five are mere names, mere terms, mere conceptualizations:üîΩpast time, future time, space, nirvana, and the person.‚Äù

original: 'das pa'i dus dang ma 'ongs pa'i @296b dus dang / nam mkha' dang mya ngan las 'das pa dang / gang zag go zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du /
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus dang ma 'ongs pa'i @296b dus dang / nam mkha' dang mya ngan las 'das pa dang / gang zag go zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du /
translated: And similarly,

original: ji ltar yan lag tshogs rnams la //
analyzed: ji ltar yan lag tshogs rnams la //
translated: Just as on the basis of a collection of parts

original: brten nas shing rtar brjod pa ltar //
analyzed: brten nas shing rtar brjod pa ltar //
translated: the term ‚Äúchariot‚Äù is used,

original: de bzhin phung po rnams brten nas //
analyzed: de bzhin phung po rnams brten nas //
translated: so on the basis of the aggregates

original: kun rdzob sems can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob sems can zhes bya'o //
translated: the convention ‚Äúliving being‚Äù is used.

original: zhes bya ba 'di las na 'dod pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di las na 'dod pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, this is not what we accept.

original: de'i phyir bdag rdzas su yod par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir na phung po rnams bdag ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag rdzas su yod par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir na phung po rnams bdag ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, because it would follow that the self would be substantially existent, the aggregates are not the self.

original: gzhan yang 'jig tshogs la lta ba rdzas kyi yul can ma yin pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'jig tshogs la lta ba rdzas kyi yul can ma yin pa'i phyir na /
translated: Moreover, because the view of the transitory collection does not have a substantially existent object,

original: sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'i shes pa ltar phyin ci log nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'i shes pa ltar phyin ci log nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: it would not be a misconception, like the consciousnesses of blue, yellow, and so on.

original: de'i phyir 'jig tshogs la lta ba kun tu 'byung ba spangs par mi 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jig tshogs la lta ba kun tu 'byung ba spangs par mi 'gyur ba'am /
translated: Therefore it would not be possible to abandon the occurrence of the view of the transitory collection.

original: sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa tsam la dmigs pa'i mig gi shes pa ltar de la dmigs pa'i bdun pa'i 'dod chags spangs pa kho nas spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa tsam la dmigs pa'i mig gi shes pa ltar de la dmigs pa'i bdun pa'i 'dod chags spangs pa kho nas spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Or, like the eye consciousness that observes blue, yellow, and so on, it would be possible to abandon attachment to the self by abandoning attachment to the mere object observed by the view of the transitory collection.

original: gzhan yang / mya ngan 'das tshe nges par bdag chad 'gyur //
analyzed: gzhan yang / mya ngan 'das tshe nges par bdag chad 'gyur //
translated: Moreover, at the time of nirvana, the self would definitely be annihilated.

original: mya ngan 'das sngon skad cig dag la ni //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das sngon skad cig dag la ni //
translated: Prior to nirvana,

original: skye 'jig byed po med pas de 'bras med //
analyzed: skye 'jig byed po med pas de 'bras med //
translated: since the creator would be born and destroyed in moments, it would be fruitless.

original: gzhan gyis bsags las gzhan gyis za bar 'gyur //
analyzed: gzhan gyis bsags las gzhan gyis za bar 'gyur //
translated: And one would experience the results of actions accumulated by another.

original: gal te bdag phung po'i rang bzhin can yin na mya ngan las 'das pa'i tshe phung po lnga char yang rgyun 'chad pas bdag chad par 'gyur ro//
analyzed: gal te bdag phung po'i rang bzhin can yin na mya ngan las 'das pa'i tshe phung po lnga char yang rgyun 'chad pas bdag chad par 'gyur ro//
translated: If the self had the nature of the aggregates, then at the time of nirvana, since the continuum of the five aggregates is severed, the self would be annihilated.

original: de'i phyir chad pa'i mthar 'dzin pas mthar lte bar thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir chad pa'i mthar 'dzin pas mthar lte bar thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, because of grasping the extreme of annihilation, it would follow that you would grasp the extreme of nihilism.

original: gang gi phyir khyed cag gi ni bdag dang bdag gi ba'i rnam pa can 'jig tshogs la lta bas bdag nyid du gang bzung ba de nyid la rtag pa dang chad par 'dzin pas mthar 'dzin par lta bar rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir khyed cag gi ni bdag dang bdag gi ba'i rnam pa can 'jig tshogs la lta bas bdag nyid du gang bzung ba de nyid la rtag pa dang chad par 'dzin pas mthar 'dzin par lta bar rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because for you, the view of the transitory collection, which has the aspect of the self and that which belongs to the self, is posited as the view grasping the extreme of permanence and annihilation in regard to that which is apprehended as the self.

original: de'i phyir bdag ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i dus su yang rgyun chad par khas blang bar mi bya ste mthar 'dzin par lta bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i dus su yang rgyun chad par khas blang bar mi bya ste mthar 'dzin par lta bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, you should not accept that the self is severed even at the time of nirvana, because it would follow, absurdly, that you would grasp the extreme of nihilism.

original: de'i phyir bdag ni phung po'i bdag nyid can ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag ni phung po'i bdag nyid can ma yin no //
translated: Therefore the self does not have the nature of the aggregates.

original: mya ngan las 'das par zhugs pa'i snga rol gyi skad cig dag tu ji ltar phung po rnams skad cig re re la skye zhing 'jig pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das par zhugs pa'i snga rol gyi skad cig dag tu ji ltar phung po rnams skad cig re re la skye zhing 'jig pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as the aggregates arise and disintegrate moment by moment in each instant prior to entering nirvana,

original: bdag kyang skye zhing 'jig pa can du 'gyur te /
analyzed: bdag kyang skye zhing 'jig pa can du 'gyur te /
translated: so too the self would arise and disintegrate.

original: bdag phung po'i rang bzhin can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag phung po'i rang bzhin can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the self has the nature of the aggregates.üîΩTherefore, just as it is said, ‚ÄúThis body of mine arose,‚Äù

original: de'i phyir ji ltar nga'i lus 'di byung bar gyur to zhes bya ba ma yin pa de bzhin du de'i tshe de'i dus na /
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar nga'i lus 'di byung bar gyur to zhes bya ba ma yin pa de bzhin du de'i tshe de'i dus na /
translated: it would not be said, ‚ÄúAt that time, in those days,

original: nga rgyal po nga la @297a * //üîΩnu zhes bya bar gyur to zhes bya ba 'di yang gsung bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: nga rgyal po nga la @297a * // nu zhes bya bar gyur to zhes bya ba 'di yang gsung bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: I was King Mandhatr.‚Äù

original: de'i tshe bdag kyang lus ltar zhig pa'i phyir dang / 'dir gzhan nyid skye bar khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe bdag kyang lus ltar zhig pa'i phyir dang / 'dir gzhan nyid skye bar khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because at that time, like the body, the self would have disintegrated and because it is accepted that another self would have arisen.

original: bstan bcos las kyang /
analyzed: bstan bcos las kyang /
translated: Also, the treatise Attainment of Knowledge says:

original: nye bar len nyid bdag ma yin //
analyzed: nye bar len nyid bdag ma yin //
translated: The appropriated aggregates are not the self.

original: de dag 'byung dang 'jig pa yin //üîΩnye bar blang ba ji lta bur //
analyzed: de dag 'byung dang 'jig pa yin // nye bar blang ba ji lta bur //
translated: They arise and disintegrate.üîΩHow could the appropriator

original: nye bar len po yin par 'gyur //
analyzed: nye bar len po yin par 'gyur //
translated: be the appropriated?

original: zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du /
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du /
translated: And similarly,

original: gal te phung po bdag yin na //
analyzed: gal te phung po bdag yin na //
translated: If the aggregates were the self,

original: skye dang 'jig pa can du 'gyur //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
analyzed: skye dang 'jig pa can du 'gyur // zhes gsungs so //
translated: It would have production and disintegration.

original: skye ba dang 'jig pa nyid yod na yang byed pa po bdag med pas de'i 'bras bu med pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: skye ba dang 'jig pa nyid yod na yang byed pa po bdag med pas de'i 'bras bu med pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: If production and disintegration existed, then since the self would not be an agent, its effects would not exist.

original: gal te las gang gis byas pa de mi rtag pa nyid du 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te las gang gis byas pa de mi rtag pa nyid du 'gyur na /
translated: If the agent were impermanent,üîΩThen since the agent would not exist, the action would be without a basis.

original: de'i tshe byed pa po med pas las la yang rten med pa'i phyir med pas las rnams 'bras bu dang 'brel pa med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe byed pa po med pas las la yang rten med pa'i phyir med pas las rnams 'bras bu dang 'brel pa med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, since the action would not exist, the connection between actions and effects would be untenable.

original: gal te skad cig snga mas byas pa'i las kyi 'bras bu skad cig phyi ma rnams su nye bar longs spyod na /
analyzed: gal te skad cig snga mas byas pa'i las kyi 'bras bu skad cig phyi ma rnams su nye bar longs spyod na /
translated: If the effects of actions done by the former moment are enjoyed in the later moments,

original: de'i tshe gzhan gyis bsags pa'i las kyi rnam par smin pa gzhan gyis longs spyod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i tshe gzhan gyis bsags pa'i las kyi rnam par smin pa gzhan gyis longs spyod pa'i phyir /
translated: then since the effects of actions accumulated by one person would be enjoyed by others,

original: gzhan gyis bsags pa'i las gzhan gyis za bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyis bsags pa'i las gzhan gyis za bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the actions accumulated by one person would be consumed by others.

original: de'i phyir byas pa chud zos pa dang ma byas pa dang phrad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir byas pa chud zos pa dang ma byas pa dang phrad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, one would encounter the results of actions not done, and the results of actions done would be lost.

original: bstan bcos las kyang /
analyzed: bstan bcos las kyang /
translated: Also, the treatise Attainment of Knowledge states:

original: gal te 'di ni gzhan gyur na //
analyzed: gal te 'di ni gzhan gyur na //
translated: If this were to become something else,

original: de med par yang 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: de med par yang 'byung bar 'gyur //
translated: it would arise even without that.

original: de bzhin du ni gnas 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: de bzhin du ni gnas 'gyur zhing //
translated: In the same way, it would remain as it is,

original: der ma shi bar skye bar 'gyur //
analyzed: der ma shi bar skye bar 'gyur //
translated: and one would be born without dying.

original: chad dang las rnams chud za dang // gzhan gyis byas pa'i las rnams ni //
analyzed: chad dang las rnams chud za dang // gzhan gyis byas pa'i las rnams ni //
translated: Annihilation, loss of what was done,üîΩand experiencing the results of what others have done,

original: gzhan gyis so sor myong ba dang // de la sogs pa thal bar 'gyur //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gzhan gyis so sor myong ba dang // de la sogs pa thal bar 'gyur // zhes gsungs so //
translated: and so forth would ensue.

original: de'i phyir phung po rnams bdag yin no zhes bya bar mi rigs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir phung po rnams bdag yin no zhes bya bar mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is not correct to say that the aggregates are the self.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say,

original: gal te yang skad cig snga phyi dag gzhan yin mod kyi /
analyzed: gal te yang skad cig snga phyi dag gzhan yin mod kyi /
translated: ‚ÄúAlthough the former and latter moments are different,

original: de lta na yang /
analyzed: de lta na yang /
translated: in that case,

original: rgyud 'di gcig kho na yin pas kho bo cag la nyes pa 'di med do //
analyzed: rgyud 'di gcig kho na yin pas kho bo cag la nyes pa 'di med do //
translated: since this continuum is one alone, we do not have this fault.‚Äù

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: We would reply,

original: de nyid du rgyud yod na skyon med de //
analyzed: de nyid du rgyud yod na skyon med de //
translated: ‚ÄúIf the continuum exists in reality, there is no fault.

original: sngar rnams dpyad tshe rgyud la nyes bshad zin //
analyzed: sngar rnams dpyad tshe rgyud la nyes bshad zin //
translated: Previously, when analyzed, faults were explained in the continuum.

original: byams pa nyer sbas la brten chos rnams ni //
analyzed: byams pa nyer sbas la brten chos rnams ni //
translated: The phenomena that depend on Maitreya and Upagupta

original: zhes bya ba der ngo //
analyzed: zhes bya ba der ngo //
translated: are like this.

original: gal te lha las mi gzhan na //
analyzed: gal te lha las mi gzhan na //
translated: If a human is different from a god,

original: de lta na ni mi rtag 'gyur //
analyzed: de lta na ni mi rtag 'gyur //
translated: then he would be impermanent.

original: gal te lha mi gzhan yin na //
analyzed: gal te lha mi gzhan yin na //
translated: If a human is different from a god,

original: rgyud ni 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyud ni 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: the continuum would be untenable.

original: zhes gsungs pa'ang yin no //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa'ang yin no //
translated: This is also stated.

original: de'i @297b phyir de ltar phan tshun mtshan nyid tha dad pa rnams la rgyud gcig tu gtogs pa nyid mi rigs pa kho na yin pas thal bar 'gyur ba ldog pa med do //
analyzed: de'i @297b phyir de ltar phan tshun mtshan nyid tha dad pa rnams la rgyud gcig tu gtogs pa nyid mi rigs pa kho na yin pas thal bar 'gyur ba ldog pa med do //
translated: Therefore, since it is completely untenable that those that have different characteristics are included in the same continuum, the absurd consequence cannot be averted.

original: de'i phyir phung po rnams bdag nyid ma yin zhing sems kyang ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir phung po rnams bdag nyid ma yin zhing sems kyang ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: Therefore, in order to demonstrate that the aggregates are not the self and the mind is also not the self, it is said:

original: de'i phyir phung po dang sems bdag mi rigs /
analyzed: de'i phyir phung po dang sems bdag mi rigs /
translated: Therefore it is untenable that the aggregates and the mind are the self.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i nyes par thal bar 'gyur ba las phung po rnams dang sems bdag tu mi 'thad pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i nyes par thal bar 'gyur ba las phung po rnams dang sems bdag tu mi 'thad pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: Not only is it untenable that the aggregates and the mind are the self due to the absurd consequence explained previously,

original: 'di las kyang ste /
analyzed: 'di las kyang ste /
translated: And also for this reason:

original: 'jig rten mtha' ldan la sogs med phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten mtha' ldan la sogs med phyir ro //
translated: Because the world has no end, etc.

original: gang gi phyir 'jig rten mtha' dang ldan pa nyid la sogs pa med par 'don pa de'i phyir phung po rnams dang sems dag yin no zhes bya bar mi rigs so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'jig rten mtha' dang ldan pa nyid la sogs pa med par 'don pa de'i phyir phung po rnams dang sems dag yin no zhes bya bar mi rigs so //
translated: Because the world has no end, etc. are not accepted, therefore it is not reasonable to say that the aggregates or the mind are the self.

original: 'di ni lung du ma bstan pa'i dngos po bcu bzhi ni sde pa thams cad kyis 'don pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni lung du ma bstan pa'i dngos po bcu bzhi ni sde pa thams cad kyis 'don pa yin te /
translated: These fourteen indeterminate things are accepted by all schools.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: 'jig rten rtag go zhes bya ba dang / 'jig rten mi rtag go zhes bya ba dang / rtag kyang rtag la mi rtag kyang mi rtag go zhes bya ba dang / rtag pa yang ma yin mi rtag pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten rtag go zhes bya ba dang / 'jig rten mi rtag go zhes bya ba dang / rtag kyang rtag la mi rtag kyang mi rtag go zhes bya ba dang / rtag pa yang ma yin mi rtag pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The world is eternal, the world is not eternal, the world is both eternal and not eternal, the world is neither eternal nor not eternal, etc.

original: 'di dag ni brda sprad par bya ba ma yin no zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis gsung pa'i phyir lung du ma bstan pa'i dngos por rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: 'di dag ni brda sprad par bya ba ma yin no zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis gsung pa'i phyir lung du ma bstan pa'i dngos por rnam par gzhag go //
translated: They are established as indeterminate things because the Lord said, ‚ÄúThey are not to be expounded. ‚Äù

original: de ltar bkag pa dang / dge slong zhig gal te 'jig rten rtag go zhes bya bar 'dzin na /
analyzed: de ltar bkag pa dang / dge slong zhig gal te 'jig rten rtag go zhes bya bar 'dzin na /
translated: The Buddha prohibited this, and a monk who holds the view that the world is permanent

original: shar gyi ri bo'i sde pa'i gzhung las /
analyzed: shar gyi ri bo'i sde pa'i gzhung las /
translated: is expelled from the order of the Eastern Mountain according to the following passage:

original: 'jig rten rtag go zhes bya ba de lta bu'i lta ba can de la yang bskrad pa'i las bya'o //üîΩ'jig rten mi rtag go zhes bya ba de lta bu'i lta ba can de la yang bskrad pa'i las bya'o //üîΩ'jig rten rtag kyang rtag la mi rtag kyang mi rtag go zhes bya ba de lta bu'i lta ba can de la yang bskrad pa'i las bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten rtag go zhes bya ba de lta bu'i lta ba can de la yang bskrad pa'i las bya'o // 'jig rten mi rtag go zhes bya ba de lta bu'i lta ba can de la yang bskrad pa'i las bya'o // 'jig rten rtag kyang rtag la mi rtag kyang mi rtag go zhes bya ba de lta bu'i lta ba can de la yang bskrad pa'i las bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOne who holds the view that the world is permanent is expelled from the order.üîΩOne who holds the view that the world is impermanent is expelled from the order.üîΩOne who holds the view that the world is both permanent and impermanent is expelled from the order.

original: 'jig rten rtag pa yang ma yin mi rtag pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba de lta bu'i lta ba can de la yang bskrad pa'i las bya'o zhes bya ba de dang mi 'grogs pa nyid du bshad do //
analyzed: 'jig rten rtag pa yang ma yin mi rtag pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba de lta bu'i lta ba can de la yang bskrad pa'i las bya'o zhes bya ba de dang mi 'grogs pa nyid du bshad do //
translated: One who holds the view that the world is neither permanent nor impermanent is expelled from the order.‚Äù

original: de ltar lung du ma bstan pa'i dngos po bcu bzhi char brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar lung du ma bstan pa'i dngos po bcu bzhi char brjod par bya'o //
translated: Thus, it is explained that one should not associate with those who hold these fourteen indeterminate views.

original: de'i phyir gal te 'jig rten gyi sgras phung po rnams 'dzin na /
analyzed: de'i phyir gal te 'jig rten gyi sgras phung po rnams 'dzin na /
translated: Therefore, if the aggregates are referred to by the word ‚Äúworld,‚Äù

original: de'i tshe phung po rnams skye ba dang 'jig pa nyid kyis mi rtag pa'i phyir 'jig rten mi rtag pa nyid ces bya bar yang lung du bstan par 'gyur la /üîΩmya ngan las 'das @298a * //
analyzed: de'i tshe phung po rnams skye ba dang 'jig pa nyid kyis mi rtag pa'i phyir 'jig rten mi rtag pa nyid ces bya bar yang lung du bstan par 'gyur la / mya ngan las 'das @298a * //
translated: then the Buddha would have declared that the world is impermanent, because the aggregates are impermanent, arising and ceasing.

original: pa'i 'og rol du phung po rnams med pas 'jig rten mtha' dang ldan no zhes bya bar lung bstan par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pa'i 'og rol du phung po rnams med pas 'jig rten mtha' dang ldan no zhes bya bar lung bstan par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: And he would have declared that the world has an end, because the aggregates do not exist after nirvana.

original: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa grongs phan chad yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar yang lung bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa grongs phan chad yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar yang lung bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: And he would have declared that the TathƒÅgata does not exist after death.

original: de'i phyir 'jig rten mtha' dang ldan pa la sogs bkag pa'i phyir phung po rnams kho na bdag yin no zhes bya bar mi rigs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jig rten mtha' dang ldan pa la sogs bkag pa'i phyir phung po rnams kho na bdag yin no zhes bya bar mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore, because the Buddha refuted the views that the world has an end and so on, it is not correct to say that the aggregates are the self.

original: gzhan yang / khyod kyi rnal 'byor bdag med mthong ba la //
analyzed: gzhan yang / khyod kyi rnal 'byor bdag med mthong ba la //
translated: Moreover, for you, when yogis see selflessness,

original: de tshe nges par dngos rnams med par 'gyur //
analyzed: de tshe nges par dngos rnams med par 'gyur //
translated: then definitely things would not exist.

original: gal te phung po rnams sam sems bdag yin na /
analyzed: gal te phung po rnams sam sems bdag yin na /
translated: If the aggregates or mind were the self,

original: gang gi tshe rnal 'byor pa 'dis bden pa mthong ba'i dus su chos thams cad ni bdag med pa'o zhes bdag med pa'i rnam par sdug bsngal gyi bden pa mthong ba de'i tshe phung po med par mthong ba bdag med par mthong bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rnal 'byor pa 'dis bden pa mthong ba'i dus su chos thams cad ni bdag med pa'o zhes bdag med pa'i rnam par sdug bsngal gyi bden pa mthong ba de'i tshe phung po med par mthong ba bdag med par mthong bar 'gyur na /
translated: when this yogi sees the truth, he would see the selflessness of all phenomena, and he would see the truth of suffering in the aspect of selflessness.

original: de ltar ni 'dod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'dod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: But this is not asserted.

original: de'i phyir phung po rnams bdag ma yin no //üîΩci ste gang gi tshe las dang 'bras bu 'brel ba'i dus su bdag gi sgra sbyor ba de'i tshe bdag gzhan mi srid pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir phung po rnams bdag ma yin no // ci ste gang gi tshe las dang 'bras bu 'brel ba'i dus su bdag gi sgra sbyor ba de'i tshe bdag gzhan mi srid pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore the aggregates are not the self.

original: phung po rnams kho na la 'jug pa gang gi tshe bdag med par mthong ba de'i tshe ni gzhan gyis kun brtags pa nang gi byed pa'i skyes bu nyid la 'jug ste /
analyzed: phung po rnams kho na la 'jug pa gang gi tshe bdag med par mthong ba de'i tshe ni gzhan gyis kun brtags pa nang gi byed pa'i skyes bu nyid la 'jug ste /
translated: If the self is imputed in dependence on the aggregates,üîΩthen the self would not exist essentially.üîΩIf the self were imputed in dependence on the aggregates, then the self would not exist essentially.

original: de'i phyir bdag med par mthong ba'i dus su yang nang gi byed pa'i skyes bu dang bral ba 'du byed tsam mthong ba la dngos po rnams med par mthong bar thal bar mi 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag med par mthong ba'i dus su yang nang gi byed pa'i skyes bu dang bral ba 'du byed tsam mthong ba la dngos po rnams med par mthong bar thal bar mi 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: things as nonexistent.

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: We reply as follows:

original: rtag bdag spong na de tshe de yi phyir //
analyzed: rtag bdag spong na de tshe de yi phyir //
translated: If you reject the permanent self, then,

original: khyod kyis sems sam phung po bdag mi 'gyur //
analyzed: khyod kyis sems sam phung po bdag mi 'gyur //
translated: You cannot have the mind or the aggregates as the self.

original: gal te yang dngos po rnams med par mthong bar thal bar 'gyur bas 'jigs nas /
analyzed: gal te yang dngos po rnams med par mthong bar thal bar 'gyur bas 'jigs nas /
translated: If you fear that it would follow that things would be seen as nonexistent,üîΩand therefore you maintain that the word ‚Äúself‚Äù refers to a permanent self,

original: bdag gi sgras bdag rtag pa nyid yongs su 'dzin zhing phung po rnams sam sems bdag tu mi 'dod na /
analyzed: bdag gi sgras bdag rtag pa nyid yongs su 'dzin zhing phung po rnams sam sems bdag tu mi 'dod na /
translated: and you do not maintain that the self is the aggregates or the mind,

original: de lta na ni 'o na phyogs nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na phyogs nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: then you have lost your position.

original: ci ste rnam pa de lta bu'i yul la 'di 'jug par mi 'dod de /
analyzed: ci ste rnam pa de lta bu'i yul la 'di 'jug par mi 'dod de /
translated: But if you do not maintain that it engages such an object, then there is

original: de'i phyir skyon med do snyam na /
analyzed: de'i phyir skyon med do snyam na /
translated: no error.

original: 'di yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: This is not possible.

original: 'dir ni nang gi byed pa'i skyes bu bdag yin la gzhan du ni phung po rnams yin no zhes 'dod dgur spyod pa rigs pa med par 'di ko ga las rnyed pa yin /
analyzed: 'dir ni nang gi byed pa'i skyes bu bdag yin la gzhan du ni phung po rnams yin no zhes 'dod dgur spyod pa rigs pa med par 'di ko ga las rnyed pa yin /
translated: But it is not reasonable to act as you please and say that the word self refers to the inner agent in one context and to the aggregates in another.

original: mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Where can you find such a thing?

original: phung po rnams la yang 'di 'jug pa srid pa yod pa ma @298b yin no zhes bstan zin to //
analyzed: phung po rnams la yang 'di 'jug pa srid pa yod pa ma @298b yin no zhes bstan zin to //
translated: We have already shown that it is impossible for the word self to refer to the aggregates.

original: de'i phyir gal te chos thams cad ni bdag med pa'o zhes bya ba 'dir bdag gi sgra phung po rnams la 'jug par mi 'dod na gzhan du yang mi 'dod par bya dgos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir gal te chos thams cad ni bdag med pa'o zhes bya ba 'dir bdag gi sgra phung po rnams la 'jug par mi 'dod na gzhan du yang mi 'dod par bya dgos so //
translated: Therefore, if you do not want to accept that the word self refers to the aggregates in the statement all phenomena are selfless, then you should not accept that it refers to the aggregates in other contexts.

original: ci ste gzhan du phung po la 'jug par 'dod na ni de 'dir yong 'dod par bya dgos so //
analyzed: ci ste gzhan du phung po la 'jug par 'dod na ni de 'dir yong 'dod par bya dgos so //
translated: But if you do accept that the word self refers to the aggregates in other contexts, then you must also accept that it refers to the aggregates in this context.

original: gzhan yang / khyod kyi rnal 'byor bdag med mthong ba yi //
analyzed: gzhan yang / khyod kyi rnal 'byor bdag med mthong ba yi //
translated: Moreover, for you, yogis who see selflessness

original: gzugs sogs de nyid rtogs par mi 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: gzugs sogs de nyid rtogs par mi 'gyur zhing //
translated: would not realize the reality of form and so on,

original: gzugs la dmigs nas 'jug phyir 'dod chags sogs //
analyzed: gzugs la dmigs nas 'jug phyir 'dod chags sogs //
translated: because they would engage in it by objectifying form and so on,

original: skye 'gyur de yi ngo bo rtogs med phyir //
analyzed: skye 'gyur de yi ngo bo rtogs med phyir //
translated: because they would not realize their nature.

original: ze'u 'bru la khu byug yod ces te de tsam gyis ni ze 'bru'i mngar po nyid ma myangs par sus kyang de'i mngar po nyid dmigs pa ma yin la de la khu byug med ces te ro myangs bzhin du yang mngar ba nyid ma dmigs pa ma yin
analyzed: ze'u 'bru la khu byug yod ces te de tsam gyis ni ze 'bru'i mngar po nyid ma myangs par sus kyang de'i mngar po nyid dmigs pa ma yin la de la khu byug med ces te ro myangs bzhin du yang mngar ba nyid ma dmigs pa ma yin
translated: The statement there is a cuckoo on the stamen does not mean that anyone can observe the sweetness of the stamen without experiencing its sweetness. The statement there is no cuckoo there does not mean that sweetness is not observed while the taste is being experienced.

original: zhing der gtogs pa'i mngon par zhen pa spong ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: zhing der gtogs pa'i mngon par zhen pa spong ba yang ma yin no //
translated: And it does not mean that the manifest clinging to that stamen is abandoned.

original: de bzhin du 'dir yang gal te rnal 'byor bas gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams rtag pa'i bdag dang bral ba de ltar mthong na /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir yang gal te rnal 'byor bas gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams rtag pa'i bdag dang bral ba de ltar mthong na /
translated: In the same way, if yogins and yoginƒ´s see that phenomena such as form are free from a permanent self,

original: de'i tshe de'i rang bzhin yongs su ma shes pas de la ci zhig 'byung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i tshe de'i rang bzhin yongs su ma shes pas de la ci zhig 'byung bar 'gyur /
translated: what would happen to them at that time due to not fully understanding their nature?

original: yang na gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyi rang gi ngo bo dmigs pas de la dmigs pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa spong na yang bdag gi dngos po med pa la ci zhig 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang na gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyi rang gi ngo bo dmigs pas de la dmigs pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa spong na yang bdag gi dngos po med pa la ci zhig 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Or, if attachment and so on that observe form and so on are abandoned by observing the nature of form and so on, what would happen to the nonexistence of a self-entity?

original: gang gis na de med par yongs su shes pa las de yul dag la chags pa la sogs pa rnams spongs bar 'gyur ba 'ga' yang nang gi byed pa'i skyes bu 'de bar gyur cig / ces bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i yul bsten par mi byed la
analyzed: gang gis na de med par yongs su shes pa las de yul dag la chags pa la sogs pa rnams spongs bar 'gyur ba 'ga' yang nang gi byed pa'i skyes bu 'de bar gyur cig / ces bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i yul bsten par mi byed la
translated: One would not seek out objects that are the basis of pleasant experience, and

original: / de sdug bsngal bar dogs pas mi 'dod pa'i yul dang phrad pa spong bar yang mi byed do //
analyzed: / de sdug bsngal bar dogs pas mi 'dod pa'i yul dang phrad pa spong bar yang mi byed do //
translated: one would not avoid encountering undesirable objects for fear of suffering.

original: de'i phyir gzugs la dmigs nas 'jug pa'i phyir na 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gzugs la dmigs nas 'jug pa'i phyir na 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, attachment and so on arise when one engages in focusing on form,

original: de'i rang gi ngo bo yongs su shes pa 'dod chags la sogs pa spong pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de'i rang gi ngo bo yongs su shes pa 'dod chags la sogs pa spong pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir te /
translated: because there is no cause for abandoning attachment and so on through fully understanding their nature.

original: phyir rol pa bzhin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: phyir rol pa bzhin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: This is similar to external things.

original: ci ste kho bo cag lung tshad mar byed pa la rtog ge'i tshad mas gnod pa ma yin la lung gis kyang phung po rnams kho na bdag nyid du ston par byed de /
analyzed: ci ste kho bo cag lung tshad mar byed pa la rtog ge'i tshad mas gnod pa ma yin la lung gis kyang phung po rnams kho na bdag nyid du ston par byed de /
translated: But if we accept scripture as valid cognition, then it is not undermined by the valid cognition of reasoning, and scripture teaches that the aggregates alone are the self.

original: ji skad du /üîΩdge slong dag dge sbyong ngam bram ze @299a * //
analyzed: ji skad du / dge slong dag dge sbyong ngam bram ze @299a * //
translated: For example, it is said:

original: gang su dag cig bdag go snyam du yang dag par rjes su lta ba de dag ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po 'di dag kho na la yang dag par rjes su blta'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: gang su dag cig bdag go snyam du yang dag par rjes su lta ba de dag ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po 'di dag kho na la yang dag par rjes su blta'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu ste /
translated: Monks, any ascetics or brahmins who view the self as real view it in terms of these five appropriated aggregates.

original: de bzhin du 'dir yang yin no snyam na /üîΩgang phyir ston pas phung po bdag go zhes //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir yang yin no snyam na / gang phyir ston pas phung po bdag go zhes //
translated: In the same way, here too, the aggregates are the self.

original: gsungs pa de phyir phung po bdag 'dod na //
analyzed: gsungs pa de phyir phung po bdag 'dod na //
translated: If you assert that the aggregates are the self because the Teacher said so,

original: de ni phung po las gzhan bdag 'gog ste //
analyzed: de ni phung po las gzhan bdag 'gog ste //
translated: then you are refuting that the self is different from the aggregates

original: gzugs bdag min sogs mdo gzhan gsungs phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs bdag min sogs mdo gzhan gsungs phyir ro //
translated: because other sutras say that form is not the self and so on.

original: mo 'dis ni gang las phung po rnams bdag ces bya bar yid ches par 'gyur ba phung po rnams bdag nyid du gsal bar byed pa ma yin pa nyid de /
analyzed: mo 'dis ni gang las phung po rnams bdag ces bya bar yid ches par 'gyur ba phung po rnams bdag nyid du gsal bar byed pa ma yin pa nyid de /
translated: This verse shows that the Teacher did not clarify that the aggregates are the self.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: If you ask, ‚ÄúWell then, what did he clarify?‚Äù

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi dgongs pa ni phung po las tha dad pa'i bdag 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi dgongs pa ni phung po las tha dad pa'i bdag 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The Bhagavat‚Äôs intention was to say that there is no self at all that is separate from the aggregates.

original: kun rdzob kyi bden pa la ltos nas mu stegs can gyi gzhung dgag par bya ba'i phyir dang kun rdzob kyi bden pa phyin ci ma log par gsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi bden pa la ltos nas mu stegs can gyi gzhung dgag par bya ba'i phyir dang kun rdzob kyi bden pa phyin ci ma log par gsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is in order to refute the treatises of the tƒ´rthikas in dependence on conventional truth and in order to clarify conventional truth without error.

original: yang 'di ni phung rnams las gzhan pa'i bdag 'gog pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di de ltar ga las nges she na /
analyzed: yang 'di ni phung rnams las gzhan pa'i bdag 'gog pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di de ltar ga las nges she na /
translated: Moreover, how is it ascertained that this is a refutation of a self that is different from the aggregates?

original: mdo gzhan las gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyang bdag nyid yin pa bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdo gzhan las gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyang bdag nyid yin pa bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because in another s≈´tra, form and so on are also refuted as being the self.

original: ci ltar zhe na /üîΩgang phyir gzugs tshor bdag min 'du shes kyang /üîΩma yin 'du byed rnams min rnam shes kyang //
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na / gang phyir gzugs tshor bdag min 'du shes kyang / ma yin 'du byed rnams min rnam shes kyang //
translated: How is that?

original: min par mdo gzhan las gsungs de yi phyir //
analyzed: min par mdo gzhan las gsungs de yi phyir //
translated: Because in another s≈´tra it is said:üîΩForm is not the self, nor is feeling the self,üîΩNor is the self perception, formation, or consciousness.üîΩTherefore,

original: mdor bstan phung po bdag ces bzhed ma yin //
analyzed: mdor bstan phung po bdag ces bzhed ma yin //
translated: The Teacher did not assert that the aggregates are the self.

original: de'i phyir nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po 'di dag kho na la bdag go snyam du yang dag par rjes su blta'o zhes bya ba'i mdo 'di las phung po las tha dad pa'i bdag bkag pa kho nar nges so //
analyzed: de'i phyir nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po 'di dag kho na la bdag go snyam du yang dag par rjes su blta'o zhes bya ba'i mdo 'di las phung po las tha dad pa'i bdag bkag pa kho nar nges so //
translated: This sutra clearly refutes the existence of a self that is different from the aggregates.

original: gang las gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyang bdag nyid yin pa bkag pa de las ni brten nas gdags pa'i bdag 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i yul phung po'i nye bar len pa can bkag go zhes bya bar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: gang las gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyang bdag nyid yin pa bkag pa de las ni brten nas gdags pa'i bdag 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i yul phung po'i nye bar len pa can bkag go zhes bya bar rig par bya ste /
translated: In those passages that refute the aggregates to be the self, it should be understood that the self that is the object of the view of the transitory collection, the appropriator of the aggregates, is refuted.

original: de kho na nyid sems pa'i skabs su bab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de kho na nyid sems pa'i skabs su bab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the context is the contemplation of reality.üîΩTherefore, since the appropriator is not perceived, the appropriated also does not exist.

original: gang gi phyir nye bar len pa po ma dmigs na de'i nye bar len pa yang yod pa ma yin no zhes gzugs la sogs bdag la yang 'dod chags dang bral bar 'thad pa nyid do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir nye bar len pa po ma dmigs na de'i nye bar len pa yang yod pa ma yin no zhes gzugs la sogs bdag la yang 'dod chags dang bral bar 'thad pa nyid do //
translated: Thus it is tenable that one becomes free from attachment to form and so on.

original: gang gi phyir mdo gzhan las de skad du gsungs pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mdo gzhan las de skad du gsungs pa de'i phyir /
translated: Because it is stated in another sutra,

original: sngar gyi mdor bstan phung po bdag @299b ces bzhed ma yin //
analyzed: sngar gyi mdor bstan phung po bdag @299b ces bzhed ma yin //
translated: The aggregates are not accepted as the self, as was previously indicated in brief.

original: gzhan yang mdo sde bstan pa 'di ni sgrub pa'i tshul du nges kyang phung po rnams bdag yin pa nyid du ston par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang mdo sde bstan pa 'di ni sgrub pa'i tshul du nges kyang phung po rnams bdag yin pa nyid du ston par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, this teaching of the sutra is ascertained as a method of proof, but it is not possible to demonstrate that the aggregates are the self.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar / phung po bdag ces brjod tshe phung rnams kyi //
analyzed: 'di ltar / phung po bdag ces brjod tshe phung rnams kyi //
translated: Because when the aggregates are called the self,

original: tshogs pa yin gyi phung po'i ngo bo min //
analyzed: tshogs pa yin gyi phung po'i ngo bo min //
translated: it is the collection of the aggregates, not the entity of the aggregates.

original: dper na shing rnams ni nags tshal lo zhes brjod pa na shing gi tshogs pa nags tshal yin gyi /üîΩshing re re dag la yang nags su thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dper na shing rnams ni nags tshal lo zhes brjod pa na shing gi tshogs pa nags tshal yin gyi / shing re re dag la yang nags su thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: For example, when it is said that the trees are the forest, the forest is the collection of the trees,üîΩbut it is not the entity of each tree, because it would then follow that each tree is a forest.

original: shing gi ngo bo ni ma yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: shing gi ngo bo ni ma yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: In the same way,

original: phung po tshogs pa nyid bdag tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phung po tshogs pa nyid bdag tu 'gyur ro //
translated: the collection of the aggregates would be the self.

original: de'i phyir tshogs pa ni ci yang ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir tshogs pa ni ci yang ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Therefore, because the collection is nothing at all,

original: mgon min 'dul ba 'am dbang po nyid kyang min //
analyzed: mgon min 'dul ba 'am dbang po nyid kyang min //
translated: it is not the protector, the one to be tamed, or the ruler.

original: de med phyir de tshogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de med phyir de tshogs pa ma yin no //
translated: Because it does not exist, it is not the collection.

original: gang bcom ldan 'das kyis ji skad du /
analyzed: gang bcom ldan 'das kyis ji skad du /
translated: The Bhagav√•n has said:

original: bdag nyid bdag gi mgon yin te //
analyzed: bdag nyid bdag gi mgon yin te //
translated: You are your own protector;

original: bdag nyid bdag gi dgra yang yin //
analyzed: bdag nyid bdag gi dgra yang yin //
translated: you are also your own enemy.

original: legs dang ngan pa byas pa la //
analyzed: legs dang ngan pa byas pa la //
translated: In regard to what is well done and what is poorly done,

original: bdag nyid bdag gi dbang po yin //üîΩzhes bya ba de las mgon nyid dang dbang po nyid du gsungs la /
analyzed: bdag nyid bdag gi dbang po yin // zhes bya ba de las mgon nyid dang dbang po nyid du gsungs la /
translated: you are your own witness.

original: bdag nyid legs par dul bas ni //
analyzed: bdag nyid legs par dul bas ni //
translated: Here, he says that you are your own protector and your own witness.üîΩThe wise attain heaven

original: mkhas pas mtho ris thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: mkhas pas mtho ris thob par 'gyur //
translated: through self-discipline.

original: zhes bya ba 'di las 'dul bar gsungs nas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di las 'dul bar gsungs nas /
translated: Here, he says that you are your own discipliner.

original: tshogs pa tsam po rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa nyid ni mgon nyid dang 'dul ba'am dbang po nyid du rigs pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: tshogs pa tsam po rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa nyid ni mgon nyid dang 'dul ba'am dbang po nyid du rigs pa yang ma yin no //
translated: But it is not reasonable that a mere collection, which does not exist substantially, is a protector, a discipliner, or a witness.

original: de'i phyir tshogs pa bdag ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir tshogs pa bdag ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the collection is not the self.

original: ji ste tshogs pa can las tha dad du med pa'i phyir 'bras bu ni tshogs pa can rnams kyi yin par rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ste tshogs pa can las tha dad du med pa'i phyir 'bras bu ni tshogs pa can rnams kyi yin par rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: But if you think that since the effect is not different from the collection of causes and conditions, the effect is understood to belong to the collection of causes and conditions,

original: de'i phyir mgon nyid dang 'dul ba dang dbang po nyid rigs par 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: de'i phyir mgon nyid dang 'dul ba dang dbang po nyid rigs par 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: and therefore it is reasonable that it is a protector, a discipliner, and a witness, then that is not so.

original: 'dir yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Here, too, it does not exist.

original: 'di la nyes pa bshad zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di la nyes pa bshad zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The faults of this have already been explained.üîΩMoreover,

original: gzhan yang / de tshe de yi yan lag tshogs gnas rnams //
analyzed: gzhan yang / de tshe de yi yan lag tshogs gnas rnams //
translated: at that time, the collection of its parts would be the chariot,

original: shing rta nyid 'gyur shing rta dang bdag mtshungs //
analyzed: shing rta nyid 'gyur shing rta dang bdag mtshungs //
translated: and the chariot and the self would be the same.

original: mdo las kyang /
analyzed: mdo las kyang /
translated: Also, a sutra states:

original: bdag ces bya ba bdud kyi sems //
analyzed: bdag ces bya ba bdud kyi sems //
translated: What is called ‚Äúself‚Äù is the mind of Mara;

original: khyod ni lta bar gyur pa yin //
analyzed: khyod ni lta bar gyur pa yin //
translated: you are a view.

original: 'du byed phung po 'di stong ste //
analyzed: 'du byed phung po 'di stong ste //
translated: This aggregate of compositional factors is empty;

original: 'di la sems can yod ma yin //üîΩji ltar yan lag tshogs rnams la //
analyzed: 'di la sems can yod ma yin // ji ltar yan lag tshogs rnams la //
translated: there is no sentient being here.üîΩJust as ‚Äúchariot‚Äù is imputed

original: brten nas shing rta brjod pa ltar //
analyzed: brten nas shing rta brjod pa ltar //
translated: in dependence upon a collection of parts,

original: de bzhin phung po rnams brten nas //üîΩkun rdzob sems can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin phung po rnams brten nas // kun rdzob sems can zhes bya'o //
translated: in the same way, in dependence upon the aggregates,

original: zhes gsungs so /
analyzed: zhes gsungs so /
translated: the conventional ‚Äúsentient being‚Äù is designated.

original: de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na /
translated: Thus,

original: mdo las @300a * //
analyzed: mdo las @300a * //
translated: a sutra states:

original: phung po brten nas yin gsungs pa //
analyzed: phung po brten nas yin gsungs pa //
translated: The self is imputed in dependence upon the aggregates.

original: de phyir phung po 'dus tsam bdag ma yin //
analyzed: de phyir phung po 'dus tsam bdag ma yin //
translated: Therefore, the mere collection of the aggregates is not the self.

original: gang zhig la brten nas gang btags pa de ni btags pa nye bar len pa'i yan lag tshogs pa tsam ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig la brten nas gang btags pa de ni btags pa nye bar len pa'i yan lag tshogs pa tsam ma yin te /
translated: That which is imputed in dependence upon something is not the mere collection of the parts that are the bases of imputation.

original: brten nas btags pa'i phyir 'byung ba las gyur pa bzhin no //
analyzed: brten nas btags pa'i phyir 'byung ba las gyur pa bzhin no //
translated: because it is designated in dependence, like what is derived from the elements.

original: ji ltar 'byung ba dag rgyur byas nas 'byung ba las gyur pa sngon po la sogs pa dang mig la sogs pa btags mod kyi /
analyzed: ji ltar 'byung ba dag rgyur byas nas 'byung ba las gyur pa sngon po la sogs pa dang mig la sogs pa btags mod kyi /
translated: Just as what is derived from the elements, such as blue, and the eye, etc., are designated in dependence on the elements as their cause,

original: de gnyis 'byung ba 'dus pa tsam nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de gnyis 'byung ba 'dus pa tsam nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: but those two are not just the mere collection of the elements.

original: de bzhin du bdag phung po rgyur byas nas btags pa'i rang bzhin can yang phung po tshogs pa tsam yin par mi rung ngo ;
analyzed: de bzhin du bdag phung po rgyur byas nas btags pa'i rang bzhin can yang phung po tshogs pa tsam yin par mi rung ngo ;
translated: In the same way, it is not tenable that the self is just the collection of the aggregates, which is designated in dependence on the aggregates as its cause.

original: / bum pa la sogs pa rnams kyi ma nges pa nyid do zhe na /üîΩde yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: / bum pa la sogs pa rnams kyi ma nges pa nyid do zhe na / de yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: But it is not definite that pots, etc., are just the collection of form, etc.

original: bum pa la sogs pa rnams kyang gzugs la sogs pa tshogs pa tsam nyid yin par ma grub pa'i phyir dang / brgal zhing brtags pa mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa rnams kyang gzugs la sogs pa tshogs pa tsam nyid yin par ma grub pa'i phyir dang / brgal zhing brtags pa mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is not so, because it is not established that pots, etc., are just the collection of form, etc., and because the objection and investigation are the same.

original: ci ste 'phang lo la sogs pa tshogs pa tsam nyid ni shing rta ma yin te /
analyzed: ci ste 'phang lo la sogs pa tshogs pa tsam nyid ni shing rta ma yin te /
translated: But the mere collection of wheels, etc., is not a chariot.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then is?

original: gang gi tshe 'phang lo la sogs pa rnams dbyibs khyad par can dang ldan par gyur pa de'i tshe shing rta'i ming rnyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'phang lo la sogs pa rnams dbyibs khyad par can dang ldan par gyur pa de'i tshe shing rta'i ming rnyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: When the wheels and so on come to possess a distinctive shape, then the name ‚Äúchariot‚Äù is acquired.

original: de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyi bkod pa tsam bdag yin no snyam na /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyi bkod pa tsam bdag yin no snyam na /
translated: In the same way, if the mere arrangement of form and so on is the self,üîΩthat is also not tenable.

original: de yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Why is it not tenable?üîΩIf you say it is shape,üîΩthat exists in the physical.üîΩWhy is it not tenable?üîΩIf you say it is shape,üîΩthat exists in the physical.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it not tenable?üîΩIf you say it is shape,

original: dbyibs she na /
analyzed: dbyibs she na /
translated: that exists in the physical.üîΩWhy is it not tenable?üîΩIf you say it is shape,üîΩthat exists in the physical.üîΩWhy is it not tenable?üîΩIf you say it is shape,

original: de gzugs can la yod phyir /
analyzed: de gzugs can la yod phyir /
translated: that exists in the physical.üîΩWhy is it not tenable?üîΩIf you say it is shape,üîΩthat exists in the physical.

original: khyod la de dag nyid bdag cis 'gyur gyi //
analyzed: khyod la de dag nyid bdag cis 'gyur gyi //
translated: Why is it not tenable?üîΩIf you say it is shape,

original: sems sogs tshogs ni bdag nyid 'gyur min te //
analyzed: sems sogs tshogs ni bdag nyid 'gyur min te //
translated: that exists in the physical.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it not tenable?üîΩIf you say it is shape,üîΩthat exists in the physical.üîΩWhy is it not tenable?

original: gang phyir de dag la dbyibs yod ma yin /
analyzed: gang phyir de dag la dbyibs yod ma yin /
translated: If you say it is shape,üîΩthat exists in the physical.üîΩWhy is it not tenable?üîΩIf you say it is shape,

original: gzugs can ma yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa'o //üîΩgzhan yang / len po rang nyer len gcig rigs dngos min //
analyzed: gzugs can ma yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa'o // gzhan yang / len po rang nyer len gcig rigs dngos min //
translated: that exists in the physical.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it not tenable?üîΩIf you say it is shape,üîΩthat exists in the physical.üîΩWhy is it not tenable?üîΩIf you say it is shape,üîΩthat exists in the physical.üîΩWhy is it not tenable?üîΩIf you say it is shape,üîΩthat exists in the physical.üîΩWhy is it not tenable?üîΩIf you say it is shape,üîΩthat exists in the physical.üîΩWhy is it not tenable?üîΩIf you say it is shape,üîΩthat exists in the physical.üîΩWhy is it not tenable?üîΩIf you say it is shape,üîΩthat exists in the physical.üîΩWhy is it not tenable?üîΩIf you say it is shape,üîΩthat exists in the physical.üîΩWhy is it not tenable?üîΩIf you say it is shape,üîΩthat exists in the physical.üîΩWhy is it not tenable?üîΩIf you say it is shape,üîΩthat exists in the physical.üîΩWhy is it not tenable?üîΩIf you say it is shape,

original: de ltar na las byed po gcig nyid 'gyur /
analyzed: de ltar na las byed po gcig nyid 'gyur /
translated: that exists in the physical.üîΩWhy

original: 'dir nye bar len par byed pas na len po ste byed pa po yin la nye bar blangs pa na nye bar len pa ste las so //
analyzed: 'dir nye bar len par byed pas na len po ste byed pa po yin la nye bar blangs pa na nye bar len pa ste las so //
translated: Here, the appropriator is the agent because it appropriates. That which is appropriated is the object.

original: 'dir nye bar len pa po ni bdag yin la /
analyzed: 'dir nye bar len pa po ni bdag yin la /
translated: Here, the self is the appropriator.

original: nye bar len pa ni phung po lnga rnams yin no //
analyzed: nye bar len pa ni phung po lnga rnams yin no //
translated: The five aggregates are that which is appropriated.

original: de la gal te gzugs la sogs pa tshogs pa tsam zhig bdag yin na ni de'i tshe byed pa po dang las gcig tu 'gyur na /
analyzed: de la gal te gzugs la sogs pa tshogs pa tsam zhig bdag yin na ni de'i tshe byed pa po dang las gcig tu 'gyur na /
translated: If the self were the mere collection of form and so on, then the agent and the object would be the same.

original: 'di ni 'dod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni 'dod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: But this is unacceptable.

original: 'byung ba dang rgyur byas pa'i gzugs dag dang bum @300b pa dang rdza mkhan dag kyang gcig nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'byung ba dang rgyur byas pa'i gzugs dag dang bum @300b pa dang rdza mkhan dag kyang gcig nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It follows that the elements and form derived from the elements and the pot and the potter would be the same.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: bud shing gang de me yin na //
analyzed: bud shing gang de me yin na //
translated: If fuel were fire,

original: byed pa po dang las gcig 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba dang / me dang shing gis bdag dang ni //
analyzed: byed pa po dang las gcig 'gyur // zhes bya ba dang / me dang shing gis bdag dang ni //
translated: then agent and object would be the same.üîΩAnd:üîΩThe self and all that is appropriated

original: nye bar blang ba'i rim pa kun //
analyzed: nye bar blang ba'i rim pa kun //
translated: by fire and fuel are completely explained

original: bum snam sogs dang lhan cig tu //üîΩma lus par ni rnam par bshad //
analyzed: bum snam sogs dang lhan cig tu //üîΩma lus par ni rnam par bshad //
translated: together with the pot, cloth, and so on.

original: ces gsungs so //
analyzed: ces gsungs so //
translated: So it is said.

original: 'dir ji ltar me dang bud shing dag gcig nyid du mi 'dod pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: 'dir ji ltar me dang bud shing dag gcig nyid du mi 'dod pa de bzhin du /
translated: Here, just as fire and fuel are not asserted to be the same,

original: bdag dang nye bar len pa dag la yang mi 'dod par bya dgos so //
analyzed: bdag dang nye bar len pa dag la yang mi 'dod par bya dgos so //
translated: so too self and appropriation should not be asserted to be the same.

original: ci ste gang zhig byed pa po nyid du 'gyur ba nye bar len pa po ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin pa nyid de /
analyzed: ci ste gang zhig byed pa po nyid du 'gyur ba nye bar len pa po ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin pa nyid de /
translated: But if you think that since the appropriator does not exist at all, the appropriator who would become the agent is nonexistent,

original: 'di ni nye bar len pa 'dus pa tsam zhig tu zad do snyam du sems na /
analyzed: 'di ni nye bar len pa 'dus pa tsam zhig tu zad do snyam du sems na /
translated: and this is merely a collection of appropriated aggregates,

original: de yang mi rigs pa nyid du bshad pa /
analyzed: de yang mi rigs pa nyid du bshad pa /
translated: then that is also illogical.

original: byed po med las yod snyam blo yin na //
analyzed: byed po med las yod snyam blo yin na //
translated: If you think that an action exists without an agent,

original: ma yin gang phyir byed po med las med //
analyzed: ma yin gang phyir byed po med las med //
translated: that is not so, because without an agent there is no action.

original: de ni de ltar ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni de ltar ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: gal te byed pa po mi 'dod na rgyu med pa'i las kyang 'dod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gal te byed pa po mi 'dod na rgyu med pa'i las kyang 'dod par mi bya'o //
translated: If you do not assert an agent, you should not assert an action that lacks a cause.

original: bstan bcos las kyang /
analyzed: bstan bcos las kyang /
translated: Also, the treatise Attainment of Knowledge says:

original: de bzhin nyer len shes par bya //
analyzed: de bzhin nyer len shes par bya //
translated: The appropriator should be understood in the same way.

original: las dang byed po bsal phyir ro //
analyzed: las dang byed po bsal phyir ro //
translated: Because the action and the agent are refuted.üîΩThe remaining things should be understood

original: byed pa po dang las dag gis //üîΩdngos po lhag ma shes par bya //
analyzed: byed pa po dang las dag gis //üîΩdngos po lhag ma shes par bya //
translated: through the agent and action.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus he spoke.

original: 'dir dngos po la l'a ta'i rkyen byas nas nye bar len pas na nye bar len pa po zhes bya ba yin la /
analyzed: 'dir dngos po la l'a ta'i rkyen byas nas nye bar len pas na nye bar len pa po zhes bya ba yin la /
translated: Here, the appropriator is so called because it appropriates by acting as the condition of the object.

original: dngos po yang sgrub par byed pa med par 'byung ba ma yin pas /
analyzed: dngos po yang sgrub par byed pa med par 'byung ba ma yin pas /
translated: Moreover, an object does not occur without a producer.

original: rang gi sgrub par byed pa nye bar blang ba dang nye bar len pa po nye bar 'jog pa yin na /
analyzed: rang gi sgrub par byed pa nye bar blang ba dang nye bar len pa po nye bar 'jog pa yin na /
translated: Therefore, the producer is posited as the appropriator and that appropriated is posited as the object.

original: nye bar len pa'i sbras ni kri ta dang l'a ta ni phal cher ro zhes bya bas las la l'a ta'i rkyen byas nas nye bar blang bar bya ba las kyang brjod pa nyid do //
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i sbras ni kri ta dang l'a ta ni phal cher ro zhes bya bas las la l'a ta'i rkyen byas nas nye bar blang bar bya ba las kyang brjod pa nyid do //
translated: Since the suffix -ta and -in are used for the most part in the sense of action, the object is also called that appropriated because it is that which is to be appropriated by acting as the object of the suffix -in.

original: de'i phyir ji ltar byed pa po la brten nas las su gdags par bya la /
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar byed pa po la brten nas las su gdags par bya la /
translated: Therefore, just as action is imputed in dependence on the agent,

original: las la brten nas kyang byed pa po yin pa de bzhin du nye bar blang ba la brten nas nye bar len pa por gdags par bya la /
analyzed: las la brten nas kyang byed pa po yin pa de bzhin du nye bar blang ba la brten nas nye bar len pa por gdags par bya la /
translated: and the agent is imputed in dependence on action, so too the appropriator is imputed in dependence on that appropriated,

original: nye bar len pa po de nyid la brten nas nye bar blang ba yin no //
analyzed: nye bar len pa po de nyid la brten nas nye bar blang ba yin no //
translated: and that appropriated is imputed in dependence on the appropriator.

original: yang de ltar lan pas gzhan ma yin //
analyzed: yang de ltar lan pas gzhan ma yin //
translated: Moreover, it is not different from that, because of the response.

original: de ni nyer len nyid kyang min //
analyzed: de ni nyer len nyid kyang min //
translated: It is not the appropriator itself.

original: bdag ni nye bar len med min //
analyzed: bdag ni nye bar len med min //
translated: The self does not exist without appropriation.

original: med pa nyid du'ang de ma nges //
analyzed: med pa nyid du'ang de ma nges //
translated: Nor is it ascertained as nonexistent.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de'i phyir de ltar byed pa po med pa na las kyang yod pa ma yin no zhes shes par @301a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar byed pa po med pa na las kyang yod pa ma yin no zhes shes par @301a * //
translated: Therefore, in this way, when there is no agent, it should be understood that there is also no action.

original: bya'o // yang gang las byed pa po ni ma dmigs kyi las kyang yod la rnam par smin pa yang yod do zhes brjod pa de las ni byed pa po rang bzhin du gyur pa bkag par shes par bya'i /
analyzed: bya'o // yang gang las byed pa po ni ma dmigs kyi las kyang yod la rnam par smin pa yang yod do zhes brjod pa de las ni byed pa po rang bzhin du gyur pa bkag par shes par bya'i /
translated: Moreover, it should be understood that from the statement ‚ÄúThe agent is not perceived, but action exists and also its result,‚Äù the naturally existing agent is refuted,

original: brten nas gdags par bya ba tha snyad kyi yan lag tu gyur pa yang bkag go zhes bya ba ni shes par mi bya'o //
analyzed: brten nas gdags par bya ba tha snyad kyi yan lag tu gyur pa yang bkag go zhes bya ba ni shes par mi bya'o //
translated: but it should not be understood that the agent that is a dependent designation, which is a part of conventional usage, is refuted.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: Thus it is said:üîΩ‚ÄúThe person who is connected with ignorance performs the composition of merit.‚Äù

original: ma rig pa dang rjes su 'brel pa'i gang zag 'di ni bsod nams mngon par 'du bya ba yang mngon par 'du byed do zhes rgya cher gsungs so //
analyzed: ma rig pa dang rjes su 'brel pa'i gang zag 'di ni bsod nams mngon par 'du bya ba yang mngon par 'du byed do zhes rgya cher gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said extensively.

original: gzhan yang / gang phyir thub pas bdag de sa chu me //
analyzed: gzhan yang / gang phyir thub pas bdag de sa chu me //
translated: Earth, water, fire,

original: rlung dang rnam shes nam mkha' zhes bya ba //üîΩkhams drug dang ni mig sogs reg pa yi //
analyzed: rlung dang rnam shes nam mkha' zhes bya ba // khams drug dang ni mig sogs reg pa yi //
translated: Wind, consciousness, and space.üîΩHe has also taught it to be the six bases of contact,

original: rten drug dag la brten nas nyer bstan zhing //
analyzed: rten drug dag la brten nas nyer bstan zhing //
translated: The eyes and so on,

original: sems dang sems byung chos rnams nyer bzung nas //
analyzed: sems dang sems byung chos rnams nyer bzung nas //
translated: And to be the phenomena of mind and mental states.

original: des gsungs de phyir de ni de rnams dang // de nyid ma yin tshogs pa tsam nyid de //
analyzed: des gsungs de phyir de ni de rnams dang // de nyid ma yin tshogs pa tsam nyid de //
translated: Therefore, the self is not those, but is their collection.

original: de phyir ngar 'dzin blo de rnams la min //
analyzed: de phyir ngar 'dzin blo de rnams la min //
translated: Thus, the mind that conceives a self does not conceive those.

original: mdo sde las /
analyzed: mdo sde las /
translated: A sutra says:

original: rgyal po chen po skyes bu gang zag de ni khams drug dang / reg pa'i skye mched drug dang / yid kyi nye bar rgyu ba bco brgyad do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rgyal po chen po skyes bu gang zag de ni khams drug dang / reg pa'i skye mched drug dang / yid kyi nye bar rgyu ba bco brgyad do zhes gsungs so //
translated: Great King, this person is the six elements, the six bases of contact, and the eighteen movements of mind.

original: de la khams drug ni sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang rnam par shes pa dang nam mkha' ste /
analyzed: de la khams drug ni sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang rnam par shes pa dang nam mkha' ste /
translated: The six elements are earth, water, fire, wind, consciousness, and space.

original: de dag la brten nas bdag tu btags so //
analyzed: de dag la brten nas bdag tu btags so //
translated: The self is imputed in dependence on those.

original: mig la sogs pa reg pa'i rten drug ni mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i skye mched nas yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i skye mched kyi bar du ste /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa reg pa'i rten drug ni mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i skye mched nas yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i skye mched kyi bar du ste /
translated: The six bases of contact such as the eyes are the contact base of the eyes up to the contact base of the mind.

original: de dag la brten nas bdag tu btags so //
analyzed: de dag la brten nas bdag tu btags so //
translated: The self is imputed in dependence on them.

original: yid kyi nye bar rgyu ba bco brgyad ni /
analyzed: yid kyi nye bar rgyu ba bco brgyad ni /
translated: The eighteen movements of the mind are

original: gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya dang chos la dmigs pa'i yid bde ba'i nye bar rgyu ba drug dang / de bzhin du yid mi bde ba'i nye bar rgyu ba dang / de bzhin du btang snyoms kyi nye bar rgyu ba ste /
analyzed: gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya dang chos la dmigs pa'i yid bde ba'i nye bar rgyu ba drug dang / de bzhin du yid mi bde ba'i nye bar rgyu ba dang / de bzhin du btang snyoms kyi nye bar rgyu ba ste /
translated: the six movements of mental satisfaction that focus on form, sound, smell, taste, tactility, and phenomena, the six movements of mental dissatisfaction, and the six movements of equanimity.

original: de dag la brten pa dang / sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams nye bar bzung nas bdag tu gdags so //
analyzed: de dag la brten pa dang / sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams nye bar bzung nas bdag tu gdags so //
translated: The self is imputed in dependence on them and in dependence on the phenomena of mind and mental factors.

original: gang gi phyir khams la sogs pa de rnams kyi sgo nas bdag tu gdags so zhes bya bar gsungs pa de'i phyir de rnams dang de nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir khams la sogs pa de rnams kyi sgo nas bdag tu gdags so zhes bya bar gsungs pa de'i phyir de rnams dang de nyid ma yin te /
translated: Since it is said that the self is imputed in terms of those elements and so on, the self is not those phenomena and it is not identical to them.

original: gzhan ma yin pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not nondifferent.

original: de tshogs pa tsam nyid du yang rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de tshogs pa tsam nyid du yang rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is also not tenable that the mere collection of the aggregates is the self.

original: gang gi phyir ji skad bshad pa'i @301b chos de rnams bdag nyid du mi rung ba de'i phyir na chos de rnams la ngar 'dzin pa'i blo mi rigs so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir ji skad bshad pa'i @301b chos de rnams bdag nyid du mi rung ba de'i phyir na chos de rnams la ngar 'dzin pa'i blo mi rigs so //
translated: Since those phenomena are not suitable as the self, as they have been explained to be, therefore it is illogical for those phenomena to be the object of the conception of ‚ÄúI.‚Äù

original: gang gi tshe de ltar phung po rnams ngar 'dzin pa'i yul yang ma yin la /
analyzed: gang gi tshe de ltar phung po rnams ngar 'dzin pa'i yul yang ma yin la /
translated: When the aggregates are not the object of the conception of ‚ÄúI‚Äù in this way,

original: phung po las tha dad pa yang yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: phung po las tha dad pa yang yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: and when there is no self that is separate from the aggregates,

original: ngar 'dzin pa'i yul nyid yod pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: ngar 'dzin pa'i yul nyid yod pa ma yin pas /
translated: then the object of the conception of ‚ÄúI‚Äù does not exist.

original: rnal 'byor pas bdag ma dmigs pa las bdag gi ba yang snying po dang ldan pa ma yin pa nyid du yongs su shes shing /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pas bdag ma dmigs pa las bdag gi ba yang snying po dang ldan pa ma yin pa nyid du yongs su shes shing /
translated: Therefore, yogis and yoginis understand that since the self is not observed, that which belongs to the self is also devoid of essence.

original: 'dus byas mtha' dag bsal nas nye bar len pa med par mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dus byas mtha' dag bsal nas nye bar len pa med par mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur te /
translated: Having eliminated all conditioned phenomena, they attain nirvana, which is free of appropriation.

original: de'i phyir rnam par dpyod pa 'di ches mdzes so //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par dpyod pa 'di ches mdzes so //
translated: Therefore this analysis is very beautiful.

original: dar 'dzin pa'i yul ni phung po rnams dang sems yin no zhes bya ba gang gi phyogs yin pa de'i ltar na ji srid du phung po rnams 'byung ba de srid du ngar 'dzin pa 'jug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dar 'dzin pa'i yul ni phung po rnams dang sems yin no zhes bya ba gang gi phyogs yin pa de'i ltar na ji srid du phung po rnams 'byung ba de srid du ngar 'dzin pa 'jug par 'gyur te /
translated: According to those who hold this position, the conception of ‚ÄúI‚Äù would operate for as long as the aggregates arise,

original: bdag tu 'dzin pa'i gzhi dngos po yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad pa /
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa'i gzhi dngos po yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad pa /
translated: because the basis of the conception of ‚ÄúI‚Äù would be a real entity.

original: bdag med rtogs tshe rtag pa'i bdag spong zhing //
analyzed: bdag med rtogs tshe rtag pa'i bdag spong zhing //
translated: When one realizes selflessness, one abandons the conception of a permanent self.

original: 'di ni ngar 'dzin rten du 'ang mi 'dod pa //üîΩde'i phyir bdag med shes pas bdag lta ba //
analyzed: 'di ni ngar 'dzin rten du 'ang mi 'dod pa // de'i phyir bdag med shes pas bdag lta ba //
translated: We do not assert that this is the basis of the conception of ‚ÄúI.‚ÄùüîΩTherefore, it is quite amazing to say that the knowledge of selflessness

original: cis kyang 'byin zhes smra ba shin tu mtshar //
analyzed: cis kyang 'byin zhes smra ba shin tu mtshar //
translated: in some way eliminates the view of self.

original: gal te bdag rtag pa dang ngar 'dzin pa'i yul yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te bdag rtag pa dang ngar 'dzin pa'i yul yin na ni /
translated: If the self were permanent and the object of the conception of ‚ÄúI,‚Äù

original: de med pas ngar 'dzin pa spong bar 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: de med pas ngar 'dzin pa spong bar 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: then it would be eliminated by the realization of selflessness.üîΩBut the object of the conception of ‚ÄúI‚Äù is something else, and the conception of ‚ÄúI‚Äù is eliminated by seeing that other thing as unreal.

original: ngar 'dzin pa'i yul na ni gzhan yin zhing gzhan dngos po med par mthong ba las ngar 'dzin pa ldog go zhes bya ba ni kye ma ma la khyod kyis mdzes so //
analyzed: ngar 'dzin pa'i yul na ni gzhan yin zhing gzhan dngos po med par mthong ba las ngar 'dzin pa ldog go zhes bya ba ni kye ma ma la khyod kyis mdzes so //
translated: Oh my! You are so beautiful!

original: phan tshun 'brel pa med pa'i don 'di nyid dpe'i sgo nas gsal bar bya ba'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: phan tshun 'brel pa med pa'i don 'di nyid dpe'i sgo nas gsal bar bya ba'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: In order to clarify this very meaning of mutual non-connection by means of an example, he says:

original: rang khyim rtsig phug sbrul gnas mthong bzhin du //
analyzed: rang khyim rtsig phug sbrul gnas mthong bzhin du //
translated: Like seeing a snake in a crevice in one‚Äôs own house,

original: 'di ni glang chen med ces dogs bsal te //
analyzed: 'di ni glang chen med ces dogs bsal te //
translated: one dispels the fear, ‚ÄúThere is no elephant here.‚Äù

original: sbrul gyi 'jigs pa'ang spong bar byed pa ni //
analyzed: sbrul gyi 'jigs pa'ang spong bar byed pa ni //
translated: But one who abandons the fear of the snake

original: kye ma gzhan gyi gnas por gyur nyid do //
analyzed: kye ma gzhan gyi gnas por gyur nyid do //
translated: is surely a fool in the eyes of others.

original: gang zhig 'jigs pa'i rkyen nyer zin kyang de la yod pa'i 'jigs pa na mthong zhing phyir 'chos par mi byed pa spong ba nyid kyis bdag nyid 'jigs pa med pa nyid du mngon par byed pa de ni phebs pa rnyed pa nyid kyis na sbrul gyis 'dzinüîΩpar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang zhig 'jigs pa'i rkyen nyer zin kyang de la yod pa'i 'jigs pa na mthong zhing phyir 'chos par mi byed pa spong ba nyid kyis bdag nyid 'jigs pa med pa nyid du mngon par byed pa de ni phebs pa rnyed pa nyid kyis na sbrul gyis 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: One who, even when the conditions for fear are present, does not see the fear that is there and does not remove it, but rather manifests himself as fearless by abandoning it, is surely a fool in the eyes of others, because he is seized by the snake.

original: gang gi phyir glang po che med pas ni de'i sbrul gyi 'jigs pa sel bar mi nus so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir glang po che med pas ni de'i sbrul gyi 'jigs pa sel bar mi nus so //
