translated: For the fear of the snake cannot be removed by the absence of the elephant.

original: de bzhin du phung po dag dang rnam par shes pa dag tu smra ba 'di'i ltar na yang /
analyzed: de bzhin du phung po dag dang rnam par shes pa dag tu smra ba 'di'i ltar na yang /
translated: In the same way, for the proponents of the aggregates and consciousness,

original: rtag pa'i bdag med pas phung po'i @302a * //
analyzed: rtag pa'i bdag med pas phung po'i @302a * //
translated: Since there is no permanent self, the aggregates are impermanent.üîΩ

original: yul can gyi ngar 'dzin pa bsal bar mi nus te /
analyzed: yul can gyi ngar 'dzin pa bsal bar mi nus te /
translated: Because the self is not permanent, it cannot be the object of the view of the transitory collection.

original: de'i phyir nges par 'di'i 'khor ba pa nyid nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir nges par 'di'i 'khor ba pa nyid nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the self definitely does not lose its status as a samsaric being.

original: de'i phyir de ltar bdag ni phung po'i rang bzhin can ma yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar bdag ni phung po'i rang bzhin can ma yin la /
translated: Thus, the self does not have the nature of the aggregates.üîΩAnd the self is not different from the aggregates.

original: phung po rnams las gzhan pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu'i phyogs gnyis yang dag par bsgrubs nas bdag gi yod pa nyid ni rten dang brten pa nyid du yang med par brjod pa'i phyir bshad pa /üîΩphung po bdag yod ma yin bdag la yang //
analyzed: phung po rnams las gzhan pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu'i phyogs gnyis yang dag par bsgrubs nas bdag gi yod pa nyid ni rten dang brten pa nyid du yang med par brjod pa'i phyir bshad pa / phung po bdag yod ma yin bdag la yang //
translated: Having thus established both of these positions, to demonstrate that the self does not exist as a support or something supported, the text says:üîΩThe aggregates do not exist as the self.

original: phung po de rnams yod min gang phyir 'dir //
analyzed: phung po de rnams yod min gang phyir 'dir //
translated: The self does not exist as the aggregates.

original: gzhan nyid yod na rtog pa 'dir 'gyur na //
analyzed: gzhan nyid yod na rtog pa 'dir 'gyur na //
translated: If they were different, this conception would occur.

original: gzhan nyid de med de phyir 'di rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan nyid de med de phyir 'di rtogs pa'o //
translated: But they are not different. Therefore, this is a misconception.

original: gzhan nyid yod na ni rten dang brten pa'i dngos por rigs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan nyid yod na ni rten dang brten pa'i dngos por rigs par 'gyur te /
translated: If they were different, it would be logical for them to exist as a support and something supported.

original: dper na 'khar gzhong na zho yod do zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na 'khar gzhong na zho yod do zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like saying, ‚ÄúThere is yogurt in the bowl.‚Äù

original: 'khar gzhong dang zho gnyis ni 'jig rten na gzhan nyid yin pa na rten dang brten pa'i dngos po mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'khar gzhong dang zho gnyis ni 'jig rten na gzhan nyid yin pa na rten dang brten pa'i dngos po mthong ngo //
translated: In the world, the bowl and the yogurt are seen to be different, but the self and the aggregates are not like that.

original: phung po rnams ni de ltar bdag las tha dad pa ma yin la bdag kyang phung po rnams las tha dad pa ma yin pas de gnyis la rten dang brten pa'i dngos po yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: phung po rnams ni de ltar bdag las tha dad pa ma yin la bdag kyang phung po rnams las tha dad pa ma yin pas de gnyis la rten dang brten pa'i dngos po yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The self is not different from the aggregates, and the aggregates are not different from the self. Therefore, the relationship of support and supported does not exist between them.

original: phung po dang ldan pa nyid kyang bdag la ji ltar yod pa ma yin pa de ltar bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: phung po dang ldan pa nyid kyang bdag la ji ltar yod pa ma yin pa de ltar bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate how the self does not possess the aggregates, the root text says:

original: bdag ni gzugs ldan mi 'dod gang phyir bdag / yod min de phyir ldan don sbyor ba med //
analyzed: bdag ni gzugs ldan mi 'dod gang phyir bdag / yod min de phyir ldan don sbyor ba med //
translated: The self is not asserted to possess form, because the self does not exist; therefore, the meaning of ‚Äúpossession‚Äù is not applicable.

original: gzhan ni gnag ldan gzhan min gzugs ldan na //
analyzed: gzhan ni gnag ldan gzhan min gzugs ldan na //
translated: If the self were different from form, it would possess form.

original: bdag ni gzugs las de nyid gzhan nyid med //
analyzed: bdag ni gzugs las de nyid gzhan nyid med //
translated: But the self is neither the same as nor different from form.

original: bdag phung po rnams de nyid dang gzhan nyid yin pa ni sngar bkag zin la /
analyzed: bdag phung po rnams de nyid dang gzhan nyid yin pa ni sngar bkag zin la /
translated: The self is the same as or different from the aggregates has already been refuted.

original: ldan pa'i skyon yang lha sbyin gzugs dang ldan no zhes bya ba de ni tha mi dad pa nyid la dmigs la /
analyzed: ldan pa'i skyon yang lha sbyin gzugs dang ldan no zhes bya ba de ni tha mi dad pa nyid la dmigs la /
translated: The error of possession is also that Devadatta possesses form. That is observed as nondifferent.

original: ba lang dang ldan no zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa yin na /
analyzed: ba lang dang ldan no zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa yin na /
translated: But that Devadatta possesses a cow is different.

original: de nyid dang gzhan nyid de dag ni gzugs bdag la yod pa ma yin pas bdag gzugs dang ldan no zhes bya ba 'di yang mi srid do //
analyzed: de nyid dang gzhan nyid de dag ni gzugs bdag la yod pa ma yin pas bdag gzugs dang ldan no zhes bya ba 'di yang mi srid do //
translated: Since that which is the same and different do not exist in the self and form, it is also impossible to say that the self possesses form.

original: da ni bkag zin pa'i phyogs rnams bsdams te bstan pas 'jig tshogs la lta ba dmigs pa dang rnam pa log pa la 'jug par grangs kyi sgo nas bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: da ni bkag zin pa'i phyogs rnams bsdams te bstan pas 'jig tshogs la lta ba dmigs pa dang rnam pa log pa la 'jug par grangs kyi sgo nas bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate the negation of the previously mentioned positions, in order to explain the view of the transitory collection in terms of the reversal of its focal object and aspects, in terms of number, it is said:

original: gzugs bdag ma yin bdag ni gzugs ldan min //
analyzed: gzugs bdag ma yin bdag ni gzugs ldan min //
translated: Form is not the self, the self does not possess form,

original: gzugs la bdag med bdag la'ang gzugs yod min //
analyzed: gzugs la bdag med bdag la'ang gzugs yod min //
translated: form does not have the self, the self does not exist in form.

original: de ltar rnam @302b bzhir phung kun shes bya ste //
analyzed: de ltar rnam @302b bzhir phung kun shes bya ste //
translated: Thus, know that all five aggregates are of four types.

original: de dag bdag tu lta ba nyi shur 'dod //
analyzed: de dag bdag tu lta ba nyi shur 'dod //
translated: They assert that the view of the self has twenty aspects.

original: phung po lnga po bdag dang bral bdag la 'jig tshogs la lta bas rnam pa bzhi'i sgo nas bdag nyid du bzung ba na 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i cha nyi shur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phung po lnga po bdag dang bral bdag la 'jig tshogs la lta bas rnam pa bzhi'i sgo nas bdag nyid du bzung ba na 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i cha nyi shur 'gyur ro //
translated: When the five aggregates are grasped as the self by the afflicted view of the self through four aspects, the afflicted view of the self has twenty aspects.

original: gal te rnam par dpyad pa rnam pa lnga la skabs su bab la /
analyzed: gal te rnam par dpyad pa rnam pa lnga la skabs su bab la /
translated: If the fivefold analysis is relevant here,

original: bstan bcos las kyang /üîΩphung min phung po las gzhan min //
analyzed: bstan bcos las kyang / phung min phung po las gzhan min //
translated: then why does the treatise proclaim:

original: de la phung med der de med //
analyzed: de la phung med der de med //
translated: The self is not the aggregates, nor is it different from the aggregates,üîΩThe aggregates do not exist in the self, nor does the self exist in them.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa phung ldan min //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa phung ldan min //
translated: The self does not possess the aggregates,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa gang zhig yin //üîΩzhes gsungs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa gang zhig yin // zhes gsungs pa ma yin nam /
translated: What then is this self?

original: de'i phyir 'di cha lngar 'gyur na /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di cha lngar 'gyur na /
translated: If this is so, then if the self has five parts,

original: cha nyi shur ji skad brjod ce na /
analyzed: cha nyi shur ji skad brjod ce na /
translated: why do you say it has twenty parts?

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i cha de dag ni mdo sde las rnam par gzhag la des kyang phung po rnams ma bzung bar bdag tu mngon par zhen par mi nus pas rnam pa bzhi'i sgo nas phung po rnams la dmigs shing 'jug go //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i cha de dag ni mdo sde las rnam par gzhag la des kyang phung po rnams ma bzung bar bdag tu mngon par zhen par mi nus pas rnam pa bzhi'i sgo nas phung po rnams la dmigs shing 'jug go //
translated: These parts of the afflicted view of the self are presented in the sutras, and since one cannot conceive the self without apprehending the aggregates, they are the focal objects of the afflicted view of the self that engages the aggregates through four aspects.

original: 'di ltar phung po ma gtogs par ni 'ga' la yang bdag tu mngon par zhen pa med pas 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rnam pa lnga pa mi srid do //
analyzed: 'di ltar phung po ma gtogs par ni 'ga' la yang bdag tu mngon par zhen pa med pas 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rnam pa lnga pa mi srid do //
translated: Thus, since one does not cling to a self apart from the aggregates, the five aspects of the afflicted view of the self are impossible.

original: de'i phyir 'jig tshogs la lta ba ni cha nyi shu kho na'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jig tshogs la lta ba ni cha nyi shu kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, the afflicted view of the self has only twenty aspects.üîΩThe treatise Attainment of Knowledge mentions five other aspects, but this should be understood as a refutation of the tƒ´rthikas‚Äô system.

original: bstan bcos las lnga pa gzhan pa nyid kyi phyogs su gsungs pa ni mu stegs pa'i lugs dgag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: bstan bcos las lnga pa gzhan pa nyid kyi phyogs su gsungs pa ni mu stegs pa'i lugs dgag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar shes par bya'o //
translated: The scriptures state:üîΩThe vajra of wisdom destroys the twenty high peaksüîΩof the mountain of the afflicted view of the self,

original: de la 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i ri'i rtse mo nyi shu mtho ba ye shes kyi rdo rjes bcom nas rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon du byas so zhes gang lung las gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de la 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i ri'i rtse mo nyi shu mtho ba ye shes kyi rdo rjes bcom nas rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon du byas so zhes gang lung las gsungs pa ni /
translated: and the result of stream enterer is actualized.

original: lta ri bdag med rtogs pa'i rdo rje yis //
analyzed: lta ri bdag med rtogs pa'i rdo rje yis //
translated: The vajra of realizing selflessness

original: bcom bdag gang dang lhan cig 'jig 'gyur ba //üîΩ'jig tshogs lta ri lhun sdug la gnas pa'i //
analyzed: bcom bdag gang dang lhan cig 'jig 'gyur ba // 'jig tshogs lta ri lhun sdug la gnas pa'i //
translated: destroys the self and what is connected to the self.üîΩThese are the high peaks

original: rtse mo mtho bar gyur pa 'di dag go //
analyzed: rtse mo mtho bar gyur pa 'di dag go //
translated: that abide on the beautiful mountain of the afflicted view of the self.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i ri bo 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi rdo rje ma babs pas nyin re bzhin nyon mongs pa'i brag rdo 'phel ba /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i ri bo 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi rdo rje ma babs pas nyin re bzhin nyon mongs pa'i brag rdo 'phel ba /
translated: The mountain of the view of the transitory collection has not been struck by the vajra of the wisdom of the ƒÅryas, so the rocks of the afflictions increase day by day.

original: 'khor ba thog ma med pa nas byung ba /üîΩdpangs khams gsum du mtho ba /
analyzed: 'khor ba thog ma med pa nas byung ba / dpangs khams gsum du mtho ba /
translated: It has existed since beginningless cyclic existence.üîΩIts height is great, for it extends to the three realms.

original: phyogs kyi ngos ma lus par khyab pa /
analyzed: phyogs kyi ngos ma lus par khyab pa /
translated: It pervades all directions.

original: ma rig pa'i gser gyi sa gzhi las 'thon pa /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i gser gyi sa gzhi las 'thon pa /
translated: It emerges from the golden ground of ignorance.

original: bdag med pa khong du chud pa'i rdo rjes bshig pa na /
analyzed: bdag med pa khong du chud pa'i rdo rjes bshig pa na /
translated: When it is destroyed by the vajra of understanding selflessness,

original: rtse mo ches mtho ba gang dag dang lhan cig 'jig par 'gyur ba de dag ni rtse mo yin par shes par bya'o //üîΩda ni 'phags pa @303a * //
analyzed: rtse mo ches mtho ba gang dag dang lhan cig 'jig par 'gyur ba de dag ni rtse mo yin par shes par bya'o // da ni 'phags pa @303a * //
translated: one should know that the peaks that are destroyed along with the highest peak are the peak.

original: mang pos bkur ba dag gis brtags pa'i gang zag rdzas su yod par smra ba bsal ba'i phyir bshad pa //
analyzed: mang pos bkur ba dag gis brtags pa'i gang zag rdzas su yod par smra ba bsal ba'i phyir bshad pa //
translated: Now, in order to remove the assertion of the Sa·πÖgha of the Many that the person substantially exists, it is said:

original: kha cig de nyid gzhan nyid rtag mi rtag / la sogs brjod med gang zag rdzas yod 'dod //
analyzed: kha cig de nyid gzhan nyid rtag mi rtag / la sogs brjod med gang zag rdzas yod 'dod //
translated: Some assert that the inexpressible person substantially exists,üîΩneither the same as nor different from the six collections of consciousness,

original: rnam shes drug gi shes byar de 'dod cing //
analyzed: rnam shes drug gi shes byar de 'dod cing //
translated: and that it is the object of knowledge of the six consciousnesses.

original: de ni ngar 'dzin gzhir yang 'dod pa yin //
analyzed: de ni ngar 'dzin gzhir yang 'dod pa yin //
translated: It is also asserted to be the basis of the conception of ‚ÄúI.‚Äù

original: de la re zhig phung po ma gtogs de 'dzin ma grub phyir //
analyzed: de la re zhig phung po ma gtogs de 'dzin ma grub phyir //
translated: First, since it is not established that it is apprehended apart from the aggregates,

original: gang zag phung po dag las gzhan du ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang zag phung po dag las gzhan du ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: the person is not different from the aggregates.

original: phung po'i rang bzhin can yang ma yin te /
analyzed: phung po'i rang bzhin can yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it the same as the aggregates,

original: skye ba dang 'jig pa dang ldan pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba dang 'jig pa dang ldan pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would absurdly follow that it would possess origination and destruction.

original: de'i phyir de ltar na phung po dag las de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod du med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar na phung po dag las de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod du med do //
translated: Therefore, in this way, it is inexpressible as the same or different from the aggregates.

original: ji ltar de nyid dang gzhan nyid du ma yin pa de bzhin du rtag pa dang mi rtag pa nyid du yang brjod du med do //
analyzed: ji ltar de nyid dang gzhan nyid du ma yin pa de bzhin du rtag pa dang mi rtag pa nyid du yang brjod du med do //
translated: Just as it is not the same or different, it is also inexpressible as permanent or impermanent.

original: rnam par shes pa drug gis shes pa yang yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa drug gis shes pa yang yin no //
translated: It is also known by the six consciousnesses.

original: gang zag de ni rdzas su yod pa nyid du yang rigs te /
analyzed: gang zag de ni rdzas su yod pa nyid du yang rigs te /
translated: It is also reasonable that the person exists substantially.

original: de la byed pa po nyid dang za ba po nyid du brjod pa'i phyir dang 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dang / bcings pa dang thar pa dang 'brel pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la byed pa po nyid dang za ba po nyid du brjod pa'i phyir dang 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dang / bcings pa dang thar pa dang 'brel pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said to be the agent and the experiencer, and because it is related to cyclic existence and nirvana, bondage and liberation.

original: de ni bdag tu 'dzin pa'i yul nyid du yang 'dod do //
analyzed: de ni bdag tu 'dzin pa'i yul nyid du yang 'dod do //
translated: It is also asserted to be the object of the conception of self.

original: smra ba 'di yang mi rigs pa nyid du bshad pa /
analyzed: smra ba 'di yang mi rigs pa nyid du bshad pa /
translated: This assertion is also explained as illogical:

original: gang phyir gzugs las sems brjod med mi rtogs //
analyzed: gang phyir gzugs las sems brjod med mi rtogs //
translated: Because the mind is not cognized as inexpressible apart from form,

original: dngos yod brjod med rtogs pa ma yin nyid //
analyzed: dngos yod brjod med rtogs pa ma yin nyid //
translated: An existent thing is not cognized as inexpressible.

original: gal te bdag 'ga' dngos por grub 'gyur na //
analyzed: gal te bdag 'ga' dngos por grub 'gyur na //
translated: If the self were established as a thing,

original: sems ltar grub dngos brjod du med mi 'gyur //
analyzed: sems ltar grub dngos brjod du med mi 'gyur //
translated: It would not be inexpressible as an established thing like the mind.

original: de'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa 'dis /
analyzed: de'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa 'dis /
translated: Therefore, this verse

original: brjod du med pa la rdzas su yod pa nyid mi srid par bstan nas /
analyzed: brjod du med pa la rdzas su yod pa nyid mi srid par bstan nas /
translated: teaches that it is impossible for the inexpressible to be substantially existent.

original: btags par yod pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: btags par yod pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: In order to teach that it is imputedly existent, it is said:

original: gang phyir khyod bum dngos por ma grub pa'i //
analyzed: gang phyir khyod bum dngos por ma grub pa'i //
translated: Because for you a pot is not established as a thing,

original: ngo bo gzugs sogs las brjod med 'gyur bas //
analyzed: ngo bo gzugs sogs las brjod med 'gyur bas //
translated: Its entity is inexpressible apart from form and so on.

original: bdag gang phung po las brjod med 'gyur te //
analyzed: bdag gang phung po las brjod med 'gyur te //
translated: The self would not be described as other than the aggregates,

original: rang gis yod par grub par rtogs mi bya //
analyzed: rang gis yod par grub par rtogs mi bya //
translated: and it would not be understood to exist by itself.

original: bum pa gzugs la sogs pa dag las de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod du med cing btags par yod par 'dod pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: bum pa gzugs la sogs pa dag las de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod du med cing btags par yod par 'dod pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as a pot is inexpressible as the same as or different from its form and so on, and is asserted to exist as an imputation,

original: bdag kyang bum pa ltar btags par yod par 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: bdag kyang bum pa ltar btags par yod par 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: so too the self would be an imputation, like the pot.

original: de'i phyir de ltar tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis dgag pa dang sgrub pa nye bar bstan nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis dgag pa dang sgrub pa nye bar bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having presented the refutation and proof in two verses,

original: @303b da ni de nyid dang gzhan nyid dag dngos po'i rten nyid du brjod nas dngos po'i chos kyi rten can ma yin pa nyid kyis bdag 'gog par rtsom pa /
analyzed: @303b da ni de nyid dang gzhan nyid dag dngos po'i rten nyid du brjod nas dngos po'i chos kyi rten can ma yin pa nyid kyis bdag 'gog par rtsom pa /
translated: now, having stated that sameness and difference are the basis of entities, he begins the refutation of the self by showing that it is not the basis of the qualities of entities.

original: khyod kyi rnam shes rang bdag las gzhan ni //
analyzed: khyod kyi rnam shes rang bdag las gzhan ni //
translated: You assert that consciousness is not different from its own self,

original: min 'dod gzugs sogs las gzhan dngos 'dod cing //
analyzed: min 'dod gzugs sogs las gzhan dngos 'dod cing //
translated: but you assert that form and so on are different entities.

original: dngos la rnam pa de gnyis mthong gyur pa //
analyzed: dngos la rnam pa de gnyis mthong gyur pa //
translated: Since these two aspects are seen in entities,

original: de phyir bdag med dngos chos dang bral phyir //
analyzed: de phyir bdag med dngos chos dang bral phyir //
translated: the self is refuted because it lacks the qualities of an entity.

original: gal te khyod kyi ltar bdag rdzas su yod par gyur na ni de gdon mi za bar rnam par shes pa ltar rang gi bdag nyid las gzhan ma yin par 'gyur zhing gzugs la sogs pa dag las tha dad pa'i ngo bo zhig tu 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te khyod kyi ltar bdag rdzas su yod par gyur na ni de gdon mi za bar rnam par shes pa ltar rang gi bdag nyid las gzhan ma yin par 'gyur zhing gzugs la sogs pa dag las tha dad pa'i ngo bo zhig tu 'gyur na /
translated: If, as you say, the self substantially exists, then it would be just like consciousness, not different from its own nature, and it would have an essence different from form and so on.

original: 'di ni yod pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni yod pa yang ma yin no //
translated: But this does not exist.

original: de'i phyir dngos po'i chos dag gi rten can ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir bum pa ltar bdag yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po'i chos dag gi rten can ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir bum pa ltar bdag yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, because it is not the basis of the qualities of things, like a pot, the self does not exist.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar rnam par dpyad pa na gang zag rdzas su yod pa nyid du mi rigs pa /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar rnam par dpyad pa na gang zag rdzas su yod pa nyid du mi rigs pa /
translated: Since it is illogical to posit the person as substantially real when analyzed in this way,

original: de phyir ngar 'dzin rten ni dngos pos min //üîΩphung las gzhan min phung po'i ngo bo min //
analyzed: de phyir ngar 'dzin rten ni dngos pos min // phung las gzhan min phung po'i ngo bo min //
translated: the basis of the conception of ‚ÄúI‚Äù is not a thing.üîΩIt is not different from the aggregates, nor is it the aggregates‚Äô nature.

original: phung po rten min 'di ni de ldan min //
analyzed: phung po rten min 'di ni de ldan min //
translated: It does not possess the aggregates, nor are the aggregates in it.

original: ngar 'dzin pa'i yul ni nges par gzhig pa na rdzas su yod par mi rigs shing /
analyzed: ngar 'dzin pa'i yul ni nges par gzhig pa na rdzas su yod par mi rigs shing /
translated: When the object of the conception of ‚ÄúI‚Äù is definitely refuted, it is illogical for it to be substantially real.

original: phung po las tha dad par yang mi rung la /
analyzed: phung po las tha dad par yang mi rung la /
translated: It is also illogical for it to be different from the aggregates.

original: phung po'i rang bzhin can yang ma yin zhing /
analyzed: phung po'i rang bzhin can yang ma yin zhing /
translated: Nor is it the nature of the aggregates.

original: phung po rnams kyi rten yang ma yin no //
analyzed: phung po rnams kyi rten yang ma yin no //
translated: Nor is it the support of the aggregates.

original: yang na 'di la rten phung po yod pas na phung po la rten zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: yang na 'di la rten phung po yod pas na phung po la rten zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Or else, it is called ‚Äúsupported by the aggregates‚Äù because the aggregates are its support.

original: rten dang brten pa'i phyogs gnyi ga gsal bar bya ba'i phyir tshig bsdu ba gnyi ga la brten to //
analyzed: rten dang brten pa'i phyogs gnyi ga gsal bar bya ba'i phyir tshig bsdu ba gnyi ga la brten to //
translated: Both compounds are used to make clear both the supported and the support.

original: bdag ni phung po dang ldan par yang mi rigs so //üîΩde'i phyir bdag btags pa'am /
analyzed: bdag ni phung po dang ldan par yang mi rigs so // de'i phyir bdag btags pa'am /
translated: It is not reasonable that the self possesses the aggregates.

original: ma dmigs par 'dod pas kyang rung ste /
analyzed: ma dmigs par 'dod pas kyang rung ste /
translated: Therefore, whether the self is accepted as a designation or as a non-apprehension,

original: ji skad smras pa'i rnam pa dag gis bdag khas blang bar mi bya'o zhes bshad pa ni /
analyzed: ji skad smras pa'i rnam pa dag gis bdag khas blang bar mi bya'o zhes bshad pa ni /
translated: it should not be accepted in the manner described.

original: 'di ni phung po rnams rten grub par 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni phung po rnams rten grub par 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is the establishment of the aggregates as the support.üîΩThis is what is stated in the line, ‚ÄúThe aggregates are established as the support.‚Äù

original: ji ltar 'di la brten nas 'di 'byung zhes bya ba 'di tsam zhig kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i rnam par gzhag pa ma chad par bya ba'i phyir khas len gyi rgyu med la sogs pa dag las skye ba ma yin pa de bzhin du /üîΩ'dir yang brten nas gdags pa la yang dag par brten pa na ji skad bshad pa'i skyon dang ldan pa'i rnam pa bsal nas phung po rnams la brten nas gdags pa zhes bya 'di tsam zhig @304a * //
analyzed: ji ltar 'di la brten nas 'di 'byung zhes bya ba 'di tsam zhig kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i rnam par gzhag pa ma chad par bya ba'i phyir khas len gyi rgyu med la sogs pa dag las skye ba ma yin pa de bzhin du / 'dir yang brten nas gdags pa la yang dag par brten pa na ji skad bshad pa'i skyon dang ldan pa'i rnam pa bsal nas phung po rnams la brten nas gdags pa zhes bya 'di tsam zhig @304a * //
translated: In the same way, we accept the mere statement ‚ÄúThis arises in dependence on that‚Äù in order to preserve the presentation of conventional truth. We do not accept that things arise without causes.üîΩIn the same way, when we rely on the correct dependent origination, we should accept the mere statement ‚ÄúThe self is imputed in dependence on the aggregates‚Äù in order to preserve the presentation of worldly convention.

original: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad rnam par gnas par bya ba'i phyir khas blang bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad rnam par gnas par bya ba'i phyir khas blang bar bya ste /
translated: We should reject the position that has the faults explained above.

original: bdag tu tha snyad btags pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag tu tha snyad btags pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because we see the designation of the self.

original: bdag btags pa tsam du grub par bya ba'i don du ji skad bshad pa'i don nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir phyi rol gyi dpe ston zhing bshad pa /
analyzed: bdag btags pa tsam du grub par bya ba'i don du ji skad bshad pa'i don nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir phyi rol gyi dpe ston zhing bshad pa /
translated: In order to prove that the self is a mere designation, the following external example is given to clarify the meaning that has been explained.

original: shing rta rang yan lag las gzhan 'dod min //
analyzed: shing rta rang yan lag las gzhan 'dod min //
translated: The chariot is not asserted to be different from its parts.

original: gzhan min ma yin de ldan yang min zhing //
analyzed: gzhan min ma yin de ldan yang min zhing //
translated: It is not the same as them, nor does it possess them.

original: yan lag la min yan lag dag der min //
analyzed: yan lag la min yan lag dag der min //
translated: It is not in the parts, nor are the parts in it.

original: 'dus pa tsam min dbyibs min ji bzhin no //
analyzed: 'dus pa tsam min dbyibs min ji bzhin no //
translated: It is not a mere collection, nor is it shape.

original: de'i phyir 'dir de nyid kyi phyogs dang gzhan nyid kyi phyogs dang / rten gyi phyogs dang brten pa'i phyogs dang / de dang ldan pa'i phyogs te phyogs lnga po dag ni sngar bstan zin pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir de nyid kyi phyogs dang gzhan nyid kyi phyogs dang / rten gyi phyogs dang brten pa'i phyogs dang / de dang ldan pa'i phyogs te phyogs lnga po dag ni sngar bstan zin pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, the five positions‚Äîthe position of sameness, the position of difference, the position of support, the position of supported, and the position of possession‚Äîhave already been explained.

original: tshogs pa'i phyogs dang dbyibs kyi phyogs gnyis ni bsgrub par bya dgos pas de dag ston pa brtsam par bya ste /
analyzed: tshogs pa'i phyogs dang dbyibs kyi phyogs gnyis ni bsgrub par bya dgos pas de dag ston pa brtsam par bya ste /
translated: The two positions‚Äîthe position of collection and the position of shape‚Äîneed to be proven. Therefore, we will begin to demonstrate them.

original: gal te tshogs tsam shing rtar 'gyur na ni //
analyzed: gal te tshogs tsam shing rtar 'gyur na ni //
translated: If the mere collection were the chariot,

original: sil bur gnas la shing rta nyid yod gyur //
analyzed: sil bur gnas la shing rta nyid yod gyur //
translated: then the chariot would exist when its parts are unassembled.

original: 'di ni sngar bshad du zin kyang slar yang nye bar bkod de skyon gzhan brjod pa'i sgo nas gsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ni sngar bshad du zin kyang slar yang nye bar bkod de skyon gzhan brjod pa'i sgo nas gsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Although this has already been explained, we will again set it forth and clarify it by stating another fault.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For this reason:

original: gang phyir yan lag can med yan lag dag //
analyzed: gang phyir yan lag can med yan lag dag //
translated: Since there is no bearer of parts,

original: med pas dbyibs tsam shing rtar rigs pa'ang min //
analyzed: med pas dbyibs tsam shing rtar rigs pa'ang min //
translated: But it is not tenable that the mere shape of the parts is the chariot.

original: zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: This is the meaning of the above verse.

original: gang gi phyir yan lag can med na yan lag dag yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir yan lag dag med pa nyid do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir yan lag can med na yan lag dag yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir yan lag dag med pa nyid do //
translated: Since the parts do not exist if the whole does not exist, the parts do not exist.

original: de'i phyir gang dag gi tshogs pa zhig shing rtar gyur /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang dag gi tshogs pa zhig shing rtar gyur /
translated: Therefore, what collection of parts could be the chariot?

original: 'ang gi sgra ni bsdu ba'i don te /
analyzed: 'ang gi sgra ni bsdu ba'i don te /
translated: The word ‚Äúbut‚Äù means ‚Äúonly.‚Äù

original: dbyibs tsam yang shing rtar mi rigs la tshogs pa tsam po'ang mi rigs so zhes shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbyibs tsam yang shing rtar mi rigs la tshogs pa tsam po'ang mi rigs so zhes shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It should be understood that the mere shape is not the chariot, and the mere collection is not the chariot.

original: ga las she na /
analyzed: ga las she na /
translated: Why is this?

original: gang gi phyir yan lag can med na yan lag dag med pas so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir yan lag can med na yan lag dag med pas so //
translated: Since the parts do not exist if the whole does not exist.

original: de'i phyir dbyibs tsam zhig shing rtar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir dbyibs tsam zhig shing rtar mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, the mere shape is not suitable as the chariot.

original: yan lag can med pa nyid du ni de dag gi rang nyid kyis khas blangs pa yin no //üîΩgzhan yang gal te dbyibs tsam zhig shing rtar 'dod na dbyibs de yan lag dag gi'am /
analyzed: yan lag can med pa nyid du ni de dag gi rang nyid kyis khas blangs pa yin no // gzhan yang gal te dbyibs tsam zhig shing rtar 'dod na dbyibs de yan lag dag gi'am /
translated: They themselves have accepted that the parts do not exist if the whole does not exist.

original: tshogs pa'i yin par rtog grang /
analyzed: tshogs pa'i yin par rtog grang /
translated: Moreover, if you assert that the mere shape is the chariot, is the shape of the parts or the shape of the collection?

original: de la yan lag gi dbyibs kyi khyad par yin par 'dod na yang sngar gyi dbyibs kyi khyad par ma btang ba dag gi'am /
analyzed: de la yan lag gi dbyibs kyi khyad par yin par 'dod na yang sngar gyi dbyibs kyi khyad par ma btang ba dag gi'am /
translated: If you assert that it is the particular shape of the parts, then it would be the particular shape of the parts that existed before,

original: sngar gyi dbyibs kyi khyad par btang ba dag gi yin par 'gyur grar na /
analyzed: sngar gyi dbyibs kyi khyad par btang ba dag gi yin par 'gyur grar na /
translated: or it would be the particular shape of the parts that existed after.

original: @304b de la gal te gong ma shos 'dod na ni de mi rigs so //
analyzed: @304b de la gal te gong ma shos 'dod na ni de mi rigs so //
translated: If you assert the former, that is illogical.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: khyod dbyibs yan lag re re sngar yod gyur //
analyzed: khyod dbyibs yan lag re re sngar yod gyur //
translated: You say that the shape of the parts existed before,

original: ji bzhin shing rtar gtogs la'ang de bzhin na //
analyzed: ji bzhin shing rtar gtogs la'ang de bzhin na //
translated: And it is the same when they are assembled in a chariot.

original: bye bar gyur pa de dag la ji ltar //
analyzed: bye bar gyur pa de dag la ji ltar //
translated: But when they are disassembled, how could it be

original: da lta yang ni shing rta yod ma yin //
analyzed: da lta yang ni shing rta yod ma yin //
translated: That the chariot exists now?

original: gal te shing rta'i gnas skabs kyi gong rol na 'phong lo la sogs pa'i dbyibs kyi khyad par ji ltar yod par gyur pa de kho na ltar shing rta nyid kyi dus su'ang 'phang lo la sogs pa rnams kyi dbyibs kyi khyad par yin na ni de'i tshe
analyzed: gal te shing rta'i gnas skabs kyi gong rol na 'phong lo la sogs pa'i dbyibs kyi khyad par ji ltar yod par gyur pa de kho na ltar shing rta nyid kyi dus su'ang 'phang lo la sogs pa rnams kyi dbyibs kyi khyad par yin na ni de'i tshe
translated: If the particular shape of the wheels and so on existed just as it does at the time of the chariot before the chariot‚Äôs assembly,

original: yan lag bye bar gyur pa dag la med pa ltar shing rta nyid kyi dus na'ang shing rta yod pa ma yin par nges par bya ste /
analyzed: yan lag bye bar gyur pa dag la med pa ltar shing rta nyid kyi dus na'ang shing rta yod pa ma yin par nges par bya ste /
translated: Just as the chariot does not exist in its parts when they are unassembled, so too, when the parts are assembled, the chariot does not exist.

original: de'i yan lag gi dbyibs tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i yan lag gi dbyibs tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the shape of the parts is not different from the shape of the parts when they were unassembled.

original: ci ste phyogs gnyis pa ste dbyibs gzhan kho na shing rta zhes bya bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: ci ste phyogs gnyis pa ste dbyibs gzhan kho na shing rta zhes bya bar 'gyur na /
translated: But if the second position is accepted‚Äîthat the shape of the parts when they are assembled is the chariot‚Äî

original: de lta na yang /üîΩda lta gal te shing rta nyid dus 'dir //
analyzed: de lta na yang / da lta gal te shing rta nyid dus 'dir //
translated: then even in that case,üîΩif the shape of the wheels and so on

original: 'phang lo sogs la dbyibs tha dad yod na //
analyzed: 'phang lo sogs la dbyibs tha dad yod na //
translated: were different from their shape when unassembled,

original: 'di gzung 'gyur na de yang yod min te //
analyzed: 'di gzung 'gyur na de yang yod min te //
translated: it would be observed, but it is not.

original: de phyir dbyibs tsam shing rtar yod ma yin //
analyzed: de phyir dbyibs tsam shing rtar yod ma yin //
translated: Therefore the chariot does not exist as a mere shape.

original: gal te 'phang lo dang srog shing dang gzer bu la sogs pa shing rta'i yan lag rnams kyi dbyibs kyi khyad par so sor lham pa dang / ring ba dang zlum po la sogs pa gang zhig sngar yod par gyur pa de las de dag gi dbyibs kyi khyad par gzhan zhig kho na shing rta nyid kyi dus su skye bar 'gyur na ni /
analyzed: gal te 'phang lo dang srog shing dang gzer bu la sogs pa shing rta'i yan lag rnams kyi dbyibs kyi khyad par so sor lham pa dang / ring ba dang zlum po la sogs pa gang zhig sngar yod par gyur pa de las de dag gi dbyibs kyi khyad par gzhan zhig kho na shing rta nyid kyi dus su skye bar 'gyur na ni /
translated: If the shape of the parts of the chariot, such as the wheels, axles, and nails, were previously existent, and then a different shape of those parts, such as square, long, round, and so on, were generated at the time of the chariot,

original: de bzung du yod par 'gyur na bzung ba yang ma yin no //üîΩji ltar rtsibs dang mu khyud dang lte ba la sogs pa'i khyad par du gyur pa'i dbyibs can 'phang lo la ni shing rta'i gnas skabs na rang gi dbyibs gzhan du gyur pa nyid ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: de bzung du yod par 'gyur na bzung ba yang ma yin no // ji ltar rtsibs dang mu khyud dang lte ba la sogs pa'i khyad par du gyur pa'i dbyibs can 'phang lo la ni shing rta'i gnas skabs na rang gi dbyibs gzhan du gyur pa nyid ma mthong ngo //
translated: then it would be apprehended, but it is not apprehended.üîΩJust as the shape of the wheel, which has the distinction of spokes, rim, hub, and so on, is not seen to transform into another shape at the time of the chariot,

original: de bzhin du srog shing la sogs pa de dag gi lham pa nyid la sogs pa yang gzhan nyid du 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du srog shing la sogs pa de dag gi lham pa nyid la sogs pa yang gzhan nyid du 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: so too the squareness and so on of the axle and so on do not transform into something else.

original: de phyir yan lag rnams kyi dbyibs shing rta'o zhes bya ba mi rigs so //
analyzed: de phyir yan lag rnams kyi dbyibs shing rta'o zhes bya ba mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is not tenable to say that the shape of the parts is the chariot.

original: ci ste 'phang lo la sogs pa tshogs pa rnams kyi dbyibs kyi khyad par shing rta yin no snyam na /
analyzed: ci ste 'phang lo la sogs pa tshogs pa rnams kyi dbyibs kyi khyad par shing rta yin no snyam na /
translated: But if you think that the specific shape of the collection of wheels, etc. is the chariot,

original: de yang mi rigs so zhes bshad pa /
analyzed: de yang mi rigs so zhes bshad pa /
translated: then that also is untenable.

original: gang phyir khyod kyi tshogs pa cang med pas //
analyzed: gang phyir khyod kyi tshogs pa cang med pas //
translated: Since your collection is nothing at all,

original: dbyibs de yan lag tshogs kyi ma yin na //
analyzed: dbyibs de yan lag tshogs kyi ma yin na //
translated: That shape does not belong to the collection of parts.

original: gang zhig ci yang ma yin de brten nas //
analyzed: gang zhig ci yang ma yin de brten nas //
translated: How could a shape that is based on what is nothing at all

original: 'dir ni dbyibs su lta zhig ci ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: 'dir ni dbyibs su lta zhig ci ltar 'gyur //
translated: Be the shape of the collection of parts here?

original: gal te tshogs pa zhes bya ba dngos po cung zad cig yod na ni de'i rten can dbyibs @305a * //üîΩsu gdags par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te tshogs pa zhes bya ba dngos po cung zad cig yod na ni de'i rten can dbyibs @305a * // su gdags par 'gyur na /
translated: If a thing called ‚Äúcollection‚Äù existed in the least, then a shape could be designated as based on it.

original: yan lag tshogs la zhes bya ba ni cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yan lag tshogs la zhes bya ba ni cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But the collection of parts does not exist in the least.

original: gang zhig cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin pa de'i rten can gyi dbyibs su gdags par yang ji ltar 'gyur te btags pa ni rdzas kyi rten can kho nar khas blangs pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: gang zhig cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin pa de'i rten can gyi dbyibs su gdags par yang ji ltar 'gyur te btags pa ni rdzas kyi rten can kho nar khas blangs pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: How could a shape be designated as the basis of something that does not exist in the slightest? Because it is accepted that designation is only based on substances.

original: / ci ste mi bden du zin kyang tshogs pa la brten nas mi bden pa'i dbyibs su 'gyur ro zhes bya bar 'dod na de lta yin dang / khyod kyi 'di ni ji ltar 'dod de ltar //üîΩmi bden pa yi rgyu la brten byas nas //üîΩ'bras bu'i rnam pa mi bden rang bzhin can //
analyzed: / ci ste mi bden du zin kyang tshogs pa la brten nas mi bden pa'i dbyibs su 'gyur ro zhes bya bar 'dod na de lta yin dang / khyod kyi 'di ni ji ltar 'dod de ltar // mi bden pa yi rgyu la brten byas nas // 'bras bu'i rnam pa mi bden rang bzhin can //
translated: If you assert that even though it is not real, an unreal shape arises in dependence on the collection, then just as you assert this,

original: thams cad kyang ni skye bar shes par gyis //
analyzed: thams cad kyang ni skye bar shes par gyis //
translated: you should understand that all resultsüîΩthat have an unreal nature

original: ma rig pa mi bden pa la brten nas 'du byed mi bden pa'i rang bzhin can kho na skye la /
analyzed: ma rig pa mi bden pa la brten nas 'du byed mi bden pa'i rang bzhin can kho na skye la /
translated: arise in dependence on unreal causes.üîΩActions that have an unreal nature arise in dependence on unreal ignorance.

original: mi bden pa'i rang bzhin can gyi sa bon la brten nas myu gu mi bden pa'i rang bzhin can skye ba de bzhin du rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo mi bden pa'i rang bzhin can ma lus pa yang rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: mi bden pa'i rang bzhin can gyi sa bon la brten nas myu gu mi bden pa'i rang bzhin can skye ba de bzhin du rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo mi bden pa'i rang bzhin can ma lus pa yang rtogs par bya ste /
translated: Just as a sprout of an unreal nature arises in dependence on a seed of an unreal nature, so too should one understand that all causes and effects are of an unreal nature.

original: 'bad rtsol brgya phrag dag gis kyang gang gis sha dag za bar mi nus pa'i dngos po grib ma'i ri dags lta bu la mngon par zhen pa don med pa 'dis ci zhig bya ste /
analyzed: 'bad rtsol brgya phrag dag gis kyang gang gis sha dag za bar mi nus pa'i dngos po grib ma'i ri dags lta bu la mngon par zhen pa don med pa 'dis ci zhig bya ste /
translated: What is the point of this pointless clinging to things that are like shadows, which even hundreds of efforts cannot make one eat flesh?

original: 'dis ni gzugs sogs de ltar gnas rnams la //
analyzed: 'dis ni gzugs sogs de ltar gnas rnams la //
translated: This is also illogical for forms and so on that exist in that way.

original: bum blo zhes bya 'ang rigs pa ma yin nyid //
analyzed: bum blo zhes bya 'ang rigs pa ma yin nyid //
translated: The so-called cognition of a pot is also illogical.

original: de la kha cig na re gzugs la sogs pa de ltar gnas pa rnams la bum pa la sogs pa'i blor 'gyur ro zhes smra ba de yang shing rta'i dpe 'dis bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: de la kha cig na re gzugs la sogs pa de ltar gnas pa rnams la bum pa la sogs pa'i blor 'gyur ro zhes smra ba de yang shing rta'i dpe 'dis bsal ba yin no //
translated: Some say, ‚ÄúCognitions of pots and so on arise with regard to forms and so on that exist in that way.‚Äù This is also refuted by the example of the chariot.

original: gzhan yang / skye ba med pas gzugs sogs kyang yod min //
analyzed: gzhan yang / skye ba med pas gzugs sogs kyang yod min //
translated: Moreover, because they are not produced, forms and so on do not exist.

original: de yi phyir yang de dag dbyibs mi rigs //
analyzed: de yi phyir yang de dag dbyibs mi rigs //
translated: Therefore it is also illogical that they are shapes.

original: ji ltar gzugs la sogs pa rnams la skye ba yod pa ma yin pa de ltar ni sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: ji ltar gzugs la sogs pa rnams la skye ba yod pa ma yin pa de ltar ni sngar bshad zin to //
translated: As for form and so on, it has already been explained that they do not arise.

original: de'i phyir skye ba med pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa dag yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir skye ba med pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa dag yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, because they do not arise, form and so on do not exist.

original: ji ltar yod pa ma yin pa rnams bum pa la sogs pa dag gdags pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid du rigs par 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar yod pa ma yin pa rnams bum pa la sogs pa dag gdags pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid du rigs par 'gyur /
translated: How could that which does not exist be a reason for positing a vase and so on?

original: de'i phyir rdzas kyi nye bar len pa can du 'dod pa bum pa la sogs pa dag mi rigs pas /
analyzed: de'i phyir rdzas kyi nye bar len pa can du 'dod pa bum pa la sogs pa dag mi rigs pas /
translated: Therefore, since it is not tenable that a vase and so on are substantially appropriated,

original: bum pa la sogs pa dag gzugs la sogs pa'i dbyibs kyi khyad par gyi bdag nyid can ma yin no //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa dag gzugs la sogs pa'i dbyibs kyi khyad par gyi bdag nyid can ma yin no //
translated: a vase and so on are not the identity of a particular shape of form and so on.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say,

original: gal te 'o na shing rta 'di ji skad bshad pa'i tshul du rnam pa bdun gyis btsal ba na yod pa ma yin @305b pa de'i tshe shing rta med pas gang zhig shing rtas 'jig rten na tha snyad 'dogs pa de rgyun chad par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te 'o na shing rta 'di ji skad bshad pa'i tshul du rnam pa bdun gyis btsal ba na yod pa ma yin @305b pa de'i tshe shing rta med pas gang zhig shing rtas 'jig rten na tha snyad 'dogs pa de rgyun chad par 'gyur na /
translated: ‚ÄúIf a chariot is not found when sought in the seven ways, as explained, then since a chariot does not exist, the conventions of the world would be disrupted.

original: shing rta 'on cig //
analyzed: shing rta 'on cig //
translated: Bring the chariot!

original: shing rta nyos shig //üîΩshing rta chos shig ces bya ba la sogs pa mthong ba yang yin no //üîΩde'i phyir 'jig rten la grags pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: shing rta nyos shig // shing rta chos shig ces bya ba la sogs pa mthong ba yang yin no // de'i phyir 'jig rten la grags pa'i phyir na /
translated: Drive the chariot!

original: shing rta la sogs pa dag ni yod pa nyid do //üîΩbrjod par bya ste /
analyzed: shing rta la sogs pa dag ni yod pa nyid do // brjod par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, because they are renowned in the world, chariots and so on do exist.

original: nyes pa 'di ni khyod kho na la 'gyur te /
analyzed: nyes pa 'di ni khyod kho na la 'gyur te /
translated: We reply: This fault applies to you alone.

original: 'di ltar sngar bshad pa'i tshul du rnam pa bdun gyis btsal ba na shing rta mi 'thad cing khyod kyis kyang rnam par dpyad nas dngos po grub par rnam par 'jog par byed la /
analyzed: 'di ltar sngar bshad pa'i tshul du rnam pa bdun gyis btsal ba na shing rta mi 'thad cing khyod kyis kyang rnam par dpyad nas dngos po grub par rnam par 'jog par byed la /
translated: Because, as explained earlier, when you search for a chariot in the seven ways, it is not tenable. You also posit things as established through analysis.

original: grub pa'i thabs gzhan yang khas ma blangs pa de'i phyir na shing rta 'o na cig ces bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'i 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad khyod la ci ltar grub par 'gyur /
analyzed: grub pa'i thabs gzhan yang khas ma blangs pa de'i phyir na shing rta 'o na cig ces bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'i 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad khyod la ci ltar grub par 'gyur /
translated: And you do not accept any other means of establishment. Therefore, how could such mundane conventions as ‚ÄúChariot!‚Äù be established for you?

original: kho bo cag la ni nyes pa 'di med de /
analyzed: kho bo cag la ni nyes pa 'di med de /
translated: We do not have this fault.

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Because:

original: de ni de nyid du'am 'jig rten du //
analyzed: de ni de nyid du'am 'jig rten du //
translated: It is not tenable in reality or in the world.

original: rnam pa bdun gyis 'grub 'gyur min mod kyi //üîΩrnam dpyad med par 'jig rten nyid las 'dis //
analyzed: rnam pa bdun gyis 'grub 'gyur min mod kyi // rnam dpyad med par 'jig rten nyid las 'dis //
translated: It is not established by the seven ways.üîΩBut without analysis, it is imputed

original: rang gi yan lag brten nas 'dogs pa yin //
analyzed: rang gi yan lag brten nas 'dogs pa yin //
translated: in the world in dependence on its parts.

original: shing rta rang yan lag las gzhan 'dod min //
analyzed: shing rta rang yan lag las gzhan 'dod min //
translated: The chariot is not asserted to be different from its parts.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshul 'di de rnam pa bdun du btsal ba na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshul 'di de rnam pa bdun du btsal ba na /
translated: In this way, when the chariot is sought in the seven ways,

original: don dam pa dang kun rdzob tu shing rta 'grub par mi 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: don dam pa dang kun rdzob tu shing rta 'grub par mi 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: it is not established ultimately or conventionally.

original: de lta na yang 'di ni rnam par dpyad pa spangs te /
analyzed: de lta na yang 'di ni rnam par dpyad pa spangs te /
translated: Nevertheless, without analysis,

original: sngon po la sogs pa dang tshor ba la sogs pa ltar 'jig rten nyid las 'phang lo la sogs pa yan lag rnams la brten nas 'dogs pa yin no //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa dang tshor ba la sogs pa ltar 'jig rten nyid las 'phang lo la sogs pa yan lag rnams la brten nas 'dogs pa yin no //
translated: like a patch of blue and so on, or a feeling and so on, it is imputed in dependence on its parts, such as wheels and so on, in the world.

original: de'i phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rkyen nyid 'di pa tsam khas blangs pa ltar brten nas brtags pa khas blangs pa'i phyir kho bo cag gi phyogs la 'jig rten gyi tha snyad chad par thal bar mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: de'i phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rkyen nyid 'di pa tsam khas blangs pa ltar brten nas brtags pa khas blangs pa'i phyir kho bo cag gi phyogs la 'jig rten gyi tha snyad chad par thal bar mi 'gyur la /
translated: Therefore, since we accept dependent origination as mere conditionality, we accept dependent imputation. Thus, it does not follow that our position is nihilism with regard to worldly convention.

original: pha rol pos kyang 'di nyid khas blang bar 'os pa yin no //
analyzed: pha rol pos kyang 'di nyid khas blang bar 'os pa yin no //
translated: It is also suitable for the opponent to accept this.

original: phyogs 'dir 'jig rten la grags pa'i sgo nas shing rtas tha snyad 'dogs pa ches gsal bar grub pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: phyogs 'dir 'jig rten la grags pa'i sgo nas shing rtas tha snyad 'dogs pa ches gsal bar grub pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: Not only is the imputation of the chariot by the conventions of the world very clearly established from this position,

original: 'di'i ming gi khyad par gang dag yin pa de dag kyang rnam par dpyad pa med par 'jig rten la grags pa'i sgo nas khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di'i ming gi khyad par gang dag yin pa de dag kyang rnam par dpyad pa med par 'jig rten la grags pa'i sgo nas khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: but also the specific terms for it should be accepted from the perspective of what is renowned in the world without analysis.

original: 'di lta ste //
analyzed: 'di lta ste //
translated: It is like this.

original: de nyid yan lag can te cha shas can //
analyzed: de nyid yan lag can te cha shas can //
translated: That very thing is the possessor of parts and the whole.

original: shing rta de nyid byed po zhes 'gror bsnyad //üîΩskye bo @306a * //
analyzed: shing rta de nyid byed po zhes 'gror bsnyad // skye bo @306a * //
translated: The world refers to that very chariot as the agent.

original: rnams la len po nyid du 'ang grub //
analyzed: rnams la len po nyid du 'ang grub //
translated: It is also established for people as the appropriator.

original: de la shing rta ni 'phang lo la sogs pa rang gi yan lag la ltos nas yan lag can nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la shing rta ni 'phang lo la sogs pa rang gi yan lag la ltos nas yan lag can nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: In this regard, the chariot is the possessor of parts in dependence on its parts, such as the wheels.

original: 'phang lo la sogs pa cha shas la ltos nas ni cha shas can nyid do //
analyzed: 'phang lo la sogs pa cha shas la ltos nas ni cha shas can nyid do //
translated: It is the part possessor in dependence on its parts, such as the nails.

original: 'phang lo la sogs pa nye bar blang ba nye bar len pa'i bya ba la ltos nas ni byed pa po nyid do //
analyzed: 'phang lo la sogs pa nye bar blang ba nye bar len pa'i bya ba la ltos nas ni byed pa po nyid do //
translated: It is the agent in dependence on the action of taking up its parts, such as the wheels.

original: rang gi nye bar len pa la ltos nas ni nye bar len pa po nyid do //
analyzed: rang gi nye bar len pa la ltos nas ni nye bar len pa po nyid do //
translated: It is the appropriator in dependence on its own appropriated parts.

original: gang 'ga' zhig gsung rab kyi don phyin ci log tu rtogs pas yan lag tshogs pa tsam zhig yod kyi yan lag can ni rnam pa thams cad du yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang 'ga' zhig gsung rab kyi don phyin ci log tu rtogs pas yan lag tshogs pa tsam zhig yod kyi yan lag can ni rnam pa thams cad du yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Someone who understands the meaning of the scriptures in a distorted way might say, ‚ÄúOnly the mere collection of parts exists, but the possessor of parts does not exist in any way,

original: de las tha dad par ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las tha dad par ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not observed to be different from them.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du cha shas tsam zhig yod kyi cha shas can ni med do //
analyzed: de bzhin du cha shas tsam zhig yod kyi cha shas can ni med do //
translated: Similarly, only the mere parts exist, but the part possessor does not exist.

original: las 'ba' zhig kho na yod kyi byed pa po ni med do //
analyzed: las 'ba' zhig kho na yod kyi byed pa po ni med do //
translated: Only the mere action exists, but the agent does not exist.

original: nye bar len pa las tha dad par ma dmigs pa'i phyir nye bar len pa kho na yod kyi nye bar len pa po ni med do zhes de lta bur rnam par gnas pa ni 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob phyin ci log tu smra ba de'i ltar na
analyzed: nye bar len pa las tha dad par ma dmigs pa'i phyir nye bar len pa kho na yod kyi nye bar len pa po ni med do zhes de lta bur rnam par gnas pa ni 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob phyin ci log tu smra ba de'i ltar na
translated: The opponent‚Äôs position is as follows:

original: gtan tshigs de nyid kyis yan lag la sogs pa tsam yang med par thal bar 'gyur bas /
analyzed: gtan tshigs de nyid kyis yan lag la sogs pa tsam yang med par thal bar 'gyur bas /
translated: By that very reason, it follows that mere parts and so on do not exist.üîΩTherefore do not destroy the conventions of the world!

original: 'jig rten grags pa'i kun rdzob ma brlag cig / ces 'di ni bzlog par bya ba kho na'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten grags pa'i kun rdzob ma brlag cig / ces 'di ni bzlog par bya ba kho na'o //
translated: This is only to be refuted.

original: gang gi phyir 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob 'di de ltar rnam par dpyad pa na yod par mi 'gyur zhing ma brtags par grags pas yod pa de nyid kyi phyir rnal 'byor pas rim pa 'di nyid kyis 'di la rnam par dpyod pa na ches myur ba kho
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob 'di de ltar rnam par dpyad pa na yod par mi 'gyur zhing ma brtags par grags pas yod pa de nyid kyi phyir rnal 'byor pas rim pa 'di nyid kyis 'di la rnam par dpyod pa na ches myur ba kho
translated: Because this worldly convention does not exist when analyzed in this way, and because it exists through worldly renown without analysis, the yogi who analyzes this in this very sequence will quickly

original: nar de kho na nyid kyi gting dpogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nar de kho na nyid kyi gting dpogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: penetrate the depths of reality.

original: ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: rnam bdun gyis med gang de ji lta bur //
analyzed: rnam bdun gyis med gang de ji lta bur //
translated: How could something that does not exist in any of these seven ways exist?

original: yod ces rnal 'byor pas 'di'i yod mi rnyed //
analyzed: yod ces rnal 'byor pas 'di'i yod mi rnyed //
translated: The yogi does not find the existence of the chariot.

original: des de nyid la'ang bde blag 'jug 'gyur bas //
analyzed: des de nyid la'ang bde blag 'jug 'gyur bas //
translated: Since this easily leads to the understanding of reality,

original: 'dir de'i grub pa de bzhin 'dod par bya //
analyzed: 'dir de'i grub pa de bzhin 'dod par bya //
translated: one should accept the establishment of the chariot in the same way.

original: nye bar rtogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa la gal te shing rta zhes bya ba'i dngos po rang bzhin gyis grub pa 'ga' zhig yod par 'gyur na ni the tshom med par de rnam pa bdun las rnam pa gang yang rung ba zhig gi bdag nyid yod pa rnyedüîΩpar 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: nye bar rtogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa la gal te shing rta zhes bya ba'i dngos po rang bzhin gyis grub pa 'ga' zhig yod par 'gyur na ni the tshom med par de rnam pa bdun las rnam pa gang yang rung ba zhig gi bdag nyid yod pa rnyed par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If the yogi who has realized the chariot were to find the existence of a thing called ‚Äúchariot‚Äù that exists by virtue of its own nature, he would find it without doubt in any of the seven ways.

original: rnyed pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: rnyed pa yang ma yin no //
translated: But he does not find it.

original: de'i phyir shing rta zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa'i ling thog gis nyams par byas pa dag kho nas brtags pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir shing rta zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa'i ling thog gis nyams par byas pa dag kho nas brtags pa yin gyi /
translated: Therefore the so-called chariot is imputed only by those whose vision is impaired by the cataract of ignorance.

original: rang bzhin gyis grub pa ni yod pa ma yin no snyam du de @306b ltar des pa skye bar 'gyur zhing de kho na nyid la yang rnal 'byor pa bde blag tu 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis grub pa ni yod pa ma yin no snyam du de @306b ltar des pa skye bar 'gyur zhing de kho na nyid la yang rnal 'byor pa bde blag tu 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the wise will generate the thought, ‚ÄúIntrinsic reality does not exist,‚Äù and they will easily enter into the yoga of reality.

original: 'ang gi sgras ni kun rdzob nyams par yang mi 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: 'ang gi sgras ni kun rdzob nyams par yang mi 'gyur ba ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù indicates that the conventional will not be undermined.

original: de'i phyir 'di ni ma brtags par grags par grub par 'dod par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ni ma brtags par grags par grub par 'dod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, this should be accepted as a position that is established through worldly renown without analysis.

original: mkhas pa dag gis phyogs 'di ni skyon med cing phan yon dang bcas pa'o snyam du bsams te gdon mi za bar khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: mkhas pa dag gis phyogs 'di ni skyon med cing phan yon dang bcas pa'o snyam du bsams te gdon mi za bar khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: The wise should think that this position is faultless and beneficial, and they should accept it without doubt.

original: 'dir smras pa rnal 'byor pas shing rta mi dmigs la rag mod de'i yan lag tshogs pa tsam zhig dmigs pa ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir smras pa rnal 'byor pas shing rta mi dmigs la rag mod de'i yan lag tshogs pa tsam zhig dmigs pa ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Here, someone might say, ‚ÄúIt is fine if the yogi does not observe a chariot, but the mere collection of its parts is observed.‚Äù

original: bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: bshad par bya ste /
translated: We respond:

original: gang zhig snam bu tshig na thal ba la snal ma tshol ba khyod ni bzhad gang du bya ba zhig ste /
analyzed: gang zhig snam bu tshig na thal ba la snal ma tshol ba khyod ni bzhad gang du bya ba zhig ste /
translated: You are laughable, searching for threads in the ashes of a burned woolen cloth!

original: shing rta yod nyid min na de yi tshe //
analyzed: shing rta yod nyid min na de yi tshe //
translated: When the chariot does not exist,

original: yan lag can med de'i yan lag kyang med //
analyzed: yan lag can med de'i yan lag kyang med //
translated: There is no possessor of parts, nor are there parts.

original: gal te shing rta zhig na de'i 'phang lo la sogs pa tshogs pa dmigs pa nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te shing rta zhig na de'i 'phang lo la sogs pa tshogs pa dmigs pa nyid ma yin nam /
translated: If a chariot is destroyed, aren‚Äôt its parts, such as the wheels, still observed?

original: de'i phyir yan lag can med par yan lag dag kyang med do zhes ci ste brjod ci na ;
analyzed: de'i phyir yan lag can med par yan lag dag kyang med do zhes ci ste brjod ci na ;
translated: So why do you say, ‚ÄúWithout a possessor of parts, there are no parts‚Äù?

original: de ni de ltar ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni de ltar ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: rtog pa po shing rta dang 'brel par rig pa kho nas 'phang lo la sogs pa 'di dag ni shing rta yin no snyam du rtogs kyi gzhan gyis ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rtog pa po shing rta dang 'brel par rig pa kho nas 'phang lo la sogs pa 'di dag ni shing rta yin no snyam du rtogs kyi gzhan gyis ni ma yin te /
translated: Only someone who is aware of the connection with the chariot thinks, ‚ÄúThese wheels, etc. are a chariot.‚Äù Others do not.

original: des ni rang gi cha shas la ltos nas 'phang lo la sogs pa dag kho na yan lag can nyid du rtogs par 'gyur ro//
analyzed: des ni rang gi cha shas la ltos nas 'phang lo la sogs pa dag kho na yan lag can nyid du rtogs par 'gyur ro//
translated: That person understands that only the wheels, etc. are the possessor of parts in dependence on their parts.

original: 'phang lo la sogs pa rnams shing rta dang 'brel pa yang rgyang ring du spangs pa kho na yin pas de'i tshe de dag shing rta'i yan lag tu mi rtogs so //
analyzed: 'phang lo la sogs pa rnams shing rta dang 'brel pa yang rgyang ring du spangs pa kho na yin pas de'i tshe de dag shing rta'i yan lag tu mi rtogs so //
translated: Since the wheels, etc. are far removed from the connection with the chariot, at that time they are not understood to be the parts of the chariot.

original: gzhan yang don 'di ni dpe 'di las shes par bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang don 'di ni dpe 'di las shes par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, this point can be understood from this example.

original: shing rta tshig na yan lag med dpe bzhin //
analyzed: shing rta tshig na yan lag med dpe bzhin //
translated: Just as when a chariot is burned, its parts are no more.

original: blo mes yan lag can sreg yan lag go //
analyzed: blo mes yan lag can sreg yan lag go //
translated: The fire of intelligence burns the whole chariot, parts and all.

original: dper na shing rta yan lag can mes tshig na de'i yan lag dag kyang nges par tshig par 'gyur ba de bzhin du rnam par dpyod pa'i gtsub shing gtsubs pa las byung ba blo'i me mi dmigs pa'i sreg par byed pa can gyis shing rta lus pa med
analyzed: dper na shing rta yan lag can mes tshig na de'i yan lag dag kyang nges par tshig par 'gyur ba de bzhin du rnam par dpyod pa'i gtsub shing gtsubs pa las byung ba blo'i me mi dmigs pa'i sreg par byed pa can gyis shing rta lus pa med
translated: Just as when a chariot is burned, its parts are no more, in the same way, the fire of intelligence, which arises from the friction of thorough analysis, and which has the function of consuming all objects of knowledge, burns the chariot without leaving any remnant.

original: par bsregs pas na shes rab kyi me'i bud shing du gyur pa yan lag dag gis kyang bdag nyid zug tshugs par mi byed de nges par bsregs pa'i phyir ro //üîΩji ltar kun rdzob kyi bden pa mi gcad par bya ba'i phyir dang / rnal 'byor pa rnams de kho na nyid la bde blag tu 'jug par bya ba'i phyir shing rta rnam par dpyad pa'i tshul la bsams @307a * //
analyzed: par bsregs pas na shes rab kyi me'i bud shing du gyur pa yan lag dag gis kyang bdag nyid zug tshugs par mi byed de nges par bsregs pa'i phyir ro // ji ltar kun rdzob kyi bden pa mi gcad par bya ba'i phyir dang / rnal 'byor pa rnams de kho na nyid la bde blag tu 'jug par bya ba'i phyir shing rta rnam par dpyad pa'i tshul la bsams @307a * //
translated: Therefore, the parts, which are the fuel for the fire of wisdom, do not remain either, because they are definitely consumed.

original: te brten nas gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa /
analyzed: te brten nas gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa /
translated: In order to avoid the cessation of conventional truth and in order to help yogis easily enter into reality, we have considered the method of analyzing the chariot and have presented the chariot as a dependent designation.

original: de bzhin 'jig rten grags pas phung po dang // khams dang de bzhin skye mched drug brten nas //
analyzed: de bzhin 'jig rten grags pas phung po dang // khams dang de bzhin skye mched drug brten nas //
translated: Likewise, in terms of what is familiar in the world, the self is asserted to be the appropriator in dependence upon the aggregates,

original: bdag kyang nye bar len po nyid du 'dod //
analyzed: bdag kyang nye bar len po nyid du 'dod //
translated: the six constituents, and likewise the six sources.

original: ji ltar 'phang lo la sogs pa dag la brten nas shing rtar 'dogs shing der 'phang lo la sogs pa dag nye bar len pa yin la shing rta nye par len pa po min pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar 'phang lo la sogs pa dag la brten nas shing rtar 'dogs shing der 'phang lo la sogs pa dag nye bar len pa yin la shing rta nye par len pa po min pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as a chariot is imputed in dependence upon wheels and so on, and the wheels and so on are its appropriated, but the chariot is not the appropriated of the wheels and so on,üîΩin the same way, the self is asserted to be the appropriator in dependence upon the aggregates, constituents, and sources, like the chariot.

original: bdag kyang kun rdzob kyi bden par 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kun tu mi gcad par bya ba'i phyir shing rta ltar nye bar len pa por 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag kyang kun rdzob kyi bden par 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kun tu mi gcad par bya ba'i phyir shing rta ltar nye bar len pa por 'dod pa yin no //
translated: This is in order to not eliminate the conventions of the world in terms of conventional truth.

original: phung po lnga dang khams drug dang skye mched drug ni bdag de'i nye bar len pa ste /
analyzed: phung po lnga dang khams drug dang skye mched drug ni bdag de'i nye bar len pa ste /
translated: The five aggregates, the six constituents, and the six sources are the appropriated of that self.

original: phung po la sogs pa rnams la brten nas bdag tu btags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa rnams la brten nas bdag tu btags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the self is imputed in dependence upon the aggregates and so on.

original: ji ltar 'phang lo la sogs pa dag shing rta'i nye bar len pa yin pa de bzhin du phung po la sogs pa rnams kyang bdag gi nye bar len pa'o zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar 'phang lo la sogs pa dag shing rta'i nye bar len pa yin pa de bzhin du phung po la sogs pa rnams kyang bdag gi nye bar len pa'o zhes bya'o //
translated: Just as the wheels, etc. are the appropriated of the chariot, so the aggregates, etc. are the appropriated of the self.

original: ji ltar nye bar len pa dang nye bar len pa po'i rnam par gzhag pa 'di 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du rnam par gzhag pa de bzhin du 'di'i las dang byed pa po'i rnam par gzhag pa yang shing rta ltar khas blang bar bya'o zhes bshad pa
analyzed: ji ltar nye bar len pa dang nye bar len pa po'i rnam par gzhag pa 'di 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du rnam par gzhag pa de bzhin du 'di'i las dang byed pa po'i rnam par gzhag pa yang shing rta ltar khas blang bar bya'o zhes bshad pa
translated: Just as the presentation of the appropriated and the appropriator is presented conventionally, so the presentation of action and agent should be accepted in this case, as in the case of the chariot.

original: / nyer len las yin 'di ni byed pa po yang yin //
analyzed: / nyer len las yin 'di ni byed pa po yang yin //
translated: The appropriated is the action, and this is the agent.

original: nye bar len pa zhes bya ba phung po la sogs pa dag ni las nyid dang bdag ni byed pa po zhes bya bar rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: nye bar len pa zhes bya ba phung po la sogs pa dag ni las nyid dang bdag ni byed pa po zhes bya bar rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The appropriated, i.e., the aggregates, etc. are presented as action, and the self is presented as the agent.

original: brten nas gdags pa la yang dag par brten pa na bdag rnam pa thams cad du brtan pa dang mi brtan pa la sogs pa'i rtogs pa'i rten ma yin pa nyid pas rtag pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rtog pa zlog pa sla bar 'gyur ro
analyzed: brten nas gdags pa la yang dag par brten pa na bdag rnam pa thams cad du brtan pa dang mi brtan pa la sogs pa'i rtogs pa'i rten ma yin pa nyid pas rtag pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rtog pa zlog pa sla bar 'gyur ro
translated: But when one relies on the self that is imputed in dependence on the aggregates, it is easy to reverse the conception of the self as permanent, impermanent, and so on, because such a self is not a basis for the conception of being permanent or impermanent, and so on.

original: zhes bshad pa /
analyzed: zhes bshad pa /
translated: This is explained in the following:

original: dngos yod min phyir 'di ni brtan min zhing //
analyzed: dngos yod min phyir 'di ni brtan min zhing //
translated: Since it does not exist as a thing, it is not permanent;

original: mi brtan nyid min 'di ni skye 'jig min //
analyzed: mi brtan nyid min 'di ni skye 'jig min //
translated: It is not impermanent, it does not arise or disintegrate.

original: 'di la rtag pa nyid la sogs pa yang //
analyzed: 'di la rtag pa nyid la sogs pa yang //
translated: It is not permanent and so on,

original: yod min de nyid dang ni gzhan nyid med //
analyzed: yod min de nyid dang ni gzhan nyid med //
translated: Nor is it nonexistent or existent.

original: phung po dag la brten nas gdags pa'i bdag 'di ni brten pa nyid kyang ma yin zhing mi brtan pa nyid kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: phung po dag la brten nas gdags pa'i bdag 'di ni brten pa nyid kyang ma yin zhing mi brtan pa nyid kyang ma yin no //
translated: The self that is imputed in dependence on the aggregates is not even a basis for the conception of being permanent or impermanent.

original: de la gal te bdag mi brtan pa yin na ni de'i tshe /
analyzed: de la gal te bdag mi brtan pa yin na ni de'i tshe /
translated: If the self were impermanent,

original: nye bar len nyid bdag ma yin //
analyzed: nye bar len nyid bdag ma yin //
translated: then the appropriated itself would not be the self.

original: de dag 'byung dang 'jig pa yin //üîΩnye bar blangs pa ci lta bur //
analyzed: de dag 'byung dang 'jig pa yin // nye bar blangs pa ci lta bur //
translated: They arise and disintegrate.üîΩHow could the appropriated

original: nye bar len po yin par 'gyur //
analyzed: nye bar len po yin par 'gyur //
translated: Be the appropriator?

original: zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du /
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du /
translated: And similarly,

original: ma byung ba las 'byung min te //
analyzed: ma byung ba las 'byung min te //
translated: It does not arise from what has not occurred.

original: 'di la skyon du @307b thal bar 'gyur //üîΩbdag ni byas par 'gyur pa'am //
analyzed: 'di la skyon du @307b thal bar 'gyur // bdag ni byas par 'gyur pa'am //
translated: This would entail the errorüîΩThat the self would be created,

original: 'byung ba'ang rgyu med can du 'gyur //
analyzed: 'byung ba'ang rgyu med can du 'gyur //
translated: Or that what occurs would be causeless.

original: zhes bya ba'ang bstan bcos dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'ang bstan bcos dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: This would contradict the treatise.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For this reason,

original: gal te phung po bdag yin na //
analyzed: gal te phung po bdag yin na //
translated: If the aggregates were the self,

original: skye dang 'jig pa can du 'gyur na skye zhing 'jig pa can du 'dod pa'ang ma yin te /
analyzed: skye dang 'jig pa can du 'gyur na skye zhing 'jig pa can du 'dod pa'ang ma yin te /
translated: The self would be subject to production and disintegration. But it is not maintained that the self is subject to production and disintegration.

original: de'i phyir phung po bdag ma yin no zhes bya ba'i thal bar 'gyur ba 'di yang 'thad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir phung po bdag ma yin no zhes bya ba'i thal bar 'gyur ba 'di yang 'thad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, this reductio argument, ‚ÄúThe aggregates are not the self,‚Äù is valid.

original: de'i phyir 'di ni mi brtan pa nyid du yang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ni mi brtan pa nyid du yang mi 'thad do //
translated: Thus, it is not tenable that the self is impermanent.

original: de bzhin du brtan par yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de bzhin du brtan par yang mi 'thad de /
translated: Similarly, it is not tenable that the self is permanent.

original: ji skad du /üîΩ'das pa'i dus ni byung gyur zhes //
analyzed: ji skad du / 'das pa'i dus ni byung gyur zhes //
translated: As it is said,

original: bya ba 'di ni mi 'thad do //
analyzed: bya ba 'di ni mi 'thad do //
translated: It is not tenable to say,üîΩ‚ÄúIn the past I was someone else.‚Äù

original: sngon tshe rnams su gang byung ba //
analyzed: sngon tshe rnams su gang byung ba //
translated: The one who existed in previous lives

original: de nyid de ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid de ni ma yin no //
translated: Is not the same as this one.

original: de nyid bdag tu 'gyur snyam na //
analyzed: de nyid bdag tu 'gyur snyam na //
translated: If you think that it is the self,

original: nye bar len pa tha dad 'gyur //
analyzed: nye bar len pa tha dad 'gyur //
translated: then the appropriator and the appropriated would be different.

original: nye bar len las ma gtogs par //
analyzed: nye bar len las ma gtogs par //
translated: Apart from the appropriated aggregates,

original: khyod kyi bdag ni gang zhig yin //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
analyzed: khyod kyi bdag ni gang zhig yin // zhes gsungs so //
translated: what is your self?

original: skye dang 'jig pa can du 'gyur //
analyzed: skye dang 'jig pa can du 'gyur //
translated: It would be subject to production and disintegration.

original: zhes bya ba'i thal bar 'gyur ba 'di nyid las na 'di ni skye 'jig min zhes bya ba'i khyad par gnyis slob dpon gyi bzhed pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i thal bar 'gyur ba 'di nyid las na 'di ni skye 'jig min zhes bya ba'i khyad par gnyis slob dpon gyi bzhed pa yin no //
translated: From this consequence itself, the master accepts the two distinctions: ‚ÄúIt is not subject to production and disintegration.‚Äù

original: 'di la rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'ang yod pa min te /
analyzed: 'di la rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'ang yod pa min te /
translated: Here, permanence, etc., also do not exist.

original: ji skad du slob dpon gyis de bzhin gshegs pa brtags pa'i thabs kyis bdag yongs su rtogs par mdzad pa na /
analyzed: ji skad du slob dpon gyis de bzhin gshegs pa brtags pa'i thabs kyis bdag yongs su rtogs par mdzad pa na /
translated: As the master says in the Examination of the Tathagata, when the means of understanding the self is investigated,

original: rtag dang mi rtag la sogs bzhi //
analyzed: rtag dang mi rtag la sogs bzhi //
translated: How can the four, such as permanence,

original: zhi ba 'di la ga la yod //
analyzed: zhi ba 'di la ga la yod //
translated: exist in this peace?

original: mtha' dang mtha' med la sogs bzhi //
analyzed: mtha' dang mtha' med la sogs bzhi //
translated: How can the four, such as finitude,

original: zhi ba 'di la ga la yod //üîΩgang gis de bzhin gshegs yod ces //
analyzed: zhi ba 'di la ga la yod // gang gis de bzhin gshegs yod ces //
translated: exist in this peace?üîΩWhoever grasps the thick grasping

original: 'dzin pa stug po bzung gyur pa //
analyzed: 'dzin pa stug po bzung gyur pa //
translated: that the Tathagata exists,üîΩfor him

original: de ni mya ngan 'das pa la //
analyzed: de ni mya ngan 'das pa la //
translated: nirvana

original: med ces rnam rtog rtog par byed//
analyzed: med ces rnam rtog rtog par byed//
translated: He conceptualizes non-existence through conceptualization.

original: rang bzhin gyis ni stong de la //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis ni stong de la //
translated: That which is empty of intrinsic nature

original: sangs rgyas mya ngan 'das nas ni //
analyzed: sangs rgyas mya ngan 'das nas ni //
translated: After the Buddha has passed into Nirva·πáa,üîΩIt is not tenable to think

original: yod do zhe'am med do zhes //üîΩbsam pa 'thad pa nyid mi 'gyur //üîΩzhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: yod do zhe'am med do zhes // bsam pa 'thad pa nyid mi 'gyur // zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: That he exists or does not exist.

original: 'di ni phung po dag las de nyid dang // gzhan nyid du yod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni phung po dag las de nyid dang // gzhan nyid du yod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: This is because the self does not exist as identical to or different from the aggregates.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: gal te phung po bdag yin na//
analyzed: gal te phung po bdag yin na//
translated: If the aggregates were the self,

original: skye dang 'jig pa can du 'gyur //
analyzed: skye dang 'jig pa can du 'gyur //
