translated: It would have the nature of arising and ceasing.

original: gal te phung po rnams las gzhan //
analyzed: gal te phung po rnams las gzhan //
translated: If it were different from the aggregates,

original: phung po'i mtshan nyid med par 'gyur //
analyzed: phung po'i mtshan nyid med par 'gyur //
translated: It would not have the characteristics of the aggregates.

original: zhes bya ba dang de bzhin du //
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang de bzhin du //
translated: And similarly:

original: shing nyid me ni ma yin te //
analyzed: shing nyid me ni ma yin te //
translated: Fire is not the fuel.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: And so on.

original: yang ci'i phyir mi brtan pa la sogs pa'i rtog pa 'di rnams @308a * //
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir mi brtan pa la sogs pa'i rtog pa 'di rnams @308a * //
translated: Why are these conceptualizations of impermanence, etc.

original: bdag la mi rung zhe na /
analyzed: bdag la mi rung zhe na /
translated: unsuitable for the self?

original: dngos yod min phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: dngos yod min phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, ‚Äúbecause the thing does not exist.‚Äù

original: gal te bdag dngos po'i rang bzhin can 'ga' zhig yod na ni de la mi brtan pa la sogs pa'i rtog pa rnams yod par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: gal te bdag dngos po'i rang bzhin can 'ga' zhig yod na ni de la mi brtan pa la sogs pa'i rtog pa rnams yod par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If the self were to exist with the nature of a thing, then thoughts of its instability, etc., would exist.

original: bdag ni 'ga' yang med de /
analyzed: bdag ni 'ga' yang med de /
translated: But the self does not exist in the least,

original: de med pa kho na'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med pa kho na'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not exist at all.

original: ji skad du mdo las /
analyzed: ji skad du mdo las /
translated: As a sutra teaches:

original: mi bzad pa yi chos bzhi ni //
analyzed: mi bzad pa yi chos bzhi ni //
translated: The four unassailable doctrines

original: 'jig rten mgon gyis bstan pa ste //
analyzed: 'jig rten mgon gyis bstan pa ste //
translated: were taught by the Protector of the World:

original: sems can nam mkha' byang chub sems //
analyzed: sems can nam mkha' byang chub sems //
translated: Sentient beings, space, the enlightened mind,

original: de bzhin sangs rgyas chos rnams so //
analyzed: de bzhin sangs rgyas chos rnams so //
translated: and the qualities of the Buddha.

original: gal te de dag rdzas yod na //
analyzed: gal te de dag rdzas yod na //
translated: If they were to exist substantially,

original: de dag yongs su zad 'gyur grang //
analyzed: de dag yongs su zad 'gyur grang //
translated: they would be exhaustible.

original: med pa de dag mi zad de //üîΩde phyir de dag zad med gsungs //
analyzed: med pa de dag mi zad de // de phyir de dag zad med gsungs //
translated: But since they do not exist, they are not exhausted;

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: therefore they are said to be inexhaustible.

original: gang zhig rnam pa bdun gyis btsal na /
analyzed: gang zhig rnam pa bdun gyis btsal na /
translated: If one searches for the self in the seven ways,

original: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa nyid du mi srid cing gang zhig gi med pa nyid ma mthong zhing ma rig pa'i dbang gis yod pa nyid du zhen par byas nas 'jig tshogs /
analyzed: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa nyid du mi srid cing gang zhig gi med pa nyid ma mthong zhing ma rig pa'i dbang gis yod pa nyid du zhen par byas nas 'jig tshogs /
translated: it is impossible to be either permanent or impermanent. Since it is not seen to exist, it is imagined to exist through the power of ignorance.

original: la lta bas 'di ni bdag go snyam du mngon par zhen pa rnams 'khor bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: la lta bas 'di ni bdag go snyam du mngon par zhen pa rnams 'khor bar 'gyur la /
translated: The self is the object of the conception of ‚ÄúI‚Äù

original: gang la rtag tu 'gro rnams ngar 'dzin blo //üîΩrab tu 'byung zhing de yi gang yin der //
analyzed: gang la rtag tu 'gro rnams ngar 'dzin blo // rab tu 'byung zhing de yi gang yin der //
translated: That always occurs in sentient beings.

original: nga yi 'dzin blo 'byung ba'i bdag de ni //
analyzed: nga yi 'dzin blo 'byung ba'i bdag de ni //
translated: The self is the object of the conception of ‚Äúmine‚ÄùüîΩThat occurs in those who have gone for refuge.üîΩThis self is a mere imputation,

original: ma brtags grags par gti mug las yin no //
analyzed: ma brtags grags par gti mug las yin no //
translated: Not to be analyzed, due to worldly consensus.

original: gang zhig yongs su tshol ba ni mu stegs pa de'i rigs pas mi 'thad pas de'i rang bzhin la phyin ci log tu gyur pa thams cad phung po las tha dad par zhen zhing /
analyzed: gang zhig yongs su tshol ba ni mu stegs pa de'i rigs pas mi 'thad pas de'i rang bzhin la phyin ci log tu gyur pa thams cad phung po las tha dad par zhen zhing /
translated: Those who search for the self are non-Buddhists. Since their logic is untenable, they are mistaken about the nature of the self. They cling to the self as being different from the aggregates.

original: rang gi sde pa rnams kyis kyang phung po las tha dad par bdag med do snyam du 'khrul pas phung po tsam nyid bdag tu khas blangs pa /
analyzed: rang gi sde pa rnams kyis kyang phung po las tha dad par bdag med do snyam du 'khrul pas phung po tsam nyid bdag tu khas blangs pa /
translated: Our own Buddhist factions also err in thinking that the self does not exist apart from the aggregates. They accept that the mere aggregates are the self.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas nye bar bstan pa phyin ci ma log par khong du chud pa rnams ni yod pa ma yin pa nyid do snyam du rig par byas nas lan brgyar yongs su grol bar 'gyur ba de ni bdag yin zhing /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas nye bar bstan pa phyin ci ma log par khong du chud pa rnams ni yod pa ma yin pa nyid do snyam du rig par byas nas lan brgyar yongs su grol bar 'gyur ba de ni bdag yin zhing /
translated: The self is the one who, having understood that the teachings of the TathƒÅgata are unmistaken, is liberated hundreds of times.

original: 'gro ba mi dang yi dvags dang dud 'gro la sogs pa'i 'gro bar gnas pa mi shes pa dang rjes su 'brel pa mtha' dag la rtag tu gang zhig la ngar 'dzin pa'i blo 'byung ba de dag yin par rig par bya la /
analyzed: 'gro ba mi dang yi dvags dang dud 'gro la sogs pa'i 'gro bar gnas pa mi shes pa dang rjes su 'brel pa mtha' dag la rtag tu gang zhig la ngar 'dzin pa'i blo 'byung ba de dag yin par rig par bya la /
translated: The self is the one who is always the object of the conception of ‚ÄúI‚Äù in all those who are related to ignorance and who abide in the realms of humans, hungry ghosts, animals, and so on.

original: gang du 'di dbang byed pa nyid dam 'brel pa 'ga' zhig tu 'gyur ba 'di gdags pa'i rkyen mig la sogs pa nang gi bdag @308b nyid can dang / phyi rol gang yin pa der bdag gir 'dzin pa'i blo 'byung ba bdag de ni shes pa las grub pa yin gyi rang gi ngo bos grub pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang du 'di dbang byed pa nyid dam 'brel pa 'ga' zhig tu 'gyur ba 'di gdags pa'i rkyen mig la sogs pa nang gi bdag @308b nyid can dang / phyi rol gang yin pa der bdag gir 'dzin pa'i blo 'byung ba bdag de ni shes pa las grub pa yin gyi rang gi ngo bos grub pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The self is established by consciousness, not by its own nature. The self is the one who is the object of the conception of ‚Äúmine‚Äù in relation to the eyes and so on, which are the conditions for imputation and which are either the inner self or the outer self.

original: gang gi phyir 'di yod pa ma yin mod kyi 'on kyang gti mug las tha snyad 'dogs pa de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di yod pa ma yin mod kyi 'on kyang gti mug las tha snyad 'dogs pa de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Although it does not exist, still, due to the imputation of convention from delusion,

original: rnal 'byor pa dag gis rnam pa thams cad du mi dmigs la /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa dag gis rnam pa thams cad du mi dmigs la /
translated: yogis do not observe it in any way.

original: de ma dmigs na yang mig la sogs pa de'i nye bar len pa rnams mi 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ma dmigs na yang mig la sogs pa de'i nye bar len pa rnams mi 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And when it is not observed, the appropriators of eyes, etc. do not occur.

original: 'di ltar rnal 'byor pas ni dngos po 'ga' la yang rang gi ngo bo dmigs pa med de /
analyzed: 'di ltar rnal 'byor pas ni dngos po 'ga' la yang rang gi ngo bo dmigs pa med de /
translated: Thus, yogis do not observe the intrinsic reality of any thing.

original: de'i phyir 'khor ba las rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'khor ba las rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, they are liberated from cyclic existence.

original: ji skad du /üîΩnang dang phyi rol nyid dag la //
analyzed: ji skad du / nang dang phyi rol nyid dag la //
translated: As it is said:üîΩWhen the thought of ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine‚Äù

original: bdag dang bdag gi snyam zad na //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gi snyam zad na //
translated: is exhausted with regard to the internal and external,

original: nye bar len pa 'gag 'gyur zhing //üîΩde zad pas na skye ba zad //
analyzed: nye bar len pa 'gag 'gyur zhing // de zad pas na skye ba zad //
translated: the appropriated will cease.

original: ces gsungs so //
analyzed: ces gsungs so //
translated: And through its exhaustion, birth is exhausted.

original: yang ji ltar na bdag med na bdag gi ba yang med ce na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar na bdag med na bdag gi ba yang med ce na /
translated: Again, how is it that if there is no self, there is also no ‚Äúmine‚Äù?

original: bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa //
analyzed: bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa //
translated: In order to demonstrate this, it is said:

original: gang phyir byed po med can las med pa //
analyzed: gang phyir byed po med can las med pa //
translated: Since there is no action without an agent,

original: de phyir bdag gi bdag med par yod min //
analyzed: de phyir bdag gi bdag med par yod min //
translated: ‚Äúmine‚Äù does not exist without a self.

original: de phyir bdag dang bdag gi stong lta zhing //
analyzed: de phyir bdag dang bdag gi stong lta zhing //
translated: Therefore, seeing the emptiness of self and ‚Äúmine,‚Äù

original: rnal 'byor pa de rnam par grol par 'gyur //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa de rnam par grol par 'gyur //
translated: the yogi is liberated.

original: ji ltar rdza mkhan med par bum pa yang mi srid pa de bzhin du bdag med par bdag gi ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar rdza mkhan med par bum pa yang mi srid pa de bzhin du bdag med par bdag gi ba yang ma yin no //
translated: Just as a pot is impossible without a potter, so too ‚Äúmine‚Äù is impossible without a self.

original: de'i phyir bdag dang bdag gi nye bar ma dmigs pas 'khor ba ma gzigs pa na rnal 'byor pa grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag dang bdag gi nye bar ma dmigs pas 'khor ba ma gzigs pa na rnal 'byor pa grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, since the yogi does not observe a self or ‚Äúmine,‚Äù when he does not see cyclic existence, he is liberated.

original: gzugs la sogs pa ma dmigs na ni de la der gtogs pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams mi 'byung bas /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa ma dmigs na ni de la der gtogs pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams mi 'byung bas /
translated: If he does not observe form and so on, attachment and so on that are included in that do not arise.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams len pa med par mya ngan las 'da' bar rnam par gzhag la /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams len pa med par mya ngan las 'da' bar rnam par gzhag la /
translated: Therefore, ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas are posited as attaining nirvana without grasping.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni bdag med par mthong du zin kyang snying rje'i gzhan gyi dbang gis byang chub kyi bar du sred pa'i rgyun 'dzin par byed pas mkhas pas ji skad bshad pa'i bdag med pa yongs su btsal bar bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni bdag med par mthong du zin kyang snying rje'i gzhan gyi dbang gis byang chub kyi bar du sred pa'i rgyun 'dzin par byed pas mkhas pas ji skad bshad pa'i bdag med pa yongs su btsal bar bya'o //
translated: Although the Bodhisattvas have seen selflessness, they maintain the continuity of craving until enlightenment, because of the power of their compassion for others. Therefore, the wise should seek selflessness as it has been explained.

original: ji ltar bdag dang de'i nye bar len pa gdags pa shing rta'i rnam par dpyad pa dang mtshungs pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar bdag dang de'i nye bar len pa gdags pa shing rta'i rnam par dpyad pa dang mtshungs pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as the imputation of self and its appropriated aggregates is similar to the analysis of a chariot,üîΩso it is with other things as well.

original: dngos po gzhan rnams kyi'ang yin no zhes bsgre ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dngos po gzhan rnams kyi'ang yin no zhes bsgre ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to extend this to other things, it says:üîΩThe pot, cloth, blanket, army, forest, garland, tree,üîΩhouse, small chariot, and inn, and so on,

original: bum pa snam bu re lde dmag dang nags tshal phreng ba ljon shing dang // khang khyim shing rta phran dang 'gron gnas la sogs dngos rnams gang dag dang / @309a * //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bum pa snam bu re lde dmag dang nags tshal phreng ba ljon shing dang // khang khyim shing rta phran dang 'gron gnas la sogs dngos rnams gang dag dang / @309a * // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: and all other thingsüîΩare like the chariot.

original: de rnams shing rta'i rnam dpyad byas pas rnam bdun yod min zhing //
analyzed: de rnams shing rta'i rnam dpyad byas pas rnam bdun yod min zhing //
translated: They do not exist in any of the seven ways,

original: de las gzhan du gyur par 'jig rten grags pa'i sgo nas yod pa yin //
analyzed: de las gzhan du gyur par 'jig rten grags pa'i sgo nas yod pa yin //
translated: but they exist in terms of what is familiar to the world.

original: zhes bya ba 'di dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di dang sbyar ro //
translated: This is to be applied to the above.

original: gang yang de lta bu'i rigs can gyi dngos po gzhan /
analyzed: gang yang de lta bu'i rigs can gyi dngos po gzhan /
translated: And also, any other thing of that kind.

original: de bzhin gang dag sgo nas skye 'dis bsnyad pa de rnams rtogs bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gang dag sgo nas skye 'dis bsnyad pa de rnams rtogs bya ste /
translated: And also, whatever is the means by which this world is designated, that should be understood.

original: ma brtags par grags pa kho nar ro //
analyzed: ma brtags par grags pa kho nar ro //
translated: But only in terms of what is renowned without analysis.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang phyir thub dbang de ni 'jig rten lhan cig rtsod mi mdzad phyir ro //
analyzed: gang phyir thub dbang de ni 'jig rten lhan cig rtsod mi mdzad phyir ro //
translated: Because the Lord of Sages does not debate with the world.

original: 'jig rten nga dang lhan cig rtsod kyi nga ni 'jig rten dang mi rtsod do zhes bya ba'i lung las na 'jig rten gyi grags pa la gnod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten nga dang lhan cig rtsod kyi nga ni 'jig rten dang mi rtsod do zhes bya ba'i lung las na 'jig rten gyi grags pa la gnod par mi bya'o //
translated: Since it is said, ‚ÄúThe world debates with me, but I do not debate with the world,‚Äù one should not contradict what is renowned in the world.

original: yang 'jig rten dngos po gang dag gis ji ltar tha snyad 'dogs she na /
analyzed: yang 'jig rten dngos po gang dag gis ji ltar tha snyad 'dogs she na /
translated: Again, by what things does the world make designations?

original: de bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: de bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: To explain that, it is said:

original: yon tan yan lag 'dod chags mtshan nyid dang ni bud shing la sogs dang // yon tan can yan lag can chags dang mtshan gzhi me la sogs don dag / de rnams shing rta'i rnam dpyad byas pas rnam bdun yod pa ma yin zhing //
analyzed: yon tan yan lag 'dod chags mtshan nyid dang ni bud shing la sogs dang // yon tan can yan lag can chags dang mtshan gzhi me la sogs don dag / de rnams shing rta'i rnam dpyad byas pas rnam bdun yod pa ma yin zhing //
translated: These do not exist in the seven ways when subjected to the analysis of the chariot.

original: de las gzhan du gyur par 'jig rten grags pa'i sgo nas yod pa yin //
analyzed: de las gzhan du gyur par 'jig rten grags pa'i sgo nas yod pa yin //
translated: But they do exist in terms of what is familiar in the world.

original: ji ltar bum pa yan lag can yin la gyo mo la sogs pa de dag de'i yan lag yin zhing /üîΩbum pa yon tan can yin la me ris sngo bsangs la sogs pa dag 'di'i yon tan yin zhing /
analyzed: ji ltar bum pa yan lag can yin la gyo mo la sogs pa de dag de'i yan lag yin zhing / bum pa yon tan can yin la me ris sngo bsangs la sogs pa dag 'di'i yon tan yin zhing /
translated: Just as a pot is the whole, and its parts, such as its base, are its parts;üîΩjust as a pot is the attribute-possessor, and its attributes, such as its blue color, are its attributes;

original: bum pa mtshan gzhi yin la lto smad ldir ba dang mchu 'phyang ba dang mgrin pa ring ba nyid la sogs pa dag de'i mtshan nyid yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: bum pa mtshan gzhi yin la lto smad ldir ba dang mchu 'phyang ba dang mgrin pa ring ba nyid la sogs pa dag de'i mtshan nyid yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: and just as a pot is the basis of attributes, and its attributes, such as its bulbous shape, are its attributes,

original: snam bu la sogs pa rnams la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: snam bu la sogs pa rnams la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: so it is with cloth, etc.

original: 'dod chags ni lhag par zhen pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags ni lhag par zhen pa'o //
translated: Attachment is a strong desire.

original: chags pa ni 'dod chags kyi rten no //
analyzed: chags pa ni 'dod chags kyi rten no //
translated: Attachment is the basis of desire.

original: me ni sreg par byed pa'o //
analyzed: me ni sreg par byed pa'o //
translated: Fire is that which burns.

original: bud shing ni bsreg bya'o //
analyzed: bud shing ni bsreg bya'o //
translated: Fuel is that which is burned.

original: de la yan lag rgyur byas nas yan lag can du gdags la yan lag can la ltos nas yan lag dag 'dogs pas shing rta'i dpe dang mtshungs te /
analyzed: de la yan lag rgyur byas nas yan lag can du gdags la yan lag can la ltos nas yan lag dag 'dogs pas shing rta'i dpe dang mtshungs te /
translated: The whole is designated in dependence on the parts, and the parts are designated in dependence on the whole. Therefore, this is similar to the example of the chariot.

original: bud shing la ltos nas me yin la de la ltos nas bud shing yin pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: bud shing la ltos nas me yin la de la ltos nas bud shing yin pa'i bar du'o //
translated: Fire is in dependence on fuel, and fuel is in dependence on fire.

original: 'di ni 'jig rten gyi tha snyad yin gyi 'di la dpyad na mi gzhug go //
analyzed: 'di ni 'jig rten gyi tha snyad yin gyi 'di la dpyad na mi gzhug go //
translated: This is the worldly convention, and one should not investigate it.

original: yan lag la sogs pa rnams phan tshun ltos pa'i grub pa yin pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: yan lag la sogs pa rnams phan tshun ltos pa'i grub pa yin pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: Not only are the parts, etc., established in mutual dependence,

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis kyang phan tshun @309b ltos pa yin no zhes bshad pa /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis kyang phan tshun @309b ltos pa yin no zhes bshad pa /
translated: but also cause and effect are in mutual dependence.

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: This is explained in the following:

original: gal te rgyu yis bskyed par bya bskyed de lta na de rgyu yin zhing //
analyzed: gal te rgyu yis bskyed par bya bskyed de lta na de rgyu yin zhing //
translated: If the effect is produced by the cause, then it is a cause.

original: gal te 'bras bu mi bskyed na ni de med rgyu med can du 'gyur //
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu mi bskyed na ni de med rgyu med can du 'gyur //
translated: If the effect is not produced, then it is without cause.

original: 'bras bu yang ni rgyu yod gyur na skye bar 'gyur ba de yi phyir //
analyzed: 'bras bu yang ni rgyu yod gyur na skye bar 'gyur ba de yi phyir //
translated: And the effect arises when the cause exists.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu 'di gnyis kyang de las gzhan yod na cig shos yod pa nyid yin no zhes shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu 'di gnyis kyang de las gzhan yod na cig shos yod pa nyid yin no zhes shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, you should understand that these two, cause and effect, exist when the other exists.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag rang bzhin gyis yod pa nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag rang bzhin gyis yod pa nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: But they do not exist essentially.

original: ci ste khyed de gnyis rang gi ngo bos grub par sems na kye //
analyzed: ci ste khyed de gnyis rang gi ngo bos grub par sems na kye //
translated: But if you think that these two exist inherently,

original: gang las gang zhig 'gyur ba gang zhig las sngar gang zhig 'gyur de smos //
analyzed: gang las gang zhig 'gyur ba gang zhig las sngar gang zhig 'gyur de smos //
translated: then tell us, what would arise from what? What would exist prior to what?

original: ci rgyu 'am 'bras bu sngar grub pa gang las rgyu 'am 'bras bu skye bar 'gyur ba de gnyis las dang po rgyu 'am 'on te 'bras bu zhig tu 'gyur /
analyzed: ci rgyu 'am 'bras bu sngar grub pa gang las rgyu 'am 'bras bu skye bar 'gyur ba de gnyis las dang po rgyu 'am 'on te 'bras bu zhig tu 'gyur /
translated: Would the cause or the effect arise from the other, the cause or the effect?

original: de'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bur gdags pa yang shing rta ltar rgyur byas nas yin par rig par bya'i rang bzhin las gyur pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bur gdags pa yang shing rta ltar rgyur byas nas yin par rig par bya'i rang bzhin las gyur pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the designation of cause and effect should be understood to be like the chariot, that is, nominally imputed in dependence on the assembly of parts, and not by way of their essence.

original: gzhan yang gal te rgyus 'bras bu rang bzhin gyis skyed par byed na phrad nas sam ma prad par skyed par byed grang /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te rgyus 'bras bu rang bzhin gyis skyed par byed na phrad nas sam ma prad par skyed par byed grang /
translated: Moreover, if a cause generates an effect essentially, does it generate it having contacted it or having not contacted it?üîΩIf your cause generates an effect by contacting it,

original: de la re zhig / gal te khyod kyi rgyu yis phrad nas 'bras skyed byed na de yi tshe //
analyzed: de la re zhig / gal te khyod kyi rgyu yis phrad nas 'bras skyed byed na de yi tshe //
translated: then at that time,

original: de dag nus pa gcig pas skyed byed 'bras bu tha dad med gyur zhing //
analyzed: de dag nus pa gcig pas skyed byed 'bras bu tha dad med gyur zhing //
translated: since they would have the same potential, the effect would not be different from it.

original: so sor na ni rgyu 'di rgyu min rnams dang khyad par med 'gyur la //
analyzed: so sor na ni rgyu 'di rgyu min rnams dang khyad par med 'gyur la //
translated: If they were different, this cause would not be different from noncauses.

original: gnyis po 'di dag spangs nas rtog pa gzhan yang yod par 'gyur ma yin //
analyzed: gnyis po 'di dag spangs nas rtog pa gzhan yang yod par 'gyur ma yin //
translated: Apart from these two, there is no other conception.

original: de la gal te rgyus 'bras bu phrad nas skyed par byed na de'i tshe //
analyzed: de la gal te rgyus 'bras bu phrad nas skyed par byed na de'i tshe //
translated: If a cause generates an effect by contacting it, then at that time,

original: phrad pa yin dang klung dang rgya mtsho'i chu phrad pa tha dad med pa ltar cig yin pas 'di ni rgyu'o //
analyzed: phrad pa yin dang klung dang rgya mtsho'i chu phrad pa tha dad med pa ltar cig yin pas 'di ni rgyu'o //
translated: since they would be one, like the water of the Ganges and the water of the ocean, which are not different when they meet, there would be no difference between them,

original: 'di ni 'bras bu'o zhes khyad par med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: 'di ni 'bras bu'o zhes khyad par med pa'i phyir //
translated: with the consequence that it would not be possible to say, ‚ÄúThis is the cause and that is the effect.‚Äù

original: gang zhig gang gis bskyed par 'gyur //
analyzed: gang zhig gang gis bskyed par 'gyur //
translated: What would be generated by what?

original: ci ste ma phrad par skyed par byed na ni //
analyzed: ci ste ma phrad par skyed par byed na ni //
translated: But if it produces without contacting,

original: de'i tshe ji ltar ma phrad par 'bras bu ma yin pa gzhan mi skyed pa de bzhin du ma phrad par 'bras bu yang bskyed par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe ji ltar ma phrad par 'bras bu ma yin pa gzhan mi skyed pa de bzhin du ma phrad par 'bras bu yang bskyed par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then just as it does not produce other non-effects without contacting them, so too it would not produce an effect without contacting it.

original: 'on te ma phrad bzhin du skyed par byed na ni ril bskyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te ma phrad bzhin du skyed par byed na ni ril bskyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: But if it produces without contacting, then everything would be produced from everything.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu rang bzhin du smra ba la bskyed bya skyed par byed pa la phrad pa dang ma phrad pa dag las ma gtogs pa'i rtogs pa gsum pa gzhan yang srid pa ma yin pas //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu rang bzhin du smra ba la bskyed bya skyed par byed pa la phrad pa dang ma phrad pa dag las ma gtogs pa'i rtogs pa gsum pa gzhan yang srid pa ma yin pas //
translated: For those who advocate that cause and effect are intrinsically real, apart from production through contact or non-contact, there is no third alternative for production.

original: rang bzhin gyis grub pa'i rgyus 'bras bu skyed par mi byed pa kho na'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis grub pa'i rgyus 'bras bu skyed par mi byed pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore a cause that is intrinsically real does not produce an effect.

original: de'i phyir / ci ste khyod @310a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir / ci ste khyod @310a * //
translated: Therefore:

original: kyi rgyu yis 'bras bu skyed par mi byed de phyir 'bras //
analyzed: kyi rgyu yis 'bras bu skyed par mi byed de phyir 'bras //
translated: If your cause does not produce an effect, then an effect does not exist.

original: shes bya yod min /
analyzed: shes bya yod min /
translated: The object of knowledge does not exist.

original: gang gi tshe rgyus 'bras bu mi skyed pa de'i tshe 'bras bu med pas /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rgyus 'bras bu mi skyed pa de'i tshe 'bras bu med pas /
translated: When a cause does not produce an effect, then an effect does not exist.

original: 'bras bral rgyu ni rgyu med can 'gyur yod pa'ang min //
analyzed: 'bras bral rgyu ni rgyu med can 'gyur yod pa'ang min //
translated: Nor is there a cause without an effect.

original: rgyu rgyu nyid du bya ba la ni 'bras bu 'byung ba rgyu yin na //
analyzed: rgyu rgyu nyid du bya ba la ni 'bras bu 'byung ba rgyu yin na //
translated: If a cause is a cause in virtue of producing an effect,

original: gal te 'bras bu med par yang rgyu nyid du 'gyur na ni /
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu med par yang rgyu nyid du 'gyur na ni /
translated: then if a cause were to exist without an effect,

original: de'i tshe rgyu'i rgyu nyid rgyu med pa can du 'gyur na 'di ni 'dod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i tshe rgyu'i rgyu nyid rgyu med pa can du 'gyur na 'di ni 'dod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: then the cause of a cause would be causeless. But this is unacceptable.

original: de'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis rang bzhin gyis yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis rang bzhin gyis yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, neither cause nor effect exist essentially.

original: khyod kyi ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: khyod kyi ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How is it for you?

original: gang phyir 'di dag gnyis char yang ni sgyu ma dang 'dra de yi phyir //
analyzed: gang phyir 'di dag gnyis char yang ni sgyu ma dang 'dra de yi phyir //
translated: Because both of these are like an illusion,

original: bdag la skyon du mi 'gyur 'jig rten pa yi dngos po rnams kyang yod //
analyzed: bdag la skyon du mi 'gyur 'jig rten pa yi dngos po rnams kyang yod //
translated: therefore, I do not commit an error, and mundane things exist.

original: gang gi ltar na rang gi mtshan nyid bskyed par bya ba nyid dang skyed par byed pa nyid yin pa de la rnam par dpyad pa 'dir 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gang gi ltar na rang gi mtshan nyid bskyed par bya ba nyid dang skyed par byed pa nyid yin pa de la rnam par dpyad pa 'dir 'gyur gyi /
translated: This analysis applies to those for whom intrinsic character is what is to be produced and what produces.

original: gang gi ltar na dngos po rnams log par kun brtags pas bskyed pa nyid kyis sgyu ma ltar ma skyes pa'i rang bzhin yin zhing rang bzhin med kyang rab rib can gyi dmigs pa'i skra shad la sogs pa ltar rnam par rtog pa'i yul du 'gyur ba de
analyzed: gang gi ltar na dngos po rnams log par kun brtags pas bskyed pa nyid kyis sgyu ma ltar ma skyes pa'i rang bzhin yin zhing rang bzhin med kyang rab rib can gyi dmigs pa'i skra shad la sogs pa ltar rnam par rtog pa'i yul du 'gyur ba de
translated: According to those who say that things are not produced, but are like illusions, and are not essentially natureless, but are like the hairs seen by one with an eye disease, and are objects of conceptual consciousnesses,

original: la ni bsam du med pa nyid de /
analyzed: la ni bsam du med pa nyid de /
translated: then this is inconceivable.

original: de'i phyir bdag la ji skad bshad pa'i skyon gyi skabs yod pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag la ji skad bshad pa'i skyon gyi skabs yod pa ma yin zhing /
translated: Therefore, we are not vulnerable to the faults explained above.

original: 'jig rten pa'i dngos po ma brtags par grub pa rnams kyang yod pa yin pas thams cad 'grub bo //üîΩ'dir kha cig lan du 'di skad du ci rgyus 'bras bu phrad nas skyed par byed dam /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i dngos po ma brtags par grub pa rnams kyang yod pa yin pas thams cad 'grub bo // 'dir kha cig lan du 'di skad du ci rgyus 'bras bu phrad nas skyed par byed dam /
translated: And since worldly things that are established without analysis exist, everything is established.

original: 'on te ma phrad par yin zhes gang smras pas 'dir khyod la yang brgal zhing brtag pa mtshungs so //
analyzed: 'on te ma phrad par yin zhes gang smras pas 'dir khyod la yang brgal zhing brtag pa mtshungs so //
translated: Here, someone might respond, ‚ÄúWhat you said, ‚ÄòDoes a cause give rise to an effect through contact or without contact?‚Äô is a similar objection to what you said to me.

original: ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: sun 'byin 'dis sun dbyung bya phrad nas 'byin nam ma phrad par //
analyzed: sun 'byin 'dis sun dbyung bya phrad nas 'byin nam ma phrad par //
translated: Does this refutation refute the object of refutation through contact or without contact?

original: yin zhes nyes pa 'di ni khyod la 'ang 'gyur ba ma yin nam //
analyzed: yin zhes nyes pa 'di ni khyod la 'ang 'gyur ba ma yin nam //
translated: But this fault also applies to you.

original: gal te sun 'byin pas sun dbyung bya phrad nas sun 'byin par byed na ni de'i tshe nyes pa de nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te sun 'byin pas sun dbyung bya phrad nas sun 'byin par byed na ni de'i tshe nyes pa de nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If the refutation refutes the refutand by coming into contact with it, then at that time this fault would ensue.

original: 'on te ma phrad par yin na de lta na yang de nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te ma phrad par yin na de lta na yang de nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: But if it is without contact, then in that case this fault would ensue.

original: gnyis po 'di dag spangs nas rtogs pa gzhan yang yod par 'gyur ba ma yin /
analyzed: gnyis po 'di dag spangs nas rtogs pa gzhan yang yod par 'gyur ba ma yin /
translated: Apart from these two, there is no other mode of refutation.

original: gang gi tshe de ltar khyod kyi sun 'byin pa la sun dbyung bya sun 'byin pa'i nus pa yod pa ma yin pa de'i tshe khyod kyi sun 'byin pa nyid sun phyung ba yin pas shugs kyis rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yang grub pa nyid do zhes
analyzed: gang gi tshe de ltar khyod kyi sun 'byin pa la sun dbyung bya sun 'byin pa'i nus pa yod pa ma yin pa de'i tshe khyod kyi sun 'byin pa nyid sun phyung ba yin pas shugs kyis rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yang grub pa nyid do zhes
translated: When the refutation does not have the ability to refute the refutand in that way, then at that time your refutation itself is refuted. Therefore, by implication, the state of affairs of cause and effect is also established.

original: bstan pa'i @310b phyir smras pa /
analyzed: bstan pa'i @310b phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate this, NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:

original: gang tshe de skad smra zhing rang phyogs kho na rnams 'joms pa //
analyzed: gang tshe de skad smra zhing rang phyogs kho na rnams 'joms pa //
translated: When you speak in this way, you destroy only your own position,

original: de tshe khyod kyi sun dbyung sun ni 'byin par nus ma yin //
analyzed: de tshe khyod kyi sun dbyung sun ni 'byin par nus ma yin //
translated: At that time, you are not able to refute what is to be refuted.

original: gzhan yang / gang phyir rang gi tshig la 'ang thal ba mtshungs pa'i ltag chod kyi //
analyzed: gzhan yang / gang phyir rang gi tshig la 'ang thal ba mtshungs pa'i ltag chod kyi //
translated: Moreover,üîΩYou are a nihilist with regard to all things,

original: rigs pa med par dngos mtha' dag la skur 'debs de yi phyir //
analyzed: rigs pa med par dngos mtha' dag la skur 'debs de yi phyir //
translated: Because you have no position of your own,üîΩAnd because you have no argument,üîΩBut only a reductio ad absurdum which is parallel to our own,üîΩAnd is therefore no argument at all.

original: khyod ni skye bo dam pas bzhed mi 'gyur zhing gang gi phyir //
analyzed: khyod ni skye bo dam pas bzhed mi 'gyur zhing gang gi phyir //
translated: You are not accepted by holy men,üîΩAnd you are a mere debater,

original: khyod la rang phyogs med pas sun ci phyin du rgol ba'ang yin /
analyzed: khyod la rang phyogs med pas sun ci phyin du rgol ba'ang yin /
translated: Because you have no position of your own.

original: de la rang gi tshig la 'ang thal bar 'gyur bar mtshungs pa nyid ni smras zin to //
analyzed: de la rang gi tshig la 'ang thal bar 'gyur bar mtshungs pa nyid ni smras zin to //
translated: The parallel to our own reductio has already been explained.

original: rigs pa med par dngos mtha' dag la skur 'debs zhes bya ba 'di bshad par bya'o //üîΩgang ma phrad par mtshungs pas skyed par byed pa ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: rigs pa med par dngos mtha' dag la skur 'debs zhes bya ba 'di bshad par bya'o // gang ma phrad par mtshungs pas skyed par byed pa ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: Now we shall explain the statement, ‚ÄúYou are a nihilist with regard to all things, because you have no argument.‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba 'di la rigs pa ci zhig yod /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di la rigs pa ci zhig yod /
translated: What argument is there for the statement, ‚ÄúIt does not cause the generation of anything because it does not come into contact with it‚Äù?

original: 'di ltar khab len gyis ma phrad pa nyid du rung ba'i yul na gnas pa'i lcags 'dren par byed kyi thams cad ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar khab len gyis ma phrad pa nyid du rung ba'i yul na gnas pa'i lcags 'dren par byed kyi thams cad ni ma yin no //
translated: For a magnet attracts a piece of iron that is in another place and does not come into contact with it, but it does not attract everything.

original: de bzhin du mig gis ma phrad pa kho nar rung ba'i yul na gnas pa'i gzugs mthong gi / ril ni ma yin pa de bzhin du rgyus kyang ma phrad par bskyed du zin kyang ma phrad pa thams cad skyed par mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du mig gis ma phrad pa kho nar rung ba'i yul na gnas pa'i gzugs mthong gi / ril ni ma yin pa de bzhin du rgyus kyang ma phrad par bskyed du zin kyang ma phrad pa thams cad skyed par mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: Likewise, the eye sees the form that is located in a suitable place, which is only not in contact, but not the whole. Likewise, although the cause generates without contact, not all that is not in contact is generated.

original: 'bras bu rung ba kho na skyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu rung ba kho na skyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Only the suitable effect is generated.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar rigs pa med par dngos po'o cog la skur ba 'debs pa de'i phyir khyod skye bo dam pas bzhed par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar rigs pa med par dngos po'o cog la skur ba 'debs pa de'i phyir khyod skye bo dam pas bzhed par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Since you thus repudiate all things without reason, therefore you are not accepted by holy beings.

original: gzhan yang khyod ni sun ci phyin du rgol ba pa nyid du yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yang khyod ni sun ci phyin du rgol ba pa nyid du yang 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, you would be a mere debater.

original: rang gi phyogs bzhag pa dang bral zhing gzhan gyi phyogs sel ba tsam la zhugs pa'i rgol ba ni sun ci phyin du rgol ba pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi phyogs bzhag pa dang bral zhing gzhan gyi phyogs sel ba tsam la zhugs pa'i rgol ba ni sun ci phyin du rgol ba pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: A debater who is devoid of positing one‚Äôs own position and who engages in merely refuting the position of another is called a ‚Äúmere debater.‚Äù

original: khyod la ni rang gi phyogs 'ga' zhig yod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: khyod la ni rang gi phyogs 'ga' zhig yod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: You do not have any position of your own.

original: khyod kyi rnam par dpyad pa ni gzhan gyi phyogs sel ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes smras so //
analyzed: khyod kyi rnam par dpyad pa ni gzhan gyi phyogs sel ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes smras so //
translated: Because your analysis is only for the purpose of refuting the position of others.

original: 'di la brjod par bya ste /üîΩsun 'byin pas sun dbyung bya ma phrad gsum ni 'byin byed dam //
analyzed: 'di la brjod par bya ste / sun 'byin pas sun dbyung bya ma phrad gsum ni 'byin byed dam //
translated: We respond:üîΩIs the refutation uncontacted with the refuted? Or is it contacted?

original: 'on te phrad nas yin zhes smras zin nyes pa 'dir gang la ;
analyzed: 'on te phrad nas yin zhes smras zin nyes pa 'dir gang la ;
translated: These three have already been explained.

original: / nges par phyogs yod de la 'gyur gyi bdag la phyogs 'di ni //
analyzed: / nges par phyogs yod de la 'gyur gyi bdag la phyogs 'di ni //
translated: This fault is for whoever definitely has a position, but I do not have this position.

original: yod pa min pas thal bar 'gyur ba 'di ni srid ma yin //
analyzed: yod pa min pas thal bar 'gyur ba 'di ni srid ma yin //
translated: Therefore this consequence is not possible for me.

original: de la rang gi tshig la'ang thal ba mtshungs pa'i ltag chod kyis //
analyzed: de la rang gi tshig la'ang thal ba mtshungs pa'i ltag chod kyis //
translated: You say, ‚ÄúThe consequence is similar to your own words,‚Äù

original: zhes gang smras pa ni kho bo cag gi phyogs la mtshungs par thal bar mi 'gyur te /üîΩgang gi @311a * //
analyzed: zhes gang smras pa ni kho bo cag gi phyogs la mtshungs par thal bar mi 'gyur te /üîΩgang gi @311a * //
translated: but the consequence does not apply to our position.

original: phyir kho bo cag gi phyogs la ni sun 'byin pas sun dbyung bar bya ba phrad nas kyang sun 'byin par mi byed pa nyid la sun 'byin pas sun dbyung bar bya ba ma phrad par yang sun 'byin par mi byed de /
analyzed: phyir kho bo cag gi phyogs la ni sun 'byin pas sun dbyung bar bya ba phrad nas kyang sun 'byin par mi byed pa nyid la sun 'byin pas sun dbyung bar bya ba ma phrad par yang sun 'byin par mi byed de /
translated: In our own system, the refutation does not refute the refutand by coming into contact with it, nor does the refutation refute the refutand without coming into contact with it.

original: sun 'byin pa dang sun dbyung bya gnyi ga rang bzhin gyis ma grub pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: sun 'byin pa dang sun dbyung bya gnyi ga rang bzhin gyis ma grub pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: This is because neither the refutation nor the refutand exists inherently.

original: / de'i phyir phrad pa dang ma phrad pa'i bsam pa mi byed do //
analyzed: / de'i phyir phrad pa dang ma phrad pa'i bsam pa mi byed do //
translated: Therefore, one should not think in terms of contact or noncontact.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it has been said:

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor ci skyes pa'i chos kyis ma skyes pa'i thob pa 'thob par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor ci skyes pa'i chos kyis ma skyes pa'i thob pa 'thob par 'gyur ram /
translated: ‚ÄúVenerable Subhuti, is the attainment of the unarisen attained by means of an arisen attainment?

original: 'on te ma skyes pa'i chos kyis ma skyes pa'i thob pa 'thob par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'on te ma skyes pa'i chos kyis ma skyes pa'i thob pa 'thob par 'gyur /
translated: Or is the attainment of the unarisen attained by means of an unarisen attainment?‚Äù

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhuti replied:

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu kho bo ni skyes pa'i chos kyis ma skyes pa'i thob pa 'thob par mi 'dod la /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu kho bo ni skyes pa'i chos kyis ma skyes pa'i thob pa 'thob par mi 'dod la /
translated: ‚ÄúVenerable Shariputra, I do not accept that the attainment of the unarisen is attained by means of an arisen attainment.

original: ma skyes pas kyang ma skyes pa'i thob pa 'thob par mi 'dod do //
analyzed: ma skyes pas kyang ma skyes pa'i thob pa 'thob par mi 'dod do //
translated: Nor do we maintain that the non-arisen obtains the attainment of the non-arisen.

original: sh'a ri'i bus smras pa /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bus smras pa /
translated: ≈öƒÅriputra said,

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor yang ci thob pa med cing mngon par rtogs pa med dam /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor yang ci thob pa med cing mngon par rtogs pa med dam /
translated: ‚ÄúVenerable Subh≈´ti, is there no attainment and no clear realization?‚Äù

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subh≈´ti replied,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu thob pa yang yod mngon par rtogs pa yang yod mod kyi /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu thob pa yang yod mngon par rtogs pa yang yod mod kyi /
translated: ‚ÄúVenerable ≈öƒÅriputra, there is attainment and there is clear realization,

original: gnyis kyi tshul gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gnyis kyi tshul gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: but not in a dualistic way.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu thob pa dang mngon par rtogs pa ni 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du yin la /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu thob pa dang mngon par rtogs pa ni 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du yin la /
translated: Venerable ≈öƒÅriputra, attainment and clear realization are in terms of worldly convention.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' yang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du yin gyi don dam par ni thob pa med cing mngon par rtogs pa med do zhes rgya cher gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' yang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du yin gyi don dam par ni thob pa med cing mngon par rtogs pa med do zhes rgya cher gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: Stream enterer, once-returner, non-returner, arhat, pratyekabuddha, and bodhisattva are in terms of worldly convention. But ultimately there is no attainment and no clear realization.‚Äù

original: 'dir ji ltar gnyis su thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir skyes pa'am ma skyes pa'i chos kyis thob pa 'thob pa bkag cing gnyis kyang dngos po med pa la mi rigs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dir ji ltar gnyis su thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir skyes pa'am ma skyes pa'i chos kyis thob pa 'thob pa bkag cing gnyis kyang dngos po med pa la mi rigs pa'i phyir /
translated: Here, since it would absurdly follow that there would be two, the attainment of a phenomenon that has arisen or not arisen is refuted. And since it is illogical for the two to be nonexistent things,

original: ma brtags par 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du thob par khas blangs pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ma brtags par 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du thob par khas blangs pa de bzhin du /
translated: just as attainment is accepted in the everyday world without analysis,

original: sun dbyung bar bya ba dang sun 'byin pa dag kyang phrad pa'am ma phrad par ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: sun dbyung bar bya ba dang sun 'byin pa dag kyang phrad pa'am ma phrad par ma yin mod kyi /
translated: so too should you understand that the refutation and the refutand do not make contact or not make contact.

original: 'on kyang tha snyad du sun 'byin pas sun dbyung ba sun 'byin par byed do zhes shes par bya'o //üîΩgzhan yang / ji ltar khyod kyis nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la yod khyad par rnams //
analyzed: 'on kyang tha snyad du sun 'byin pas sun dbyung ba sun 'byin par byed do zhes shes par bya'o // gzhan yang / ji ltar khyod kyis nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la yod khyad par rnams //
translated: However, conventionally, the refutation refutes the refutand.üîΩMoreover, just as you see the features of the sun‚Äôs orb,

original: gzugs brnyan la yang gzas gzung la sogs rnam 'tshe mthong 'gyur la //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan la yang gzas gzung la sogs rnam 'tshe mthong 'gyur la //
translated: such as eclipses, in its reflection,

original: nyi ma dang ni gzugs brnyan rnam pa phrad dang ma phrad par //
analyzed: nyi ma dang ni gzugs brnyan rnam pa phrad dang ma phrad par //
translated: the sun and its reflection do not make contact or not make contact.

original: mi rigs mod kyi brten @311b nas tha snyad tsam zhig 'byung 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: mi rigs mod kyi brten @311b nas tha snyad tsam zhig 'byung 'gyur zhing //
translated: Although it is not reasonable, it is merely a convention that arises in dependence.

original: mi bden bzhin du'ang rang gi byad bzhin mdzes par bsgrub bya'i phyir //
analyzed: mi bden bzhin du'ang rang gi byad bzhin mdzes par bsgrub bya'i phyir //
translated: And although it is not true, it is for the sake of beautifying one‚Äôs face.

original: de ni yod pa ji ltar de bzhin 'dir yang shes rab gdong //üîΩsbyang bar bya la nus pa mthong bar gyur pa'i gtan tshigs ni //
analyzed: de ni yod pa ji ltar de bzhin 'dir yang shes rab gdong // sbyang bar bya la nus pa mthong bar gyur pa'i gtan tshigs ni //
translated: In the same way, here, the face of wisdom is cleansed.

original: 'thad pa dang bral las kyang bsgrub bya rtogs zhes shes par bya //
analyzed: 'thad pa dang bral las kyang bsgrub bya rtogs zhes shes par bya //
translated: One should understand that even though a reason is devoid of a logical object, the probandum is realized.

original: ji ltar gzugs brnyan zhes bya ba cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: ji ltar gzugs brnyan zhes bya ba cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir na /
translated: Because something called a reflection does not exist in the least,

original: nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor dang phrad pa'am ma phrad par skye zhes bya ba'i rtogs pa rnam pa thams cad du mi srid mod kyi /
analyzed: nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor dang phrad pa'am ma phrad par skye zhes bya ba'i rtogs pa rnam pa thams cad du mi srid mod kyi /
translated: it is completely impossible to think, ‚ÄúIt arises from contact with or separation from the orb of the sun.‚Äù

original: 'on kyang rkyen gzugs nye ba las gzugs brnyan du dmigs pa na rtogs par 'dod pa'i don nges par byed pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: 'on kyang rkyen gzugs nye ba las gzugs brnyan du dmigs pa na rtogs par 'dod pa'i don nges par byed pa de bzhin du /
translated: However, when a reflection is observed due to the condition of the proximity of a form, the object that is to be understood is ascertained.

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i sun 'byin pas sun dbyung bya sun 'byin pa dang / rang bzhin gyis stong zhing 'thad pa dang bral ba'i gtan tshigs kyis bsgrub par bya ba bsgrub pa yin la /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i sun 'byin pas sun dbyung bya sun 'byin pa dang / rang bzhin gyis stong zhing 'thad pa dang bral ba'i gtan tshigs kyis bsgrub par bya ba bsgrub pa yin la /
translated: The refutation refutes the refutand by means of a refutation that is empty of intrinsic reality, and the proof proves the probandum by means of a reason that is empty of intrinsic reality and devoid of validity.

original: gnyis su thal bar yang mi 'gyur bas rang gi tshig la'ang thal bar mtshungs par mi rigs so zhes shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gnyis su thal bar yang mi 'gyur bas rang gi tshig la'ang thal bar mtshungs par mi rigs so zhes shes par bya'o //
translated: And since the consequence of duality does not ensue, it should be understood that the consequence is not equally applicable to your words.

original: shes rab nyid gdong yin pas shes rab gdong ngo //
analyzed: shes rab nyid gdong yin pas shes rab gdong ngo //
translated: Since wisdom itself is the face, there is the face of wisdom.

original: de sbyang ba ni ma rig pa spangs pas yongs su dag pa nyid do //
analyzed: de sbyang ba ni ma rig pa spangs pas yongs su dag pa nyid do //
translated: Its purification is its complete purity due to the elimination of ignorance.

original: de la nus pa mthong bar gyur pa'i zhes bya ba ni der nus mthu can du mthong ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de la nus pa mthong bar gyur pa'i zhes bya ba ni der nus mthu can du mthong ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: With regard to that, the phrase ‚Äúseeing the power‚Äù means seeing the power or ability in that.

original: gang gi phyir btags par yod pa rnams la gnyis su smra ba 'di mi rigs pa de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir btags par yod pa rnams la gnyis su smra ba 'di mi rigs pa de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Since this discourse on the duality of the imputed is untenable,

original: gnyis la brten nas sun 'byin pa dang lan smra bas dbu ma pa la rnam pa thams cad du glags mi rnyed do //
analyzed: gnyis la brten nas sun 'byin pa dang lan smra bas dbu ma pa la rnam pa thams cad du glags mi rnyed do //
translated: Therefore, the Madhyamika is not at all vulnerable to the refutations and rebuttals that are based on those two.

original: ji skad du 'phags pa'i lhas /üîΩyod dang med dang yod med ces //
analyzed: ji skad du 'phags pa'i lhas / yod dang med dang yod med ces //
translated: As ƒÄryadeva says:üîΩOne who has no position

original: gang la phyogs ni yod min pa //
analyzed: gang la phyogs ni yod min pa //
translated: of existence, nonexistence, or existence and nonexistenceüîΩcannot be refuted

original: de la yun ni ring po la'ang //üîΩklan ka brjod par nus ma yin //
analyzed: de la yun ni ring po la'ang // klan ka brjod par nus ma yin //
translated: even for a long time.

original: zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du /üîΩstong pa nyid kyis brtsad byas te //
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du / stong pa nyid kyis brtsad byas te //
translated: And similarly:üîΩOne who is questionedüîΩabout emptiness

original: gang zhig lan 'debs smra byed pa //
analyzed: gang zhig lan 'debs smra byed pa //
translated: and answers

original: de yis thams cad lan btab min //
analyzed: de yis thams cad lan btab min //
translated: has not answered at all.üîΩHe is just like

original: bsgrub par bya dang mtshungs par 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya dang mtshungs par 'gyur // zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: the one who is to be instructed.

original: 'dis ni skyed par byed pa'i rgyu yang rnam par bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni skyed par byed pa'i rgyu yang rnam par bshad par bya'o //
translated: This also explains the productive cause.

original: de la kha cig dbu ma pa'i bstan bcos 'dir skyed par byed pa'i rgyu'i skabs su bab pa yin gyi gsal bar byed pa ni ma yin la /
analyzed: de la kha cig dbu ma pa'i bstan bcos 'dir skyed par byed pa'i rgyu'i skabs su bab pa yin gyi gsal bar byed pa ni ma yin la /
translated: In this regard, some say that the productive cause is relevant in this treatise of the Madhyamaka, but the revealing cause is not.

original: phrad pa dang ma phrad pa'i brgal ba yang gsal bar byed pa'i rgyu la yin gyi skyed par byed pa la ni ma yin pas kho bo cag gi tshig rnams la @312a * //
analyzed: phrad pa dang ma phrad pa'i brgal ba yang gsal bar byed pa'i rgyu la yin gyi skyed par byed pa la ni ma yin pas kho bo cag gi tshig rnams la @312a * //
translated: And since the cause of manifestation is the cause of clarification, not the cause of generation, there is no opportunity for you to respond to our statements with countercriticisms.

original: ltag chod kyi skabs med pa nyid do zhes gang smra bar byed pa de'i 'di ni lan ma yin te /
analyzed: ltag chod kyi skabs med pa nyid do zhes gang smra bar byed pa de'i 'di ni lan ma yin te /
translated: This is not a response to our argument.

original: gang gi phyir glags dang bcas pa'i dngos po brjod na pha rol po mi bzod pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir glags dang bcas pa'i dngos po brjod na pha rol po mi bzod pa nyid yin la /
translated: If you state something that is open to challenge, then the opponent will be intolerant.

original: skyed par byed pa ltar gsal bar byed pa la yang glags yod pa yin pas de'i lan mi rigs pa nyid do //
analyzed: skyed par byed pa ltar gsal bar byed pa la yang glags yod pa yin pas de'i lan mi rigs pa nyid do //
translated: But since there is an opportunity to respond to the claim that the cause of manifestation is the cause of generation, it is not right to respond with a countercriticism.

original: gzhan yang 'dis bstan bcos su dam bcas pa'i don sgrub pa'i phyir yongs su bzung ba'i sgrub byed kyi sun 'byin pa rnams la ltag chod 'god par byed pa'i lan smra bar byed pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'dis bstan bcos su dam bcas pa'i don sgrub pa'i phyir yongs su bzung ba'i sgrub byed kyi sun 'byin pa rnams la ltag chod 'god par byed pa'i lan smra bar byed pa de'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, you respond to the refutations of the proofs that we accept in order to establish the point of the treatise by stating countercriticisms.

original: 'di ni gzhan gyis sun dbyung bar bya ba kho na yin pas kho bo cag gis btab pa'i lan kho na ches mdzes so //
analyzed: 'di ni gzhan gyis sun dbyung bar bya ba kho na yin pas kho bo cag gis btab pa'i lan kho na ches mdzes so //
translated: Since this is only something to be refuted by others, our response alone is most beautiful.üîΩMoreover,üîΩIf the reason that causes one to understand one‚Äôs own thesis were established,

original: gzhan yang / gal te rang gi bsgrub bya go byed gtan tshigs dngos grub dang // dngos su go bya nyid 'gyur bsgrub bya'i ngo bo'ang yod 'gyur na //
analyzed: gzhan yang / gal te rang gi bsgrub bya go byed gtan tshigs dngos grub dang // dngos su go bya nyid 'gyur bsgrub bya'i ngo bo'ang yod 'gyur na //
translated: And if the object to be understood were actually to become the thesis,

original: phrad pa la sogs rigs pa nye bar sbyor bar 'gyur zhig na //
analyzed: phrad pa la sogs rigs pa nye bar sbyor bar 'gyur zhig na //
translated: Then the reasoning of contact and so on would apply.

original: de yang yod pa min pas khyod kyi yi chad 'ba' zhig yin //
analyzed: de yang yod pa min pas khyod kyi yi chad 'ba' zhig yin //
translated: But since that is not the case, your objection is pointless.

original: yongs su dag pa'i phyogs kyi skyon yongs su ma dag pa'i phyogs kyi steng du 'god pa khyod ni kho bo cag la don med par yid 'byung ba kho na yin par rtogs te /
analyzed: yongs su dag pa'i phyogs kyi skyon yongs su ma dag pa'i phyogs kyi steng du 'god pa khyod ni kho bo cag la don med par yid 'byung ba kho na yin par rtogs te /
translated: We see that you are only needlessly frustrated with us, since you attribute to our position the faults of the position that is completely flawed.

original: dper na rab rib can gyis dmigs pa'i skra shad la sogs pa rnams kyi gcig nyid dang / mang po nyid dang / ring po nyid dang / zlum po nyid dang / nag po la sogs pa'i phyogs sun 'byin pas /
analyzed: dper na rab rib can gyis dmigs pa'i skra shad la sogs pa rnams kyi gcig nyid dang / mang po nyid dang / ring po nyid dang / zlum po nyid dang / nag po la sogs pa'i phyogs sun 'byin pas /
translated: For example, the refutation of the position that the hairs seen by someone with an eye disease are one, many, long, round, black, and so forth.üîΩ

original: rab rib med pa rnams la mi gnod pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: rab rib med pa rnams la mi gnod pa de bzhin du /
translated: For example, the refutation of the oneness, multiplicity, length, roundness, blackness, and so forth of the hairs and so on that are perceived by those with eye disease does not undermine those without eye disease.

original: rang bzhin med pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu rnam par dpyod pa na /
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu rnam par dpyod pa na /
translated: Likewise, when you analyze causes and effects that are essenceless,

original: khyod kyis gnyis yongs su bzung nas sun 'byin pa bkod pas kyang mi gnod do //
analyzed: khyod kyis gnyis yongs su bzung nas sun 'byin pa bkod pas kyang mi gnod do //
translated: you cannot undermine them by positing an argument that presupposesüîΩthat they exist essentially.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gang dag mig dang khab len la sogs pa ma phrad par rang gi bya ba byed par rnam par gzhag pa dpe de dag kyang bkag par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gang dag mig dang khab len la sogs pa ma phrad par rang gi bya ba byed par rnam par gzhag pa dpe de dag kyang bkag par rig par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, you should understand that the examples of the eye, the magnet, and so on, which are presented as cases of things that do not come into contact with their objects and yet perform their own functions, are also refuted,

original: de dag la yang thal bar 'gyur ba mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag la yang thal bar 'gyur ba mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the same reductio argument applies to them.üîΩThose who, having abandoned the straight path of essencelessness,

original: gang zhig khyod rang bzhin med pa nyid kyi lam drang po btang nas rtog ge ngan pa'i lam shin tu 'khyog pa /
analyzed: gang zhig khyod rang bzhin med pa nyid kyi lam drang po btang nas rtog ge ngan pa'i lam shin tu 'khyog pa /
translated: take the very crooked path of bad logic,

original: rang gi rnam par rtog pa'i bzo bo ngan pas sbyar ba /
analyzed: rang gi rnam par rtog pa'i bzo bo ngan pas sbyar ba /
translated: It is a product of the bad craftsman of your own thoughts.

original: yang dag pa'i lam 'gegs par byed par spro ba /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lam 'gegs par byed par spro ba /
translated: It is a delight in obstructing the correct path.

original: te por tshegs che ba 'dis khyod la ci zhig bya /üîΩgzhan yang / dngos rnams mtha' dag dngos po med par rtogs su gzhug par ni //
analyzed: te por tshegs che ba 'dis khyod la ci zhig bya / gzhan yang / dngos rnams mtha' dag dngos po med par rtogs su gzhug par ni //
translated: What use is it to you, this great trouble?üîΩMoreover, it is easy to get others to understand

original: nus pa ches sla ji lta @312b de ltar rang bzhin gzhan dag la /
analyzed: nus pa ches sla ji lta @312b de ltar rang bzhin gzhan dag la /
translated: That all things are devoid of entityness,

original: khong du chud par bde blag tu ni nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: khong du chud par bde blag tu ni nus pa ma yin no //
translated: But it is not easy to get them to understandüîΩThat they are devoid of intrinsic reality.üîΩWhy do you, with the web of bad reasoning,

original: rtog ge ngan pa'i dra bas 'jig rten ci ste 'dir gcol byed //
analyzed: rtog ge ngan pa'i dra bas 'jig rten ci ste 'dir gcol byed //
translated: Confuse the world here?

original: ji ltar rmi lam dang sgyu ma la sogs pa rang gi phyogs la grub pa'i dpe rnams kho nas /üîΩ'jig rten gyi dngos po rang bzhin med pa nyid du rtogs su gzhug par nus pa de ltar /
analyzed: ji ltar rmi lam dang sgyu ma la sogs pa rang gi phyogs la grub pa'i dpe rnams kho nas / 'jig rten gyi dngos po rang bzhin med pa nyid du rtogs su gzhug par nus pa de ltar /
translated: By means of examples that are established for your own position, such as dreams and illusions,üîΩit is possible to get others to understand that worldly things are devoid of intrinsic existence.

original: 'ga' zhig dngos po rnams rang bzhin dang bcas par 'dzin du gzhug par nus par sla ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig dngos po rnams rang bzhin dang bcas par 'dzin du gzhug par nus par sla ba ma yin te /
translated: But it is not easy to get others to understand that things possess intrinsic reality.

original: gnyi ga la grags pa'i dpe med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyi ga la grags pa'i dpe med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no example that is renowned to both parties.

original: de ltar yin dang // kho bos rtsod pa thams cad bzlog pa yin la lan yang sus kyang brjod par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar yin dang // kho bos rtsod pa thams cad bzlog pa yin la lan yang sus kyang brjod par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: If that is the case, then I have refuted all of your arguments, and no one can respond to my arguments.

original: de'i phyir 'jig rten la don ma yin pa bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jig rten la don ma yin pa bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, why do you, O worldly one,

original: su zhig gis sbed cing khyod 'jig rten nyon mongs dar gyi srin bu ltar rang gi rtog pa'i sbubs kyis gtums pa'i steng du rtog ge ngan pa'i srad bus bres pa'i rgyu shin tu bsran te ma kun nas 'dzugs par ci ste byed /
analyzed: su zhig gis sbed cing khyod 'jig rten nyon mongs dar gyi srin bu ltar rang gi rtog pa'i sbubs kyis gtums pa'i steng du rtog ge ngan pa'i srad bus bres pa'i rgyu shin tu bsran te ma kun nas 'dzugs par ci ste byed /
translated: like a silkworm that spins itself into a cocoon, wrap yourself in the cocoon of your own thoughts and then, with the thread of bad logic, spin yourself into a cocoon?

original: rtsod pa 'di ni dor bar bya dgos te /
analyzed: rtsod pa 'di ni dor bar bya dgos te /
translated: This debate should be abandoned.

original: dngos po gzugs brnyan dang 'dra bas de dag thams cad la rang gi mtshan nyid med cing spyi'i mtshan nyid kyang med la mngon sum mam rjes su dpag pa'ang ci zhig yod /
analyzed: dngos po gzugs brnyan dang 'dra bas de dag thams cad la rang gi mtshan nyid med cing spyi'i mtshan nyid kyang med la mngon sum mam rjes su dpag pa'ang ci zhig yod /
translated: Since things are like reflections, they have no intrinsic character, and they have no universal character. What is there to be perceived or inferred?

original: 'di ni mngon sum gcig nyid kho nar zad de gang thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: 'di ni mngon sum gcig nyid kho nar zad de gang thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes so //
translated: This is the only direct perception, namely, the knowledge of an omniscient one.

original: gzhan yang ; sun 'byin lhag ma gong du bstan pa yang ni shes byas nas //
analyzed: gzhan yang ; sun 'byin lhag ma gong du bstan pa yang ni shes byas nas //
translated: Moreover, having understood the remaining refutations taught above,

original: phrad pa la sogs phyogs kyi lan gyi ched du 'di gtang bya //
analyzed: phrad pa la sogs phyogs kyi lan gyi ched du 'di gtang bya //
translated: one should apply them to the remaining positions, such as contact, etc.

original: sun ci phyin du rgol ba po yang ji ltar yod min pa //
analyzed: sun ci phyin du rgol ba po yang ji ltar yod min pa //
translated: And just as there is no one who is a quibbler,

original: de skad sngar bshad lhag ma phyogs 'di nyid kyis rtogs par bya //
analyzed: de skad sngar bshad lhag ma phyogs 'di nyid kyis rtogs par bya //
translated: one should understand this very point explained above.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang brten nas gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa gzhan gyi phyogs la sun 'byin pa gang bshad pa de nyid las sun 'byin pa lhag ma shes par byas nas /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang brten nas gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa gzhan gyi phyogs la sun 'byin pa gang bshad pa de nyid las sun 'byin pa lhag ma shes par byas nas /
translated: Having understood the remaining refutations from just what has been explained, the refutations of the positions of others with respect to the establishment of dependent arising and the establishment of dependent designation,üîΩone should apply them to the remaining positions, such as contact, etc.

original: ci rgyus 'bras bu phrad nas skyed par byed dam /
analyzed: ci rgyus 'bras bu phrad nas skyed par byed dam /
translated: For example, one might ask, ‚ÄúDoes a cause give rise to an effect through contact or without contact?‚Äù

original: 'on te ma phrad par zhes bya ba'i sun 'byin pa'i lan gyi don du gang gis smras pa de la sun 'byin gtang bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'on te ma phrad par zhes bya ba'i sun 'byin pa'i lan gyi don du gang gis smras pa de la sun 'byin gtang bar bya'o //
translated: One should apply the refutation to whoever asks this question.

original: bstan bcos las ni rtog pa ldog pa nyid brjod par 'dod pa yin la /
analyzed: bstan bcos las ni rtog pa ldog pa nyid brjod par 'dod pa yin la /
translated: But the treatise wishes to state only the cessation of conceptualization.

original: de yang kho bo cag gis bstan zin pa'i phyir bstan bcos las sun ci phyin du rgol ba nyid ga la yod /
analyzed: de yang kho bo cag gis bstan zin pa'i phyir bstan bcos las sun ci phyin du rgol ba nyid ga la yod /
translated: And since we have already stated that, how can there be any fault of quibbling in the treatise?

original: 'dir bdag gis gzhan gyi phyogs bsal bar @313a * //üîΩbyas pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir bdag gis gzhan gyi phyogs bsal bar @313a * // byas pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Here we do not remove the position of others,

original: bsal bar bya ba'i dngos po med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: bsal bar bya ba'i dngos po med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because there is no entity to be removed.

original: de'i phyir sun ci phyin du rgol ba pa nyid ga la yod /
analyzed: de'i phyir sun ci phyin du rgol ba pa nyid ga la yod /
translated: So how can there be any fault of quibbling?

original: gang gis na mtshan nyid byas pa 'di yang dag pa'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur ba sus rang gi phyogs gzhag cing gzhan gyi phyogs bzlog pa ste ;
analyzed: gang gis na mtshan nyid byas pa 'di yang dag pa'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur ba sus rang gi phyogs gzhag cing gzhan gyi phyogs bzlog pa ste ;
translated: By what is this definition of quibblers correct? Who posits their own position and refutes the position of others?

original: de'i phyir sun ci phyin du rgol ba'i mtshan nyid 'di ni rnam pa thams cad du mi rigs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir sun ci phyin du rgol ba'i mtshan nyid 'di ni rnam pa thams cad du mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore this definition of quibblers is not correct in any way.

original: de lta bu la sogs pa sun 'byin lhag ma ni phyogs 'di nyid kyis rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu la sogs pa sun 'byin lhag ma ni phyogs 'di nyid kyis rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The remaining refutations of this sort should be understood by this very method.

original: de la de nyid de las 'byung min zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de la de nyid de las 'byung min zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: The passage beginning with It does not arise from itself

original: rnam dpyod pa na myur du grol bar 'gyur //
analyzed: rnam dpyod pa na myur du grol bar 'gyur //
translated: and ending with one who analyzes will quickly be liberated

original: zhes bya ba'i bar 'dis ni chos kyi bdag med pa mngon par gsal bar byas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i bar 'dis ni chos kyi bdag med pa mngon par gsal bar byas so //
translated: clarifies the selflessness of phenomena.

original: nyon mongs skyon rnams ma lus 'jig tshogs la //
analyzed: nyon mongs skyon rnams ma lus 'jig tshogs la //
translated: All the faults and afflictions arise from the view of the transitory collection.

original: lta las 'byung bar zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas 'di yan chad kyis ni gang zag gi bdag med pa gsal bar byas so //
analyzed: lta las 'byung bar zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas 'di yan chad kyis ni gang zag gi bdag med pa gsal bar byas so //
translated: The passage beginning with The view of the transitory collection and ending here clarifies the selflessness of persons.

original: de'i phyir 'di ston zhing stong pa nyid kyi rab tu dbye ba brjod par 'dod nas bshad /üîΩbdag med 'di ni 'gro ba rnam dgrol phyir //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ston zhing stong pa nyid kyi rab tu dbye ba brjod par 'dod nas bshad / bdag med 'di ni 'gro ba rnam dgrol phyir //
translated: Therefore, in order to teach this and to explain the divisions of emptiness, it says:

original: chos dang gang zag dbye bas rnam gnyis gsungs //
analyzed: chos dang gang zag dbye bas rnam gnyis gsungs //
translated: This selflessness is taught to be twofold, divided into the selflessness of phenomena and the selflessness of persons, in order to liberate beings.

original: bdag med pa 'di ni mdor bsdus nas rnam pa gnyis su gsungs te /
analyzed: bdag med pa 'di ni mdor bsdus nas rnam pa gnyis su gsungs te /
translated: This selflessness is taught to be twofold in brief:

original: chos kyi bdag med pa dang gang zag gi bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi bdag med pa dang gang zag gi bdag med pa'o //
translated: the selflessness of phenomena and the selflessness of persons.

original: yang ci'i phyir bdag med pa rnam pa gnyis nye bar bstan zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir bdag med pa rnam pa gnyis nye bar bstan zhe na /
translated: Why are two types of selflessness taught?

original: bshad pa / 'gro ba rnam dgrol phyir te /
analyzed: bshad pa / 'gro ba rnam dgrol phyir te /
translated: NƒÅgƒÅrjuna responds: For the sake of liberating migrating beings.

original: bdag med pa rnam pa gnyis po 'di ni bcom ldan 'das kyis 'gro ba rnam par dgrol bar bya ba'i don du nye bar bstan to //
analyzed: bdag med pa rnam pa gnyis po 'di ni bcom ldan 'das kyis 'gro ba rnam par dgrol bar bya ba'i don du nye bar bstan to //
translated: The Transcendent Conqueror taught these two types of selflessness for the sake of liberating migrating beings.

original: de la gang zag gi bdag med pa ni rang sangs rgyas rnams dang / nyan thos rnams rnam par dgrol bar bya ba'i phyir bstan la byang chub sems dpa' rnams rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob pas rnam par dgrol bar bya ba'i phyir ni gnyi ga bstan to //
analyzed: de la gang zag gi bdag med pa ni rang sangs rgyas rnams dang / nyan thos rnams rnam par dgrol bar bya ba'i phyir bstan la byang chub sems dpa' rnams rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob pas rnam par dgrol bar bya ba'i phyir ni gnyi ga bstan to //
translated: Among them, the selflessness of persons was taught for the sake of liberating solitary realizers and hearers, and both were taught for the sake of liberating bodhisattvas, who attain omniscience.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis kyang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rkyen nyid 'di pa tsam mthong mod kyi ;
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis kyang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rkyen nyid 'di pa tsam mthong mod kyi ;
translated: Even though hearers and solitary realizers see dependent arising as merely the conditionality of this world,

original: de lta na yang de dag la chos kyi bdag med pa yongs su rdzogs par sgom pa med de /
analyzed: de lta na yang de dag la chos kyi bdag med pa yongs su rdzogs par sgom pa med de /
translated: still they do not meditate on the selflessness of phenomena in a complete way.

original: khams gsum na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa spong ba'i thabs tsam zhig ni yod do //
analyzed: khams gsum na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa spong ba'i thabs tsam zhig ni yod do //
translated: They have a method for abandoning the afflictions that are active in the three realms.

original: de dag la gang zag gi bdag med pa ma lus par sgom pa ni yod par rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de dag la gang zag gi bdag med pa ma lus par sgom pa ni yod par rnam par gzhag go //
translated: But it is established that they do meditate on the complete selflessness of persons.

original: de ltar ston pas slar @313b yang 'di nyid ni //
analyzed: de ltar ston pas slar @313b yang 'di nyid ni //
translated: Thus the Teacher again

original: gdul ba rnams la phye ste rnam mang gsungs //
analyzed: gdul ba rnams la phye ste rnam mang gsungs //
translated: classified it for disciples and taught it in many ways.üîΩThe two kinds of selflessness were taught by the Lord in many places in the scriptures, in accordance with the various inclinations of disciples.üîΩThe S≈´tra of the Questions of Brahmavi≈õe·π£acinti says that the selflessness of persons and the selflessness of phenomena are the emptiness of the internal and the emptiness of the external:

original: bdag med pa rnam pa gnyis po 'di ni slar bcom ldan 'das kyis gdul ba'i bsam pa sna tshogs pa nyid kyis mang por bstan to //
analyzed: bdag med pa rnam pa gnyis po 'di ni slar bcom ldan 'das kyis gdul ba'i bsam pa sna tshogs pa nyid kyis mang por bstan to //
translated: The emptiness of the internal is the selflessness of persons.

original: de la / spros dang bcas par stong pa nyid //üîΩbcu drug bshad nas mdor bsdus te //
analyzed: de la / spros dang bcas par stong pa nyid // bcu drug bshad nas mdor bsdus te //
translated: The emptiness of the external is the selflessness of phenomena.

original: slar yang bzhir bshad de dag ni //
analyzed: slar yang bzhir bshad de dag ni //
translated: The emptiness of the internal and the external is the emptiness of both.üîΩThe emptiness of emptiness is the emptiness of all phenomena.

original: theg chen du yang bzhed pa yin //üîΩji skad du /
analyzed: theg chen du yang bzhed pa yin // ji skad du /
translated: The emptiness of the great is the emptiness of the world systems.üîΩThe emptiness of the ultimate is the emptiness of nirvƒÅ·πáa.üîΩThe emptiness of conditioned phenomena is the emptiness of the three realms.üîΩThe emptiness of unconditioned phenomena is the emptiness of that which is not discarded.üîΩThe emptiness of the beginningless and endless is the emptiness of sa·πÉsƒÅra.üîΩThe emptiness of that which is not to be discarded is the emptiness of the perfection of wisdom.üîΩThe emptiness of inherent existence is the emptiness of all phenomena.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa chen po ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa chen po ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The emptiness of all phenomena is the emptiness of all phenomena.üîΩThe emptiness of nonobservation is the emptiness of nonentities.üîΩThe emptiness of the nature is the emptiness of the nature.üîΩThe emptiness of the nonexistence of things is the emptiness of the nonexistence of things.üîΩThe emptiness of inherent existence is the emptiness of inherent existence.üîΩThe emptiness of the ultimate is the emptiness of the ultimate.

original: nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid dang / stong pa nyid stong pa nyid dang / chen po stong pa nyid dang / don dam pa stong pa nyid dang / 'dus byas stong pa nyid dang /üîΩ'dus ma byas stong pa nyid dang / mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid dang / thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid dang / dor ba med pa stong pa nyid dang / rang bzhin stong pa nyid dang / chos thams cad stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid dang / stong pa nyid stong pa nyid dang / chen po stong pa nyid dang / don dam pa stong pa nyid dang / 'dus byas stong pa nyid dang / 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid dang / mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid dang / thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid dang / dor ba med pa stong pa nyid dang / rang bzhin stong pa nyid dang / chos thams cad stong pa nyid dang /
translated: The emptiness of internal phenomena, the emptiness of external phenomena, the emptiness of both external and internal phenomena, the emptiness of emptiness, the emptiness of great extent, the emptiness of ultimate reality, the emptiness of conditioned phenomena,üîΩthe emptiness of unconditioned phenomena, the emptiness of the unlimited, the emptiness of that which has neither beginning nor end, the emptiness of non-dispersal, the emptiness of inherent existence, the emptiness of all phenomena,

original: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid dang / mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid dang / mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid do //
translated: the emptiness of intrinsic characteristics, the emptiness of non-apprehension, and the emptiness of the essential nature of non-existence.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is taught.

original: de skad du stong pa nyid bcu drug bstan nas /
analyzed: de skad du stong pa nyid bcu drug bstan nas /
translated: Having taught the sixteen kinds of emptiness in this way,

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang dngos po ni dngos pos stong ngo //
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang dngos po ni dngos pos stong ngo //
translated: Subh≈´ti, moreover, entities are empty of entities.

original: dngos po med pa ni dngos po med pas stong ngo //
analyzed: dngos po med pa ni dngos po med pas stong ngo //
translated: The non-existent is empty of the non-existent.

original: rang bzhin ni rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
analyzed: rang bzhin ni rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
translated: The intrinsic nature is empty of the intrinsic nature.

original: gzhan gyi dngos po ni gzhan gyi dngos pos stong ngo zhes slar yang stong pa nyid bzhi bstan te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dngos po ni gzhan gyi dngos pos stong ngo zhes slar yang stong pa nyid bzhi bstan te /
translated: The extrinsic entity is empty of the extrinsic entity.

original: stong pa nyid 'di rnams ni theg pa chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid 'di rnams ni theg pa chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: These four kinds of emptiness are called the Great Vehicle.

original: stong pa nyid dam stong pa nyid ma yin pa ni cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid dam stong pa nyid ma yin pa ni cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Neither emptiness nor non-emptiness exist in the least,
