original: rnam pa de lta bus gdul bya'i skye bo'i dbang gis gzugs la sogs pa ltar kun rdzob tu bsnyad par zad do //
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bus gdul bya'i skye bo'i dbang gis gzugs la sogs pa ltar kun rdzob tu bsnyad par zad do //
translated: but they are merely conventionally expressed in that way, like form, etc., in accordance with the disciples.

original: ji skad du bstan bcos las /üîΩgal te stong min cung zad yod //üîΩstong pa cung zad yod par 'gyur //
analyzed: ji skad du bstan bcos las / gal te stong min cung zad yod // stong pa cung zad yod par 'gyur //
translated: As the treatise teaches:üîΩIf something were not empty,üîΩthen something would be empty.

original: mi stong cung zad yod min na //
analyzed: mi stong cung zad yod min na //
translated: Since nothing is not empty,

original: stong pa'ang yod par ga la 'gyur //üîΩstong ngo zhes kyang mi brjod de //
analyzed: stong pa'ang yod par ga la 'gyur // stong ngo zhes kyang mi brjod de //
translated: how could anything be empty?üîΩOne should not say ‚Äúempty,‚Äù

original: mi stong zhes kyang mi bya zhing //
analyzed: mi stong zhes kyang mi bya zhing //
translated: nor should one say ‚Äúnon-empty.‚Äù

original: gnyis dang gnyis min mi bya ste //
analyzed: gnyis dang gnyis min mi bya ste //
translated: One should not say ‚Äúboth‚Äù or ‚Äúneither,‚Äù

original: gdags pa'i don du brjod par bya //
analyzed: gdags pa'i don du brjod par bya //
translated: I will explain it for the purpose of designation.üîΩ

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said for the purpose of designation.

original: de la nang stong pa nyid kyi dbang du byas nas bshad pa /
analyzed: de la nang stong pa nyid kyi dbang du byas nas bshad pa /
translated: Here, in terms of inner emptiness, it is explained:

original: gang phyir de yi rang bzhin de //
analyzed: gang phyir de yi rang bzhin de //
translated: Because that is its nature,

original: yin phyir mig ni mig gis stong //
analyzed: yin phyir mig ni mig gis stong //
translated: the eye is empty of eye.

original: de bzhin rna ba sna dang lce //
analyzed: de bzhin rna ba sna dang lce //
translated: Likewise, the ear, nose, tongue,

original: lus dang @314a * //
analyzed: lus dang @314a * //
translated: body,

original: yid kyang bsnyad par bya //
analyzed: yid kyang bsnyad par bya //
translated: and mind should be explained.

original: ther zug gnas pa ma yin dang // 'jig pa ma yin nyid kyi phyir //
analyzed: ther zug gnas pa ma yin dang // 'jig pa ma yin nyid kyi phyir //
translated: Because they are not permanent and not annihilated,üîΩthe six,

original: mig la sogs pa drug po yi //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa drug po yi //
translated: the eye and so on,

original: rang bzhin med nyid gang yin pa //
analyzed: rang bzhin med nyid gang yin pa //
translated: are devoid of intrinsic nature.

original: de ni nang stong nyid du 'dod //
analyzed: de ni nang stong nyid du 'dod //
translated: This is asserted to be inner emptiness.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: de la gang dag nang stong pa nyid du 'gyur ba na nang gi chos rnams gang dag yin zhe na /
analyzed: de la gang dag nang stong pa nyid du 'gyur ba na nang gi chos rnams gang dag yin zhe na /
translated: Here, when it becomes inner emptiness, what are inner phenomena?

original: nang gi chos rnams zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nang gi chos rnams zhes bya ba ni /
translated: What are called inner phenomena

original: mig dang rna ba dang sna dang lce dang lus dang yid de /
analyzed: mig dang rna ba dang sna dang lce dang lus dang yid de /
translated: are the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind.

original: de la ther zug tu gnas pa ma yin pa dang / 'jig pa ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de la ther zug tu gnas pa ma yin pa dang / 'jig pa ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Regarding those, because they are not permanent and not annihilated,

original: mig ni mig gis stong ste /
analyzed: mig ni mig gis stong ste /
translated: the eye is empty of eye.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: de'i rang bzhin de yin pa'i phyir ro zhes rgya cher gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin de yin pa'i phyir ro zhes rgya cher gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: Because that is its nature.

original: de la ther zug tu gnas pa ma yin pa nyid ni rang bzhin mi 'dor ba la bya'o //
analyzed: de la ther zug tu gnas pa ma yin pa nyid ni rang bzhin mi 'dor ba la bya'o //
translated: There, ‚Äúnot enduring‚Äù is to be taken as not relinquishing its nature.

original: de yang dus cung zad cig gnas nas ldog par yang 'gyur bas 'jig pa ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de yang dus cung zad cig gnas nas ldog par yang 'gyur bas 'jig pa ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir zhes gsungs so //
translated: Moreover, since it would be reversed after remaining for a little while, it is said that it is not ‚Äúdestroyed.‚Äù

original: 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: This is taught:

original: dngos po gang zhig rang bzhin dang bcas pa nyid de ni gor ma chag par ther zug pa ma yin pa dang mi ldog pa zhig tu 'gyur dgos so //
analyzed: dngos po gang zhig rang bzhin dang bcas pa nyid de ni gor ma chag par ther zug pa ma yin pa dang mi ldog pa zhig tu 'gyur dgos so //
translated: Any thing that has an intrinsic reality would certainly have to be not enduring and not reversed.

original: ji skad du /üîΩrang bzhin rgyu dang rkyen dag las //
analyzed: ji skad du / rang bzhin rgyu dang rkyen dag las //
translated: As it is said:

original: 'byung bar rigs pa ma yin no //üîΩrgyu dang rkyen las byung ba yin //
analyzed: 'byung bar rigs pa ma yin no // rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba yin //
translated: It is not tenable

original: rang bzhin byas pa can du gyur //
analyzed: rang bzhin byas pa can du gyur //
translated: That intrinsic reality arises from causes and conditions.üîΩIf it arose from causes and conditions,

original: rang bzhin byas pa yin no zhes //
analyzed: rang bzhin byas pa yin no zhes //
translated: Intrinsic reality would be a product.

original: ji lta bur na rung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: ji lta bur na rung bar 'gyur //
translated: How could it be tenableüîΩTo say that intrinsic reality is a product?

original: rang bzhin nyid ni bcos min dang // gzhan la ltos pa med pa yin //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rang bzhin nyid ni bcos min dang // gzhan la ltos pa med pa yin // zhes gsungs so //
translated: and does not depend on another.

original: yang ci gang zhig slob dpon gyis bstan bcos las khyad par du mdzad pa rnam pa de lta ba'i rang bzhin slob dpon gyis zhal gyis bzhes pa zhig yod dam zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci gang zhig slob dpon gyis bstan bcos las khyad par du mdzad pa rnam pa de lta ba'i rang bzhin slob dpon gyis zhal gyis bzhes pa zhig yod dam zhe na /
translated: Again, is there any nature that the Master has taught in the treatise, and that the Master himself accepts, that is not fabricated and does not depend on another?

original: gang gi dbang du mdzad nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byang yang rung /
analyzed: gang gi dbang du mdzad nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byang yang rung /
translated: With reference to what, did the Lord say:

original: ma byung yang rung chos rnams kyi chos nyid 'di ni gnas pa nyid do zhes rgyas par gsungs pa chos nyid ces bya ba ni yod do //
analyzed: ma byung yang rung chos rnams kyi chos nyid 'di ni gnas pa nyid do zhes rgyas par gsungs pa chos nyid ces bya ba ni yod do //
translated: ‚ÄúWhether TathƒÅgatas arise or not, this dharmatƒÅ of dharmas stands,üîΩ‚Äù and so on at length?

original: chos nyid ces bya ba 'di yang ci zhig / mig la sogs pa 'di dag gi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: chos nyid ces bya ba 'di yang ci zhig / mig la sogs pa 'di dag gi rang bzhin no //
translated: What is this so-called dharmatƒÅ? It is the intrinsic nature of these eyes, etc.

original: de dag gi rang bzhin yang gang zhig ce na /
analyzed: de dag gi rang bzhin yang gang zhig ce na /
translated: What is their intrinsic nature?

original: 'di dag ni bcos ma ma yin pa dang gzhan la ltos pa med pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: 'di dag ni bcos ma ma yin pa dang gzhan la ltos pa med pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is that which is not fabricated and does not depend on another.

original: ma rig pa'i rab rib dang bral ba'i shes pas rtogs par bya ba'i rang gi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rab rib dang bral ba'i shes pas rtogs par bya ba'i rang gi ngo bo'o //
translated: It is the essence that is to be realized by a cognition free from the cataracts of ignorance.

original: ci de yod dam med do zhes de skad du smra /
analyzed: ci de yod dam med do zhes de skad du smra /
translated: Do you say that it exists or that it does not exist?

original: gal te de med na ni @314b ci'i don du byang chub sems dpa' rnams pha rol tu phyin pa'i lam sgom par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te de med na ni @314b ci'i don du byang chub sems dpa' rnams pha rol tu phyin pa'i lam sgom par 'gyur te /
translated: If it does not exist, for whose sake do the bodhisattvas cultivate the path of the perfections?

original: gang gi phyir chos nyid de rtogs par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir chos nyid de rtogs par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: For the sake of realizing that reality.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams de ltar dka' ba brgya phrag rtsom pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams de ltar dka' ba brgya phrag rtsom pa yin no //
translated: The bodhisattvas undertake such hundreds of hardships.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: rigs kyi bu don dam pa ni skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / 'jig pa med pa dang / 'ong ba med pa dang / 'gro ba med pa dang / yi ge rnams kyis brjod par bya ba ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu don dam pa ni skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / 'jig pa med pa dang / 'ong ba med pa dang / 'gro ba med pa dang / yi ge rnams kyis brjod par bya ba ma yin pa dang /
translated: Son of noble family, the ultimate is unborn, unceasing, imperishable, not coming, not going, not to be expressed by syllables,

original: yi ge rnams kyis rab tu bsnyad du med cing spros pas rtogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yi ge rnams kyis rab tu bsnyad du med cing spros pas rtogs pa ma yin te /
translated: not to be proclaimed by syllables, and not to be realized through mental proliferation.

original: rigs kyi bu don dam pa ni brjod du med cing zhi ba 'phags pa rnams kyis so so rang gis rigs par bya'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu don dam pa ni brjod du med cing zhi ba 'phags pa rnams kyis so so rang gis rigs par bya'o //
translated: Son of noble family, the ultimate is inexpressible, peaceful, and to be realized by the noble ones through their own individual wisdom.üîΩSon of noble family, whether the tathƒÅgatas appear or not,

original: rigs kyi bu don dam pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung ma byung yang rung ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu don dam pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung ma byung yang rung ste /
translated: the ultimate remains.üîΩFor the sake of that ultimate, bodhisattvas shave their heads and beards,

original: gang gi don du byang chub sems dpa' rnams skra dang kha spu dag bregs nas gos ngur smrig bgos te /üîΩyang dag par dad pas khyim nas /
analyzed: gang gi don du byang chub sems dpa' rnams skra dang kha spu dag bregs nas gos ngur smrig bgos te / yang dag par dad pas khyim nas /
translated: put on the orange robes,

original: khyim med par rab tu byung zhing /
analyzed: khyim med par rab tu byung zhing /
translated: and with sincere faith go forth from home to homelessness.üîΩHaving gone forth, they strive with diligence like their hair or clothes were on fire,

original: rab tu byung nas kyang chos de nyid thob par bya ba'i phyir /üîΩskra'am gos la me shor ba ltar brtson 'grus rtsom zhing gnas pa rnam par 'jig pa med pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu byung nas kyang chos de nyid thob par bya ba'i phyir / skra'am gos la me shor ba ltar brtson 'grus rtsom zhing gnas pa rnam par 'jig pa med pa'o //
translated: in order to attain that very Dharma.

original: rigs kyi bu gal te don dam pa yod par ma gyur na ni tshangs par spyod pa med par 'gyur zhing de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung ba don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu gal te don dam pa yod par ma gyur na ni tshangs par spyod pa med par 'gyur zhing de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung ba don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Son of noble family, if the ultimate did not exist, pure conduct would not exist, and the appearance of the tathƒÅgatas would be meaningless.

original: gang gi phyir don dam par de yod pa de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams la don dam pa la mkhas pa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir don dam par de yod pa de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams la don dam pa la mkhas pa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: Because it exists ultimately, therefore the bodhisattvas are called ‚Äúskilled in the ultimate.‚Äù

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone says:

original: kye ma ma la gang zhig dngos po cung zad kyang mi 'dod cing /
analyzed: kye ma ma la gang zhig dngos po cung zad kyang mi 'dod cing /
translated: Alas! You who do not assert any thing at all,

original: glo bur du bcos ma ma yin pa dang / gzhan la ltos pa med pa'i rang bzhin yang 'dod pa khyod ni phan tshun 'gal ba'i don brjod pa zhig go //
analyzed: glo bur du bcos ma ma yin pa dang / gzhan la ltos pa med pa'i rang bzhin yang 'dod pa khyod ni phan tshun 'gal ba'i don brjod pa zhig go //
translated: and who assert a nature that is not fabricated and does not depend on another, you speak of things that are mutually contradictory.

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: We reply:

original: khyod kyis bstan bcos kyi dgongs pa ma rig pa zhig ste /
analyzed: khyod kyis bstan bcos kyi dgongs pa ma rig pa zhig ste /
translated: You do not understand the intention of the treatise.

original: 'di'i dgongs pa ni /
analyzed: 'di'i dgongs pa ni /
translated: The intention of this treatise is as follows:

original: gal te mig la sogs pa rnams kyis rang gi ngo bo rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba byis pa'i skye bos gzung bar bya ba gang yin pa de nyid de rnams kyi rang bzhin yin na ni //
analyzed: gal te mig la sogs pa rnams kyis rang gi ngo bo rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba byis pa'i skye bos gzung bar bya ba gang yin pa de nyid de rnams kyi rang bzhin yin na ni //
translated: If the nature of such things as the eye is that which arises in dependence and is apprehended by ordinary beings,

original: rang bzhin de phyin ci log tu gyur pas kyang rtogs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rang bzhin de phyin ci log tu gyur pas kyang rtogs pa'i phyir /
translated: then because that nature is realized even by those who are mistaken,

original: tshangs par spyod pa don med par 'gyur na /
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa don med par 'gyur na /
translated: and the pure life would be pointless.

original: gang gi phyir 'di nyid rang bzhin ma @315a * //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di nyid rang bzhin ma @315a * //
translated: But since this is not its nature,

original: yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: therefore

original: de'i lta ba'i don du tshangs par spyod pa don dang bcas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i lta ba'i don du tshangs par spyod pa don dang bcas par 'gyur ro //
translated: the pure life is meaningful for the sake of seeing that.

original: de yang bdag gis kun rdzob kyi bden pa la ltos nas bcos ma ma yin pa nyid dang / gzhan la mi ltos pa nyid du brjod do //
analyzed: de yang bdag gis kun rdzob kyi bden pa la ltos nas bcos ma ma yin pa nyid dang / gzhan la mi ltos pa nyid du brjod do //
translated: Moreover, we say that it is not fabricated and does not depend on anything else in reliance on conventional truth.

original: gang zhig byis pa'i skye bos blta bar bya ba ma yin pa de nyid ni rang bzhin du rigs la /
analyzed: gang zhig byis pa'i skye bos blta bar bya ba ma yin pa de nyid ni rang bzhin du rigs la /
translated: It is reasonable that that which is not seen by ordinary beings is its nature.

original: de tsam gyis don dam pa dngos po ma yin zhing dngos po med pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de tsam gyis don dam pa dngos po ma yin zhing dngos po med pa yang ma yin te /
translated: But the ultimate is not a thing or a non-thing,üîΩbecause it is peace by nature.

original: de ni rang bzhin gyis zhi ba nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: de ni rang bzhin gyis zhi ba nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: This is the nature of things.

original: rang bzhin 'di ni slob dpon gyis zhal gyis bzhes pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: rang bzhin 'di ni slob dpon gyis zhal gyis bzhes pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: This nature is not only accepted by the master NƒÅgƒÅrjuna.

original: gzhan yang don 'di khas len du gzhug par nus pas rang bzhin 'di ni gnyi ga la grub pa nyid du yang rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: gzhan yang don 'di khas len du gzhug par nus pas rang bzhin 'di ni gnyi ga la grub pa nyid du yang rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Moreover, since one can induce the other to accept this meaning, this nature is also presented as established for both.

original: gang dag me la sogs pa'i rang bzhin tsha ba la sogs pa yin par smra ba de dag gi ltar na ni /
analyzed: gang dag me la sogs pa'i rang bzhin tsha ba la sogs pa yin par smra ba de dag gi ltar na ni /
translated: For those who say that the nature of fire, etc. is heat, etc.,

original: rnam pa thams cad du mi rung ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du mi rung ste /
translated: it is not tenable in any way.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nyid kyis bcos ma nyid yin pa'i phyir dang ; ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nyid kyis bcos ma nyid yin pa'i phyir dang ; ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are fabricated by dependent origination and because they are dependent.

original: yod pa nyid kyi phyir de la bcos ma nyid med pa dang / gzhan la ltos pa nyid med pa yod do zhes bya bar brjod par yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: yod pa nyid kyi phyir de la bcos ma nyid med pa dang / gzhan la ltos pa nyid med pa yod do zhes bya bar brjod par yang mi rigs te /
translated: It is not tenable to say that they are not fabricated and do not depend on others because they exist.

original: de la zhes bya ba 'dis mchog tu 'dzin pa'i dngos po med pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba 'dis mchog tu 'dzin pa'i dngos po med pa'i phyir la /
translated: Because of the phrase ‚Äúin that,‚Äù the thing that is grasped as supreme does not exist.

original: kun rdzob tu rnam pa de lta bu'i don bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu rnam pa de lta bu'i don bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is taught that the meaning of such a mode of expression is conventional.

original: rgya chen pos chog go //
analyzed: rgya chen pos chog go //
translated: Enough with the extensive explanation.

original: dkyus ma nyid rnam par bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: dkyus ma nyid rnam par bshad par bya'o //
translated: The simple explanation will be explained.

original: de la mig la sogs pa rnams mig la sogs pa rnams nyid kyis stong pa nyid du smras pas ni rang bzhin stong pa nyid yongs su gsal bar byas pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de la mig la sogs pa rnams mig la sogs pa rnams nyid kyis stong pa nyid du smras pas ni rang bzhin stong pa nyid yongs su gsal bar byas pa yin gyi /
translated: Since it is said that the eyes, etc. are empty of the eyes, etc., the emptiness of intrinsic nature is fully clarified.

original: mig ni nang gi byed pa dang bral ba'i phyir stong zhing gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid kyis stong ngo zhes gcig la gcig med pa'i stong pa nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mig ni nang gi byed pa dang bral ba'i phyir stong zhing gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid kyis stong ngo zhes gcig la gcig med pa'i stong pa nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: The eyes, etc. are empty because they are devoid of internal activity, and they are empty of the nature of the apprehended and apprehender, but not of the emptiness of one thing in another.

original: de la phyi stong pa nyid ni /
analyzed: de la phyi stong pa nyid ni /
translated: External emptiness

original: gang phyir de yi rang bzhin de //
analyzed: gang phyir de yi rang bzhin de //
translated: Since the nature of that

original: yin phyir gzugs ni gzugs kyis stong //
analyzed: yin phyir gzugs ni gzugs kyis stong //
translated: is that, form is empty of form.

original: sgra dang dri ro reg bya dang // chos rnams nyid kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: sgra dang dri ro reg bya dang // chos rnams nyid kyang de bzhin no //
translated: Sound, smell, taste, feeling, and phenomena are also like that.

original: gzugs sogs rang bzhin med pa nyid //
analyzed: gzugs sogs rang bzhin med pa nyid //
translated: The absence of intrinsic reality of form, etc.

original: phyi rol stong pa nyid du 'dod //
analyzed: phyi rol stong pa nyid du 'dod //
translated: is asserted as external emptiness.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: de la phyi stong pa nyid gang zhe na //
analyzed: de la phyi stong pa nyid gang zhe na //
translated: What is external emptiness?

original: phyi'i chos rnams zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: phyi'i chos rnams zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'o //
translated: The so-called external phenomena are form, etc.

original: de la ther zug tu gnas pa ma yin pa dang 'jig pa ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de la ther zug tu gnas pa ma yin pa dang 'jig pa ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Because it is not permanent and not annihilated,

original: gzugs ni gzugs kyis @315b stong ste /
analyzed: gzugs ni gzugs kyis @315b stong ste /
translated: form is empty of form.

original: de'i rang bzhin de yin pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs te snga ma bzhin no //üîΩgnyis char rang bzhin med nyid ni //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin de yin pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs te snga ma bzhin no // gnyis char rang bzhin med nyid ni //
translated: Because its nature is just that, as before.üîΩThe emptiness of both the internal and the external

original: phyi nang stong pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: phyi nang stong pa nyid yin no //
translated: is the emptiness of the external and internal.

original: ji skad du phyi dang nang gi chos rnams phyi dang nang gi chos rnams kyi rang bzhin med pa nyid ni phyi dang nang gi stong pa nyid do zhes gsungs te snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: ji skad du phyi dang nang gi chos rnams phyi dang nang gi chos rnams kyi rang bzhin med pa nyid ni phyi dang nang gi stong pa nyid do zhes gsungs te snga ma bzhin no //
translated: As it is said, ‚ÄúThe lack of intrinsic reality of external and internal phenomena is the emptiness of the external and internal, as before.

original: chos rnams rang bzhin med pa nyid //
analyzed: chos rnams rang bzhin med pa nyid //
translated: The lack of intrinsic reality of phenomena

original: mkhas pas stong pa nyid ces bsnyad //
analyzed: mkhas pas stong pa nyid ces bsnyad //
translated: is said by the learned to be emptiness.

original: stong nyid de yang stong nyid kyi //
analyzed: stong nyid de yang stong nyid kyi //
translated: And that emptiness is also empty

original: ngo bos stong par 'dod pa yin //
analyzed: ngo bos stong par 'dod pa yin //
translated: of the entity of emptiness.

original: stong nyid ces bya'i stong nyid gang //
analyzed: stong nyid ces bya'i stong nyid gang //
translated: The emptiness of that which is called emptiness

original: stong nyid stong nyid du 'dod de //
analyzed: stong nyid stong nyid du 'dod de //
translated: is asserted to be the emptiness of emptiness.

original: stong nyid dngos po'i blo can gyi //
analyzed: stong nyid dngos po'i blo can gyi //
translated: Those who think of emptiness as an entity

original: 'dzin pa zlog phyir gsungs pa yin //
analyzed: 'dzin pa zlog phyir gsungs pa yin //
translated: It is taught in order to reverse fixation.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: de la stong pa nyid gang zhe na //
analyzed: de la stong pa nyid gang zhe na //
translated: What is emptiness?

original: chos rnams kyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa'i stong pa nyid des stong pa nyid stong pa 'di ni stong pa nyid stong pa nyid ces bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa'i stong pa nyid des stong pa nyid stong pa 'di ni stong pa nyid stong pa nyid ces bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: The emptiness of phenomena is empty of itself. This is called the emptiness of emptiness.

original: gang dag stong pa nyid la yang dngos por mngon par zhen pa de dag gi stong pa nyid la dngos por 'dzin pa bzlog pa'i don du nye bar bstan te /
analyzed: gang dag stong pa nyid la yang dngos por mngon par zhen pa de dag gi stong pa nyid la dngos por 'dzin pa bzlog pa'i don du nye bar bstan te /
translated: It is taught for those who cling to emptiness as a thing, in order to reverse their fixation on emptiness as a thing.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: kun rtog thams cad gzhom pa'i phyir //
analyzed: kun rtog thams cad gzhom pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to destroy all conceptualization,

original: stong nyid bdud rtsi bstan par mdzad //
analyzed: stong nyid bdud rtsi bstan par mdzad //
translated: The nectar of emptiness is taught.

original: gang la de la'ang 'dzin yod pa //
analyzed: gang la de la'ang 'dzin yod pa //
translated: But if there is clinging to that,

original: de ni khyod kyis smad par mdzad //üîΩces gsungs so //
analyzed: de ni khyod kyis smad par mdzad // ces gsungs so //
translated: You have condemned it.

original: sems can snod kyi 'jig rten ni //üîΩma lus khyab byed nyid phyir dang // tshad med dpe yi mu mtha' ni //
analyzed: sems can snod kyi 'jig rten ni // ma lus khyab byed nyid phyir dang // tshad med dpe yi mu mtha' ni //
translated: The world of sentient beings‚Äô containersüîΩIs pervaded without exception,üîΩAnd the directions are vast

original: med phyir phyogs rnams chen po nyid //
analyzed: med phyir phyogs rnams chen po nyid //
translated: Because of the absence of a limit to immeasurables and examples.

original: phyogs las logs shig tu sems can gyi 'jig rten med cing snod kyi 'jig rten med pas 'gro ba ma lus pa la khyab par byed pa nyid kyis phyogs rnams chen po nyid do //
analyzed: phyogs las logs shig tu sems can gyi 'jig rten med cing snod kyi 'jig rten med pas 'gro ba ma lus pa la khyab par byed pa nyid kyis phyogs rnams chen po nyid do //
translated: The world of sentient beings does not exist apart from the directions, nor does the physical world exist apart from the directions. The directions are great because they pervade all beings without exception.

original: gang gi phyir byams pa la sogs pa sgom pa ni phyogs yongs su bcad nas sgom pas na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir byams pa la sogs pa sgom pa ni phyogs yongs su bcad nas sgom pas na /
translated: Since the cultivation of lovingkindness, etc. is cultivated by delimiting the directions,

original: phyogs rnams tshad med pa'i dpe can du gnas pa de'i phyir mu med pas kyang chen po nyid do //
analyzed: phyogs rnams tshad med pa'i dpe can du gnas pa de'i phyir mu med pas kyang chen po nyid do //
translated: the directions are the exemplifications of the immeasurables. Therefore, they are great because they are infinite.

original: 'di dag bcu char phyogs rnams kyis //üîΩstong pa nyid ni gang yin te //
analyzed: 'di dag bcu char phyogs rnams kyis // stong pa nyid ni gang yin te //
translated: These ten are the emptiness of the greatüîΩbecause of the emptiness of the directions.

original: chen po stong pa nyid yin te //
analyzed: chen po stong pa nyid yin te //
translated: The emptiness of the great

original: chen por 'dzin pa bzlog phyir gsungs //
analyzed: chen por 'dzin pa bzlog phyir gsungs //
translated: is taught in order to counteract the grasping of the great.

original: ji skad du ;
analyzed: ji skad du ;
translated: As it is said:

original: chen po stong pa nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: chen po stong pa nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the emptiness of the great?

original: shar phyogs ni shar phyogs kyis stong ngo zhes rgya cher gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: shar phyogs ni shar phyogs kyis stong ngo zhes rgya cher gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: The eastern direction is empty of the eastern direction.

original: chen po stong pa nyid de ni gang dag phyogs tshad med do snyam du phyogs rnams la chen por 'dzin pa de dag gi 'dzin pa de bzlog pa'i phyir bstan te /üîΩ'di ltar bye brag pa @316a * //
analyzed: chen po stong pa nyid de ni gang dag phyogs tshad med do snyam du phyogs rnams la chen por 'dzin pa de dag gi 'dzin pa de bzlog pa'i phyir bstan te / 'di ltar bye brag pa @316a * //
translated: The emptiness of the great is taught in order to reverse the fixation on the great of those who think that the directions are immeasurable.

original: dag gis phyogs rnams rdzas nyid du rtogs so //
analyzed: dag gis phyogs rnams rdzas nyid du rtogs so //
translated: In this way, the Vai≈õe·π£ikas understand the directions to be substantial.

original: de ni dgos pa mchog yin pas //
analyzed: de ni dgos pa mchog yin pas //
translated: Since that is the supreme purpose,

original: don dam mya ngan 'das pa yin //üîΩde ni de yis stong nyid gang //
analyzed: don dam mya ngan 'das pa yin // de ni de yis stong nyid gang //
translated: it is the ultimate, nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: de ni don dam stong nyid de //üîΩmya ngan 'das dngos blo can gyi //
analyzed: de ni don dam stong nyid de // mya ngan 'das dngos blo can gyi //
translated: That emptiness of that is the emptiness of the ultimate.üîΩIn order to reverse the fixation

original: 'dzin pa bzlog par bya ba'i phyir //üîΩdon dam mkhyen pas don dam pa //
analyzed: 'dzin pa bzlog par bya ba'i phyir // don dam mkhyen pas don dam pa //
translated: of those who think nirvƒÅ·πáa is a thing,üîΩthe knower of the ultimate

original: stong pa nyid ni bstan pa mdzad //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni bstan pa mdzad //
translated: taught the emptiness of the ultimate.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it was said:

original: de la don dam pa stong pa nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la don dam pa stong pa nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the emptiness of the ultimate?

original: don dam pa zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: don dam pa zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúUltimate‚Äù means nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: ther zug tu gnas pa ma yin pa dang / 'jig pa ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: ther zug tu gnas pa ma yin pa dang / 'jig pa ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Because it is not something that endures permanently and is not something that is destroyed,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ni mya ngan las 'das pas stong ste /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ni mya ngan las 'das pas stong ste /
translated: Nirvana is empty of nirvana.

original: zhes rgya cher 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes rgya cher 'byung ngo //
translated: Thus it is extensively stated.

original: de yang mya ngan las 'das pa la dngos por mngon par zhen pa rnams kyi dngos por 'dzin pa bzlog par bya ba'i phyir gsungs so //
analyzed: de yang mya ngan las 'das pa la dngos por mngon par zhen pa rnams kyi dngos por 'dzin pa bzlog par bya ba'i phyir gsungs so //
translated: Moreover, it was taught in order to reverse the grasping at substantiality of those who are attached to substantiality in nirvana.

original: don gyi sgra ni dgos pa'i tshig gam shes bya'i tshig go //
analyzed: don gyi sgra ni dgos pa'i tshig gam shes bya'i tshig go //
translated: The term ‚Äúmeaning‚Äù is a term for purpose or a term for object of knowledge.

original: rkyen las byung phyir khams gsum po //
analyzed: rkyen las byung phyir khams gsum po //
translated: Because they arise from conditions, the three realms

original: 'dus byas yin par nges par bsnyad //
analyzed: 'dus byas yin par nges par bsnyad //
translated: are definitely said to be conditioned.

original: de ni de yis stong nyid gang //
analyzed: de ni de yis stong nyid gang //
translated: That emptiness of that by that

original: de ni 'dus byas stong nyid gsungs //
analyzed: de ni 'dus byas stong nyid gsungs //
translated: is declared to be the emptiness of the conditioned.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: de la 'dus byas stong pa nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la 'dus byas stong pa nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the emptiness of the conditioned?

original: 'dus byas zhes bya ba ni khams gsum mo //
analyzed: 'dus byas zhes bya ba ni khams gsum mo //
translated: The conditioned is the three realms.

original: de la 'dod pa'i khams ni 'dod pa'i khams kyis stong ste zhes rgya cher gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de la 'dod pa'i khams ni 'dod pa'i khams kyis stong ste zhes rgya cher gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: Therein, the desire realm is empty of the desire realm.

original: gang la skye gnas mi rtag nyid //
analyzed: gang la skye gnas mi rtag nyid //
translated: Where there is no arising, enduring, or impermanence,

original: de dag med pa 'dus ma byas //
analyzed: de dag med pa 'dus ma byas //
translated: that absence is unconditioned.

original: de ni de yis stong nyid gang //
analyzed: de ni de yis stong nyid gang //
translated: That emptiness of that by thatüîΩis declared to be the emptiness of the unconditioned.

original: de ni 'dus ma byas stong nyid //
analyzed: de ni 'dus ma byas stong nyid //
translated: That is the emptiness of the unconditioned.

original: de yis zhes bya ba ni 'dus ma byas kyis zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de yis zhes bya ba ni 'dus ma byas kyis zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚Äú By that‚Äù means by the unconditioned.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: de la 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid gang zhe na /üîΩ'dus ma byas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid gang zhe na / 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: What is the emptiness of the unconditioned?

original: gang la skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / 'jig pa med pa dang / gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid med pa'o //
analyzed: gang la skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / 'jig pa med pa dang / gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid med pa'o //
translated: The unconditioned is that which is not produced by causes and conditions.üîΩThere, the unconditioned is empty of the unconditioned.

original: de la 'dus ma byas ni 'dus ma byas kyis stong ste zhes gsungs pa lta bu ste snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de la 'dus ma byas ni 'dus ma byas kyis stong ste zhes gsungs pa lta bu ste snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The rest is as before.

original: gang la mtha' ni yod min pa //
analyzed: gang la mtha' ni yod min pa //
translated: That which has no end

original: de ni mtha' las 'das par brjod //
analyzed: de ni mtha' las 'das par brjod //
translated: Is said to be beyond the extremes.

original: de de kho nas stong pa nyid //
analyzed: de de kho nas stong pa nyid //
translated: That is empty of just that

original: mtha' las 'das pa stong nyid bsnyad //
analyzed: mtha' las 'das pa stong nyid bsnyad //
translated: And is called the emptiness of what is beyond extremes.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: de la mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the emptiness of what is beyond extremes?

original: mtha' zhes bya ba ni rtag pa'i mtha' dang chad pa'i mtha' ste /
analyzed: mtha' zhes bya ba ni rtag pa'i mtha' dang chad pa'i mtha' ste /
translated: ‚Äú Extreme‚Äù means the extreme of eternalism and the extreme of nihilism.

original: gang la mtha' yod pa ma yin pa de ni mtha' las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: gang la mtha' yod pa ma yin pa de ni mtha' las 'das pa'o //
translated: That which has no end is beyond the extremes.

original: mtha' las 'das pa ni @316b mtha' las 'das pas stong ste zhes rgya cher gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: mtha' las 'das pa ni @316b mtha' las 'das pas stong ste zhes rgya cher gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: The beyond of the extremes is empty of the beyond of the extremes.üîΩThe beginning is the first extreme.

original: thog ma dang po tha ma mtha' //
analyzed: thog ma dang po tha ma mtha' //
translated: The end is the final extreme.

original: de dag med pas 'khor ba ni //
analyzed: de dag med pas 'khor ba ni //
translated: Since these do not exist,

original: thog ma tha ma med par brjod //
analyzed: thog ma tha ma med par brjod //
translated: samsara is said to be without beginning or end.

original: 'gro 'ong bral zhing rmi lam lta'i //
analyzed: 'gro 'ong bral zhing rmi lam lta'i //
translated: It is free from coming and going, like a dream.

original: srid 'di de yis dben nyid gang //
analyzed: srid 'di de yis dben nyid gang //
translated: This existence is empty of that.üîΩThis is the emptiness of what is without beginning or end.

original: de ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid do zhes bstan bcos las ni nges par bsnyad //
analyzed: de ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid do zhes bstan bcos las ni nges par bsnyad //
translated: This is explained in the treatise.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: de la thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the emptiness of what is without beginning or end?

original: gang la thog ma dang tha ma mi dmigs pa de la dbus med cing /
analyzed: gang la thog ma dang tha ma mi dmigs pa de la dbus med cing /
translated: That which cannot be observed as having a beginning or an end does not have a middle.

original: gang la thog ma dang tha ma dbus ma dmigs pa de la 'ong ba dang 'gro ba med do //
analyzed: gang la thog ma dang tha ma dbus ma dmigs pa de la 'ong ba dang 'gro ba med do //
translated: That which cannot be observed as having a beginning, an end, or a middle does not come or go.

original: de la ther zug tu gnas pa ma yin pa dang / 'jig pa ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de la ther zug tu gnas pa ma yin pa dang / 'jig pa ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Since it does not abide permanently and does not disintegrate,

original: thog ma dang tha ma dang dbus rnams ni thog ma dang tha ma dang dbus rnams kyis stong ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: thog ma dang tha ma dang dbus rnams ni thog ma dang tha ma dang dbus rnams kyis stong ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: The beginning, end, and middle are empty of the beginning, end, and middle.

original: thog ma zhes bya ba ni dang po la bya'o //
analyzed: thog ma zhes bya ba ni dang po la bya'o //
translated: The beginning is the first part.

original: tha ma zhes bya ba ni mtha'o //
analyzed: tha ma zhes bya ba ni mtha'o //
translated: The end is the last part.üîΩDiscarding is said to be throwing away,

original: dor ba zhes bya 'thor ba dang // 'bor ba la ni nges par brjod //
analyzed: dor ba zhes bya 'thor ba dang // 'bor ba la ni nges par brjod //
translated: and letting go.

original: dor med stong pa med pa ste //
analyzed: dor med stong pa med pa ste //
translated: Non-discarding is non-empty.

original: 'ga' yang 'bor med gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'ga' yang 'bor med gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is not discarded at all.

original: dor ba med pa de nyid kyis //
analyzed: dor ba med pa de nyid kyis //
translated: Non-discarding itself

original: de nyid stong pa nyid gang yin //
analyzed: de nyid stong pa nyid gang yin //
translated: is emptiness.

original: de de'i phyir na dor med pa //
analyzed: de de'i phyir na dor med pa //
translated: Therefore, non-discarding

original: stong pa nyid ces bya bar brjod //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ces bya bar brjod //
translated: is said to be emptiness.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: de la dor ba med pa stong pa nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la dor ba med pa stong pa nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the emptiness of non-discarding?

original: dor ba ni 'thor ba dang 'bor ba dang gtong ba'o //
analyzed: dor ba ni 'thor ba dang 'bor ba dang gtong ba'o //
translated: Discarding is throwing away, letting go, and giving up.

original: de la dor ba med pa ni dor ba med pas stong ste zhes rgya cher gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de la dor ba med pa ni dor ba med pas stong ste zhes rgya cher gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: Non-discarding is empty of non-discarding.

original: dor ba ni gtong pa yin la dor ba med pa ni gang la 'ga' yang gtong pa med pa'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dor ba ni gtong pa yin la dor ba med pa ni gang la 'ga' yang gtong pa med pa'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Abandonment is giving up. The absence of abandonment is that with regard to which there is no giving up at all.

original: 'dus byas la sogs ngo bo nyid //
analyzed: 'dus byas la sogs ngo bo nyid //
translated: The nature of the compounded, etc.üîΩis not made by disciples,

original: gang phyir slob ma rang sangs rgyas //
analyzed: gang phyir slob ma rang sangs rgyas //
translated: by self-enlightened ones,

original: rgyal sras de bzhin gshegs rnams kyis //üîΩma mdzad de phyir 'dus byas la //
analyzed: rgyal sras de bzhin gshegs rnams kyis // ma mdzad de phyir 'dus byas la //
translated: by bodhisattvas, or by the transcendent lords.

original: sogs pa rnams kyi ngo bo nyid //
analyzed: sogs pa rnams kyi ngo bo nyid //
translated: Therefore, the nature of the compounded, etc.

original: rang bzhin nyid du bsnyad pa ste //
analyzed: rang bzhin nyid du bsnyad pa ste //
translated: is called intrinsic nature.

original: de nyid kyis de stong nyid gang //
analyzed: de nyid kyis de stong nyid gang //
translated: The emptiness of that is

original: de ni rang bzhin stong pa nyid //
analyzed: de ni rang bzhin stong pa nyid //
translated: intrinsic emptiness.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: de la rang bzhin stong pa nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la rang bzhin stong pa nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is intrinsic emptiness?

original: gang chos rnams kyi rang bzhin ma byas shing mngon par 'dus ma byas pa ste /
analyzed: gang chos rnams kyi rang bzhin ma byas shing mngon par 'dus ma byas pa ste /
translated: The intrinsic nature of phenomena is not made, not brought about.

original: de ni nyan thos rnams kyis ma byas zhes rgya cher gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de ni nyan thos rnams kyis ma byas zhes rgya cher gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is not made by disciples, not made by self-enlightened ones, not made by bodhisattvas, not made by the transcendent lords.üîΩThe eighteen elements, the six contacts,

original: khams bco brgyad dang reg drug dang // de las dbyung ba'i tshor ba drug //
analyzed: khams bco brgyad dang reg drug dang // de las dbyung ba'i tshor ba drug //
translated: and the six feelings that arise from those,

original: gzugs can gzugs can min de bzhin //
analyzed: gzugs can gzugs can min de bzhin //
translated: are like the material and the immaterial.

original: 'dus byas 'du @317a * //
analyzed: 'dus byas 'du @317a * //
translated: Conditioned and unconditioned phenomena.üîΩ

original: ma byas chos rnams //
analyzed: ma byas chos rnams //
translated: 1. The conditioned and the unconditioned

original: chos de dag ni thams cad kyi //
analyzed: chos de dag ni thams cad kyi //
translated: are all dharmas.

original: de dag gis dben stong nyid gang //
analyzed: de dag gis dben stong nyid gang //
translated: The emptiness of thoseüîΩis the emptiness of all dharmas.

original: yin pa 'di ni chos thams cad stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: yin pa 'di ni chos thams cad stong pa nyid do //
translated: This is the emptiness of all dharmas.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: de la chos thams cad stong pa nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la chos thams cad stong pa nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the emptiness of all dharmas?

original: chos thams cad ces bya ba ni 'dus byas rnams dang / 'dus ma byas rnams dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu'o //üîΩde la khams bco brgyad ni /
analyzed: chos thams cad ces bya ba ni 'dus byas rnams dang / 'dus ma byas rnams dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu'o // de la khams bco brgyad ni /
translated: All dharmas are the conditioned and the unconditioned.

original: nang gi skye mched drug dang / phyi'i drug dang rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug go //
analyzed: nang gi skye mched drug dang / phyi'i drug dang rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug go //
translated: The eighteen elements are the six inner sense spheres, the six outer sense spheres, and the six collections of consciousness.

original: reg pa drug ni mig gi 'dus te reg pa nas yid kyi 'dus te reg pa zhes bya ba'i bar ro //
analyzed: reg pa drug ni mig gi 'dus te reg pa nas yid kyi 'dus te reg pa zhes bya ba'i bar ro //
translated: The six contacts are the contact of eye, etc., up to the contact of mind.

original: reg pa'i rgyu can gyi tshor ba yang drug go //
analyzed: reg pa'i rgyu can gyi tshor ba yang drug go //
translated: The six feelings are those that have contact as their cause.

original: de la chos thams cad ni chos thams cad kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: de la chos thams cad ni chos thams cad kyis stong ngo //
translated: Therein, all dharmas are empty of all dharmas.

original: gzugs rung la sogs dngos med gang //
analyzed: gzugs rung la sogs dngos med gang //
translated: 2. The nonexistence of the suitability of form, etc.,

original: de ni rang mtshan stong pa nyid //
analyzed: de ni rang mtshan stong pa nyid //
translated: This is the emptiness of defining characteristics.

original: yang gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid ci yin zhe na /
translated: What are the defining characteristics of form, etc.?

original: rgyas par bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: rgyas par bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: In order to teach this extensively, he says:

original: gzugs ni gzugs rung mtshan nyid can //
analyzed: gzugs ni gzugs rung mtshan nyid can //
translated: Form is the characteristic of that which is suitable as form.

original: tshor ba myong ba'i bdag nyid can //
analyzed: tshor ba myong ba'i bdag nyid can //
translated: Feeling has the nature of experience.

original: 'du shes mtshan mar 'dzin pa ste //
analyzed: 'du shes mtshan mar 'dzin pa ste //
translated: Perception is the apprehension of signs.

original: 'du byed mngon par 'du byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'du byed mngon par 'du byed pa'o //
translated: Disposition is the act of conditioning.

original: yul la so sor rnam rig pa //
analyzed: yul la so sor rnam rig pa //
translated: Consciousness is the individual perception of objects.

original: rnam shes rang gi mtshan nyid de //
analyzed: rnam shes rang gi mtshan nyid de //
translated: This is the defining characteristic of consciousness.

original: phung po sdug bsngal rang mtshan nyid //üîΩkhams kyi bdag nyid sbrul gdug 'dod //
analyzed: phung po sdug bsngal rang mtshan nyid // khams kyi bdag nyid sbrul gdug 'dod //
translated: The aggregates have the defining characteristic of suffering.üîΩThe elements are considered to have the nature of poisonous snakes.

original: 'dzin par chos mthun pa'i sgo nas khams rnams ni sbrul gdug pa'i mtshan nyid can no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dzin par chos mthun pa'i sgo nas khams rnams ni sbrul gdug pa'i mtshan nyid can no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The elements have the characteristic of poisonous snakes, in the sense of having a similar mode of apprehension.

original: skye mched rnams ni sangs rgyas kyis //
analyzed: skye mched rnams ni sangs rgyas kyis //
translated: The Buddha has declared the sense bases to be the doors of birth,

original: skye ba'i sgor gyur nyid du gsungs te sdug bsngal 'byung zhing skye ba'i sgor gyur pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba'i sgor gyur nyid du gsungs te sdug bsngal 'byung zhing skye ba'i sgor gyur pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because they are the doors of the arising and birth of suffering.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba gang //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba gang //
translated: Dependent origination

original: de ni 'du 'phrod mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de ni 'du 'phrod mtshan nyid do //
translated: is characterized by contact.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni 'du 'phrod kyi mtshan nyid can /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni 'du 'phrod kyi mtshan nyid can /
translated: Dependent origination is characterized by contact,

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'du 'phrod kyis rab tu phye ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'du 'phrod kyis rab tu phye ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it is distinguished by contact.

original: gtong ba sbyin pa'i pha rol phyin //üîΩtshul khrims gdung med mtshan nyid bzod //
analyzed: gtong ba sbyin pa'i pha rol phyin // tshul khrims gdung med mtshan nyid bzod //
translated: Giving is the perfection of generosity.üîΩMorality is characterized by non-remorse.

original: khro med mtshan nyid brtson 'grus kyi //
analyzed: khro med mtshan nyid brtson 'grus kyi //
translated: Patience is characterized by non-anger.

original: kha na ma tho med nyid do //
analyzed: kha na ma tho med nyid do //
translated: Exertion is characterized by non-remorse.

original: brtson 'grus ni dge ba yongs su 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brtson 'grus ni dge ba yongs su 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Exertion is characterized by non-remorse, because it is the cause of the acquisition and preservation of virtue.

original: bsam gtan sdud pa'i mtshan nyid can te /
analyzed: bsam gtan sdud pa'i mtshan nyid can te /
translated: Concentration is characterized by collecting.

original: dge ba'i chos thams cad sdud par byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos thams cad sdud par byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is characterized by collecting, because it collects all virtuous qualities.

original: shes rab @317b chags med mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: shes rab @317b chags med mtshan nyid do //
translated: Wisdom is characterized by non-attachment.

original: mya ngan las 'das par bgrod pa'i phyir 'ga' la yang chags pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das par bgrod pa'i phyir 'ga' la yang chags pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is characterized by non-attachment, because it is not attached to anything in order to reach nirvana.

original: pha rol phyin pa drug rnams kyi //
analyzed: pha rol phyin pa drug rnams kyi //
translated: The six perfections

original: mtshan nyid 'di dag yin par brjod //
analyzed: mtshan nyid 'di dag yin par brjod //
translated: These are their characteristics.üîΩThe meditative concentrations, the immeasurables,

original: bsam gtan rnams dang tshad med dang // de bzhin gzhan gang gzugs med pa //
analyzed: bsam gtan rnams dang tshad med dang // de bzhin gzhan gang gzugs med pa //
translated: and likewise the formless states,

original: de dag yang dag mkhyen pa yis //
analyzed: de dag yang dag mkhyen pa yis //
translated: the Knower of Truth

original: mi 'khrugs mtshan nyid can du gsungs //
analyzed: mi 'khrugs mtshan nyid can du gsungs //
translated: has declared to have the characteristic of non-disturbance.

original: de dag ni bcom ldan 'das kyis khro ba med pa'i mtshan nyid can du gsungs te /
analyzed: de dag ni bcom ldan 'das kyis khro ba med pa'i mtshan nyid can du gsungs te /
translated: The Blessed One has declared that they have the characteristic of non-anger,

original: de dag khong khro ba spangs pas 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag khong khro ba spangs pas 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are attained through the abandonment of anger.

original: byang chub phyogs ni sum cu bdun //
analyzed: byang chub phyogs ni sum cu bdun //
translated: The factors of enlightenment

original: nges par 'byung byed rang mtshan nyid //
analyzed: nges par 'byung byed rang mtshan nyid //
translated: have the characteristic of leading to liberation.

original: nges par 'byung ba ni nges par 'byung ba ste thar pa'o zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩ'khor ba las 'da' ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir nges par 'byung bar byed par nus pas nges par 'byung bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba ni nges par 'byung ba ste thar pa'o zhes bya ba'i don to // 'khor ba las 'da' ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir nges par 'byung bar byed par nus pas nges par 'byung bar byed pa ste /
translated: Liberation is the going forth, that is, the deliverance, of the mind.üîΩThey are able to lead to liberation because they are the cause of transcending cyclic existence.

original: thar pa thob par byed pa'i mtshan nyid can no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: thar pa thob par byed pa'i mtshan nyid can no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: They have the characteristic of leading to liberation, that is, they cause the attainment of liberation.

original: bsam gtan la sogs pa dag ni sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: bsam gtan la sogs pa dag ni sngar bshad zin to //
translated: The meditative concentrations, etc., have already been explained.

original: stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid ni //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid ni //
translated: The characteristic of emptiness is

original: dmigs pa med pas rnam dben nyid //üîΩdngos po ma dmigs pas rnam par rtog pa'i dri mas nye bar ma spags pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: dmigs pa med pas rnam dben nyid // dngos po ma dmigs pas rnam par rtog pa'i dri mas nye bar ma spags pa'i phyir na /
translated: freedom from the objectification of things.

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid ni rnam par dben pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid ni rnam par dben pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: The emptiness gate of liberation has the characteristic of freedom from the objectification of things, because it is not sullied by the stain of conceptual thought.

original: mtshan ma med pa zhi nyid de //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa zhi nyid de //
translated: The signless gate of liberation has the characteristic of peace,üîΩbecause it is free from the objectification of signs.

original: gsum pa'i mtshan nyid sdug bsngal dang gti mug med /üîΩrnam par thar pa'i sgo mtshan ma med pa ni /
analyzed: gsum pa'i mtshan nyid sdug bsngal dang gti mug med / rnam par thar pa'i sgo mtshan ma med pa ni /
translated: The third has the characteristic of the absence of suffering and delusion.üîΩThe signless gate of liberation has the characteristic of peace,

original: mtshan ma ma dmigs pa'i sgo nas zhi ba'i mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: mtshan ma ma dmigs pa'i sgo nas zhi ba'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: because it is free from the objectification of signs.

original: gsum pa'i zhes bya ba ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo smon pa med pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gsum pa'i zhes bya ba ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo smon pa med pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The third is the wishless gate of liberation.

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo smon pa med pa 'di ni sdug bsngal dang gti mug med pa'i mtshan nyid can te /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo smon pa med pa 'di ni sdug bsngal dang gti mug med pa'i mtshan nyid can te /
translated: The wishless gate of liberation has the characteristic of the absence of suffering and delusion,üîΩbecause it is free from the objectification of suffering and delusion.

original: 'du byed sdug bsngal gyi bdag nyid can rnams la yang dag par rjes su lta zhing shes rab kyis 'du byed kyi rang bzhin la lta ba na smon par mi byed pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: 'du byed sdug bsngal gyi bdag nyid can rnams la yang dag par rjes su lta zhing shes rab kyis 'du byed kyi rang bzhin la lta ba na smon par mi byed pa'i phyir na /
translated: He also sees the nature of formations as it truly is with wisdom, and does not wish for them, since they are the essence of the suffering of conditioned existence.

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum pa ni sdug bsngal dang gti mug med pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum pa ni sdug bsngal dang gti mug med pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: The third door of liberation has the characteristic of the absence of suffering and delusion.

original: rnam thar rnams kyis mtshan nyid rnam par grol byed pa'o //
analyzed: rnam thar rnams kyis mtshan nyid rnam par grol byed pa'o //
translated: The doors of liberation are so called because they liberate by means of their characteristics.

original: rnam par thar pa brgyad ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa brgyad ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The eight liberations are as follows:

original: gzugs can gzugs rnams la lta ba ni rnam par thar pa dang po'o //üîΩnang gzugs su 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi @318a * //
analyzed: gzugs can gzugs rnams la lta ba ni rnam par thar pa dang po'o // nang gzugs su 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi @318a * //
translated: The first liberation is the perception of form by one who has form.

original: gzugs rnams la lta ba zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs rnams la lta ba zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: The second is the perception of external forms by one who has the perception of form internally.

original: sdug pa'i rnam par thar pa bsam gtan bzhi pa'i bdag nyid can ni gsum pa'o //
analyzed: sdug pa'i rnam par thar pa bsam gtan bzhi pa'i bdag nyid can ni gsum pa'o //
translated: The third is the liberation of beauty, which is the fourth meditative absorption.

original: gzugs med pa bzhi ni ji skad bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gzugs med pa bzhi ni ji skad bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: The four formless states are as explained above.

original: 'du shes dang / tshor ba 'gog pa ni brgyad pa ste /
analyzed: 'du shes dang / tshor ba 'gog pa ni brgyad pa ste /
translated: The eighth is the cessation of ideation and sensation.

original: rnam par thar pa 'di dag ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgrib pa las grol bar byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa 'di dag ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgrib pa las grol bar byed pa'i phyir /
translated: These emancipations liberate one from the obscurations to meditative attainment.

original: rnam par grol bar byed pa'i mtshan nyid can no //üîΩstobs rnams shin tu rnam par ni //
analyzed: rnam par grol bar byed pa'i mtshan nyid can no // stobs rnams shin tu rnam par ni //
translated: These liberations are characterized by liberation, because they liberate from the obscurations to meditative concentration.

original: gtan la 'bebs pa'i rang bzhin gsungs //
analyzed: gtan la 'bebs pa'i rang bzhin gsungs //
translated: The powers are said to have the nature of complete nondoubting.

original: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i stobs bcu ni shin tu gtan la 'bebs pa'i mtshan nyid can du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i stobs bcu ni shin tu gtan la 'bebs pa'i mtshan nyid can du rig par bya ste /
translated: The ten powers of the Tathagata, which will be explained, should be understood as having the nature of complete nondoubting.

original: shin tu rnam par gtan la 'bebs pa nyid kyis thogs pa med pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir na stobs rnams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par gtan la 'bebs pa nyid kyis thogs pa med pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir na stobs rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called powers because they have the nature of unhinderedness due to their complete nondoubting.

original: skyob pa'i mi 'jigs pa rnams ni //
analyzed: skyob pa'i mi 'jigs pa rnams ni //
translated: The four forms of fearlessness of the Protector

original: shin tu brtan pa'i ngo bo yin //
analyzed: shin tu brtan pa'i ngo bo yin //
translated: have the nature of complete firmness.

original: mi 'jigs pa ni bzhi yin te //
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa ni bzhi yin te //
translated: There are four forms of fearlessness:

original: 'di lta ste /üîΩnga yang dag par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so zhes dam bcas na /
analyzed: 'di lta ste / nga yang dag par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so zhes dam bcas na /
translated: The first is the fearlessness to proclaim:üîΩ‚ÄúI am perfectly enlightened with regard to all dharmas.‚Äù

original: kye ma de la chos 'di rnams mngon par rdzogs par sangs ma rgyas so zhes dge sbyong ngam /
analyzed: kye ma de la chos 'di rnams mngon par rdzogs par sangs ma rgyas so zhes dge sbyong ngam /
translated: If someone were to say: ‚ÄúYou are not perfectly enlightened with regard to these dharmas,‚Äù

original: bram ze'am / lha'am /
analyzed: bram ze'am / lha'am /
translated: a Brahmin, a god,

original: bdud dam / tshangs pa'am su yang rung ste /
analyzed: bdud dam / tshangs pa'am su yang rung ste /
translated: a demon, Brahma, or anyone else.

original: 'jig rten na chos dang mthun par bdag la rgol lo snyam pa'i rgyu yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste zhes rgyas par 'byung zhing /
analyzed: 'jig rten na chos dang mthun par bdag la rgol lo snyam pa'i rgyu yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste zhes rgyas par 'byung zhing /
translated: I do not see any reason to think that anyone in the world could legitimately dispute me about this.

original: kye ma de zag pa zad do zhes dam bcas na /
analyzed: kye ma de zag pa zad do zhes dam bcas na /
translated: If I were to say, ‚ÄúI have exhausted the defilements,‚ÄùüîΩthen someone might say to me, ‚ÄúHey, you,

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la ca co'am rjes su ca co med do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la ca co'am rjes su ca co med do //

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni 'jig rten gang dang yang rtsod pa ma yin te /

analyzed: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa la ca co med do //

analyzed: du sems can thams cad kyi ca co thams cad spang ba'i phyir chos ston te /
translated: in the same way he teaches the Dharma so that all idle talk of all sentient beings may be abandoned.

original: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i las bcu drug pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i las bcu drug pa'o //
translated: This is the sixteenth tathƒÅgata activity of the tathƒÅgatas.

original: 'di sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: 'di sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: This is the second of the buddhadharmas that are not shared by others.

original: rigs kyi bu gzhan yang bsnyel ba gang gis chos gang la yang rmongs par 'gyur ba'i bsnyel ba de bzhin gshegs pa la med do //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu gzhan yang bsnyel ba gang gis chos gang la yang rmongs par 'gyur ba'i bsnyel ba de bzhin gshegs pa la med do //
translated: ‚ÄúMoreover, son of noble family, the TathƒÅgata has no forgetfulness that would cause him to be confused about any phenomenon.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni bsam gtan dang rnam par thar pa dang ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa thams cad la bsnyel ba med do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni bsam gtan dang rnam par thar pa dang ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa thams cad la bsnyel ba med do //
translated: The TathƒÅgata is not forgetful with regard to any of the meditative concentrations, liberations, samƒÅdhis, or samƒÅpattis.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi spyod pa dang g-yo ba la rnam par lta zhing so so ci rigs par chos ston pa la bsnyel ba med do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi spyod pa dang g-yo ba la rnam par lta zhing so so ci rigs par chos ston pa la bsnyel ba med do //
translated: The Tathagata looks at the mental activity and movements of all sentient beings and teaches the Dharma to each one as is appropriate, without forgetting anything.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni don dang chos dang nges pa'i tshig dang spobs ba so so yang dag par rig pa rnams la bsnyel ba med do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni don dang chos dang nges pa'i tshig dang spobs ba so so yang dag par rig pa rnams la bsnyel ba med do //
translated: The Tathagata does not forget the analytical knowledges of meaning, Dharma, language, and confidence.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba la chags pa med pa'i ye shes mthong ba la bsnyel ba med do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba la chags pa med pa'i ye shes mthong ba la bsnyel ba med do //
translated: The Tathagata does not forget the vision of wisdom that is unimpeded with regard to the past, future, and present.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ji ltar bdag la bsnyel ba med pa de ltar sems can thams cad brjed par mi 'gyur bar chos ston te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ji ltar bdag la bsnyel ba med pa de ltar sems can thams cad brjed par mi 'gyur bar chos ston te /
translated: Just as the Tathagata does not forget himself, he teaches the Dharma to all sentient beings so that they will not forget anything.

original: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i las bcu bdun pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i las bcu bdun pa'o //
translated: This is the seventeenth Tathagata activity of the Tathagatas.

original: 'di sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa ni gsum pa'o //
analyzed: 'di sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa ni gsum pa'o //
translated: This is the third of the Buddha qualities that are not shared.

original: rigs kyi bu gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa la sems mnyam par ma bzhag pa med do /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa la sems mnyam par ma bzhag pa med do /
translated: Son of noble family, moreover, there is no time when the TathƒÅgata is not in meditative equipoise.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni 'chag gam zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni 'chag gam zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: The TathƒÅgata is said to be in meditative equipoise when walking, and so on.

original: rtag tu mnyam par bzhag pa'i ting nge 'dzin zab mo'i mchog thob pa sgrib pa med pa'i bsam gtan la bsam gtan byed pa ste /
analyzed: rtag tu mnyam par bzhag pa'i ting nge 'dzin zab mo'i mchog thob pa sgrib pa med pa'i bsam gtan la bsam gtan byed pa ste /
translated: He has attained the supreme, profound meditative concentration of constant meditative equipoise, and he meditates in meditative concentration free of obscurations.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs ma gtogs par sems can gyi ris na sems can gang mnyam par bzhag kyang rung mnyam par ma bzhag kyang rung ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs ma gtogs par sems can gyi ris na sems can gang mnyam par bzhag kyang rung mnyam par ma bzhag kyang rung ste /
translated: Except for the TathƒÅgata‚Äôs own blessing, there is no sentient being in the realms of sentient beings who, whether in meditative equipoise or not,

original: su yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sems la blta bar nus pa med do //
analyzed: su yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sems la blta bar nus pa med do //
translated: could look at the TathƒÅgata‚Äôs mind.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ji ltar rtag tu mnyam par bzhag pa de ltar sems can rnams la chos ston te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ji ltar rtag tu mnyam par bzhag pa de ltar sems can rnams la chos ston te /
translated: The TathƒÅgata teaches the Dharma to sentient beings in such a way that he is always in meditative equipoise.

original: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i las bco brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i las bco brgyad pa'o //
translated: This is the eighteenth tathƒÅgata activity of the TathƒÅgata.

original: 'di sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa ni bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: 'di sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa ni bzhi pa'o //
translated: This is the fourth of the buddhas‚Äô unique qualities.

original: rigs kyi bu gzhan yang tha dad pa'i 'du shes gang gis sems mi mnyam par gnas @320b par 'gyur pa'i tha dad pa'i 'du shes de bzhin gshegs pa la med do //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu gzhan yang tha dad pa'i 'du shes gang gis sems mi mnyam par gnas @320b par 'gyur pa'i tha dad pa'i 'du shes de bzhin gshegs pa la med do //
translated: ‚ÄúMoreover, son of noble family, the TathƒÅgata does not have the notion of difference that causes the mind to be uneven.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: nam mkha' bzhin du zhing mi zad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nam mkha' bzhin du zhing mi zad pa'i phyir /
translated: Because, like space, the field is inexhaustible.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa zhing rnams la tha dad pa'i 'du shes med do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa zhing rnams la tha dad pa'i 'du shes med do //
translated: The TathƒÅgata does not have the notion of difference with regard to fields.

original: rang bzhin gyis bdag med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis bdag med pa'i phyir /

original: de bzhin gshegs pa sems can rnams la'ang tha dad pa'i 'du shes pa med do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa sems can rnams la'ang tha dad pa'i 'du shes pa med do //

original: chos kyi dbyings 'dres pa med cing mnyam pa nyid du shes pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings 'dres pa med cing mnyam pa nyid du shes pa'i phyir /
translated: Because of the knowledge of the unmixed and uniform dharmadhƒÅtu,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa sangs rgyas rnams la tha dad pa'i 'du shes med do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa sangs rgyas rnams la tha dad pa'i 'du shes med do //
translated: the TathƒÅgata does not have the notion of difference with regard to buddhas.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i chos nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i chos nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Because of the nature of being free from desire,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa chos rnams la tha dad pa'i 'du shes med do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa chos rnams la tha dad pa'i 'du shes med do //
translated: the TathƒÅgata does not have the notion of difference with regard to phenomena.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni tshul khrims dang ldan pa rnams la rjes su chags pa med /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni tshul khrims dang ldan pa rnams la rjes su chags pa med /
translated: The TathƒÅgata is not attached to those who have moral discipline.

original: ngang tshul ngan pa can rnams la khong khro ba med /
analyzed: ngang tshul ngan pa can rnams la khong khro ba med /

original: phan btags pa rnams la lan du phan 'dogs pa med /
analyzed: phan btags pa rnams la lan du phan 'dogs pa med /

original: gnod pa byas pa rnams la lan du gnod pa byed pa med /
analyzed: gnod pa byas pa rnams la lan du gnod pa byed pa med /

original: gdul bar 'os pa rnams la ri mor ma yin /
analyzed: gdul bar 'os pa rnams la ri mor ma yin /

original: log par nges pa rnams la smod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: log par nges pa rnams la smod pa ma yin gyi /

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni chos thams cad la mnyam pa nyid du gnas pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni chos thams cad la mnyam pa nyid du gnas pa ste /

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ste /
