original: 'di sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa ni lnga pa'o //
analyzed: 'di sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa ni lnga pa'o //
translated: This is the fifth of the Buddha‚Äôs unique qualities.

original: rigs kyi bu gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa la so sor ma brtags pa'i btang snyoms med do //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa la so sor ma brtags pa'i btang snyoms med do //
translated: ‚ÄúSon of noble family, moreover, the TathƒÅgata does not have a non-discerning equanimity.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i btang snyoms ni lam bsgoms pa yin gyi lam ma bsgoms pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i btang snyoms ni lam bsgoms pa yin gyi lam ma bsgoms pa ma yin te /
translated: The TathƒÅgata‚Äôs equanimity is cultivated on the path, not on a path that is not cultivated.

original: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i btang snyoms ni shes rab bsgoms pa yin gyi ma bsgoms pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i btang snyoms ni shes rab bsgoms pa yin gyi ma bsgoms pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Likewise, the equanimity of the TathƒÅgata is cultivated wisdom, not uncultivated wisdom.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i btang snyoms ni ye shes dang ldan pa yin pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa yin gyi 'jig rten par ltung ba ma yin no zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i btang snyoms ni ye shes dang ldan pa yin pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa yin gyi 'jig rten par ltung ba ma yin no zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The equanimity of the TathƒÅgata is endowed with wisdom, is supramundane, and does not fall into the mundane.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni btang snyoms chen po de lta bu phun sum tshogs pa /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni btang snyoms chen po de lta bu phun sum tshogs pa /
translated: The TathƒÅgata is endowed with such great equanimity.

original: sems can rnams la btang snyoms de lta bu yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir chos ston te /
analyzed: sems can rnams la btang snyoms de lta bu yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir chos ston te /
translated: He teaches the Dharma in order to perfect such equanimity for sentient beings.

original: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i las nyi shu pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i las nyi shu pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du 'byung ste /
translated: This is the twentieth deed of a tathƒÅgata.

original: 'di sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa ni drug pa'o //
analyzed: 'di sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa ni drug pa'o //
translated: This is the sixth of the buddhas‚Äô unique qualities.

original: rigs kyi bu gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'dun pa nyams pa med pa'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'dun pa nyams pa med pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúMoreover, son of noble family, the TathƒÅgata‚Äôs aspiration is unimpaired.

original: @321a * // de la 'dun pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: @321a * // de la 'dun pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is aspiration?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa'o //
translated: Aspiration for virtuous qualities.

original: de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: byams pa chen po la de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'dun pa nyams pa med do //
analyzed: byams pa chen po la de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'dun pa nyams pa med do //
translated: The TathƒÅgata‚Äôs aspiration for great love is never impaired.

original: de bzhin du snying rje chen po dang / chos ston pa dang / sems can 'dul ba dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang / rab tu dben pa dang / sems can byang chub yang dag par 'dzin du bcug pa la 'dun pa nyams pa med do //
analyzed: de bzhin du snying rje chen po dang / chos ston pa dang / sems can 'dul ba dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang / rab tu dben pa dang / sems can byang chub yang dag par 'dzin du bcug pa la 'dun pa nyams pa med do //
translated: Similarly, his aspiration for great compassion, for teaching the Dharma, for disciplining sentient beings, for bringing sentient beings to maturity, for solitude, and for causing sentient beings to take up awakening is never impaired.

original: dkon mchog gsum gyi rigs rgyun mi gcod pa la 'dun pa nyams pa med do //
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum gyi rigs rgyun mi gcod pa la 'dun pa nyams pa med do //
translated: His aspiration for not interrupting the lineage of the Three Jewels is never impaired.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni 'dun pas 'gro ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni 'dun pas 'gro ba ma yin gyi /
translated: The TathƒÅgata does not go by aspiration,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'dun pa ni ye shes sngon du 'gro ba nyid de de'i phyir zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'dun pa ni ye shes sngon du 'gro ba nyid de de'i phyir zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: but the TathƒÅgata‚Äôs aspiration is preceded by wisdom.

original: 'di sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa ni bdun pa'o //
analyzed: 'di sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa ni bdun pa'o //
translated: This is the seventh of the Buddha‚Äôs unique qualities.

original: rigs kyi bu gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i brtson 'grus nyams pa med do //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i brtson 'grus nyams pa med do //
translated: ‚ÄúSon of noble family, moreover, the TathƒÅgata‚Äôs diligence is never impaired.

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i brtson 'grus ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i brtson 'grus ni 'di yin te /
translated: The TathƒÅgata‚Äôs effort is as follows:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: namely,

original: 'dul ba'i sems can rnams yal bar mi 'dor ba'i brtson 'grus dang / chos nyan pa rnams la brnyas pa med pa'i brtson 'grus so //
analyzed: 'dul ba'i sems can rnams yal bar mi 'dor ba'i brtson 'grus dang / chos nyan pa rnams la brnyas pa med pa'i brtson 'grus so //
translated: the effort not to abandon sentient beings who are to be disciplined, and the effort not to despise those who listen to the Dharma.

original: gal te de bzhin gshegs pas chos kyi snod chos nyan pa gang bskal bar yang chos nyan pas skyo bar mi 'gyur ba rnyed na de bzhin gshegs pa yang chos ston zhing kha zas dang bral ba'i rgyud du gyur kyang bskal bar yang mi ldang ngo //
analyzed: gal te de bzhin gshegs pas chos kyi snod chos nyan pa gang bskal bar yang chos nyan pas skyo bar mi 'gyur ba rnyed na de bzhin gshegs pa yang chos ston zhing kha zas dang bral ba'i rgyud du gyur kyang bskal bar yang mi ldang ngo //
translated: If the TathƒÅgata finds someone who is a vessel for the Dharma, who listens to the Dharma, and who would not be discouraged even if he had to listen to the Dharma for an eon, then the TathƒÅgata would teach the Dharma to him, even if he had to remain in the same place for an eon.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni sems can la lta bas tha na gang na sangs rgyas kyis 'dul ba'i sems can gcig gi phyir yang sangs rgyas kyi zhing gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyid 'da' zhing 'gro ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni sems can la lta bas tha na gang na sangs rgyas kyis 'dul ba'i sems can gcig gi phyir yang sangs rgyas kyi zhing gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyid 'da' zhing 'gro ste /
translated: The TathƒÅgata, looking out for sentient beings, would go to a buddhafield that lay beyond as many buddhafields as there are sands in the Ganges River, even for the sake of a single sentient being who was to be disciplined by a buddha.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i lus ngal ba'am /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i lus ngal ba'am /
translated: The TathƒÅgata would not be physically tired,

original: ngag ngal ba'am sems ngal ba med do //
analyzed: ngag ngal ba'am sems ngal ba med do //
translated: nor would he be verbally or mentally tired.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni sems shin tu sbyangs pa brtson 'grus brtsams pa brtson 'grus kyi bsngags pa smra ba ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni sems shin tu sbyangs pa brtson 'grus brtsams pa brtson 'grus kyi bsngags pa smra ba ste /
translated: The TathƒÅgata has a well-purified mind, he has undertaken striving, and he praises striving.

original: yang dag par sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus gang gis sems can rnams 'phags pa'i rnam par grol ba thob par 'gyur ba'i brtson 'grus de sems can rnams la bsngags pa byed de zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: yang dag par sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus gang gis sems can rnams 'phags pa'i rnam par grol ba thob par 'gyur ba'i brtson 'grus de sems can rnams la bsngags pa byed de zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ste /
translated: He praises for sentient beings that striving by which they will attain the noble liberation of sentient beings.

original: 'di sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa ni brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: 'di sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa ni brgyad pa'o //
translated: This is the eighth of the Buddha‚Äôs unique qualities.

original: rigs kyi bu gzhan yang de bzhin @321b gshegs pa'i dran pa ni yong ye nyams pa med do //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu gzhan yang de bzhin @321b gshegs pa'i dran pa ni yong ye nyams pa med do //
translated: ‚ÄúMoreover, son of noble family, the TathƒÅgata‚Äôs mindfulness is never impaired.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la bsnyel ba med do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la bsnyel ba med do //
translated: The TathƒÅgata has no forgetfulness.

original: rigs kyi bu de bzhin gshegs pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas ma thag tu 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sems can rnams kyi sems kyi rgyud la rnam par bltas kyang de bzhin gshegs pa la bsnyel ba shin tu med do //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu de bzhin gshegs pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas ma thag tu 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sems can rnams kyi sems kyi rgyud la rnam par bltas kyang de bzhin gshegs pa la bsnyel ba shin tu med do //
translated: Son of noble family, as soon as the TathƒÅgata fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood, he looked at the mind-streams of sentient beings of the past, future, and present, and the TathƒÅgata did not have the slightest forgetfulness.

original: sems can gyi spyod pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes kyang de la de bzhin gshegs pas ye shes gtong ba yang med do //
analyzed: sems can gyi spyod pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes kyang de la de bzhin gshegs pas ye shes gtong ba yang med do //
translated: Even though he knew the conduct of sentient beings just as it is, the TathƒÅgata did not have any loss of wisdom.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas ni phung po gsum du rnam par dgod pa dang / sems can gyi dbang po la 'jug pa dang / sems can gyi bsam pa la 'jug pa dang / sems can gyi spyod pa la rnam par lta bas dran pa nyams pa med de /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas ni phung po gsum du rnam par dgod pa dang / sems can gyi dbang po la 'jug pa dang / sems can gyi bsam pa la 'jug pa dang / sems can gyi spyod pa la rnam par lta bas dran pa nyams pa med de /
translated: The TathƒÅgata did not have any loss of mindfulness due to the arrangement of the three heaps, the engagement with the faculties of sentient beings, the engagement with the thoughts of sentient beings, and the observation of the conduct of sentient beings.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni dran par byas sam bsams sam rnam par brtags te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni dran par byas sam bsams sam rnam par brtags te /
translated: The TathƒÅgata did not have any loss of mindfulness due to being mindful, thinking, or investigating.

original: sems can rnams la chos ston pa med do //
analyzed: sems can rnams la chos ston pa med do //
translated: They do not teach the Dharma to sentient beings.

original: ston kyang nyams pa med do //
analyzed: ston kyang nyams pa med do //
translated: Even if they do teach, there is no decline.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i dran pa ni ji ltar yang nyams pa med do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i dran pa ni ji ltar yang nyams pa med do //
translated: The mindfulness of the TathƒÅgatas never declines in any way.

original: de ji ltar bdag ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: de ji ltar bdag ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: How is that?

original: 'di sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa ni dgu pa'o //
analyzed: 'di sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa ni dgu pa'o //

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang yin pa de ni chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid dang mi mnyam pa ma yin pa dang / ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang yin pa de ni chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid dang mi mnyam pa ma yin pa dang / ji lta ba bzhin no //

original: ci'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i ting nge 'dzin nyams par mi 'gyur zhe na /üîΩde bzhin nyid gang dang mnyam pa de dang ting nge 'dzin mnyam mo //
analyzed: ci'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i ting nge 'dzin nyams par mi 'gyur zhe na / de bzhin nyid gang dang mnyam pa de dang ting nge 'dzin mnyam mo //
translated: Why does the TathƒÅgata‚Äôs samƒÅdhi not decline?üîΩThat which is the sameness of suchness is the sameness of samƒÅdhi.

original: ting nge 'dzin gang dang mnyam pa de dang de bzhin gshegs pa mnyam pa ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gang dang mnyam pa de dang de bzhin gshegs pa mnyam pa ste /

original: de'i phyir mnyam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir mnyam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba nas /

original: khams gsum char la yang mi gnas pa'i phyir nyams pa med de /
analyzed: khams gsum char la yang mi gnas pa'i phyir nyams pa med de /
translated: ‚Äù Since it does not dwell in any of the three realms, it is not subject to loss.

analyzed: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i ting nge 'dzin nyams pa med ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called ‚Äúthe TathƒÅgata‚Äôs samƒÅdhi that is not subject to loss.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa sems can thams cad kyang ting nge 'dzin thob par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bar du 'byung ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa sems can thams cad kyang ting nge 'dzin thob par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bar du 'byung ste /
translated: ‚Äù The TathƒÅgata also teaches the Dharma to all sentient beings so that they may attain samƒÅdhi.

original: 'di sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa ni bcu pa'o //üîΩrigs kyi bu gzhan yang de bzhin @322a * //
analyzed: 'di sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa ni bcu pa'o // rigs kyi bu gzhan yang de bzhin @322a * //
translated: This is the tenth of the buddhas‚Äô unique qualities.

original: gshegs pa'i shes rab nyams pa med do //
analyzed: gshegs pa'i shes rab nyams pa med do //
translated: ‚ÄúMoreover, son of noble family, the TathƒÅgata‚Äôs wisdom is not subject to loss.

original: shes rab gang zhe na /
analyzed: shes rab gang zhe na /
translated: What is wisdom?

original: gang chos thams cad rab tu shes pa ste gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: gang chos thams cad rab tu shes pa ste gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: It is the knowledge of all phenomena, the knowledge that does not rely on others,

original: sems can gzhan dag dang / gang zag gzhan rnams la chos yang dag par ston pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: sems can gzhan dag dang / gang zag gzhan rnams la chos yang dag par ston pa'i shes pa'o //

original: so so yang dag par rig pa la mkhas pas tshig rab tu dbye ba shes pa'o //
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa la mkhas pas tshig rab tu dbye ba shes pa'o //
translated: and the knowledge that understands the divisions of words through skill in the correct discerning awareness.

original: tshig gcig la 'jug pas bskal pa brgya stong du gnas shing ston pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: tshig gcig la 'jug pas bskal pa brgya stong du gnas shing ston pa shes pa'o //

original: ji ltar dris pa bzhin du the tshom gcod pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar dris pa bzhin du the tshom gcod pa'i shes pa'o //

original: thams cad du chags pa med pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad du chags pa med pa'i shes pa'o //

original: theg pa gsum rnam par dgod par bstan pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa gsum rnam par dgod par bstan pa shes pa'o //

analyzed: sems can gyi sems kyi spyod pa brgyad khri bzhi stong du yongs su shes pa'i shes pa'o //

original: chos kyi phung po brgyad khri bzhi stong so so ci rigs par ston pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi phung po brgyad khri bzhi stong so so ci rigs par ston pa shes pa'o //

original: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i shes rab mtha' yas pa thug pa med pa zad pa med pa tshad med pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i shes rab mtha' yas pa thug pa med pa zad pa med pa tshad med pa bstan pa'o //

original: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa la nyams pa med pa de ltar sems can thams cad kyang shes rab mi zad par bya ba'i phyir chos ston te /
analyzed: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa la nyams pa med pa de ltar sems can thams cad kyang shes rab mi zad par bya ba'i phyir chos ston te /
translated: Just as the tathƒÅgatas are without decline, so they teach the Dharma to all sentient beings so that their wisdom may be inexhaustible.

original: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i las nyi shu rtsa lnga pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i las nyi shu rtsa lnga pa'o //

original: 'di sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa ni bcu gcig pa'o //
analyzed: 'di sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa ni bcu gcig pa'o //

original: rigs kyi bu gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par grol ba nyams pa med do //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par grol ba nyams pa med do //

original: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i las nyi shu rtsa dgu pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i las nyi shu rtsa dgu pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du 'byung ste /

translated: This is the fifteenth of the Buddha‚Äôs unique qualities.

translated: He knows by calculation the arising and perishing of the buddha-fields of the past.

analyzed: de dag na rtsva dang shing gel ba dang / sman dang nags tshal du gyur pa de dag thams cad kyang rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows all the grasses, trees, medicinal herbs, and forests that have existed there.

original: de dag na sems can gyi tshogs sems can du btags par gyur pa ji snyed pa dang / sangs rgyas 'byung ba ji snyed pa dang ; sangs rgyas re res chos bstan zhing brjod pa ji snyed pa dang / ji snyed cig nyan thos kyi theg pa la btul ba dang /
analyzed: de dag na sems can gyi tshogs sems can du btags par gyur pa ji snyed pa dang / sangs rgyas 'byung ba ji snyed pa dang ; sangs rgyas re res chos bstan zhing brjod pa ji snyed pa dang / ji snyed cig nyan thos kyi theg pa la btul ba dang /
translated: He knows all the various kinds of beings that have existed there, all the buddhas that have appeared there, all the teachings and expressions of the Dharma by those buddhas, all the disciples who have been trained in the vehicle of the disciples,

original: ji snyed cig theg pa chen po la btul ba de dag thams cad rab tu shes so zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung zhing sems kyi rgyud kyang rab tu shes so //
analyzed: ji snyed cig theg pa chen po la btul ba de dag thams cad rab tu shes so zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung zhing sems kyi rgyud kyang rab tu shes so //

original: sems gang gi 'og tu sems gang byung ba de thams cad kyang bgrang ba'i tshul gyis rab tu shes te /
analyzed: sems gang gi 'og tu sems gang byung ba de thams cad kyang bgrang ba'i tshul gyis rab tu shes te /
translated: He knows all the mental processes, and he knows the order in which one mind follows another.

original: de yang mngon sum gyi shes pa dang rjes su 'gro ba'i shes pas so //
analyzed: de yang mngon sum gyi shes pa dang rjes su 'gro ba'i shes pas so //
translated: He knows them by direct knowledge and by inference.

original: de yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sems kyi rgyud 'das pa btang ba rnams kyang dmigs so //
analyzed: de yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sems kyi rgyud 'das pa btang ba rnams kyang dmigs so //
translated: He also knows the mental processes of the past and future Tathagatas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni ye shes de lta bu dang ldan pas sems can rnams la phyad par chos ston to zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni ye shes de lta bu dang ldan pas sems can rnams la phyad par chos ston to zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ste /
translated: The Tathagata, possessing such knowledge, teaches the Dharma to beings.

original: 'di sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa ni bcu drug pa'o //
analyzed: 'di sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa ni bcu drug pa'o //
translated: This is the sixteenth of the Buddha‚Äôs powers.

original: rigs kyi bu gzhan yang ma 'ongs pa'i dus la de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes mthong ba chags pa med cing thogs pa med par 'jug @323b go ;
analyzed: rigs kyi bu gzhan yang ma 'ongs pa'i dus la de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes mthong ba chags pa med cing thogs pa med par 'jug @323b go ;
translated: Son of noble family, moreover, the TathƒÅgata‚Äôs wisdom vision extends to the future without impediment or obstruction.

original: / sems can nam chos sam zhing gang dag cig ma 'ongs pa na 'byung bar 'gyur ba'am 'jig par 'gyur ba de dag thams cad de bzhin gshegs pas rab tu shes so zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung zhing /
analyzed: / sems can nam chos sam zhing gang dag cig ma 'ongs pa na 'byung bar 'gyur ba'am 'jig par 'gyur ba de dag thams cad de bzhin gshegs pas rab tu shes so zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung zhing /
translated: Whatever sentient beings, phenomena, or realms will arise or perish in the future, the TathƒÅgata knows them all.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i sems kyi rgyud bskal par 'gyur ba ma yin par ma 'ongs pa la lta bas sems can rnams la chos ston to zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i sems kyi rgyud bskal par 'gyur ba ma yin par ma 'ongs pa la lta bas sems can rnams la chos ston to zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
translated: And, ‚ÄúThe TathƒÅgata teaches the Dharma to sentient beings by seeing the future without the mind-stream of the future becoming a kalpa.‚Äù

original: 'di sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa ni bcu bdun pa'o //
analyzed: 'di sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa ni bcu bdun pa'o //
translated: This is the seventeenth of the buddhas‚Äô unique qualities.

original: rigs kyi bu gzhan yang da ltar byung ba'i dus la de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes mthong ba chags pa med cing thogs pa med par 'jug go //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu gzhan yang da ltar byung ba'i dus la de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes mthong ba chags pa med cing thogs pa med par 'jug go //
translated: Son of noble family, moreover, the TathƒÅgata‚Äôs wisdom vision extends to the present without impediment or obstruction.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas phyogs bcu dag na da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad bgrang ba'i tshul gyis rab tu shes so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas phyogs bcu dag na da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad bgrang ba'i tshul gyis rab tu shes so //
translated: The Tathagata knows by means of calculation all the present Buddha-fields in the ten directions.

original: da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas thams cad rab tu shes so //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas thams cad rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows all the present Buddhas,

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad nas dngos po thams cad dang / sa'i khams rdul phra rab kyi rdul gyi char brlags pa thams cad kyi bar du bgrang ba'i tshul gyis rab tu shes shing //
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad nas dngos po thams cad dang / sa'i khams rdul phra rab kyi rdul gyi char brlags pa thams cad kyi bar du bgrang ba'i tshul gyis rab tu shes shing //
translated: and likewise all the Bodhisattvas, all the Sravakas and Pratyekabuddhas, and all things, down to the smallest particles of dust on the earth.

original: de bzhin du chu'i khams sgra'i rtse mos blangs pa bgrang ba'i tshul dang / me'i khams kyi skye ba dang 'gag pa bgrang ba'i tshul dang / rlung gi khams thams cad gzugs su gyur pa la bab pa'i tshul dang / nam mkha'i khams thams cad skra'i rtse mos rgyas par dgang pa'i tshul gyi bar gyis rab tu shes so //
analyzed: de bzhin du chu'i khams sgra'i rtse mos blangs pa bgrang ba'i tshul dang / me'i khams kyi skye ba dang 'gag pa bgrang ba'i tshul dang / rlung gi khams thams cad gzugs su gyur pa la bab pa'i tshul dang / nam mkha'i khams thams cad skra'i rtse mos rgyas par dgang pa'i tshul gyi bar gyis rab tu shes so //
translated: In the same way, he knows the water element by the method of counting the tips of the sounds, the fire element by the method of counting the arising and ceasing, the wind element by the method of the falling of all forms, and the space element by the method of filling all with the tip of a hair.

original: de bzhin du sems can dmyal ba la sogs pa'i 'gro bar skyes pa'i sems can gyi khams dang / de bzhin du da ltar byung ba'i lha'i sems can gyi khams kyang rab tu shes so zhes rgya cher sbyar bar bya zhing /
analyzed: de bzhin du sems can dmyal ba la sogs pa'i 'gro bar skyes pa'i sems can gyi khams dang / de bzhin du da ltar byung ba'i lha'i sems can gyi khams kyang rab tu shes so zhes rgya cher sbyar bar bya zhing /
translated: In the same way, he knows the element of sentient beings born in the realms of hell and so on, and in the same way, he knows the element of sentient beings who are presently gods.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la ni gnyis kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i rnam par shes pa med cing gnyis su med pa la gzud pa'i phyir sems can rnams la chos kyang ston te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la ni gnyis kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i rnam par shes pa med cing gnyis su med pa la gzud pa'i phyir sems can rnams la chos kyang ston te /
translated: The TathƒÅgata does not have consciousness that follows the two, and he teaches the Dharma to sentient beings in order to introduce them to the nondual.

original: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i las sum cu rtsa gnyis pa'o zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i las sum cu rtsa gnyis pa'o zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
translated: This is the thirty-second Tathagata activity of the Tathagata.

original: 'di sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa ni bco brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: 'di sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa ni bco brgyad pa'o //
translated: This is the eighteenth of the unshared qualities of the Buddha.

original: rnam kun mkhyen nyid ye shes ni //
analyzed: rnam kun mkhyen nyid ye shes ni //
translated: The knowledge of all things in all aspects

original: mngon sum mtshan nyid can du 'dod //üîΩgzhan @324a * //üîΩni nyi tshe ba nyid kyis //
analyzed: mngon sum mtshan nyid can du 'dod // gzhan @324a * // ni nyi tshe ba nyid kyis //
translated: is accepted as having the nature of direct perception.üîΩThe others are not called direct perception

original: mngon sum zhes byar mi 'dod do //
analyzed: mngon sum zhes byar mi 'dod do //
translated: because they are limited.üîΩThe characteristics of the conditioned

original: gang zhig 'dus byas mtshan nyid dang // 'dus ma byas kyi mtshan nyid gang //üîΩde de kho nas stong pa nyid //
analyzed: gang zhig 'dus byas mtshan nyid dang // 'dus ma byas kyi mtshan nyid gang // de de kho nas stong pa nyid //
translated: and the characteristics of the unconditionedüîΩare empty of their own intrinsic reality.

original: de ni rang mtshan stong pa nyid //
analyzed: de ni rang mtshan stong pa nyid //
translated: This is the emptiness of own-characteristics.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid bshad zin to //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid bshad zin to //
translated: The emptiness of own-characteristics has been explained.

original: da ltar ba 'di mi gnas shing //
analyzed: da ltar ba 'di mi gnas shing //
translated: The present does not endure;

original: 'das dang ma 'ongs yod ma yin //
analyzed: 'das dang ma 'ongs yod ma yin //
translated: the past and future do not exist.

original: gang du de dag mi dmigs pa //
analyzed: gang du de dag mi dmigs pa //
translated: Where they are not apprehended,

original: de la mi dmigs pa zhes brjod //
analyzed: de la mi dmigs pa zhes brjod //
translated: that is called non-apprehension.üîΩThat non-apprehension

original: mi dmigs pa de rang ngo bo //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa de rang ngo bo //
translated: is empty of its own intrinsic reality.

original: de yis dben pa nyid gang de //
analyzed: de yis dben pa nyid gang de //
translated: That emptinessüîΩis the emptiness of non-apprehension.

original: ther zug gnas min 'jig min pas //
analyzed: ther zug gnas min 'jig min pas //
translated: Because they are neither permanent nor extinguished,

original: mi dmigs zhes bya'i stong nyid do //üîΩ'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa gnyis zhig pa dang ma skyes pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: mi dmigs zhes bya'i stong nyid do // 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa gnyis zhig pa dang ma skyes pa'i phyir la /
translated: the emptiness of nonapprehension.üîΩThe past and future do not exist because they have perished or are not yet born,

original: da ltar ba mi gnas pa'i phyir dus gsum char yang med do //
analyzed: da ltar ba mi gnas pa'i phyir dus gsum char yang med do //
translated: and the present does not endure.

original: de la mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni gang du dus gsum mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de la mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni gang du dus gsum mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: Nonapprehension is that in which the three times are not apprehended.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: de la ther zug tu gnas pa ma yin pa dang / 'jig pa ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir mi dmigs pa ni mi dmigs pas stong ngo //
analyzed: de la ther zug tu gnas pa ma yin pa dang / 'jig pa ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir mi dmigs pa ni mi dmigs pas stong ngo //
translated: Because they are neither permanent nor extinguished, nonapprehension is empty of nonapprehension.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: de'i rang bzhin de yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin de yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because that is their nature.

original: 'di ni mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid ces bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ni mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid ces bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: This is called the emptiness of nonapprehension.

original: rkyen las byung phyir dngos rnams la //
analyzed: rkyen las byung phyir dngos rnams la //
translated: Because things arise from conditions,

original: 'dus pa pa yi ngo bo med //
analyzed: 'dus pa pa yi ngo bo med //
translated: they do not have an inherent nature of assemblage.

original: 'dus pa pa ni de nyid kyis //
analyzed: 'dus pa pa ni de nyid kyis //
translated: The emptiness of that very assemblage

original: stong nyid dngos med stong nyid do //
analyzed: stong nyid dngos med stong nyid do //
translated: is the emptiness of the nature of nonthings.

original: 'dus pa pa ni 'dus pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'dus pa pa ni 'dus pa las byung ba'o //
translated: An assemblage is that which arises from an assemblage.

original: rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba'i phyir na 'dus pa pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba'i phyir na 'dus pa pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Because it arises from causes and conditions, the compounded does not exist.

original: ngo bo nyid ni dngos po med pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni dngos po med pa nyid yin la /
translated: The intrinsic reality is the non-existence.

original: de'i stong pa nyid ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i stong pa nyid ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid do //
translated: The emptiness of that is the emptiness of the intrinsic reality of non-existence.

original: stong pa nyid bcu drug po de dag spros pa dang bcas par bshad do //
analyzed: stong pa nyid bcu drug po de dag spros pa dang bcas par bshad do //
translated: These sixteen kinds of emptiness are explained in detail.

original: gang gzhan bzhi po de dag brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: gang gzhan bzhi po de dag brjod par bya ste /
translated: The other four should be explained.

original: dngos po'i sgras ni mdor bsdus na //
analyzed: dngos po'i sgras ni mdor bsdus na //
translated: In brief, the term ‚Äúthing‚Äù

original: phung po lnga rnams brjod pa yin //
analyzed: phung po lnga rnams brjod pa yin //
translated: refers to the five aggregates.

original: de rnams de yis stong nyid gang //
analyzed: de rnams de yis stong nyid gang //
translated: Their emptiness of themselves

original: de dngos stong pa nyid du bshad //
analyzed: de dngos stong pa nyid du bshad //
translated: is explained as the emptiness of things.

original: dngos po zhes bya ba ni phung po lnga'o //
analyzed: dngos po zhes bya ba ni phung po lnga'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThing‚Äù refers to the five aggregates.

original: dngos po ni dngos pos stong zhes bya ba ni gong ma bzhin te 'di ni dngos po stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po ni dngos pos stong zhes bya ba ni gong ma bzhin te 'di ni dngos po stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúA thing is empty of a thing‚Äù is as explained above. This is called the emptiness of things.

original: mdor bsdus na ni dngos med pa //
analyzed: mdor bsdus na ni dngos med pa //
translated: In brief, the term ‚Äúnon-thing‚Äù

original: 'dus ma byas chos rnams la brjod //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas chos rnams la brjod //
translated: refers to uncompounded phenomena.

original: de ni dngos med des stong nyid //
analyzed: de ni dngos med des stong nyid //
translated: That is empty of that non-thing.

original: dngos po med pa stong nyid do //
analyzed: dngos po med pa stong nyid do //
translated: The emptiness of non-entities.

original: dngos po med pa zhes bya ba ni 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams @324b te nam mkha' dang mya ngan las 'das pa la sogs pa dag go //
analyzed: dngos po med pa zhes bya ba ni 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams @324b te nam mkha' dang mya ngan las 'das pa la sogs pa dag go //
translated: Non-entities are uncompounded things, such as space, nirvana, etc.

original: de la dngos po med pa ni dngos po med pas stong ste /
analyzed: de la dngos po med pa ni dngos po med pas stong ste /
translated: The emptiness of that is the emptiness of non-entities.

original: 'di ni dngos po med pa stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dngos po med pa stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: This is called the emptiness of non-entities.

original: rang bzhin ngo bo nyid med ni //
analyzed: rang bzhin ngo bo nyid med ni //
translated: The emptiness of own-nature.

original: rang bzhin zhes bya'i stong nyid de //
analyzed: rang bzhin zhes bya'i stong nyid de //
translated: The emptiness of that is called the emptiness of own-nature.

original: 'di ltar rang bzhin ma byas pas //üîΩrang bzhin zhes ni bya bar bsnyad //
analyzed: 'di ltar rang bzhin ma byas pas // rang bzhin zhes ni bya bar bsnyad //
translated: Because it is not made by itself,üîΩit is called own-nature.

original: rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin la bya ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin la bya ste /
translated: Own-nature is the own-nature of things.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa rnams kyis ma byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa rnams kyis ma byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not made by the Disciples, etc.

original: rang bzhin ni rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin ni rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
translated: The own-nature of own-nature is empty of own-nature.

original: 'di ni rang bzhin stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rang bzhin stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: This is called the emptiness of own-nature.

original: sangs rgyas rnams ni byung ba'am //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams ni byung ba'am //
translated: Whether the Buddhas appear

original: ma byung yang rung dngos su ni //
analyzed: ma byung yang rung dngos su ni //
translated: or not, in reality,

original: dngos po kun gyi stong pa nyid //
analyzed: dngos po kun gyi stong pa nyid //
translated: the emptiness of all thingsüîΩis proclaimed to be the emptiness of non-entities.

original: gzhan gyi dngos por rab tu bsgrags //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dngos por rab tu bsgrags //
translated: It is proclaimed to be the ultimate reality,

original: yang dag mtha' dang de bzhin nyid //
analyzed: yang dag mtha' dang de bzhin nyid //
translated: the reality-limit, and thusness.

original: de bzhin dngos po'i stong nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin dngos po'i stong nyid do //
translated: The emptiness of that is the emptiness of the ultimate.

original: gzhan gyi dngos po ni mchog tu byung ba'i de kho na nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dngos po ni mchog tu byung ba'i de kho na nyid do //
translated: The ultimate reality is the supreme reality.

original: de'i mchog tu byung ba nyid ni rtag tu yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i mchog tu byung ba nyid ni rtag tu yod pa nyid do //
translated: Its supremacy is its eternal existence.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na gzhan gyi dngos po ni ye shes phul du byung bas rtogs par bya ba'i dngos po ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na gzhan gyi dngos po ni ye shes phul du byung bas rtogs par bya ba'i dngos po ste /
translated: Or, the ultimate reality is the object to be realized by the highest knowledge.

original: de ni de nyid kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: de ni de nyid kyis stong ngo //
translated: It is empty of that.

original: yang na pha rol na yod pa ni gzhan gyi dngos po'o //
analyzed: yang na pha rol na yod pa ni gzhan gyi dngos po'o //
translated: Or, the ultimate reality is the existence on the other side,üîΩbecause it transcends the lifecycle.

original: 'khor ba las 'das pa'i phyir gzhan gyi dngos po zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa'i mtha' ste /üîΩrnam par 'gyur ba med pas don de bzhin nyid stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid can gyi stong pa nyid ni gzhan gyi dngos po stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'khor ba las 'das pa'i phyir gzhan gyi dngos po zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa'i mtha' ste / rnam par 'gyur ba med pas don de bzhin nyid stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid can gyi stong pa nyid ni gzhan gyi dngos po stong pa nyid do //
translated: The ultimate reality is the reality-limit.üîΩThe emptiness of that is the emptiness of the ultimate.

original: shes rab pha rol phyin tshul las //
analyzed: shes rab pha rol phyin tshul las //
translated: The emptiness of the ultimate is explained in the Perfection of Wisdom

original: de dag de skad rab tu bsgrags //
analyzed: de dag de skad rab tu bsgrags //
translated: They are proclaimed in just that way.

original: da ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la lhag par mos pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi thun mong ma yin pa'i yon tan phul du byung ba brjod pa'i sgo nas shes rab kyi skabs yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: da ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la lhag par mos pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi thun mong ma yin pa'i yon tan phul du byung ba brjod pa'i sgo nas shes rab kyi skabs yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: Now, in order to completely perfect the section on wisdom by way of describing the uncommon, excellent qualities of the bodhisattvas who have superior devotion to the perfection of wisdom, it is said:

original: de ltar blo gros zer gyis snang ba gsal byas pa //
analyzed: de ltar blo gros zer gyis snang ba gsal byas pa //
translated: Thus, the light rays of intelligence illuminate

original: rang gi lag na gnas pa'i skyu ru ra bzhin du //
analyzed: rang gi lag na gnas pa'i skyu ru ra bzhin du //
translated: like a myrobalan fruit in the palm of the hand.

original: srid gsum 'di dag ma lus gdod nas skye med par //
analyzed: srid gsum 'di dag ma lus gdod nas skye med par //
translated: All three realms without exception are primordially non-arisen.

original: rtogs de tha snyad bden pa'i stobs kyis 'gog par 'gro //
analyzed: rtogs de tha snyad bden pa'i stobs kyis 'gog par 'gro //
translated: Realizing that, by the power of conventional truth, one goes to cessation.

original: de ltar gyi sgra ni ji skad bshad pa'i rnam par dpyad pa nye bar ston pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: de ltar gyi sgra ni ji skad bshad pa'i rnam par dpyad pa nye bar ston pa'i don du'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúthus‚Äù is for the purpose of teaching the analysis as it has been explained.

original: ji skad bshad pa'i rnam par dpyad pa las byung ba'i blo gros kyi 'od zer @325a * //
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i rnam par dpyad pa las byung ba'i blo gros kyi 'od zer @325a * //
translated: The light rays of intelligence that arise from the analysis as it has been explained

original: gyis de kho na nyid mthong ba la gegs byed pa'i mun pa 'joms pa'i snang ba gsal bar byas pa gang la yod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: gyis de kho na nyid mthong ba la gegs byed pa'i mun pa 'joms pa'i snang ba gsal bar byas pa gang la yod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The Bodhisattva who has this is said to be the one who has the light that destroys the darkness that obstructs the seeing of reality.

original: de ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i stobs kyis 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i stobs kyis 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: By the power of the conventional truth, he enters into the absorption of cessation.

original: 'gog pa'i ngo bos 'gro ba yongs su skyob pa'i bsam pa yongs su 'dor ba yang ma yin no zhes bshad pa /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i ngo bos 'gro ba yongs su skyob pa'i bsam pa yongs su 'dor ba yang ma yin no zhes bshad pa /
translated: And he does not abandon the intention to protect the world by the nature of cessation.

original: rtag tu 'gog par rtogs pa'i bsam ldan yin mod kyi //
analyzed: rtag tu 'gog par rtogs pa'i bsam ldan yin mod kyi //
translated: He always has the intention to realize cessation,

original: 'gro ba mgon med pa la snying rje'ang skyed par byed //
analyzed: 'gro ba mgon med pa la snying rje'ang skyed par byed //
translated: and he also generates compassion for the world that is without a protector.

original: 'di'i sbyor ba ni 'khor bar gtogs pa yin la ;
analyzed: 'di'i sbyor ba ni 'khor bar gtogs pa yin la ;
translated: His practice belongs to cyclic existence,

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa ni mya ngan las 'das par gtogs pa yin pas 'gro ba mgon med pa la 'di'i snying rje ches shin tu rnam par 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa ni mya ngan las 'das par gtogs pa yin pas 'gro ba mgon med pa la 'di'i snying rje ches shin tu rnam par 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and his superior intention belongs to nirvana. Therefore, his compassion for the world that is without a protector increases greatly.

original: de gong bde gshegs gsung skyes sangs rgyas 'bring bcas ni //
analyzed: de gong bde gshegs gsung skyes sangs rgyas 'bring bcas ni //
translated: Above that, the offspring of the Sugata, together with the middling Buddhas,

original: ma lus pa rnams blo yis pham par byed pa'ang yin ;
analyzed: ma lus pa rnams blo yis pham par byed pa'ang yin ;
translated: and all of them are defeated by the wisdom of the bodhisattva.

original: / sangs rgyas bar ma rnams dang lhan cig tu gyur pa ni sangs rgyas 'bring bcas so //
analyzed: / sangs rgyas bar ma rnams dang lhan cig tu gyur pa ni sangs rgyas 'bring bcas so //
translated: ‚ÄúTogether with the middling buddhas‚Äù means together with the middling buddhas.

original: de dag su yin zhe na /
analyzed: de dag su yin zhe na /
translated: Who are they?

original: bde bar gshegs pa'i gsung las skyes pa rnams te nyan thos rnams so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa'i gsung las skyes pa rnams te nyan thos rnams so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: They are the ‚Äúoffspring of the Sugata,‚Äù that is, the ≈õrƒÅvakas.

original: de dag thams cad kyang byang chub sems dpa'i sa drug pa de'i gong rol bdun pa la sogs par shes rab kyis pham par byed do //üîΩkun rdzob de nyid gshog yangs dkar po rgyas gyur pa //
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyang byang chub sems dpa'i sa drug pa de'i gong rol bdun pa la sogs par shes rab kyis pham par byed do // kun rdzob de nyid gshog yangs dkar po rgyas gyur pa //
translated: All of them are defeated by the wisdom of the bodhisattva on the seventh ground and above.üîΩThe king of swans, with his vast white wings of the two truths,

original: ngang pa'i rgyal po de ni skye bo'i ngang pa yis //üîΩmdun du bdar nas dge ba'i rlung gi shugs stobs kyis //
analyzed: ngang pa'i rgyal po de ni skye bo'i ngang pa yis // mdun du bdar nas dge ba'i rlung gi shugs stobs kyis //
translated: surrounded by a flock of ordinary swans,üîΩwith the power of the wind of virtue,

original: rgyal ba'i yon tan rgya mtsho'i pha rol mchog tu 'gro //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i yon tan rgya mtsho'i pha rol mchog tu 'gro //
translated: goes to the other side of the ocean of the qualities of the Victor.

original: de'i kun rdzob kyi yon tan rnams kyang ches lhag par rab tu 'bar bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i kun rdzob kyi yon tan rnams kyang ches lhag par rab tu 'bar bar 'gyur ro //
translated: His qualities of conventional truth also blaze forth.

original: gang gis na 'di skye bo'i ngang pa phul du byung ba bskyed pa rnams dang lhan cig rgyal ba'i yon tan gyi rgya mtsho chen po'i pha rol tu 'gro bar 'gyur ba bden pa gnyis po de ni 'di'i gshog pa yangs pa gnyis yin no //
analyzed: gang gis na 'di skye bo'i ngang pa phul du byung ba bskyed pa rnams dang lhan cig rgyal ba'i yon tan gyi rgya mtsho chen po'i pha rol tu 'gro bar 'gyur ba bden pa gnyis po de ni 'di'i gshog pa yangs pa gnyis yin no //
translated: By means of which, those who are the best of the flock of beings will cross to the far shore of the great ocean of the qualities of the Victor. These two truths are his two vast wings.

original: sems bskyed pa drug pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: sems bskyed pa drug pa bshad zin to //
translated: The sixth generation of the spirit of enlightenment has been explained.

original: dbu ma la 'jug pa'i bshad pa las sems bskyed pa drug pa'o /
analyzed: dbu ma la 'jug pa'i bshad pa las sems bskyed pa drug pa'o /
translated: This has been the sixth chapter of the Ornament of the MahƒÅyƒÅna S≈´tras, the ‚ÄúGeneration of the Spirit of Enlightenment.‚Äù

original: // / da ni sems bskyed pa bdun pa'i dbang du byas nas bshad pa /
analyzed: // / da ni sems bskyed pa bdun pa'i dbang du byas nas bshad pa /
translated: Now, in order to explain the seventh generation of the spirit of enlightenment, it is said:

original: rang du song ba 'dir ni skad cig dang // skad @325b cig la ni 'gog par 'jug 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: rang du song ba 'dir ni skad cig dang // skad @325b cig la ni 'gog par 'jug 'gyur zhing //
translated: In this, he enters into cessation moment by moment,

original: thabs kyi pha rol phyin legs 'bar ba thob //
analyzed: thabs kyi pha rol phyin legs 'bar ba thob //
translated: and attains the perfection of the blazing method.

original: 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug pa ni yang dag pa'i mtha' la snyoms par 'jug pa yin pas /
analyzed: 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug pa ni yang dag pa'i mtha' la snyoms par 'jug pa yin pas /
translated: The meditative equipoise on cessation is the meditative equipoise on the perfect endpoint.

original: de bzhin nyid la 'gog pa zhes brjod de 'dir spros pa thams cad 'gag par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: de bzhin nyid la 'gog pa zhes brjod de 'dir spros pa thams cad 'gag par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro ;
translated: Thusness is called cessation because in it all elaborations cease.

original: / sa bdun pa ring du song ba 'dir ni sa drug pa thob pa'i 'gog pa de la byang chub sems dpa' skad cig dang skad cig la snyoms par 'jug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: / sa bdun pa ring du song ba 'dir ni sa drug pa thob pa'i 'gog pa de la byang chub sems dpa' skad cig dang skad cig la snyoms par 'jug par 'gyur te /
translated: On this seventh ground, Gone Far Beyond, the bodhisattva enters into cessation in every instant.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag byang chub sems dpa'i sa drug pa yan chad byang chub sems dpa'i 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug ste /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag byang chub sems dpa'i sa drug pa yan chad byang chub sems dpa'i 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug ste /
translated: O children of the buddhas, from the sixth bodhisattva ground onward, bodhisattvas enter into the cessation of bodhisattvas.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun pa 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni sems kyi skad cig dang sems kyi skad cig la yang 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug cing ldang ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun pa 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni sems kyi skad cig dang sems kyi skad cig la yang 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug cing ldang ste /
translated: The bodhisattva who is on this seventh bodhisattva ground enters into and arises from cessation in every instant of mind.

original: 'gog pa mngon sum du byas zhes ni mi bya'o zhes rgyas par gsungs so ;
analyzed: 'gog pa mngon sum du byas zhes ni mi bya'o zhes rgyas par gsungs so ;
translated: But it is not said that he has actualized cessation.

original: /'di'i thabs la mkhas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ches yongs su dag par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: /'di'i thabs la mkhas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ches yongs su dag par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: And his perfection of skillful means becomes utterly pure.

original: shes rab nyid rnam pa khyad par du zhugs pa la thabs dang smon lam dang stobs dang ye shes zhes shes par bya ste /
analyzed: shes rab nyid rnam pa khyad par du zhugs pa la thabs dang smon lam dang stobs dang ye shes zhes shes par bya ste /
translated: One should understand that wisdom itself, when it has entered into a special aspect, is method, aspiration, strength, and primordial wisdom.

original: rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i gnas skabs kho nar shes rab la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes brjod kyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i gnas skabs kho nar shes rab la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes brjod kyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: Wisdom is called the perfection of wisdom only in the context of perfect discernment, not in any other context.

original: dbu ma la 'jug pa'i bshad pa las sems bskyed pa bdun pa'o /
analyzed: dbu ma la 'jug pa'i bshad pa las sems bskyed pa bdun pa'o /
translated: This completes the seventh bodhichitta generation from the Entrance to the Middle Way.

original: // / da ni sems bskyed pa brgyad pa'i dbang du byas nas bshad pa /
analyzed: // / da ni sems bskyed pa brgyad pa'i dbang du byas nas bshad pa /
translated: Now, in consideration of the eighth bodhichitta generation, it is said:

original: yang yang sngar dge las lhag thob bya'i phyir //
analyzed: yang yang sngar dge las lhag thob bya'i phyir //
translated: In order to attain again and again a virtue that is greater than before,

original: gang du phyir mi ldog pa nyid 'gyur ba //
analyzed: gang du phyir mi ldog pa nyid 'gyur ba //
translated: the bodhisattvas enter into the immovable.

original: mi g-yo de la bdag nyid che de 'jug / byang chub sems dpa' de ni yang dang yang du sngar gyi dge ba las lhag pa thob par bya ba'i ched du gang du de phyir mi ldog par 'gyur ba byang chub sems dpa'i sa brgyad pa mi g-yo
analyzed: mi g-yo de la bdag nyid che de 'jug / byang chub sems dpa' de ni yang dang yang du sngar gyi dge ba las lhag pa thob par bya ba'i ched du gang du de phyir mi ldog par 'gyur ba byang chub sems dpa'i sa brgyad pa mi g-yo
translated: In order to attain again and again a virtue that is greater than before, the bodhisattvas enter into the eighth bodhisattva ground, the Immovable, on which they become irreversible.

original: ba la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ba la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: And they will enter into the Great Vehicle.

original: de la yang dang yang du sngar gyi dge ba las lhag pa thob pa ni /
analyzed: de la yang dang yang du sngar gyi dge ba las lhag pa thob pa ni /
translated: And in that, they will again and again attain virtues that surpass the previous ones.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: O sons of the Conqueror, it is like this.

original: rgya mtsho chen por 'gro ba'i gru bo che ni rgya mtsho chen po la ma thug gi bar du ched du bskyod cing 'gro bar bya ba yin te /üîΩgang gi tshe rgya mtsho chen po la phyin ma thag tu rlung @326a * //üîΩgi dkyil 'khor gyis bskyod nas ched du 'bad mi dgos par 'gro ste /
analyzed: rgya mtsho chen por 'gro ba'i gru bo che ni rgya mtsho chen po la ma thug gi bar du ched du bskyod cing 'gro bar bya ba yin te / gang gi tshe rgya mtsho chen po la phyin ma thag tu rlung @326a * // gi dkyil 'khor gyis bskyod nas ched du 'bad mi dgos par 'gro ste /
translated: A great ship that sails the great ocean is propelled by sails until it reaches the great ocean.üîΩBut as soon as it reaches the great ocean, it is propelled by the wind and moves without any further effort.

original: des rgya mtsho chen po la nyin gcig gis ci chod pa de ni sngon chad du bskyod cing 'gro bas lo brgyar yang de srid du tshad med par phyin par mi nus so //
analyzed: des rgya mtsho chen po la nyin gcig gis ci chod pa de ni sngon chad du bskyod cing 'gro bas lo brgyar yang de srid du tshad med par phyin par mi nus so //
translated: In a single day it goes farther than it could in a hundred years of being propelled by sails.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag de bzhin du /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag de bzhin du /
translated: O sons of the Conqueror, in the same way,

original: byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'i rtsa ba'i tshogs shin tu bsags pa theg pa chen po yang dag par bsgrubs pa yang /üîΩbyang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i rgya mtshor phyin nas lhun gyis grub pa'i ye shes kyis yud tsam cig la thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes ci tsam gnon pa de ni sngon gyi ched du bya ba'i las kyis bskal pa 'bum du yang de snyed du dpag tu
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'i rtsa ba'i tshogs shin tu bsags pa theg pa chen po yang dag par bsgrubs pa yang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i rgya mtshor phyin nas lhun gyis grub pa'i ye shes kyis yud tsam cig la thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes ci tsam gnon pa de ni sngon gyi ched du bya ba'i las kyis bskal pa 'bum du yang de snyed du dpag tu
translated: The bodhisattva who has accumulated the collection of roots of virtue and has accomplished the Great Vehicle

original: med pa gnon par mi nus so zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: med pa gnon par mi nus so zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: having gone to the ocean of bodhisattva conduct, in a single instant with spontaneous wisdom, surpasses the wisdom of omniscience to a degree that cannot be calculated even in a hundred thousand eons by the previous intentional actions.

original: 'di yi smon lam shin tu dag 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: 'di yi smon lam shin tu dag 'gyur zhing //
translated: His prayers become very pure,

original: rgyal ba rnams kyis 'gog las slong bar mdzad //
analyzed: rgyal ba rnams kyis 'gog las slong bar mdzad //
translated: and the victors rouse him from cessation.

original: 'dis sems dang po bskyed par gyur pa na smon lam chen po bcu la sogs pa smon lam 'bum phrag grangs med pa phrag bcu gang dag mngon par btab pa de dag 'di la yongs su dag par 'gyur bas 'di'i smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa
analyzed: 'dis sems dang po bskyed par gyur pa na smon lam chen po bcu la sogs pa smon lam 'bum phrag grangs med pa phrag bcu gang dag mngon par btab pa de dag 'di la yongs su dag par 'gyur bas 'di'i smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa
translated: Since they are fulfilled in him, his perfection of vows

original: ches lhag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ches lhag par 'gyur ro //
translated: is far superior.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis mi g-yo ba 'di ni gzhon nu'i sar rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis mi g-yo ba 'di ni gzhon nu'i sar rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: This stage of Immovability is established for the bodhisattva as the stage of youth.

original: dbu par ni rgyal tshab thob la /
analyzed: dbu par ni rgyal tshab thob la /
translated: On the stage of Cloud of Dharma, he is consecrated as regent.

original: bcu par ni 'khor los sgyur ba ltar rgyal ba rnams kyis dbang bskur ro //
analyzed: bcu par ni 'khor los sgyur ba ltar rgyal ba rnams kyis dbang bskur ro //
translated: On the tenth stage, he is consecrated by the victors as a universal monarch.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa mi g-yo bar 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs par gyur pa na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa mi g-yo bar 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs par gyur pa na /
translated: When the bodhisattva enters into the cessation of the stage of Immovability,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis 'gog pa las slong bar yang mdzad do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis 'gog pa las slong bar yang mdzad do //
translated: the bhagavat buddhas cause him to rise from cessation.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag de ltar byang chub sems dpa'i mi g-yo ba 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sngon gyi smon lam gyi stobs bskyed pa dang / chos kyi sgo'i rgyun de la gnas pa de la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes nye bar bsgrub par mdzad do //
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag de ltar byang chub sems dpa'i mi g-yo ba 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sngon gyi smon lam gyi stobs bskyed pa dang / chos kyi sgo'i rgyun de la gnas pa de la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes nye bar bsgrub par mdzad do //
translated: ‚ÄúO children of the Victorious Ones, in this way, the bodhisattvas who abide in this Immovable ground, through the power of their previous aspirations and through abiding in the stream of the door of Dharma, the blessed buddhas will cause them to accomplish the wisdom of the thus-gone ones.

original: de la 'di skad ces kyang bka' stsal te /
analyzed: de la 'di skad ces kyang bka' stsal te /
translated: They will say to them:

original: rigs kyi bu legs so legs so //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu legs so legs so //
translated: ‚ÄòExcellent, excellent, son of noble family!

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rjes su rtogs par bya ba la 'di ni don dam pa'i bzod pa yang yin na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rjes su rtogs par bya ba la 'di ni don dam pa'i bzod pa yang yin na /
translated: This is the ultimate acceptance that leads to the realization of the qualities of the buddhas.

original: 'on kyang rigs kyi bu gang nged kyi stobs bcu dang mi @326b 'jigs pa bzhi la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa phun sum tshogs pa de khyod la med kyi /
analyzed: 'on kyang rigs kyi bu gang nged kyi stobs bcu dang mi @326b 'jigs pa bzhi la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa phun sum tshogs pa de khyod la med kyi /
translated: However, son of noble family, you do not possess the perfection of the ten powers, the four forms of fearlessness, and so forth, which are the unique qualities of the buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos phun sum tshogs pa de yongs su btsal ba'i phyir sbyor ba byos shig / brtson 'grus rtsoms shig / bzod pa'i sgo 'di nyid kyang ma dor zhig / rigs kyi bu khyod kyis de ltar zhig ba'i rnam par thar pa la gnas pa thob
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos phun sum tshogs pa de yongs su btsal ba'i phyir sbyor ba byos shig / brtson 'grus rtsoms shig / bzod pa'i sgo 'di nyid kyang ma dor zhig / rigs kyi bu khyod kyis de ltar zhig ba'i rnam par thar pa la gnas pa thob
translated: Son of noble family, even though you have attained the state of abiding in this kind of liberation,üîΩyou should consider these childish ordinary beings who are not liberated, who are not at peace, in whom various afflictions arise, whose minds are disturbed by various thoughts.

original: kyang byis pa so so'i skye bo ma zhig par rab tu ma zhi pa nyon mongs pa sna tshogs kun tu 'byung bar gyur pa rnam par rtog pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyis yid g-yen spyo ba 'di dag la soms shig / gzhan yang rigs kyi bu sngon
analyzed: kyang byis pa so so'i skye bo ma zhig par rab tu ma zhi pa nyon mongs pa sna tshogs kun tu 'byung bar gyur pa rnam par rtog pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyis yid g-yen spyo ba 'di dag la soms shig / gzhan yang rigs kyi bu sngon
translated: Moreover, son of noble family, in the past,

original: gyi smon lam dang zhes rgya cher 'byung ba nas /
analyzed: gyi smon lam dang zhes rgya cher 'byung ba nas /
translated: as extensively quoted,

original: gal te sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' de la thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes mngon par sgrub pa'i sgo rnams su gzhug pa mdzad du zin na /
analyzed: gal te sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' de la thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes mngon par sgrub pa'i sgo rnams su gzhug pa mdzad du zin na /
translated: if those BhagavƒÅn Buddhas had caused that bodhisattva to enter the doors of the accomplishment of omniscient wisdom,

original: de de nyid kyi tshe yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bar du gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de de nyid kyi tshe yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bar du gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: And at that time, he will pass into parinirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: gang gi phyir 'di de ltar 'gog pa las slong ba de nyid kyi phyir 'di'i chags pa med pa'i blo ni skyon rnams ngag dang lhan cig mi gnas phyir //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di de ltar 'gog pa las slong ba de nyid kyi phyir 'di'i chags pa med pa'i blo ni skyon rnams ngag dang lhan cig mi gnas phyir //
translated: Because he is roused from cessation in this way, therefore his unattached mind is free of faults, because it does not dwell with them.

original: sa brgyad pa la dri ma de dag rtsar bcas nye bar zhi 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: sa brgyad pa la dri ma de dag rtsar bcas nye bar zhi 'gyur zhing //
translated: On the eighth level, those stains together with their roots are pacified.

original: nyon mongs zad cing khams gsum bla mar gyur kyang sangs rgyas rnams kyi ni //
analyzed: nyon mongs zad cing khams gsum bla mar gyur kyang sangs rgyas rnams kyi ni //
translated: And although he has exhausted the afflictions and become superior to the three realms,

original: 'byor pa mkha' ltar mkha' bral ma lus thob par nus ma yin //
analyzed: 'byor pa mkha' ltar mkha' bral ma lus thob par nus ma yin //
translated: he is still unable to attain the spacelike mastery of the buddhas, which is free of all spacelike obstructions.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi nyi ma shar bas mun pa ltar nyon mongs par sngar byung ba 'khor bar skye ba'i rgyur gyur pa khams gsum spyod pa gang yin pa de dag thams cad kyang rtsa ba dang bcas par zhi ba kho nar 'gyur la
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi nyi ma shar bas mun pa ltar nyon mongs par sngar byung ba 'khor bar skye ba'i rgyur gyur pa khams gsum spyod pa gang yin pa de dag thams cad kyang rtsa ba dang bcas par zhi ba kho nar 'gyur la
translated: When the sun of nonconceptual gnosis rises, the darkness of the afflictions that had previously arisen, which are the cause of birth in sa·πÉsƒÅra, and the three realms that are their domain, are completely pacified, together with their roots.

original: / de de spangs pas sa gsum gyi bla ma nyid du gyur du zin kyang byang chub sems dpa' 'dis gnas skabs der sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi 'byor pa thob par mi nus te /
analyzed: / de de spangs pas sa gsum gyi bla ma nyid du gyur du zin kyang byang chub sems dpa' 'dis gnas skabs der sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi 'byor pa thob par mi nus te /
translated: Although he has abandoned that and become the highest of the three realms, this bodhisattva is not able to attain the wealth of the Bhagavan Buddhas at that stage.

original: de thob par bya ba'i phyir 'dis bsgrim par bya dgos so //
analyzed: de thob par bya ba'i phyir 'dis bsgrim par bya dgos so //
translated: He must strive to attain that.

original: de de nyid kyi tshe yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur te zhes 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de de nyid kyi tshe yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur te zhes 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: Because it says, ‚ÄúAt that time he would attain nirvana.‚Äù

original: 'di khams gsum las 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid srid pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di khams gsum las 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid srid pa yin te /
translated: It is possible that he is free from attachment to the three realms,

original: 'dod chags dang ma bral ba la mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa srid pa med pa'i phyir /üîΩgal te 'dis der @327a * //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang ma bral ba la mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa srid pa med pa'i phyir / gal te 'dis der @327a * //
translated: because it is impossible for someone who is not free from attachment to attain nirvana.

original: khams gsum las 'dod chags dang bral bar gyur na /
analyzed: khams gsum las 'dod chags dang bral bar gyur na /
translated: If he were free from attachment to the three realms at that stage,

original: de'i tshe 'khor ba 'gags pas ji ltar 'di sangs rgyas kyi chos ma lus pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de'i tshe 'khor ba 'gags pas ji ltar 'di sangs rgyas kyi chos ma lus pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: then since samsara would have ceased, how could he complete all the qualities of a Buddha?

original: bshad pa / 'khor ba 'gags kyang dbang rnams bcu po thob par gyur zhing de dag gis //
analyzed: bshad pa / 'khor ba 'gags kyang dbang rnams bcu po thob par gyur zhing de dag gis //
translated: NƒÅgƒÅrjuna responds: Even though sa·πÉsƒÅra has ceased, they attain the ten masteries,

original: srid pa'i 'gro bar rang gi bdag nyid sna tshogs ston par byed par 'gyur //
analyzed: srid pa'i 'gro bar rang gi bdag nyid sna tshogs ston par byed par 'gyur //
translated: and by means of them, they display various bodies in the migrations of existence.

original: 'dir 'khor ba ni 'gags mod kyi de lta na yang 'di la dbang bcu po de dag nye bar skye la /
analyzed: 'dir 'khor ba ni 'gags mod kyi de lta na yang 'di la dbang bcu po de dag nye bar skye la /
translated: Here, even though sa·πÉsƒÅra has ceased, these ten masteries arise for them.

original: de dag gis 'dis yid kyi rang bzhin gyi lus kyi sog nas bdag nyid kyi dngos po sna tshogs pa ston par byed do ;
analyzed: de dag gis 'dis yid kyi rang bzhin gyi lus kyi sog nas bdag nyid kyi dngos po sna tshogs pa ston par byed do ;
translated: By means of them, they display various bodies of their own nature from the mental body.

original: / de'i phyir 'di'i tshogs ma lus par yongs su rdzogs par mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: / de'i phyir 'di'i tshogs ma lus par yongs su rdzogs par mi 'gal lo //
translated: Therefore, it is not contradictory that their entire accumulations are completely perfected.

original: de la dbang bcu ni /
analyzed: de la dbang bcu ni /
translated: The ten masteries are as follows.

original: ji skad du //
analyzed: ji skad du //
translated: As it is said:

original: bskal pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med par tshe tshad byin gyis rlob pas tshe la dbang ba 'thob po //
analyzed: bskal pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med par tshe tshad byin gyis rlob pas tshe la dbang ba 'thob po //
translated: By blessing their lifespan to be inexpressibly inexpressible eons, they attain mastery over lifespan.

original: ting nge 'dzin nges par sems pa dpag tu med pa'i ye shes kyis 'jug pas sems la dbang ba 'thob bo //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin nges par sems pa dpag tu med pa'i ye shes kyis 'jug pas sems la dbang ba 'thob bo //
translated: By engaging with the wisdom of immeasurable meditative concentration, they attain mastery over mind.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad rgyan bkod pa du mas rab tu brgyan pa'i byin gyi rlabs kun tu ston pas yo byad la dbang 'thob bo //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad rgyan bkod pa du mas rab tu brgyan pa'i byin gyi rlabs kun tu ston pas yo byad la dbang 'thob bo //
translated: They attain mastery of requisites by displaying the blessing of adorning all world systems with many arrays of adornments.

original: las kyi rnam par smin pa sbyin gyi rlabs kyis dus ji lta ba bzhin du ston pas las la dbang ba 'thob po ;
analyzed: las kyi rnam par smin pa sbyin gyi rlabs kyis dus ji lta ba bzhin du ston pas las la dbang ba 'thob po ;
translated: They attain mastery of karma by displaying the blessing of the ripening of karma in accordance with time.

original: /'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du skye ba kun tu ston pas skye ba la dbang ba 'thob bo //
analyzed: /'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du skye ba kun tu ston pas skye ba la dbang ba 'thob bo //
translated: They attain mastery of birth by displaying birth in all world systems.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing dang / dus gang du ci dga' bar mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa kun tu ston pas smon lam la dbang ba 'thob bo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing dang / dus gang du ci dga' bar mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa kun tu ston pas smon lam la dbang ba 'thob bo //
translated: They attain mastery of aspiration by displaying the attainment of complete buddhahood in any buddha field and at any time as they wish.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad sangs rgyas kyis rab tu gang ba kun tu ston pas mos pa la dbang ba 'thob bo //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad sangs rgyas kyis rab tu gang ba kun tu ston pas mos pa la dbang ba 'thob bo //
translated: They attain mastery of resolve by displaying all world systems as completely filled with buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du rdzu 'phrul gyi rnam par 'phrul pa kun tu ston pas rdzu 'phrul la dbang po 'thob bo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du rdzu 'phrul gyi rnam par 'phrul pa kun tu ston pas rdzu 'phrul la dbang po 'thob bo //
translated: They attain mastery of miracles by displaying miraculous transformations in all buddha fields.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa dang / mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po dang / mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa kun tu ston pas ye shes la dbang ba 'thob bo //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa dang / mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po dang / mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa kun tu ston pas ye shes la dbang ba 'thob bo //
translated: They attain mastery of wisdom by displaying the powers of the tathagatas, the fearlessnesses, the distinctive qualities of the buddhas, the major and minor marks and complete enlightenment.

original: mtha' dang dbus med pa'i chos kyi sgo snang ba kun tu ston pas chos la dbang 'thob bo zhes rgyas par gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: mtha' dang dbus med pa'i chos kyi sgo snang ba kun tu ston pas chos la dbang 'thob bo zhes rgyas par gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: They attain mastery of phenomena by displaying the illumination of the Dharma doors that are without limit or center.

original: sems @327b bskyed pa brgyad pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: sems @327b bskyed pa brgyad pa bshad zin to //
translated: This is explained in detail.

original: dbu ma la 'jug pa'i bshad pa las sems bskyed pa brgyad pa'o /
analyzed: dbu ma la 'jug pa'i bshad pa las sems bskyed pa brgyad pa'o /
translated: This completes the eighth bodhichitta generation from the Entrance to the Middle Way.

original: // / da ni sems bskyed pa dgu pa la ni de'i stobs lta zhig mtha' dag rdzogs par dag 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: // / da ni sems bskyed pa dgu pa la ni de'i stobs lta zhig mtha' dag rdzogs par dag 'gyur zhing //
translated: Now, on the ninth bodhichitta generation, all of the strengths are completely purified,

original: de bzhin yang dag rig chos rang gi yon tan yongs su dag pa'ang 'thob //
analyzed: de bzhin yang dag rig chos rang gi yon tan yongs su dag pa'ang 'thob //
translated: and likewise, the correct and discerning awarenesses and the completely pure qualities of the buddhas are attained.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa dgu par ni byang chub sems dpa'i stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa chos yongs su dag par 'gyur zhing so so yang dag par rig pa rang gi yon tan yongs su dag pa bzhi yang 'thob ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa dgu par ni byang chub sems dpa'i stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa chos yongs su dag par 'gyur zhing so so yang dag par rig pa rang gi yon tan yongs su dag pa bzhi yang 'thob ste /
translated: On the ninth bodhisattva stage, the bodhisattva perfects the transcendent strength of the bodhisattva and attains the four purities of the qualities of the analytical knowledges.

original: chos so so yang dag par rig pa dang ; don so so yang dag par rig pa dang / nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa dang / spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa'o //
analyzed: chos so so yang dag par rig pa dang ; don so so yang dag par rig pa dang / nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa dang / spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa'o //
translated: The four purities of the analytical knowledges are the purity of the analytical knowledge of the teaching, the purity of the analytical knowledge of meaning, the purity of the analytical knowledge of the expression, and the purity of the analytical knowledge of confidence giving.

original: de la chos so yang dag par rig pas ni chos thams cad kyi rang gi mtshan nyid rab tu shes so //
analyzed: de la chos so yang dag par rig pas ni chos thams cad kyi rang gi mtshan nyid rab tu shes so //
translated: By the purity of the analytical knowledge of the teaching, one knows the intrinsic identity of all teachings.

original: don so so yang dag par rigs pas ni chos thams cad kyi rnam par dbye bar rab tu shes so //
analyzed: don so so yang dag par rigs pas ni chos thams cad kyi rnam par dbye bar rab tu shes so //
translated: By the purity of the analytical knowledge of meaning, one knows the classification of all teachings.üîΩBy the purity of the analytical knowledge of the expression, one knows how to teach all the teachings without confusion.

original: nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pas ni chos rnams ma 'dres par ston pa rab tu shes so //
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pas ni chos rnams ma 'dres par ston pa rab tu shes so //
translated: By the purity of the analytical knowledge of confidence giving, one knows how to teach the Dharma in all its aspects.

original: spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pas ni chos rnams kyi mthun pa'i rgyu rgyun chad pa med pa nyid du rab tu shes so //üîΩsems bskyed pa dgu pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pas ni chos rnams kyi mthun pa'i rgyu rgyun chad pa med pa nyid du rab tu shes so // sems bskyed pa dgu pa bshad zin to //
translated: Through the analytical knowledge of eloquence, one knows the uninterrupted continuity of the causes that accord with the teachings.üîΩThis completes the ninth ground or stage in the cultivation of absolute bodhichitta.

original: dbu ma la 'jug pa'i bshad pa las sems bskyed pa dgu pa'o /
analyzed: dbu ma la 'jug pa'i bshad pa las sems bskyed pa dgu pa'o /
translated: This has been the ninth chapter, the ‚ÄúThe Ninth Ground,‚Äù from Ornament of the Mahayana Sutras: A Commentary on the Ornament of the Mahayana Sutras.

original: // / da ni sems bskyed pa bcu pa'i dbang du byas nas bshad pa /
analyzed: // / da ni sems bskyed pa bcu pa'i dbang du byas nas bshad pa /
translated: Now, in terms of the tenth ground, the text explains:

original: bcu pa'i sa la de yis kun nas sangs rgyas rnams las dbang bskur ba //
analyzed: bcu pa'i sa la de yis kun nas sangs rgyas rnams las dbang bskur ba //
translated: On the tenth ground, they are fully consecrated by the buddhas,

original: dam pa thob cing ye shes lhag par mchog tu 'byung bar 'gyur ba'ang yin //
analyzed: dam pa thob cing ye shes lhag par mchog tu 'byung bar 'gyur ba'ang yin //
translated: And they attain the supreme and the supreme of the supreme of wisdom.

original: char sprin rnams las chu car 'bab pa ji ltar de bzhin 'gro rnams kyi //
analyzed: char sprin rnams las chu car 'bab pa ji ltar de bzhin 'gro rnams kyi //
translated: Just as water falls from the clouds, so from the children of the victors,

original: dge ba'i lo thog ched du rgyal sras las kyang lhun grub chos char 'bab //
analyzed: dge ba'i lo thog ched du rgyal sras las kyang lhun grub chos char 'bab //
translated: The rain of Dharma falls spontaneously for the sake of the crops of virtue in beings.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis dbang bskur te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis dbang bskur te /
translated: On the tenth ground of bodhisattvas, the bodhisattvas are consecrated by the blessed buddhas.

original: ji skad de la ting nge 'dzin grangs med pa 'bum phrag bcu ji snyed pa'i tha ma la byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes dang khyad par med par dbang bskur ba dang ldan pa zhes bya ba mngon @328a * //üîΩdu 'gyur te /üîΩmngon du gyur ma thag tu stong gsum 'bum phrag bcu'i gtos dang mnyam pa'i rin po che chen po'i padma rin po che rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pas spras pa zhes bya ba nas rgyas par stong gsum 'bum phrag bcur tshang ba'i rdul phra rab
analyzed: ji skad de la ting nge 'dzin grangs med pa 'bum phrag bcu ji snyed pa'i tha ma la byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes dang khyad par med par dbang bskur ba dang ldan pa zhes bya ba mngon @328a * // du 'gyur te / mngon du gyur ma thag tu stong gsum 'bum phrag bcu'i gtos dang mnyam pa'i rin po che chen po'i padma rin po che rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pas spras pa zhes bya ba nas rgyas par stong gsum 'bum phrag bcur tshang ba'i rdul phra rab
translated: At the end of as many as one hundred thousand countless hundreds of thousands of concentrations, the concentration called ‚Äúendowed with the empowerment that is not different from the wisdom of omniscience of a bodhisattva‚Äù manifests.üîΩImmediately after it manifests, a great lotus called ‚Äúadorned with the supreme of all jewels‚Äù equal in size to one hundred thousand trichiliocosms arises, and so on up to:

original: kyi rdul snyed kyi padma'i 'khor dang ldan pa 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: kyi rdul snyed kyi padma'i 'khor dang ldan pa 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: it has a retinue of lotuses equal to the number of atoms in one hundred thousand trichiliocosms.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de'i lus kyang de dang 'tsham zhing de'i rkyen du 'bab par gnas so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de'i lus kyang de dang 'tsham zhing de'i rkyen du 'bab par gnas so //
translated: The body of that bodhisattva also becomes commensurate with that and remains in a condition suitable for it.

original: de ting nge 'dzin de thob ma thag tu padma de la 'dug par kun tu snang ngo //
analyzed: de ting nge 'dzin de thob ma thag tu padma de la 'dug par kun tu snang ngo //
translated: As soon as he attains that meditative absorption, he is seen sitting on that lotus.

original: de de la 'dug pa dang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sangs rgyas kyi zhing kun nas gdan 'dzom pa rnams kyi mdzod spu nas 'od zer dag phyung nas /
analyzed: de de la 'dug pa dang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sangs rgyas kyi zhing kun nas gdan 'dzom pa rnams kyi mdzod spu nas 'od zer dag phyung nas /
translated: When he sits there, the Blessed Buddhas, the assembled Buddhas of all the buddha-fields, emit light rays from their foreheads
