original: byang chub sems dpa' de la dbang bskur bar mdzad do zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de la dbang bskur bar mdzad do zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: and they confer the consecration on that bodhisattva.

original: 'di'i ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ches yongs su dag par yang 'gyur la /üîΩsprin chen po ltar 'jig rten gyi dge ba'i lo thog mngon par spel ba'i phyir //
analyzed: 'di'i ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ches yongs su dag par yang 'gyur la / sprin chen po ltar 'jig rten gyi dge ba'i lo thog mngon par spel ba'i phyir //
translated: The perfection of wisdom becomes even more purified for him.

original: lhun gyis grub par dam pa'i chos kyi char yang mngon par 'bebs so //üîΩsems bskyed pa bcu pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: lhun gyis grub par dam pa'i chos kyi char yang mngon par 'bebs so // sems bskyed pa bcu pa bshad zin to //
translated: And, like a great cloud, he showers down the rain of the holy Dharma spontaneously, in order to increase the crop of virtue in the world.üîΩThe tenth generation of the enlightenment mind has been explained.

original: dbu ma la 'jug pa'i bshad pa las sems bskyed pa bcu pa'o /
analyzed: dbu ma la 'jug pa'i bshad pa las sems bskyed pa bcu pa'o /
translated: This has been the tenth chapter of the commentary on the ‚ÄúEntry into the Middle Way,‚Äù called ‚ÄúThe Generation of the Enlightenment Mind.‚Äù

original: // / da ni sems bskyed pa dang po nas brtsams te de dag gis yon tan gyi grangs thob pa'i dbang du byas nas bshad pa /
analyzed: // / da ni sems bskyed pa dang po nas brtsams te de dag gis yon tan gyi grangs thob pa'i dbang du byas nas bshad pa /
translated: Now, beginning from the first production of the thought of enlightenment, the author explains the number of qualities that are obtained by the bodhisattvas.

original: de'i tshe 'dis ni sangs rgyas brgya mthong zhing //
analyzed: de'i tshe 'dis ni sangs rgyas brgya mthong zhing //
translated: At that time, he sees a hundred Buddhas,

original: de dag byin gyi rlabs kyang 'di yis rtogs //
analyzed: de dag byin gyi rlabs kyang 'di yis rtogs //
translated: and he knows their blessing.

original: de nyid tshe na bskal brgyar gnas shing //
analyzed: de nyid tshe na bskal brgyar gnas shing //
translated: At that time, he remains for a hundred eons,üîΩand he penetrates the past and the future.

original: sngon dang phyi ma'i mthar yang yang dag 'jug / blo ldan ting 'dzin brgya phrag snyoms par 'jug cing gtong byed de /
analyzed: sngon dang phyi ma'i mthar yang yang dag 'jug / blo ldan ting 'dzin brgya phrag snyoms par 'jug cing gtong byed de /
translated: The wise one enters a hundred meditative concentrations and emerges from them.

original: 'jig rten khams brgya 'di yis kun nas g-yo zhing snang bar nus //
analyzed: 'jig rten khams brgya 'di yis kun nas g-yo zhing snang bar nus //
translated: He can cause a hundred world-realms to quake and to be illuminated.

original: de bzhin rdzu 'phrul gyis de sems can brgya phrag smin byed cing //
analyzed: de bzhin rdzu 'phrul gyis de sems can brgya phrag smin byed cing //
translated: Likewise, through his superknowledge, he matures a hundred sentient beings.

original: brgya phrag grangs dang rjes 'brel zhing dag tu yang 'gro bar 'gyur //
analyzed: brgya phrag grangs dang rjes 'brel zhing dag tu yang 'gro bar 'gyur //
translated: He goes to a hundred buddha-fields, and he is followed by a retinue of a hundred bodhisattvas.

original: des ni chos kyi sgo rnams yang dag 'byed byed thub dbang sras //
analyzed: des ni chos kyi sgo rnams yang dag 'byed byed thub dbang sras //
translated: The sons of the Victor open a hundred Dharma doors.

original: rang gi lus la lus rnams kun nas ston par byed pa'ang yin //
analyzed: rang gi lus la lus rnams kun nas ston par byed pa'ang yin //
translated: And they manifest a hundred bodies in their own body.

original: rang gi 'khor dang bcas pas mdzes 'byor lus ni re re zhing //
analyzed: rang gi 'khor dang bcas pas mdzes 'byor lus ni re re zhing //
translated: Each of them has a beautiful body with its own retinue,

original: rgyal ba'i sras po brgya phrag dag @328b dang rjes su 'brel pa'ang ston //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i sras po brgya phrag dag @328b dang rjes su 'brel pa'ang ston //
translated: and they manifest a hundred times a hundred sons of the Victor.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As is said:

original: rab tu byung nas kyang skad cig thang cig yul tsam cig la ting nge 'dzin brgya rab tu 'thob cing de dag la snyoms par 'jug pa yang 'jug pa dang / sangs rgyas brgya mthong ba dang / de dag gi byin gyi rlabs kyang yang dag par shes pa dang /
analyzed: rab tu byung nas kyang skad cig thang cig yul tsam cig la ting nge 'dzin brgya rab tu 'thob cing de dag la snyoms par 'jug pa yang 'jug pa dang / sangs rgyas brgya mthong ba dang / de dag gi byin gyi rlabs kyang yang dag par shes pa dang /
translated: Having gone forth, in an instant, a moment, a flash, they attain a hundred concentrations and enter them. They see a hundred buddhas and know their blessings.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams brgya g-yo bar byed pa dang / zhing brgyar yang 'gro ba dang / 'jig rten gyi khams brgya snang bar byed pa dang / sems can brgya yongs su smin par byed pa dang / bskal pa brgyar yang gnas par byed pa dang /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams brgya g-yo bar byed pa dang / zhing brgyar yang 'gro ba dang / 'jig rten gyi khams brgya snang bar byed pa dang / sems can brgya yongs su smin par byed pa dang / bskal pa brgyar yang gnas par byed pa dang /
translated: They shake a hundred worlds, go to a hundred realms, illuminate a hundred worlds, ripen a hundred beings, remain for a hundred eons,

original: bskal pa brgya la sngon dang phyi ma'i mthar 'jug pa dang / chos kyi sgo brgya rnam par 'byed pa dang / lus brgya kun tu ston pa dang / lus re re yang 'khor byang chu sems dpa' brgya brgya dang ldan par kun tu ston pa'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu 'o //
analyzed: bskal pa brgya la sngon dang phyi ma'i mthar 'jug pa dang / chos kyi sgo brgya rnam par 'byed pa dang / lus brgya kun tu ston pa dang / lus re re yang 'khor byang chu sems dpa' brgya brgya dang ldan par kun tu ston pa'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu 'o //
translated: He enters into the past and future in a hundred eons, he opens a hundred Dharma doors, he manifests a hundred bodies, and he manifests each body as accompanied by a hundred bodhisattvas.

original: blo ldan rab tu dga' bar gnas pas yon tan de dag ni ;
analyzed: blo ldan rab tu dga' bar gnas pas yon tan de dag ni ;
translated: These qualities of the wise one who abides in the stage of great joy

original: / thob par gyur nas de bzhin kho nar dri ma med gnas pas //
analyzed: / thob par gyur nas de bzhin kho nar dri ma med gnas pas //
translated: are obtained, and in just the same way, the one who abides in the stainless

original: de dag stong ni yan dag thob par 'gyur ba ste //
analyzed: de dag stong ni yan dag thob par 'gyur ba ste //
translated: obtains a thousand of each of those qualities.

original: sems dang po bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' 'dis yon tan grangs brgya dang rjes su 'brel pa gang dag thob pa de dag kho na sems gnyis pa bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpas ston 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes rgya cher 'brang bar bya'o //
analyzed: sems dang po bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' 'dis yon tan grangs brgya dang rjes su 'brel pa gang dag thob pa de dag kho na sems gnyis pa bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpas ston 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes rgya cher 'brang bar bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva who has generated the first stage of the mind obtains these qualities that are connected with a hundred enumerations. The bodhisattva who has generated the second stage of the mind obtains a thousand of those very qualities. This should be extended in detail.

original: yon tan de dag nyid sems bskyed pa gsum pa la sogs pas lnga pa'o //
analyzed: yon tan de dag nyid sems bskyed pa gsum pa la sogs pas lnga pa'o //
translated: These same qualities are multiplied by one hundred thousand, etc. in the third generation of the Thought, etc.

original: 'di dag rnams la byang chub sems dpa' yis ni 'bum phrag dang // bye ba phrag brgya 'thob cing de yis bye ba stong 'gyur 'thob //üîΩde nas bye ba brgya phrag stong 'gyur yang 'thob bye ba phrag / khrag khrig phra brgyar rdzogs par sgyur dang slar yang stong phrag tu //
analyzed: 'di dag rnams la byang chub sems dpa' yis ni 'bum phrag dang // bye ba phrag brgya 'thob cing de yis bye ba stong 'gyur 'thob // de nas bye ba brgya phrag stong 'gyur yang 'thob bye ba phrag / khrag khrig phra brgyar rdzogs par sgyur dang slar yang stong phrag tu //
translated: The Bodhisattva obtains these in the hundreds of thousands, in the hundreds of times a hundred thousand,üîΩin the hundreds of thousands of times a hundred thousand, in the hundreds of thousands of times a hundred of thousands of times a hundred thousand,

original: yang dag par ni sgyur ba mtha' dag rab tu 'thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: yang dag par ni sgyur ba mtha' dag rab tu 'thob par 'gyur //
translated: and in the hundreds of thousands of times a hundred of thousands of times a hundred thousand of times a hundred thousand.

original: de la sems gsum pa bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpas ni ji skad bshad pa'i yon tan rnams 'bum 'thob po //
analyzed: de la sems gsum pa bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpas ni ji skad bshad pa'i yon tan rnams 'bum 'thob po //
translated: Therein, the Bodhisattva who has generated the third Thought obtains the qualities as explained in the hundreds of thousands.

original: sems bzhi pa bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpas ni bye ba phrag brgya 'thob bo //
analyzed: sems bzhi pa bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpas ni bye ba phrag brgya 'thob bo //
translated: The Bodhisattva who has generated the fourth Thought obtains them in the hundreds of times a hundred thousand.

original: sems lnga pa bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpas ni bye ba phrag stong 'thob po //
analyzed: sems lnga pa bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpas ni bye ba phrag stong 'thob po //
translated: The Bodhisattva who has generated the fifth Thought obtains them in the hundreds of thousands of times a hundred thousand.

original: sems drug pa bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpas ni bye ba @329a * //üîΩ'bum 'thob bo //
analyzed: sems drug pa bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpas ni bye ba @329a * // 'bum 'thob bo //
translated: The bodhisattva who has generated the sixth ground obtains a hundred thousand times that number.üîΩThe bodhisattva who has generated the seventh ground obtains a hundred thousand times that number.

original: sems bdun pa bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpas ni yon tan de dag nyid bye ba khrag khrig phrag 'bum 'thob par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: sems bdun pa bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpas ni yon tan de dag nyid bye ba khrag khrig phrag 'bum 'thob par shes par bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva who has generated the eighth ground obtains a hundred thousand times that number.

original: de yan chad ni yon tan dag la grangs kyis yongs su bgrang bar mi srid pas /
analyzed: de yan chad ni yon tan dag la grangs kyis yongs su bgrang bar mi srid pas /
translated: Beyond that, it is not possible to enumerate the qualities with numbers.

original: rdul phra rab rnams kyis yongs su bgrang bar bshad pa /
analyzed: rdul phra rab rnams kyis yongs su bgrang bar bshad pa /
translated: Therefore, they are explained as being enumerated by subtle particles.

original: mi g-yo'i sar gnas rnam rtog med pa des //
analyzed: mi g-yo'i sar gnas rnam rtog med pa des //
translated: The one who abides on the Immovable ground, who is free from conceptuality,üîΩobtains qualities equal in number to the number of subtle particles

original: stong gsum brgya phrag stong bsdoms 'jig rten na //üîΩrdul tshad ji snyed yod pa de rnams dang // grangs mnyam yon tan dag ni 'thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: stong gsum brgya phrag stong bsdoms 'jig rten na // rdul tshad ji snyed yod pa de rnams dang // grangs mnyam yon tan dag ni 'thob par 'gyur //
translated: that exist in a billion three-thousand great one-thousand worlds.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems brgyad pa bskyed pas ni ji skad du bstan pa'i yon tan dag stong gsum gyi 'jig rten gyi khams 'bum gyi rdul phra rab kyi rdul snyed 'thob bo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems brgyad pa bskyed pas ni ji skad du bstan pa'i yon tan dag stong gsum gyi 'jig rten gyi khams 'bum gyi rdul phra rab kyi rdul snyed 'thob bo //
translated: The bodhisattva who has generated the eighth ground obtains the qualities that have been explained, equal in number to the subtle particles in a billion three-thousand great one-thousand worlds.

original: legs pa'i blo gros sa la gnas pa yi //
analyzed: legs pa'i blo gros sa la gnas pa yi //
translated: The bodhisattva who is on the ground of Perfect Joy

original: byang chub sems des sngar bstan yon tan dag / grangs med brgya phrag stong du yang dag par ;
analyzed: byang chub sems des sngar bstan yon tan dag / grangs med brgya phrag stong du yang dag par ;
translated: attains qualities that are taught earlier,

original: / bsdoms pa phrag bcu'i rdul tshad thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: / bsdoms pa phrag bcu'i rdul tshad thob par 'gyur //
translated: but in a magnitude equal to the number of particles in ten timesüîΩa hundred thousand countless systems of a billion worlds.

original: sems dgu pa bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpas ni sngar bstan pa'i yon tan dag stong gsum gyi 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med pa 'bum phrag bcu'i rdul phra rab kyi rdul dang mnyam pa 'thob po //
analyzed: sems dgu pa bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpas ni sngar bstan pa'i yon tan dag stong gsum gyi 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med pa 'bum phrag bcu'i rdul phra rab kyi rdul dang mnyam pa 'thob po //
translated: The bodhisattva who has generated the ninth generation of the thought of awakening attains qualities that are taught earlier, but in a magnitude equal to the number of particles in ten times a hundred thousand countless systems of a billion worlds.

original: re zhig bcu pa 'dir de'i yon tan dag / ngag gi spyod yul las ches 'das gyur zhing //
analyzed: re zhig bcu pa 'dir de'i yon tan dag / ngag gi spyod yul las ches 'das gyur zhing //
translated: Here, on the tenth ground, his qualities

original: ngag gi spyod yul ma yin bsdoms rnams na //
analyzed: ngag gi spyod yul ma yin bsdoms rnams na //
translated: are beyond the range of speech,üîΩand the number of his qualities

original: rdul dag ji snyed yod pa de snyed 'gyur //
analyzed: rdul dag ji snyed yod pa de snyed 'gyur //
translated: is equal to the number of particles in the buddha-fields.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems bcu pa bskyed pas ni yon tan ji skad du bstan pa dag sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rdul phra rab kyi rdul snyed 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems bcu pa bskyed pas ni yon tan ji skad du bstan pa dag sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rdul phra rab kyi rdul snyed 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: The bodhisattva who has generated the tenth generation of the thought of awakening attains as many qualities as there are atoms in an anabhilƒÅpyƒÅnabhilƒÅpya of buddha-fields.

original: re zhig bcu pa 'dir de'i zhes bya ba'i re zhig gi sgra 'dis ni de tsam kho nar zad pa ni ma yin no zhes yon tan brjod par bya ba la go rims ston par byed do //
analyzed: re zhig bcu pa 'dir de'i zhes bya ba'i re zhig gi sgra 'dis ni de tsam kho nar zad pa ni ma yin no zhes yon tan brjod par bya ba la go rims ston par byed do //
translated: The word ‚Äúonly‚Äù in the line ‚Äúonly here‚Äù in the above verse indicates that the qualities are not exhausted by the number given.

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' 'dis ni //üîΩba spu'i khung bur byang chub sems rnams dang // lhan cig rdzogs sangs rgyas sku bgrang 'das dang // de bzhin lha dang lha min mi dag kyang //
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' 'dis ni // ba spu'i khung bur byang chub sems rnams dang // lhan cig rdzogs sangs rgyas sku bgrang 'das dang // de bzhin lha dang lha min mi dag kyang //
translated: Moreover, this bodhisattvaüîΩcan manifest in a single pore of his skin infinite buddhas and their bodies, as well as gods, demigods, and humans,

original: skad cig skad cig la ni ston par nus //
analyzed: skad cig skad cig la ni ston par nus //
translated: together with the bodhisattvas, in every moment of thought.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems bcu pa @329b bskyed pa 'dis ni rtog pa kun nas rgyu ba med par rang gis lus kyi ba spu'i bu ga re rer sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das bgrang ba las 'das pa re re zhing byang chub sems dpa' gzhal gyis mi lang
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems bcu pa @329b bskyed pa 'dis ni rtog pa kun nas rgyu ba med par rang gis lus kyi ba spu'i bu ga re rer sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das bgrang ba las 'das pa re re zhing byang chub sems dpa' gzhal gyis mi lang
translated: By giving rise to this tenth bodhicitta, bodhisattvas are able to display in each pore of their bodies, without any conceptualization, an infinite number of buddhas,

original: ba'i 'khor mnga' bdag skad cig skad cig la rnam pa gzhan dang gzhan du 'ang ston bar nus la /
analyzed: ba'i 'khor mnga' bdag skad cig skad cig la rnam pa gzhan dang gzhan du 'ang ston bar nus la /
translated: each of them surrounded by an innumerable retinue of bodhisattvas, and they are able to display this in each instant in different ways.

original: de dag las gzhan 'gro ba lnga'i 'khor ba mi la sogs pa'i dbye bas tha dad pas yang ma 'dres par ba spu'i khung bu re rer skad cig re re la ston par nus so //
analyzed: de dag las gzhan 'gro ba lnga'i 'khor ba mi la sogs pa'i dbye bas tha dad pas yang ma 'dres par ba spu'i khung bu re rer skad cig re re la ston par nus so //
translated: And in each pore of their bodies, they are able to display in each instant beings of the five classes of the universe, distinct from each other as humans and so on, without mixing.

original: kyang gi sgra ni ma smos pa bsdu ba'i don du ste /
analyzed: kyang gi sgra ni ma smos pa bsdu ba'i don du ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù means that it includes what is not mentioned.

original: brgya byin dang / tshangs pa dang / 'jig rten skyong ba dang / mi'i rgyal po dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / de bzhin gshegs pas gdul ba'i sems can rnams la brgya byin la sogs pa'i gzugs bzung nas lhun gyis grub par chos ston par nus so zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bar gyi don sdud pa'o //
analyzed: brgya byin dang / tshangs pa dang / 'jig rten skyong ba dang / mi'i rgyal po dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / de bzhin gshegs pas gdul ba'i sems can rnams la brgya byin la sogs pa'i gzugs bzung nas lhun gyis grub par chos ston par nus so zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bar gyi don sdud pa'o //
translated: and the gods, such as Indra, Brahma, the Lokapalas, human kings, disciples, solitary sages, and the Tathagatas, he is able to assume the forms of Indra and so forth and spontaneously teach the Dharma to those beings who are to be trained.

original: yon tan gyi khyad par rnams rgyas par ni mdo nyid las bcal bar bya'o //
analyzed: yon tan gyi khyad par rnams rgyas par ni mdo nyid las bcal bar bya'o //
translated: The details of these qualities should be understood from the sutra itself.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i yon tan bstan pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i yon tan bstan pa bshad zin to //
translated: The explanation of the qualities of the Bodhisattva stage is now complete.

original: de'i 'og tu sangs rgyas kyi sa'i yon tan cung zad tsam cig brjod par 'dod pas bstod pa sgrub pa'i sgo nas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi dbang du byas te bshad pa /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu sangs rgyas kyi sa'i yon tan cung zad tsam cig brjod par 'dod pas bstod pa sgrub pa'i sgo nas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi dbang du byas te bshad pa /
translated: Immediately after that, wishing to explain just a little of the qualities of the Buddha stage, with the Bhagavat Buddha in mind, he explains by way of establishing praise:

original: gang phyir nam mkha' dri ma med la zla snang gsal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir //
analyzed: gang phyir nam mkha' dri ma med la zla snang gsal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir //
translated: Because in a stainless sky the moon's radiance becomes clear,

original: sngon tshe stobs bcu bskyed pa'i sa la khyod kyis slar yang 'bad gyur zhing //
analyzed: sngon tshe stobs bcu bskyed pa'i sa la khyod kyis slar yang 'bad gyur zhing //
translated: In former lives, you exerted yourself in the ten grounds of the ten powers,

original: 'og min du ni gang gi don du 'bad gyur go 'phang mchog zhi ba //
analyzed: 'og min du ni gang gi don du 'bad gyur go 'phang mchog zhi ba //
translated: And attained the supreme, peaceful state for which you strove in Akani·π£·π≠ha.

original: yon tan mtha' dag mthar thug mtshungs pa med de khyod kyis brnyes //
analyzed: yon tan mtha' dag mthar thug mtshungs pa med de khyod kyis brnyes //
translated: You have reached the ultimate, incomparable perfection of all good qualities.

original: dper na zla bas nam mkha'i dri ma med pa kho na la 'gro ba ma lus pa gsal bar nus pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na zla bas nam mkha'i dri ma med pa kho na la 'gro ba ma lus pa gsal bar nus pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as the moon, in a clear sky, can illuminate the entire world,

original: bcom ldan 'das sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams thob pa la gegs byed pa'i mun pa sbyong ba nyid du mdzad pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams thob pa la gegs byed pa'i mun pa sbyong ba nyid du mdzad pa /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn, having purified the darkness that obstructs the attainment of the qualities of a buddha,

original: thugs bskyed pa bcu pa brnyes pas rang nyid sangs rgyas kyi chos brnyes nus par mkhyen nas dus phyis sangs rgyas kyi sa la 'bad pa brtsams par gyur la /
analyzed: thugs bskyed pa bcu pa brnyes pas rang nyid sangs rgyas kyi chos brnyes nus par mkhyen nas dus phyis sangs rgyas kyi sa la 'bad pa brtsams par gyur la /
translated: Attained the tenth generation of the mind of awakening, and knowing that he himself was capable of attaining the qualities of a buddha, he later began to exert himself in the buddha ground.

original: gang gi don du 'bad pa 'di brtsams pa bla na med pa'i ye shes de yang bcom ldan 'das kyis 'og min gyi gnas kho nar brnyes par gyur to //üîΩde ni yon tan mtha' dag @330a * //
analyzed: gang gi don du 'bad pa 'di brtsams pa bla na med pa'i ye shes de yang bcom ldan 'das kyis 'og min gyi gnas kho nar brnyes par gyur to // de ni yon tan mtha' dag @330a * //
translated: The Bhagavat attained that unexcelled knowledge for the sake of which this effort was undertaken, only in the Akanistha realm.

original: gi mthar thug pa ste yon tan mtha' dag 'dir mthar thug cing phul du byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gi mthar thug pa ste yon tan mtha' dag 'dir mthar thug cing phul du byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: That is the culmination of all virtues, because all virtues culminate and reach their peak here.

original: de ni mtshungs pa med pa yang yin te /
analyzed: de ni mtshungs pa med pa yang yin te /
translated: That is also incomparable,

original: de dang 'dra ba med pa'i phyir dang gong na med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba med pa'i phyir dang gong na med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is nothing like it and nothing above it.

original: der mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba na bcom ldan 'das kyis skad cig gcig kho na la thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes brnyes so zhes bya ba 'di bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: der mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba na bcom ldan 'das kyis skad cig gcig kho na la thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes brnyes so zhes bya ba 'di bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: When he was fully enlightened there, the Bhagavat attained omniscient knowledge in a single instant. In order to demonstrate this, it is said:

original: ji ltar snod kyi dbye bas mkha' la dbye ba med de ltar //
analyzed: ji ltar snod kyi dbye bas mkha' la dbye ba med de ltar //
translated: Just as space is undifferentiated by the differentiation of vessels,

original: dngos byas dbye ba 'ga' yang de nyid la med de yi phyir //
analyzed: dngos byas dbye ba 'ga' yang de nyid la med de yi phyir //
translated: so there is no differentiation at all in reality due to the differentiation of things.

original: ro mnyam nyid du yang dag thugs su chud par mdzad gyur nas //
analyzed: ro mnyam nyid du yang dag thugs su chud par mdzad gyur nas //
translated: Having realized the perfect realization of the sameness of taste,

original: mkhyen bzangs khyod kyis skad cig gis ni shes bya thugs su chud //
analyzed: mkhyen bzangs khyod kyis skad cig gis ni shes bya thugs su chud //
translated: you, the one with excellent knowledge, in a single moment of knowledge, know all objects of knowledge.

original: dper na bum pa dang 'khar gzhong la sogs pa tha dad kyang sgrib pa med pa nyid du mtshungs pa'i phyir der rtogs pa'i nam mkha' la tha dad pa med pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na bum pa dang 'khar gzhong la sogs pa tha dad kyang sgrib pa med pa nyid du mtshungs pa'i phyir der rtogs pa'i nam mkha' la tha dad pa med pa de bzhin du /
translated: For example, although pots, bowls, and so on are different, the space that is realized in them is undifferentiated because it is the same in being unobstructed.

original: gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa'i dngos po tha dad kyang der gtogs pa'i de kho na nyid skye ba med pa'i mtshan nyid can la tha dad pa med pas de kho na nyid ni ro gcig pa kho nar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa'i dngos po tha dad kyang der gtogs pa'i de kho na nyid skye ba med pa'i mtshan nyid can la tha dad pa med pas de kho na nyid ni ro gcig pa kho nar shes par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, although things such as form and feeling are different, the reality that is included in them is undifferentiated because it has the characteristic of nonarising. Therefore, you should understand that reality is of one taste.

original: de yang mkhyen pa'i skad cig gcig kho nas thugs su chud pas bcom ldan 'das kyis mkhyen pa'i skad cig gcig kho nas thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes brnyes so //
analyzed: de yang mkhyen pa'i skad cig gcig kho nas thugs su chud pas bcom ldan 'das kyis mkhyen pa'i skad cig gcig kho nas thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes brnyes so //
translated: Moreover, because it is realized by a single moment of knowledge, the Bhagavat attained the exalted wisdom of omniscience in a single moment of knowledge.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here it is said:

original: gang tshe zhi ba de nyid yin na de la blo gros 'jug mi 'gyur //
analyzed: gang tshe zhi ba de nyid yin na de la blo gros 'jug mi 'gyur //
translated: If it is peace, the mind does not engage it.

original: blo ma zhugs par shes bya'i yul can nges par rigs pa'ang ma yin la //
analyzed: blo ma zhugs par shes bya'i yul can nges par rigs pa'ang ma yin la //
translated: If the mind does not engage, it is not right to ascertain the object of knowledge.

original: kun nas shes med pa ni shes par ji ltar 'gyur te 'gal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: kun nas shes med pa ni shes par ji ltar 'gyur te 'gal bar 'gyur //
translated: If it is completely noncognizable, how could it be cognized? It would be contradictory.

original: mkhyen po med par khyed kyis gzhan la 'di lta'o zhes su zhig ston //
analyzed: mkhyen po med par khyed kyis gzhan la 'di lta'o zhes su zhig ston //
translated: If it is not cognized, who will teach others, saying, ‚ÄúIt is like this‚Äù?

original: skye ba med pa ni gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyi de kho na nyid do zhes rnam par 'jog cing de yang shes pa yin no zhes 'jog pa na /
analyzed: skye ba med pa ni gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyi de kho na nyid do zhes rnam par 'jog cing de yang shes pa yin no zhes 'jog pa na /
translated: When you posit that nonarising is the suchness of forms and so on and also posit that it is cognition,

original: gang gi tshe zhi ba de kho na nyid yin no zhes rnam par gzhag pa de nyid kyi tshe de la rnam pa thams cad blo mi 'jug par khas blang dgos te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe zhi ba de kho na nyid yin no zhes rnam par gzhag pa de nyid kyi tshe de la rnam pa thams cad blo mi 'jug par khas blang dgos te /
translated: then at that time you must accept that the mind does not engage it in any way.

original: 'di ltar de kho na nyid skye ba med pa'i rang bzhin can la blo 'jug pa na ci'i rnam pa can zhig tu 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar de kho na nyid skye ba med pa'i rang bzhin can la blo 'jug pa na ci'i rnam pa can zhig tu 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: This is because when the mind engages suchness, which has the nature of nonarising, what aspect of it would appear?

original: de'i phyir rnam pa med pas de kho na nyid la blo mi 'jug pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam pa med pas de kho na nyid la blo mi 'jug pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, since there are no aspects, the mind does not engage reality.

original: blo mi 'jug na ni /
analyzed: blo mi 'jug na ni /
translated: If the mind does not engage,

original: 'o na shes bya'i yul can gyi @330b nges pa yang mi rigs pas de'i phyir 'di yongs su shes par 'gyur bar ji ltar 'os /
analyzed: 'o na shes bya'i yul can gyi @330b nges pa yang mi rigs pas de'i phyir 'di yongs su shes par 'gyur bar ji ltar 'os /
translated: then it is not tenable that there is ascertainment that has an object of cognition. Therefore, how could it be tenable that this is thoroughly cognized?

original: yongs su shes pa med pa nyid de kho na nyid yongs su shes pa'o zhes bya bar yang mi rigs so //
analyzed: yongs su shes pa med pa nyid de kho na nyid yongs su shes pa'o zhes bya bar yang mi rigs so //
translated: It is not tenable to say, ‚ÄúThe absence of thorough cognition is the thorough cognition of reality.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: smras pa / kun nas shes pa med pa ni shes par ji ltar 'gyur te 'gal bar 'gyur /
analyzed: smras pa / kun nas shes pa med pa ni shes par ji ltar 'gyur te 'gal bar 'gyur /
translated: We say: How could the absence of thorough cognition be thorough cognition? It would be contradictory.

original: kun nas mi shes pa nyid shes pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni phan tshun 'gal ba zhig ste /
analyzed: kun nas mi shes pa nyid shes pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni phan tshun 'gal ba zhig ste /
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThe absence of thorough cognition is thorough cognition‚Äù is mutually contradictory.

original: gal te kun nas mi shes pa yin na ji ltar shes pa yin /
analyzed: gal te kun nas mi shes pa yin na ji ltar shes pa yin /
translated: If it is the absence of thorough cognition, how could it be thorough cognition?

original: sems skye ba med na yang mkhyen pa po med par 'di lta bu'i mtshan nyid can gyi de kho na nyid ngas thugs su chud do zhes khyed cag gi gzhan dag la su zhig gis rtogs par byed /
analyzed: sems skye ba med na yang mkhyen pa po med par 'di lta bu'i mtshan nyid can gyi de kho na nyid ngas thugs su chud do zhes khyed cag gi gzhan dag la su zhig gis rtogs par byed /
translated: If mind is non-arisen, then without a knower, who would realize suchness and say, ‚ÄúI have realized suchness‚Äù?

original: de'i phyir 'di mi rigs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore, this is not reasonable.

original: 'di la brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di la brjod par bya ste /
translated: Here we say:

original: gang tshe skye med de nyid yin zhing blo yang skye ba dang bral ba //
analyzed: gang tshe skye med de nyid yin zhing blo yang skye ba dang bral ba //
translated: When suchness is non-arisen and mind is also free from arising,

original: de tshe de rnams bsten las de yis de nyid rtogs pa lta bu ste //
analyzed: de tshe de rnams bsten las de yis de nyid rtogs pa lta bu ste //
translated: then, just as one realizes suchness through relying on those,

original: ji ltar sems ni gang gi rnam pa can du 'gyur ba de yis yul //
analyzed: ji ltar sems ni gang gi rnam pa can du 'gyur ba de yis yul //
translated: just as the mind becomes the aspect of an object,

original: de yongs shes pa de bzhin tha snyad nye bar bsten nas rig pa yin //
analyzed: de yongs shes pa de bzhin tha snyad nye bar bsten nas rig pa yin //
translated: so too, through the conventional, one knows.

original: 'di na de'i rnam pa'i rjes su byed pa nyid 'dzin pa na rnam par shes pas yul rig go zhes brjod do //
analyzed: 'di na de'i rnam pa'i rjes su byed pa nyid 'dzin pa na rnam par shes pas yul rig go zhes brjod do //
translated: Here, when consciousness takes on the aspect of an object, it is said that consciousness knows the object.

original: dper na rnam par shes pa sngon po'i rnam par bsrel ba nye bar skye ba na sngon po shes so zhes brjod pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na rnam par shes pa sngon po'i rnam par bsrel ba nye bar skye ba na sngon po shes so zhes brjod pa de bzhin du /
translated: For example, when consciousness arises in the aspect of blue, it is said that blue is cognized.

original: shes pa de kho na nyid kyi rnam pa'i rjes su byed pa skye ba na de kho na nyid shes so zhes nye bar gdags so //
analyzed: shes pa de kho na nyid kyi rnam pa'i rjes su byed pa skye ba na de kho na nyid shes so zhes nye bar gdags so //
translated: In the same way, when consciousness arises in the aspect of reality, it is said that reality is cognized.

original: shes pa de'i rnam pa'i rjes su byed pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: shes pa de'i rnam pa'i rjes su byed pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that consciousness is in the aspect of that reality, he says:

original: gang tshe skye med de nyid yin zhing blo yang skye ba dang bral ba //
analyzed: gang tshe skye med de nyid yin zhing blo yang skye ba dang bral ba //
translated: When non-arising is reality and the mind is free from arising,

original: de tshe de rnams bsten las de yis de nyid rtogs pa lta bu ste //
analyzed: de tshe de rnams bsten las de yis de nyid rtogs pa lta bu ste //
translated: then, by relying on those, it is as if one realizes reality through that.

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says this.

original: de'i rnam pa bsten pa'i sgo nas rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de'i rnam pa bsten pa'i sgo nas rnam par gzhag go //
translated: It is established by way of its aspect.

original: ji ltar sems ni gang gi rnam pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rab tu grags par gyur pa'i dpe smos te de yang rnam par bshad zin to //
analyzed: ji ltar sems ni gang gi rnam pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rab tu grags par gyur pa'i dpe smos te de yang rnam par bshad zin to //
translated: In the line ‚ÄúWhen the mind is in the aspect of that,‚Äù he gives a well-known example, which has already been explained.

original: de'i phyir btags pa las de kho na nyid rtogs so zhes rnam par gzhag gi / dngos su na 'ga' zhig 'ga' zhig gis shes pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir btags pa las de kho na nyid rtogs so zhes rnam par gzhag gi / dngos su na 'ga' zhig 'ga' zhig gis shes pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is established that reality is realized through designation, but not that one thing is known by another.

original: shes pa dang shes bya gnyi ga yang ma skyes pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa dang shes bya gnyi ga yang ma skyes pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: For neither the knower nor the known is produced.

original: gang yang mkhyen po med par khyed kyis gzhan la 'di lta bu'o zhes su zhig ston zhes @331a * //
analyzed: gang yang mkhyen po med par khyed kyis gzhan la 'di lta bu'o zhes su zhig ston zhes @331a * //
translated: But if you say, ‚ÄúWho can teach this to others, since there is no knower?‚Äù

original: smras pa de la yang brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: smras pa de la yang brjod par bya ste /
translated: we reply:

original: shes pa 'di skye ba med pa de kho na yin pa bden mod kyi 'jig rten na de nyid ston pa mi srid pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: shes pa 'di skye ba med pa de kho na yin pa bden mod kyi 'jig rten na de nyid ston pa mi srid pa yang ma yin no //
translated: It is true that this knowledge is the non-production of reality, but it is not impossible to teach reality to the world.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: We reply:

original: de yi longs spyod rdzogs sku bsod nams kyis //
analyzed: de yi longs spyod rdzogs sku bsod nams kyis //
translated: The enjoyment body of the Buddha is produced from merit.

original: zin dang sprul pa mkha' gzhan las de'i mthus //
analyzed: zin dang sprul pa mkha' gzhan las de'i mthus //
translated: The emanation body is produced from the power of the enjoyment body, from space and other things.

original: sgra gang chos kyi de nyid ston 'byung ba //
analyzed: sgra gang chos kyi de nyid ston 'byung ba //
translated: The sound that arises from these bodies teaches the suchness of things.

original: de las 'jig rten gyis kyang de nyid rig / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni gzugs kyi sku gang la bzhugs nas chos kyi dbyings mngon sum du mdzad pa'i sku bsod nams brgyas zin pa /
analyzed: de las 'jig rten gyis kyang de nyid rig / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni gzugs kyi sku gang la bzhugs nas chos kyi dbyings mngon sum du mdzad pa'i sku bsod nams brgyas zin pa /
translated: The body of the Tathagata in which he abides and in which he actualizes the dharmadhatu is a body formed from a hundred merits,

original: bsam gyis mi khyab cing sna tshogs pa'i sku mnga' ba de ni ngo bo de dang der byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi chos kyi longs spyod kyi rgyu nyid du yongs su 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab cing sna tshogs pa'i sku mnga' ba de ni ngo bo de dang der byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi chos kyi longs spyod kyi rgyu nyid du yongs su 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: it is a body of inconceivable variety, and it is the very essence of the cause for the bodhisattvas' enjoyment of the Dharma.üîΩFrom that, the various conventions of the scriptures are understood, such as:

original: gang las da dung du yang 'jam dpal skye ba med cing 'gag pa med pa zhes bya ba 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshig bla dags so zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa gsung rab kyi tha snyad sna tshogs pa dag rtogs par 'gyur ba
analyzed: gang las da dung du yang 'jam dpal skye ba med cing 'gag pa med pa zhes bya ba 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshig bla dags so zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa gsung rab kyi tha snyad sna tshogs pa dag rtogs par 'gyur ba
translated: Manjusri, non-arising and non-cessation are epithets of the Tathagata.

original: / bsod nams brgya las bskrun pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyi sgra gang zhig 'byung ba de las 'jig rten rnam pa de lta bu'i chos nye bar ston pa'i snod du gyur pas de kho na nyid phyin ci ma log par nges par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: / bsod nams brgya las bskrun pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyi sgra gang zhig 'byung ba de las 'jig rten rnam pa de lta bu'i chos nye bar ston pa'i snod du gyur pas de kho na nyid phyin ci ma log par nges par 'gyur ro //
translated: The sound that arises from the blessing of the Tathagata, which is produced from hundreds of merits, is the vessel for teaching the Dharma in the world in that way, and from that, reality is ascertained without error.

original: bsod nams kyis 'dus byas pa'i sku las 'byung ba lta zhog gi de'i byin gyi rlabs kyis sprul pa dag las chos kyi de kho na nyid gsal bar byed pa'i sgra gang zhig 'byung ba de las kyang 'jig rten gyis de kho na nyid nges bar 'gyur ro
analyzed: bsod nams kyis 'dus byas pa'i sku las 'byung ba lta zhog gi de'i byin gyi rlabs kyis sprul pa dag las chos kyi de kho na nyid gsal bar byed pa'i sgra gang zhig 'byung ba de las kyang 'jig rten gyis de kho na nyid nges bar 'gyur ro
translated: Forget about the sound that arises from the body produced by merit, the sound that clarifies the reality of the Dharma from the emanations by his blessing is the vessel for teaching the Dharma in the world in that way, and from that, reality is ascertained.

original: // sprul pa dag las 'byung ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi gzhan yang de'i mthus sems dang sems las byung ba 'jug pa med du zin kyang /
analyzed: // sprul pa dag las 'byung ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi gzhan yang de'i mthus sems dang sems las byung ba 'jug pa med du zin kyang /
translated: Not only does it arise from emanations, but also by the power of that, even though the engagement of mind and mental factors is absent,

original: nam mkha' dag gzhan rtsva dang shing dang rtsig pa dang brag la sogs pa las de'i mthus sgra gang zhig 'byung ba de las kyang 'jig rten gyis de nyid rig pa yin no //
analyzed: nam mkha' dag gzhan rtsva dang shing dang rtsig pa dang brag la sogs pa las de'i mthus sgra gang zhig 'byung ba de las kyang 'jig rten gyis de nyid rig pa yin no //
translated: The sound that arises from the power of that, even from space, grass, trees, walls, rocks, and so on, is also known by the world as that.

original: yang ji ltar sems dang sems las byung ba med pa'i rang bzhin can rnam par rtog pa med pa ni bya ba da ltar ba mi srid kyang ji skad bshad pa'i bya ba 'byung ba'i rgyu nyid du 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar sems dang sems las byung ba med pa'i rang bzhin can rnam par rtog pa med pa ni bya ba da ltar ba mi srid kyang ji skad bshad pa'i bya ba 'byung ba'i rgyu nyid du 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Moreover, how is it that the nature of mind and mental factors, which are without conceptualization, become the cause of the arising of the activity that was explained, even though the present activity is impossible?

original: de bstan pa'i phyir phyi rol gyi dpe nye bar bkod pa /
analyzed: de bstan pa'i phyir phyi rol gyi dpe nye bar bkod pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, an external example is presented:

original: ji @331b ltar rdza mkhan stobs chen ldan pas 'dir //
analyzed: ji @331b ltar rdza mkhan stobs chen ldan pas 'dir //
translated: Just as a potter with great strength

original: yun rings 'bad pas ches bskor 'khor lo ni //
analyzed: yun rings 'bad pas ches bskor 'khor lo ni //
translated: turns the wheel for a long time with effort,

original: de rtsol da lta skyes pa med bzhin du 'ang //
analyzed: de rtsol da lta skyes pa med bzhin du 'ang //
translated: though the present arising of that effort does not exist,

original: 'khor zhing bum pa la sogs rgyur mthong ltar //
analyzed: 'khor zhing bum pa la sogs rgyur mthong ltar //
translated: it is seen as the cause of the vase and so on.

original: de bzhin da lta skyes rtsol med bzhin du //
analyzed: de bzhin da lta skyes rtsol med bzhin du //
translated: In the same way, though the present arising of effort does not exist,

original: chos kyi bdag can sku nyid la bzhugs de'i //
analyzed: chos kyi bdag can sku nyid la bzhugs de'i //
translated: it is seen as the cause of the body of the dharmakƒÅya.

original: 'jug pa skye bo'i dge dang smon lam gyi //üîΩkhyad par gyis 'phangs las ches bsam mi khyab //
analyzed: 'jug pa skye bo'i dge dang smon lam gyi // khyad par gyis 'phangs las ches bsam mi khyab //
translated: being projected by the virtue of beings and the special prayers of the bodhisattvas.

original: de la gang gis na rtog pa med par gyur du zin kyang gdul ba'i bya ba ji ltar 'tsham pa ltar 'jug pas sems can gyi khams mtha' yas pa'i don byed par 'gyur ba ;
analyzed: de la gang gis na rtog pa med par gyur du zin kyang gdul ba'i bya ba ji ltar 'tsham pa ltar 'jug pas sems can gyi khams mtha' yas pa'i don byed par 'gyur ba ;
translated: Even though the buddhas have no thoughts, they act to guide beings in whatever way is necessary and thus they benefit the infinite realms of sentient beings.

original: ji ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'di dag da ltar rnam par rtog pa mi mnga' zhing /
analyzed: ji ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'di dag da ltar rnam par rtog pa mi mnga' zhing /
translated: How is it that the bhagavƒÅn buddhas, who are free of thoughts,

original: yid bzhin gyi nor bu dang dpag bsam gyi shing dang 'dra bar ji ltar 'tsham par sems can gyi don sgrub pa lhur mdzad cing chos kyi dbyings las skad cig kyang mi bskyod la /
analyzed: yid bzhin gyi nor bu dang dpag bsam gyi shing dang 'dra bar ji ltar 'tsham par sems can gyi don sgrub pa lhur mdzad cing chos kyi dbyings las skad cig kyang mi bskyod la /
translated: like wish fulfilling gems and wish granting trees, are intent on accomplishing the welfare of sentient beings in whatever way is necessary and yet do not waver for even a moment from the dharmadhƒÅtu?

original: sems can 'dul ba'i dus las kyang mi 'da' ba de bzhin du bdag kyang gyur cig ces byang chub sems dpa' sngar smon lam gang btab pa'i smon lam de'i shugs dang / gdul ba rnams kyi rnam pa de lta bu'i chos nyan par 'gyur ba'i las yongs su smin pa las bya ba'i khyad par de 'dra ba dag mngon pa yin no //
analyzed: sems can 'dul ba'i dus las kyang mi 'da' ba de bzhin du bdag kyang gyur cig ces byang chub sems dpa' sngar smon lam gang btab pa'i smon lam de'i shugs dang / gdul ba rnams kyi rnam pa de lta bu'i chos nyan par 'gyur ba'i las yongs su smin pa las bya ba'i khyad par de 'dra ba dag mngon pa yin no //
translated: The bodhisattva's previous aspiration prayer and the maturation of the karma of those to be trained to listen to the Dharma in that way, such special activities are manifested.

original: de ltar na da ltar skyes pa'i 'bad rtsol med par de kho na nyid nye bar ston pa dang / sems can gyi don bya ba yang 'grub po zhes bya ba shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na da ltar skyes pa'i 'bad rtsol med par de kho na nyid nye bar ston pa dang / sems can gyi don bya ba yang 'grub po zhes bya ba shes par bya'o //
translated: Thus, it should be understood that without present effort, the teaching of reality and the benefit of sentient beings are accomplished.

original: da ni chos kyi sku'i dbang du byas nas bshad pa /
analyzed: da ni chos kyi sku'i dbang du byas nas bshad pa /
translated: Now, in terms of the dharmakƒÅya, it is explained:

original: shes bya'i bud shing skam po ma lus pa //
analyzed: shes bya'i bud shing skam po ma lus pa //
translated: The dry firewood of objects of knowledge, being completely burned,

original: bsregs pas zhi ste rgyal rnams chos sku ste //
analyzed: bsregs pas zhi ste rgyal rnams chos sku ste //
translated: is pacified. The dharmakƒÅya of the victors

original: de'i tshe skye ba med cing 'gag pa med //
analyzed: de'i tshe skye ba med cing 'gag pa med //
translated: is unborn and unceasing at that time.

original: sems 'gag pa de sku yis mngon sum mdzad //
analyzed: sems 'gag pa de sku yis mngon sum mdzad //
translated: The cessation of mind is actualized by the body.

original: ye shes kyi rang bzhin can gyi sku shes bya'i bud shing skam po ma lus pa bsregs pa la shes bya skye ba med pas skye ba med pa dang ldan par gyur pa gang yin pa 'di ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos kyi sku'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi rang bzhin can gyi sku shes bya'i bud shing skam po ma lus pa bsregs pa la shes bya skye ba med pas skye ba med pa dang ldan par gyur pa gang yin pa 'di ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos kyi sku'o //
translated: The body that has the nature of intuition, which is endowed with the non-arising of all that is knowable, because the fuel of the dry knowledge-objects is completely burned up, is the Dharma Body of the Buddhas.

original: 'di nyid kyi dbang du mdzad nas //
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi dbang du mdzad nas //
translated: With reference to just this, it is said:

original: sangs rgyas rnams ni chos nyid lta //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams ni chos nyid lta //
translated: The Buddhas are to be seen in terms of reality.

original: 'dren pa rnams ni chos kyi sku //
analyzed: 'dren pa rnams ni chos kyi sku //
translated: The Leaders are the Dharma Body.

original: chos nyid shes bya'ang ma yin te //
analyzed: chos nyid shes bya'ang ma yin te //
translated: Reality is not to be known.

original: de ni shes par nus ma yin //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de ni shes par nus ma yin // zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is not possible to know it.

original: chos kyi sku 'di ni /
analyzed: chos kyi sku 'di ni /
translated: This Dharma Body

original: de'i tshe @332a * //
analyzed: de'i tshe @332a * //
translated: at that time

original: skye ba med cing 'gag pa med pa ste /
analyzed: skye ba med cing 'gag pa med pa ste /
translated: is non-arisen and unceasing.

original: 'di nyid kyi dbang du mdzad nas 'jam dpal skye ba med cing 'gag pa med pa zhes bya ba 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshig bla dags so zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi dbang du mdzad nas 'jam dpal skye ba med cing 'gag pa med pa zhes bya ba 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshig bla dags so zhes gsungs so //
translated: With reference to just this, it is said: ‚ÄúMa√±ju≈õrƒ´, non-arisen and unceasing is a designation for the TathƒÅgata.‚Äù

original: de lta na ye shes kyi yul de kho na nyid la rnam pa thams cad du de'i yul can sems dang sems las byung ba rnams mi 'jug pas sku kho nas mngon sum du mdzad par kun rdzob tu rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de lta na ye shes kyi yul de kho na nyid la rnam pa thams cad du de'i yul can sems dang sems las byung ba rnams mi 'jug pas sku kho nas mngon sum du mdzad par kun rdzob tu rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Thus, the wisdom that is the object of reality does not engage in any way the mind and mental factors that are the subjects of that wisdom. Therefore, it is conventionally posited that the body alone manifests that reality.üîΩThis is the meaning of the following:

original: 'di ni / zhi sku dpag bsam shing ltar gsal gyur cing //
analyzed: 'di ni / zhi sku dpag bsam shing ltar gsal gyur cing //
translated: The body of peace is like a wish-fulfilling tree,üîΩnonconceptual like a wish-fulfilling jewel,üîΩit remains for the world‚Äôs welfare until beings are free,

original: yid bzhin nor bu ji bzhin rnam mi rtog /'gro grol bar du 'jig rten 'byor slad rtag /'di ni spros dang bral la snang bar 'gyur //
analyzed: yid bzhin nor bu ji bzhin rnam mi rtog /'gro grol bar du 'jig rten 'byor slad rtag /'di ni spros dang bral la snang bar 'gyur //
translated: it appears to those free of conceptual elaboration.

original: sku gang gis de kho na nyid 'di mngon sum du mdzad par bshad pa de ni zhi ba'i rang bzhin can du 'dod de /
analyzed: sku gang gis de kho na nyid 'di mngon sum du mdzad par bshad pa de ni zhi ba'i rang bzhin can du 'dod de /
translated: The body by which this reality is manifested is asserted to be the body of peace.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is free of mind and mental factors.

original: zhi ba'i rang bzhin can yin yang sems can gyi don mdzad par spyod pa gsal bar byed pa ni /
analyzed: zhi ba'i rang bzhin can yin yang sems can gyi don mdzad par spyod pa gsal bar byed pa ni /
translated: Even though it is the body of peace, it is active in bringing about the welfare of sentient beings.

original: dpag bsam shing ltar gsal gyur cing //
analyzed: dpag bsam shing ltar gsal gyur cing //
translated: It is like a wish-fulfilling tree.

original: yid bzhin nor bu ji bzhin rnam mi rtog / ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: yid bzhin nor bu ji bzhin rnam mi rtog / ces bya ba ste /
translated: Like a wish-fulfilling gem, it is nonconceptual.

original: 'di rnam par mi rtog pa nyid yin du zin kyang dpag bsam gyi shing dang yid bzhin gyi nor bu ltar ji ltar mngon par 'dod pa'i don 'grub pa'i rgyu nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di rnam par mi rtog pa nyid yin du zin kyang dpag bsam gyi shing dang yid bzhin gyi nor bu ltar ji ltar mngon par 'dod pa'i don 'grub pa'i rgyu nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Even though it is nonconceptual, it is the cause for accomplishing the aims that are desired, like a wish-fulfilling gem or a wish-fulfilling tree.

original: sku 'di ni 'khor ba ji srid par 'jig rten gyi 'byor ba'i slad du gnas pa yang yin no //
analyzed: sku 'di ni 'khor ba ji srid par 'jig rten gyi 'byor ba'i slad du gnas pa yang yin no //
translated: This body also remains for as long as cyclic existence lasts, in order to provide for the world.

original: rtag ces bya ba 'dis ni yun ring por gnas pa nyid du mtshon to //
analyzed: rtag ces bya ba 'dis ni yun ring por gnas pa nyid du mtshon to //
translated: The word ‚Äúpermanent‚Äù indicates that it remains for a long time.

original: de'i phyir 'jig rten ji srid pa dang nam mkha' ji srid pa de srid du sangs rgyas rnams tshul 'dis sems can gyi don kho na mdzad cing rnam par bzhugs so zhes bya bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jig rten ji srid pa dang nam mkha' ji srid pa de srid du sangs rgyas rnams tshul 'dis sems can gyi don kho na mdzad cing rnam par bzhugs so zhes bya bar shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that the buddhas, for as long as the world exists, for as long as space remains, remain in this way, accomplishing the aims of sentient beings.

original: bsod nams brgya'i mtshan gyis brgyan pa'i sku 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' spros pa dang bral ba rang gi bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs las shes rab dri ma med pa'i me long thob pa rnams kho na la yod pa nyid du snang gi spros pa
analyzed: bsod nams brgya'i mtshan gyis brgyan pa'i sku 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' spros pa dang bral ba rang gi bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs las shes rab dri ma med pa'i me long thob pa rnams kho na la yod pa nyid du snang gi spros pa
translated: This body adorned with the marks of a hundred merits is only seen to exist for bodhisattvas free of elaborations who have obtained the mirror of stainless wisdom from their accumulations of merit and wisdom.üîΩ

original: dang bcas pa rnams la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dang bcas pa rnams la ni ma yin no //
translated: This body, adorned with the marks of a hundred merits, appears only to bodhisattvas free of conceptual elaboration, who have attained the mirror of stainless wisdom from their accumulations of merit and wisdom. It does not appear to those with conceptual elaboration.

original: chos kyi sku las byung ba'am gzugs kyi sku'i mthu las byung ba yin yang rung ste /
analyzed: chos kyi sku las byung ba'am gzugs kyi sku'i mthu las byung ba yin yang rung ste /
translated: Whether it arises from the dharmakƒÅya or from the power of the r≈´pakƒÅya,

original: ji skad bshad pa'i sku las gzhan du gyur pa rgyu mthun pa'i sku gang dag @332b sems can 'dul ba'i rgyus byung ba de dag la yang mthu'i khyad par bsam gyis mi khyab pa mnga' bar brjod pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i sku las gzhan du gyur pa rgyu mthun pa'i sku gang dag @332b sems can 'dul ba'i rgyus byung ba de dag la yang mthu'i khyad par bsam gyis mi khyab pa mnga' bar brjod pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: the natural outflow body that is different from the body explained above, which arises from the cause of training sentient beings, also has an inconceivable power.

original: thub dbang dus gcig kho nar de'i rgyu mthun //üîΩgzugs sku gcig la rang gi skye gnas skabs //
analyzed: thub dbang dus gcig kho nar de'i rgyu mthun // gzugs sku gcig la rang gi skye gnas skabs //
translated: The power of the buddhas is inconceivable.üîΩThe power of the buddhas is inconceivable.

original: sngar 'gags gsal dang ma 'chol byung tshul ni //
analyzed: sngar 'gags gsal dang ma 'chol byung tshul ni //
translated: The power of the buddhas is inconceivable.

original: ma lus kyis bkra mtha' dag ston par mdzad //üîΩthams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi gnas skabs kyi snga rol 'khor ba thog ma med pa rang nyid kyi skye ba'i gnas skabs 'gags zin pa byung mtha' dag ma lus par bstan pa'i phyir gsal ba dang ma 'chol bar de phan tshun ma 'dres par byung tshul
analyzed: ma lus kyis bkra mtha' dag ston par mdzad // thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi gnas skabs kyi snga rol 'khor ba thog ma med pa rang nyid kyi skye ba'i gnas skabs 'gags zin pa byung mtha' dag ma lus par bstan pa'i phyir gsal ba dang ma 'chol bar de phan tshun ma 'dres par byung tshul
translated: He displays all of them at once,üîΩclearly and distinctly, in a single body.

original: du mas bkra bar gyur pa de dag thams cad cig car kho nar me long gi dkyil 'khor shin tu yongs su dag pa la bzhin gyi gzugs brnyan ltar rgyu mthun pa'i sku gcig nyid la lhun gyis grub par ston par mdzad do //
analyzed: du mas bkra bar gyur pa de dag thams cad cig car kho nar me long gi dkyil 'khor shin tu yongs su dag pa la bzhin gyi gzugs brnyan ltar rgyu mthun pa'i sku gcig nyid la lhun gyis grub par ston par mdzad do //
translated: In order to display all of his previous births in samsara, which are without beginning and have already ceased, the Buddha displays them all at once, clearly and distinctly, in a single body, which is the result in conformity with its cause. He displays them as if they were reflected in a very clear mirror.

original: 'di byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa spyad pa'i byung tshul gang dang gang du ji ltar gang gi don du byung ba de dag thams cad lhun gyis grub par sku gcig kho na la ston par spyod par brjod pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'di byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa spyad pa'i byung tshul gang dang gang du ji ltar gang gi don du byung ba de dag thams cad lhun gyis grub par sku gcig kho na la ston par spyod par brjod pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: In order to describe how the bodhisattvas' conduct is performed in a single body, spontaneously and effortlessly, in all the realms in which it occurs, in whatever way and for whatever purpose, it is said:üîΩThe buddha field, the lord of sages, their body, conduct, power,üîΩthe ≈õrƒÅvaka sa·πÖgha, how many there are, and how they are,üîΩthe forms of the bodhisattvas there,

original: sangs rgyas zhing ci 'dra der thub dbang dang // de dag sku spyod mthu stobs ci 'dra dang // nyan thos dge 'dun ji snyed ji lta dang // byang chub sems rnams der gzugs ci 'dra dang // ci 'dra'i chos dang de bdag ci 'dra dang //
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhing ci 'dra der thub dbang dang // de dag sku spyod mthu stobs ci 'dra dang // nyan thos dge 'dun ji snyed ji lta dang // byang chub sems rnams der gzugs ci 'dra dang // ci 'dra'i chos dang de bdag ci 'dra dang //
translated: the Dharma, and what the self is like,üîΩthe Dharma that is heard, the conduct that is practiced,

original: chos thos spyod pa gang la spyad pa dang // sbyin gang ji tsam de dag la phul ba //
analyzed: chos thos spyod pa gang la spyad pa dang // sbyin gang ji tsam de dag la phul ba //
translated: and the generosity that is offered to them

original: de ni ma lus sku gcig la ston mdzad//
analyzed: de ni ma lus sku gcig la ston mdzad//
translated: are all shown in a single body.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi sngon sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi sngon sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na /
translated: When the Bhagavat was previously practicing the perfection of generosity,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang rnams la bsnyen bkur mdzad pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing bee d'urya dang / padma r'a ga dang / aanda rnyil dang / shel la sogs pa'i rang bzhin can /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang rnams la bsnyen bkur mdzad pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing bee d'urya dang / padma r'a ga dang / aanda rnyil dang / shel la sogs pa'i rang bzhin can /
translated: The Buddha Bhagavans who are served, the Buddha-fields which are the nature of beryl, ruby, sapphire, crystal, etc.,

original: rin po che'i ljon shing la sogs pas mdzes par byas pa chu dang zheng dang kun nas zlum pa dang bcas pa de la brtan pa'i sems can gyi khyad par gyis nye bar mdzes pa ci 'dra ba zhig na /üîΩsangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dag bltams pa la sogs pa ston par mdzad pa de ma lus par sku gcig @333a * //
analyzed: rin po che'i ljon shing la sogs pas mdzes par byas pa chu dang zheng dang kun nas zlum pa dang bcas pa de la brtan pa'i sems can gyi khyad par gyis nye bar mdzes pa ci 'dra ba zhig na / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dag bltams pa la sogs pa ston par mdzad pa de ma lus par sku gcig @333a * //
translated: which are beautified by jeweled trees, etc., which are endowed with length, breadth, and circumference, are beautified by the special beings who are steadfast.

original: la ston par mdzad do //
analyzed: la ston par mdzad do //
translated: In what way? The Buddha Bhagavans display the birth, etc. of the Tathagata in their entirety in a single body.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi sku dang spyod pa dag gi mthu phul du byung ba gang yin pa dang / de dag gi nyan thos kyi dge 'dun 'dus par gyur pa ji snyed pa'am ji lta dang ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi sku dang spyod pa dag gi mthu phul du byung ba gang yin pa dang / de dag gi nyan thos kyi dge 'dun 'dus par gyur pa ji snyed pa'am ji lta dang ste /
translated: The power of the Buddha Bhagavans' bodies and deeds is supreme, and the assembly of their Shravaka Sangha is immeasurable.

original: chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos kyi nan tan rnam pa gang gis nyan thos kyi dge 'dun der gyur pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing na byang chub sems dpa' mtshan dang dpe byad kyis lus spras pa /
analyzed: chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos kyi nan tan rnam pa gang gis nyan thos kyi dge 'dun der gyur pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing na byang chub sems dpa' mtshan dang dpe byad kyis lus spras pa /
translated: He displays in a single body all the aspects of the practice of the Dharma that accords with the Dharma by which that Sa·πÖgha of ≈õrƒÅvakas became that way.üîΩHe displays in a single body all the bodhisattvas who exist in the buddhafields of those Bhagavat Buddhas, whose bodies are adorned with the major and minor marks,üîΩwho are endowed with a beautiful form, who enjoy the enjoyment of the Dharma, and who enjoy the enjoyment of robes, food, dwellings, and so forth.

original: dbyibs dang ldan pa chos gos dang zas dang gnas la sogs pa yongs su longs spyod pa nye bar longs spyod pa dang ldan pa ci 'dra ba de dag yod par gyur pa dang / ci 'dra ba'i chos dang ste theg pa gcig dang gsum gyi rten can bstan pa de dag thams cad sku gcig la ston par mdzad do //
analyzed: dbyibs dang ldan pa chos gos dang zas dang gnas la sogs pa yongs su longs spyod pa nye bar longs spyod pa dang ldan pa ci 'dra ba de dag yod par gyur pa dang / ci 'dra ba'i chos dang ste theg pa gcig dang gsum gyi rten can bstan pa de dag thams cad sku gcig la ston par mdzad do //
translated: He displays in a single body all the teachings of the Dharma, which are the support of the One Vehicle and the Three Vehicles.

original: de bdag ci 'dra dang ste bram ze la sogs pa'i rigs su skyes pa gzugs dang blo dang ldan pa /
analyzed: de bdag ci 'dra dang ste bram ze la sogs pa'i rigs su skyes pa gzugs dang blo dang ldan pa /
translated: He displays in a single body all the aspects of his own self, such as being born in the caste of brahmins and so forth, having a beautiful form and intelligence,

original: khyim pa dang rab tu byung bar gyur pa dang / chos thos nas lhag ma dang bcas pa dang lhag ma med pa'i bslab pa khas blangs te spyod pa gang la spyad pa dang / sbyin pa gang ci tsam de dag la phul ba ste sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das nyan thos dang byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun dang bcas pa de dag la bza' ba la sogs pa dang /
analyzed: khyim pa dang rab tu byung bar gyur pa dang / chos thos nas lhag ma dang bcas pa dang lhag ma med pa'i bslab pa khas blangs te spyod pa gang la spyad pa dang / sbyin pa gang ci tsam de dag la phul ba ste sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das nyan thos dang byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun dang bcas pa de dag la bza' ba la sogs pa dang /
translated: whatever they have offered to those Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, together with their Sangha of Shravakas and Bodhisattvas, be it food and so forth,üîΩor Dharma robes, precious ornaments and so forth,

original: chos gos dang rin po che'i rgyan la sogs pa gang phul ba dang / ji tsam ste dus ji tsam dang tshad ji tsam phul ba de ma lus par sku gcig la ston par mdzad do //
analyzed: chos gos dang rin po che'i rgyan la sogs pa gang phul ba dang / ji tsam ste dus ji tsam dang tshad ji tsam phul ba de ma lus par sku gcig la ston par mdzad do //
translated: and for as long, for however much time and however much in quantity, he displays all of that in a single body.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i byung mtha' 'di ji ltar ston pa //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i byung mtha' 'di ji ltar ston pa //
translated: How does he display this history of practicing the perfection of generosity?üîΩAnd likewise, when practicing discipline, patience, diligence, concentration,

original: de bzhin tshul khrims bzod brtson ting 'dzin dang // shes rab spyod tshe sngar gyi gnas skabs gang //
analyzed: de bzhin tshul khrims bzod brtson ting 'dzin dang // shes rab spyod tshe sngar gyi gnas skabs gang //
translated: and wisdom, whatever was the case previously,

original: ma tshang med de dag / ma lus sku gcig la ston mdzad ces gong ma dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: ma tshang med de dag / ma lus sku gcig la ston mdzad ces gong ma dang sbyar ro //
translated: The verse is to be applied to the above in the following way:

original: sku gcig la cig car gnas skabs thams cad ston pa lta zhog gi 'on kyang /
analyzed: sku gcig la cig car gnas skabs thams cad ston pa lta zhog gi 'on kyang /
translated: He displays all the situations simultaneously in a single body.

original: nyid spyod pa kun /
analyzed: nyid spyod pa kun /
translated: He displays all his own activities

original: sku yi ba spu'i khung bu'ang gsal bar ston //
analyzed: sku yi ba spu'i khung bu'ang gsal bar ston //
translated: in a single pore of his body.

original: bdag nyid kyi spyod pa kho na ston par mdzad pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /üîΩgzhan yang / sangs rgyas gang dag 'das dang 'byung 'gyur gang //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi spyod pa kho na ston par mdzad pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi / gzhan yang / sangs rgyas gang dag 'das dang 'byung 'gyur gang //
translated: Not only does he display his own activities,üîΩbut he also displays the activities of all the buddhas.üîΩThe buddhas of the past, those yet to come,

original: gang dag da ltar nam mkha'i mthar thug par //
analyzed: gang dag da ltar nam mkha'i mthar thug par //
translated: and those of the present, as many as there are,

original: gdangs mthon chos ston sdug bsngal gyis bzung ba'i//
analyzed: gdangs mthon chos ston sdug bsngal gyis bzung ba'i//
translated: who teach the Dharma with their melodious voicesüîΩto the ends of space,üîΩwho remain in the world to comfort living beingsüîΩwho are tormented by suffering,

original: @333b 'gro dbugs 'byin zhing 'jig rten bzhugs pa dang // dang po'i thugs bzung byang chub snying po'i bar //
analyzed: @333b 'gro dbugs 'byin zhing 'jig rten bzhugs pa dang // dang po'i thugs bzung byang chub snying po'i bar //
translated: from the time when they first give rise to bodhichittaüîΩuntil they reach the essence of enlightenment,

original: de dag spyod kun dngos rnams mig 'phrul gyis //
analyzed: de dag spyod kun dngos rnams mig 'phrul gyis //
translated: he displays all their activities, like a reflection,üîΩin a single pore of his body,

original: rang bzhin mkhyen nas bdag bzhin ba spu yi //üîΩkhung bur dus gcig la ni gsal bar ston //
analyzed: rang bzhin mkhyen nas bdag bzhin ba spu yi //üîΩkhung bur dus gcig la ni gsal bar ston //
translated: knowing that they are by nature like an illusion.

original: re shig mig 'phrul gyi tshul shes pa tha mal pa dag kyang sngags kyi mthu rnam pa de lta bu tsam zhig gis rang gi lus la dngos po'i rnam pa sna tshogs pa gnas par ston nus na /
analyzed: re shig mig 'phrul gyi tshul shes pa tha mal pa dag kyang sngags kyi mthu rnam pa de lta bu tsam zhig gis rang gi lus la dngos po'i rnam pa sna tshogs pa gnas par ston nus na /
translated: For the time being, even ordinary people who know the way of magic can display various things in their bodies by the power of mantra.

original: ci 'gro ba'i dbang phyug sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis dngos po'i rang bzhin mig 'phrul gyi rang bzhin rnam pa de lta bu dang tha mi dad pa mkhyen nas mi spyod par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: ci 'gro ba'i dbang phyug sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis dngos po'i rang bzhin mig 'phrul gyi rang bzhin rnam pa de lta bu dang tha mi dad pa mkhyen nas mi spyod par 'gyur ram /
translated: How much more so the lords of migrators, the Bhagavan Buddhas and the Bodhisattvas, who know the nature of things, which is not different from the nature of magic, and do not act?

original: de'i phyir // mkhas pa gang zhig ma rtogs pa'am som nyi za bar 'gyur //
analyzed: de'i phyir // mkhas pa gang zhig ma rtogs pa'am som nyi za bar 'gyur //
translated: Therefore, what wise person would not understand or would doubt this?

original: de'i phyir mkhas pas dpe 'di'i sgo nas gsal bar 'di la lhag par mos par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir mkhas pas dpe 'di'i sgo nas gsal bar 'di la lhag par mos par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the wise should have special faith in this through this example.

original: ji ltar nyid kyi spyod pa dang de bzhin gshegs pa gzhan gyi spyod pa dag dus gcig tu rang nyid kyi ba spu'i khung bur ston par mdzad pa /
analyzed: ji ltar nyid kyi spyod pa dang de bzhin gshegs pa gzhan gyi spyod pa dag dus gcig tu rang nyid kyi ba spu'i khung bur ston par mdzad pa /
translated: Just as he displays in a single pore of his body his own conduct and the conduct of other Tathagatas,

original: de bzhin dus gsum byang chub sems dpa' dang // rang rgyal 'phags pa nyan thos ma lus kyi //üîΩspyod dang de lhag skye bo'i gnas skabs ni //
analyzed: de bzhin dus gsum byang chub sems dpa' dang // rang rgyal 'phags pa nyan thos ma lus kyi // spyod dang de lhag skye bo'i gnas skabs ni //
translated: Likewise, in a single pore, all the conduct of the bodhisattvas of the three times,üîΩThe noble solitary realizers and ≈õrƒÅvakas,

original: thams cad ba spu'i khung bur gcig tshe ston //üîΩsku phun sum tshogs pa brjod nas rnam par rtog pa mi mnga' bar zin kyang bzhed pa la mnga' bsgyur ba nyid phun sum tshogs par bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: thams cad ba spu'i khung bur gcig tshe ston // sku phun sum tshogs pa brjod nas rnam par rtog pa mi mnga' bar zin kyang bzhed pa la mnga' bsgyur ba nyid phun sum tshogs par bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: And all the states of ordinary beings,üîΩAre revealed.

original: dag pa 'di ni bzhed par 'jug pa yis //
analyzed: dag pa 'di ni bzhed par 'jug pa yis //
translated: Having described the perfection of the Buddha‚Äôs body, the following verse is expressed to illustrate the perfection of his mastery over his intentions, even though he is free from conceptualization.üîΩThrough his intention, he can display in the domain of a single atom

original: rdul gcig yul la mkha' gtugs 'jig rten dang // 'jig rten mtha' yas phyogs khyab rdul ston mod //
analyzed: rdul gcig yul la mkha' gtugs 'jig rten dang // 'jig rten mtha' yas phyogs khyab rdul ston mod //
translated: The worlds of the billion worlds and worlds extending to the ends of space,

original: rdul rags mi 'gyur 'jig rten phra mi 'gyur //
analyzed: rdul rags mi 'gyur 'jig rten phra mi 'gyur //
translated: Without the atom becoming larger or the worlds becoming smaller.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis ni bzhed pa'i sgo nas nam mkha'i mthas gtugs pa'i 'jig rten rdul phra rab gcig gi yul la ston par byed de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis ni bzhed pa'i sgo nas nam mkha'i mthas gtugs pa'i 'jig rten rdul phra rab gcig gi yul la ston par byed de /
translated: The blessed buddhas can, through their intention, display in the domain of a single atom the worlds of the billion worlds and worlds extending to the ends of space.

original: 'jig rten phra bar yang mi 'gyur zhing rdul phra rab rags par yang mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'jig rten phra bar yang mi 'gyur zhing rdul phra rab rags par yang mi 'gyur la /
translated: The world does not become subtle, nor does the atom become gross.

original: bzhed pa nyid kyis rang gi ngo bo ji ltar gnas pa yang de ltar yang dag par ston to //
analyzed: bzhed pa nyid kyis rang gi ngo bo ji ltar gnas pa yang de ltar yang dag par ston to //
translated: By mere wish, he reveals the nature of things just as it is.

original: 'jig rten mtha' yas phyogs khyab rdul yang ston te /
analyzed: 'jig rten mtha' yas phyogs khyab rdul yang ston te /
translated: He reveals the atoms that pervade the infinite directions of the world.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni bzhed pa tsam gyis mtha' yas phyogs te 'jig rten ma lus pa'i @334a * //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni bzhed pa tsam gyis mtha' yas phyogs te 'jig rten ma lus pa'i @334a * //
translated: The Bhagavat Buddhas, by mere wish, reveal the infinite directions, i.e., the entire world,

original: 'jig rten rdul phra rab gcig gis khyab par yang ston par mdzad do //
analyzed: 'jig rten rdul phra rab gcig gis khyab par yang ston par mdzad do //
translated: pervaded by a single atom.

original: de bzhin du /üîΩrnam rtog mi mnga' khyod kyis srid mtha'i bar //
analyzed: de bzhin du / rnam rtog mi mnga' khyod kyis srid mtha'i bar //
translated: And so,üîΩYou who are free from discursive thought, in each instant

original: skad cig de re re la spyod sna tshogs //üîΩji snyed ston pa de snyed 'dzam bu'i gling //
analyzed: skad cig de re re la spyod sna tshogs // ji snyed ston pa de snyed 'dzam bu'i gling //
translated: until the end of existence, you manifestüîΩas many different manifestations as there are atoms

original: ma lus rdul gang de dag la grangs med //
analyzed: ma lus rdul gang de dag la grangs med //
translated: in all the Jambu continents.

original: rnam par rtog pa mi mnga' ba khyod 'khor ba'i bar du skad cig dang skad cig la spyod pa sna tshogs ston pa'i tshad gang yin pa'i tshad de'i grangs ni 'dzam bu'i gling ma lus pa na rdul phra rab ji snyed yod pa de dag la yod pa
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa mi mnga' ba khyod 'khor ba'i bar du skad cig dang skad cig la spyod pa sna tshogs ston pa'i tshad gang yin pa'i tshad de'i grangs ni 'dzam bu'i gling ma lus pa na rdul phra rab ji snyed yod pa de dag la yod pa
translated: The number of instants in which you display various activities in cyclic existence is not the same as the number of atoms in all of Jambudvipa.

original: ma yin no zhes 'di ni thun mong ma yin pa'i yon tan phul du byung bar brjod pa'i sgo nas bcom ldan 'das la bstod pa yin no //
analyzed: ma yin no zhes 'di ni thun mong ma yin pa'i yon tan phul du byung bar brjod pa'i sgo nas bcom ldan 'das la bstod pa yin no //
translated: This is praise of the Bhagavan from the perspective of expressing his uncommon, excellent qualities.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa ni stobs bcus rab tu phye ba yin pa'i phyir de'i rnam par dbye ba cha tsam zhig bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa ni stobs bcus rab tu phye ba yin pa'i phyir de'i rnam par dbye ba cha tsam zhig bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: Since the buddha stage is distinguished by the ten powers, a mere part of their classification is explained:üîΩThe power of knowledge of the possible and impossible,üîΩthe power of knowledge of the ripening of karma,üîΩthe power of knowledge of various higher interests,üîΩthe power of knowledge of various dhƒÅtus,

original: gnas dang gnas min mkhyen stobs dang // de bzhin las rnam smin blo dang // mos pa sna tshogs thugs chud dang // sna tshogs khams ni mkhyen stobs dang // de bzhin dbang mchog mchog ma yin //
analyzed: gnas dang gnas min mkhyen stobs dang // de bzhin las rnam smin blo dang // mos pa sna tshogs thugs chud dang // sna tshogs khams ni mkhyen stobs dang // de bzhin dbang mchog mchog ma yin //
translated: the power of knowledge of superior and inferior faculties,üîΩthe power of knowledge of the path going everywhere,üîΩthe power of knowledge of recollection of past lives,üîΩthe power of knowledge of death and rebirth,üîΩand the power of knowledge of the termination of contamination.

original: mkhyen dang thams cad du 'gro dang // bsam gtan rnam thar ting 'dzin dang // snyoms par 'jug sogs mkhyen stobs dang // sngon gnas dran pa mkhyen pa dang // de bzhin 'chi 'pho skye blo dang // zag rnams zad pa mkhyen stobs te //
analyzed: mkhyen dang thams cad du 'gro dang // bsam gtan rnam thar ting 'dzin dang // snyoms par 'jug sogs mkhyen stobs dang // sngon gnas dran pa mkhyen pa dang // de bzhin 'chi 'pho skye blo dang // zag rnams zad pa mkhyen stobs te //
translated: And the power of knowledge of the exhaustion of contaminants.

original: stobs ni bcu po 'di dag go //
analyzed: stobs ni bcu po 'di dag go //
translated: These are the ten powers.

original: de la gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyi dbang du byas nas bshad pa /
analyzed: de la gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyi dbang du byas nas bshad pa /
translated: With regard to the first power, that of knowledge of bases and nonbases, it is said:üîΩThe wise declare that a certain result

original: rgyu gang zhig las gang zhig nges par skye 'gyur ba //üîΩde ni de yi gnas su de mkhyen rnams kyis gsungs //
analyzed: rgyu gang zhig las gang zhig nges par skye 'gyur ba // de ni de yi gnas su de mkhyen rnams kyis gsungs //
translated: Will definitely arise from a certain cause.

original: bshad pa las bzlog gnas min shes bya mtha' yas pa //
analyzed: bshad pa las bzlog gnas min shes bya mtha' yas pa //
translated: The opposite of this is to be understood as the nonbase.
